column17: Al Shabaab ambushed an anti-al Shabaab (not named) military convoy near Faafaxdhun Village in Baardheere District in the afternoon of 30/06. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour. Casualties could not be established.

Two factions of al Shabaab clashed against each other in Baraawe in the morning of 30/06. The clash opposed pro-Godane militias and forces loyal to the local District Commissioner and police chief. Five persons were killed and three others wounded.

Somali or pro-Somali forces launched an attack against al Shabaab in Ceel Leheli Village (18km W of Xudur) on 30/06. The allied forces came from Ceel Barde. Unconfirmed reports indicate that three members of al Shabaab were killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab attacked Somali or pro-Somali forces near Kulunjerer Village in Xudur District in the afternoon 30/06. Al Shabaab launched the attack after receiving information about a small group allied forces moving in the area. One soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab ambushed a group of Somali forces in Kobog Village (40km S of Xudur) in the afternoon of 30/06. Reports indicate that the soldiers were heading to an area near Kulunjerer Village to reinforce their colleagues who were attacked by al Shabaab. One soldier was killed in the clash.

Isse and Gudabirsi clans clashed near Cabdil Qadir Village (80km NE of Borama) following a dispute over farm ownership on 30/06. The two sides reported used sticks and stones during the clash. Elders from the two clans intervened and managed to stop the fighting. Police later reportedly deployed in the village to prevent further clashes.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against Somali forces position near Abdi Wayeel Cinema (Heliwa District)in the evening of 30/06. The soldiers reacted by opening fire in the direction of the attackers. One soldier was injured in the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of NSA officer in Jamhuuriya neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 30/06. Reports indicate that the device hit the perimeter wall of the building. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in the Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District)in the evening of 30/06. Two civilian bystanders reportedly sustained minor injuries in the attack. The attackers managed to escape.

Al Shabaab forces launched a hit and run attack against a government forces position in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 30/06. The attackers reportedly fired three RPG rounds followed by direct exchange of gunfire between the two sides. AL Shabaab withdrew after five minutes of the gun battle. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a defensive base located in Hosh neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 30/06. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Protesters gathering Tarabuunka Square to demand the release of Hasan Dahir Aweys, an al Shabaab leader who had recently been arrested by Somali authorities at Mogadishu airport. The group smashed windows of passing cars, burnt tires, and clashed with police. Causalities list not provided.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade a al Shabaab fighters in a house in Baraawe town the evening of 01/0. The fighters a conducted a security operation after the explosion but made no arrest. It is believed that the attack was carried out by rival al Shabaab forces that were defeated by forces loyal to Godane.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the morning of 10/06 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. No casualties were reported.

A demonstration in protest against the involvement of KDF in recent clashes in Kismaayo was held in Ceel Waaq in the morning of 01/07. The governor of Gero spoke at the event and declared the KDF was an enemy and a destabilizing factor in the region.

Resident of Bulo Xawo on 01/07 staged a demonstration in protest against KDF involvement in the armed clashes between Ras Kaambooni forces (RKB) and those loyal to Barre Hirale in Kismaayo on 29/06. A man affiliated with Raskamboni opened fire in the crowd, injuring one of the demonstrators.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces positions in Awdiinle Village (Baidoa District) in the night of 01/07. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Two groups of Somali forces clash over food aid distribution. Two soldiers and two civilians injured in the clash.

Arrests: Police arrest a man in Hargeisa after he reportedly tried to take a photo of the UN-Som office in Masalaha neighbourhood in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning on 01/07. Reports indicate that the man was a journalist and wanted to investigate if the recent government decision to close the office was implemented.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at a passenger vehicle in Weydow Village (7km N of Jowhar) in the morning of 01/07. One passenger was reportedly killed and another injured. It is believed that the incident is related to the on-going clan conflicts between Abgal and Shidle clans in the district, though it is not clear which was the aggressor in this instance. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled hand grenade at the residence of a businessman in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 01/07. Reports indicate that the businessman supplies goods to Ethiopian forces in Beled Weyne. Other reports indicate that the grenade was targeted at Somali forces passing near the house. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 01/07. The soldiers reacted by opening fire in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades at police manning a security outpost located in KPP Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 01/07. The soldiers reacted by opening fire in the direction of the attackers. Two female bystanders were injured in the blast. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces chewing khat in front of a teashop in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 01/07. The device reportedly missed its target. No casualties were reported. The soldiers conducted a security operation after the blast but made no arrest. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM position near Maslah building area (Heliwa District) in the night of 01/07. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire that lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot in Godey neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening 01/07. The hand grenade reportedly missed its target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks Kismayo airport over the midnight hour, however, AMISOM forces rebuffed the attack. Causalities unknown.
Al Shabaab attacks a military installation five kilometres from Ceel Burde, 10 reported deaths.
Gunmen from Majeerten/Ali Saleebaan sub-clan carjacked a Toyota Land Cruiser belonging to Warsangeli sub-clan an area between Carmo and Ceel-Dahir villages (Bosasso District) in the evening of 02/07.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted AMISOM forces convoy in an area between Awdheegle town and Bariire villages in Afgooye District in the morning of 02/07. Causalities could not be established.
Geledle and Garre clan members clashed using matchers, axes and sticks following an escalated dispute over grazing lands in Diinsoor in the afternoon of 02/07. Causalities unknown.
A demonstration in support of the possible appointment of Suleiman Hagla-Toosiye as the Somaliland minister of health was held in Buuhoodle on 02/07.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Garbahaarey on 02/07 in protest against KDF involvement in the armed clashes between Ras Kaambooni forces (RKB) and those loyal to Barre Hirale in Kismaayo on 29/06. The demonstrators reportedly shouted anti-Kenyan slogans and reportedly burnt the Kenyan flag.

Unidentified gunmen shot dead a prominent businessman in the centre of Kismaayo on 02/07 and carjacked his vehicle. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators were reportedly hailing from Ogaden while the victim was a Marehan.

Gunmen reportedly hailing from Marehan shot and killed an Ogaden man in Calanley neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 02/07. The killing was in revenge of the murder of a businessman in Kismaayo earlier in the day.

Hundreds of people staged demonstrations in Industrial road, Al-Baraka Junction, Trebunka, Maka Al-Mukarama road in Hodan District in the morning of 02/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the arrest of Sheikh Hassan Dahir Aweys by the Somali government. This is the second day demonstration held in Mogadishu in protest against the arrest of Aweys.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Puntland forces clashed with opposition supporters (unknown party, likely Midnimo) backed by armed militia in Barxadda area (Galkacyo North) in the morning of 03/07. The fighting broke after the security forces confronted opposition supporters who tried to block Horseed Party officials from holding a rally in Barxadda area. Five killed in the clash, 13 others injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired three mortar rounds at the Baidoa airport where AMISOM/ENDF are based in the night of 03/07. The ENDF responded with heavy artillery. There no were reports of casualties.
Forces loyal to Barre Hirale reportedly established a base in Sabaa Asharaf Village (25 km N of Kismaayo). The village is located in al Shabaab area, fully under their control.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An Shabaab fighter opened fire at an AMISOM helicopter with anti-craft gun (Dishka) from a distance of 10km SE of Baidoa in the morning of 03/07. The gunfire did not hit the helicopter and the plane landed safely.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somalia/AMISOM forces regular position near Shalaambood Village in Marka in the afternoon of 03/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a private residence in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 03/07. One person (a female) was reportedly injured in the blast. The motive of the attack remains unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police on patrol in Daryeel mini-market in the Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 03/07. One police officer and two bystanders were wounded. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces on foot patrol in Bar Jowhar area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 03/07. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The perpetrator escaped.
An IED targeted a military convoy in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 03/07. The soldiers reacted by opening fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces on patrol in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District)in the evening of 03/07. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

A IED targeted a security forces vehicle near General Daud School (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 03/07. Reports indicate that the vehicle was badly damaged. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police manning a security checkpoint at Bakaara Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 03/07. The soldiers responded by firing in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces based near the former milk factory (Hodan District) in the evening of 03/07. The soldiers responded by firing in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a prominent business man in Beytu Raas neighbourhood in Marka in the morning of 04/07. The motive of the killing is unclear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A shop owner discovered a suspicious device planted in her tea-shop at the meat market in Berdale neighbourhood of Baidoa in the morning of 04/07 and reported to police. The police identified the device as an IED and disabled it safely.

Militiamen from Saad/Hawiye sub clan attacked Galkacyo South police station in the evening of 04/07. The militiamen reportedly wanted to release a man held at the police station who had been sentenced to death. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew without releasing the suspect. A police officer is killed and a teashop owner were injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a al Shabaab member in Abaq Beeday Village (17km E of Xudur) in the night of 04/07 after he reportedly refused to continue working with them. The victim belonged to the group that stated that they cannot fight against other al Shabaab commanders and surrendered their guns.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire deliberately at people coming out of a small mosque in Bayaxow settlement (3km E Jowhar) after the dawn prayers on 04/07. Two people were reportedly killed while five others were injured. The motive behind the shooting remains unclear but the attack is believed to be clan related attack. The perpetrators escaped. Shabeelle Media Network reported four deaths.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified armed men attacked a Puntland police convoy killing two officers and two civilian bystanders. Fifteen others were wounded. The attack comes after a Horseed Party political rally.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a prominent traditional leader in Sheekh Abrone neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 04/07. The deceased was the sultan of Jiide clan. The motive of the killing is currently unknown.

Police and army clashed in Afasiyooni neighbourhood in Waberi District following an escalated dispute over land ownership in the afternoon of 04/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted about 15 minutes. Three soldiers from both sides were reportedly killed while two others were injured.

Defusal: A special unit of Somali forces arrested a woman wearing an explosive belt near Wardhiigley police station (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 04/07. The soldiers surrounded the woman as she walked near the police station and managed to arrest her.

A gunman from the Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan shot and killed a labourer hailing from Rahaweyn at greenline area in Galkacyo South in the morning of 05/07. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator escaped.
Armed militiamen from the Majerten/Ali Salebaan sub-clan attacked a group of Majeerten/Ugaar Salebaan camel herders in Rako Raho (77km NE of Qardho) on 05/07. Three injuries reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a Somali forces regular position in Wajer neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 05/07. The soldiers fired back in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District)in the evening of 05/07. The soldiers fired back in the suspected direction. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
A business owner discovered an IED planted inside her store. Security forces were bale to disable the device before it detonated.

An IED exploded prematurely in area near Carafat neighbourhood (Yaqshiid District) in the evening of 05/07. Three bystanders were reportedly injured in the blast. The target is unclear but Somali soldiers frequent the area.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Three Somali soldiers are shot and killed during a shootout with al Shabaab. One allied AMISOM is captured and later publicly executed in the town square.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab publicly beheads a captured AMISOM soldier Bulo Mareer shortly after he is captured in a shootout. About 100 in the village witnessed the event. Radio al-Furqaan is pro-al Shabaab.

An IED attached to the car of Jubaland regional court chairman went off in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 05/07. The chairman escaped unhurt but his son was slightly injured. Three people were arrested in connection with the incident.

Government allied militia (not identified) conducted a security in Orogley Village (22km SW of Xudur) and killed two al Shabaab fighters in the village. The militia is presumably the same militia active in Kayaane earlier in the day.
Government allied militia (not identified) conducted a security operation in Kayaane Village (26km SW of Tayeeglow) and killed three members of al Shabaab in the village on 05/07.

Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against a Somali forces position in Goof-Gaduud Village (25km SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 05/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at a house in Aasas near Ardaa Village (55km SE of Ceerigaabo) and killed a man hailing from Habar Yonis sub-clan in the evening of 05/07. The motive is unclear. His relatives claimed that the perpetrators were members of Dhulbahante/Barik Haye sub-clan.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired a number of mortar rounds at AMISOM position near Kismaayo airport in the night of 06/07. AMISOM did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.
Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration at Zero area in Ceerigaabo District on 06/07 in support of the UKs ban on khat. The demonstration was organized by local youths and elders.

An RCIED targeting a Somali forces truck went off just after the vehicle passed in the livestock market located in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 06/07. A female bystander was killed and at least two others were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab attacked Somali forces based at Jowhar airport in the morning of 06/07. The two sides in engaged in a serious fighting that lasted for about an hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Raskamboni (RKB) forces launched a security operation in pursuit of the remaining Marehan militias loyal to Barre Hirale in Goob Weyn Village (14 km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/07. The two sides clashed briefly. One RKB and a Marehan militia man were killed in the clash.

Unidentified attackers opened fire at a residential house in Buua-shikh neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 06/07. A father and his son were reportedly injured in the attack. Reports indicate that the incident was a clan revenge attack.
The body of an Isse businessman was found near Cara-Cad Village (20km NW of Borama) on 06/07. The murder is believed to be related to the ongoing revenge killing between Isse and Gudabirsi clans.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces on foot patrol at Ali Kamiin Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 06/07. The soldiers fired back in the suspected direction. Two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a military forces regular position at Al-Baraka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/07. The soldiers fired back in the suspected direction. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Jamacadaha area (Hodan District) on 06/07. The motive is unclear. The victim was standing near a small shop when he was attacked. The perpetrators escaped.
A journalist is shot and killed in Galkacyo for unknown reasons. It is not clear if the attack occurred in Northern or Southern portion of the city.

Hundreds people staged a peaceful demonstration in Jowhar on 07/07 in protest against the presence of KDF in Lower Juba Region. The protestors accused the KDF of not being neutral in the recent fighting in Kismaayo and called for their withdrawal from the region.

Two groups of Somali forces (Abgal and Elay sub-clans) clashed in Buur Hakaba in the morning of 07/07 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. Two soldiers hailing from Elay sub-clan were killed and another injured, while four soldiers from Abgal sub-clan were wounded in the clash. AMISOM forces intervened and managed to stop the fighting.

Somali forces launched an attack against al Shabaab in Darusalam Village (18km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 07/07. The attack followed after the Somali forces received reports that al Shabaab was planning to attack their base in Aw Dheegle Village (37km SW of Afgooye). The two sides battled for about 45 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Somali forces reportedly seized a number of small arms during the clash and returned to their base in Aw Dheegle. Causalities unknown.

Unidentified militiamen from Galkacyo North shot and killed a herder hailing from the Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan in Buurcad Village (7km E of Galkacyo) in the evening of 07/07. The motive of the killing is unclear but it is believed to be related to clan revenge attack. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Two armed and masked men stormed the home of the headmaster of the local primary school in Cabdil Qadir Village (80km NE of Borama) in the night of 07/07. The motive of the attack is unclear, though it may be linked to clan revenge. The headmaster, who was able to escape unharmed, hails from Isse clan.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: The commander of the Bosasso central police station survives an assassination attempt by unknown gunmen.

Three unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed military officer in Banaadir Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 07/07. The deceased was the SNA commander in Dharkeynley District. The perpetrators stole his pistol and escaped.

Three armed men riding on a motor cycle shot and killed a police officer at Fagax Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 07/07. Soldiers in the vicinity reacted by opening fire at the perpetrators, killing one on the spot and arresting the other two. Conflicting reports indicate that the slain police officer was attached to Heliwa police station.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launches attacks on Kenyan bases stationed at Kismayo airport. Causalities reported, though precise numbers unknown.

On 8 July 2013, a vigilante community policeman opened fire at a group of people in the market area in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 08/07. The motive is unknown. A woman was killed in the attack.

Unidentified men assassinate a government intelligence official at Fagax intersection in Yaaqshiid District. It is not clear if the perpetrators are the same as those who assassinated another official at Banaadir intersection earlier in the afternoon.
Unidentified men assassinate a senior government intelligence official, Abdirahman Ato. The attack occurred at Banaadir intersection.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Somali forces in Ceel Jaale Village (7km SW of Marka). Causalities unknown.

Al Shabaab forces attacked military forces in Shalaambood settlement (Marka) in the night of 08/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. A civilian woman in her home was killed by a stray bullet. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali forces in Ceel Jaale Village (7km SW of Marka) before launching the Shalaambood attack.

Members of various opposition parties protest outside the building of the Transitional Puntland Electoral Commission (TPEC), who been training university students on election process. Police fired weapons into the air to disperse the group. A militia group loyal to the demonstrators attack the police in their defence.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar)in the evening of 08/07. Two soldiers were reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Puntland police clashed with group of militiamen loyal to opposition politicians in Qardho on 08/07. The fighting broke out after police fired in the air to stop a group of demonstrators who wanted to storm a venue where the Transitional Puntland Electoral Commission (TPEC) had been training university students on election process. Causalities unknown.
A vehicle carrying a group of soldiers explodes, causing five injuries and one death. Authorities believe al Shabaab is responsible.

An IED attached on the roof of a restaurant in Awdiinle Village (Baidoa District) detonated in the morning of 09/07. The restaurant was frequented by Somali military forces, though it is unclear if they were the target of the blast. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified militiamen from Galkacyo North shot and injured a herder hailing from Shiikhal clan in Gobsho area (13km N of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 09/07. The motive of the attack killing is unclear but it is believed the perpetrators thought the man was a member of Saad sub-clan. The perpetrators also stole the victims AK 47 rifle and escaped.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Ali Saleban shot and killed a truck driver from Majeerten/Ismail Saleban in Dorokhle area near Carmo Village (205km S of Bosasso) in the evening of 09/07 and carjacked the vehicle. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a passenger in the vehicle was injured in the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police car near Ali Dheere building in the main Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 09/07. Three police officers were reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Armed men suspected to be al Shabaab launched simultaneous attacks against Heliwa police station and military forces based near Abdi Wayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the evening of 09/07. Exchange of gunfire at both locations lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a businessman in the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 09/07. The motive remains unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman in the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 09/07. The victim used to run a teashop frequented by Somali forces. The motive of the killing is unknown since there were no soldiers in the premise during the attack. The perpetrators escaped.
Government forces clash with al Shabaab, causalities reported. The fighting started after al-Shabaab attacked a government army base in the area.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration along Mogadishu-Afgooye road in protest against the destruction of Xawa Cabdi Hospital (Xawa Cabdi settlement) in the morning of 10/07. The protesters, mostly women and children, chanted slogans denouncing SNG forces for demolishing the hospital.

Members of Leysan and Haren sub-clans clashed in Mayafulka area (7km NE of Baidoa) following an escalated dispute of land ownership in the area in the afternoon of 10/07.One Leysan was killed and another wounded.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier near Afgooye Police Station in Dhagax Tuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 10/07. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacked AMISOM forces based in Janaale Village (18 NE of Qoryooley) in the evening of 10/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces in Shalaambood settlement (Marka District) in the night of 10/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Militia men from Lelkase opened fire at pastoralists from Majeerten/Isse Mohamud in Sarmaanyo Village (67km NE of Xudun) on 10/07. The shooting was reportedly a clan revenge attack. Two herders from Majeerten/Isse Mohamud and an Ogaden were injured in the attack.

Armed militiamen believed to be from the Majeerten/Ugaar Saleeban sub-clan attacked a group of Majeerten/Ali Saleeban herders in an area between Hunbays and Rako Raho villages (77km NE of Qardho) on 10/07. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire briefly. Five Ugaar Saleeban militia men were injured in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified armed men in Puntland military uniforms opened fire at a local municipal police in a car in Gaaca area (Bosasso) in the evening of 10/07. One municipal policeman was killed and another injured in the attack. Reports indicate that the attackers had been planning to assassinate the secretary of the municipal council. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with AK-47 rifles shot and killed a khat seller in Zona K area (Hodan District) in the evening of 10/07. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Coca-Cola factory in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 10/07. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM water bowsers. AMISOM forces blocked the road for about 30 minutes and later continued with their trip.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A suicide bomber detonated his explosives near a moving convoy of African Union troops killing himself and three civilian bystanders. Two soldiers wounded. The attack occurred near the airport.
Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab forces (affiliation unknown) base close to Afmadow airstrip in the evening of 11/07. No casualties were reported.
Anti-democracy protesters demonstrate in Xaafuun.

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Iskushuban in the morning of 11/07 in protest against political parties. The demonstrators reportedly carried anti-political parties slogans. Horseed party official, who had been planning to hold a public rally in the town, were forced to cancel it following the demonstration.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Mubarak village (9km SW of Aw Dheegle) in the night of 11/07. The victim used to sell khat to soldiers. The motive of the killing is unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A IED targeted a AMISOM convoy near SOS Junction in Heliwa District in the morning of 11/07.Casualties or damages could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy along the airport-K4 road (Haaji Dool area) in proximity of the WFP compound and several INGO offices in the afternoon of 12/07. Three AMISOM soldiers, six civilians were reportedly killed and eight others injured. The blast caused extensive damage to some properties along the road. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
Five are killed and nine wounded during an attack on a Somali base by al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted AMISOM vehicles in Afgooye town in Bar Ismail area in the evening of 12/07. Reports indicate that the explosion damaged a water tanker. AMISOM closed the area after the explosion. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene unidentified.

Al Shabaab attacked Somali forces in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 12/07. Al Shabaab fired several RPGs rounds at the soldiers before the two sides engaged in direct confrontation that lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could be established.
Two al Shabaab groups clashed over the issue of hosting Barre Hiraale in al Shabaab territory. Causalities and result of the clash unknown.

Al Shabaab forces launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali positions in Goof Gaduud (30km SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 12/07. The clash lasted for around 20 minutes. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen from Ugar-Saleban ambushed and opened fire at a public transport vehicle near Kalabayr Village (Bosasso District) on 12/07. The motive was reported as clan revenge attack between Ugar-Saleban and Ali Saleban. Four passengers killed in the attack.

Local militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud opened fire at a car of a prominent clan elder in the evening of 12/07. The elders also hails from Omar Mohamud sub-clan. The son of the elder was injured in the shooting but the elder was unhurt. Reports indicate that both the elder and his son were strong supporters of Horseed Party.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante-Ugaasyo sub clan carjacked two vehicles belonging Dhulbahante-Jamac Siyaad in the vicinity of Buuro-Wadal (100km E of Laas Caanood) on 12/07. The motive for the attack was apparently related to clan revenge.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at Barwaaqo Hotel near Shaqaalaha junction (Waaberi District) in the evening of 12/07. A large number of people were in the restaurant of the hotel to break their fast at the time of the attack. One person was killed and seven others injured.
""One INGO staff member was injured when shooting broke out during what seems to have been an inter-clan attack.""

A group of people demonstrated in front of Lughaya MCH (Mother and Child Health care) on 13/07 after the driver of the centres ambulance refused to transport unconscious boy to Borama Hospital. The demonstrators reportedly stoned the centre and called for the sacking of the driver and other staffs.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/KDF positions in Badhaade in the night of 13/07. The clash lasted for 30 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Anti-al Shabaab security forces (affiliation not named) conduct a security operation against al Shabaab. Two Marehan members of the sect are shot and killed. The operation was in response to a clash within al Shabaab the previous day.

Al Shabaab forces launched a hit-and-run attack against anti-al Shabaab positions in Qooqaani on the Dhoobley-Afmadow road in the night of 13/07. The attack was of a very limited scale. No casualties were reported.

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xabado Stadium in Buuhoodle on 13/07 in protest against plans by Puntland to hold the local council elections in Buuhoodle. The protestors chanted slogans condemning pro-Puntland Dhulbahante officials who were organizing the elections to be held in the town.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at a Playstation lounge in Shareeca neighbourhood of Ceelasha in the night of 13/07. Two young boys who were playing video-games were reportedly injured. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Two pastoralists were killed by al Shabaab while looking for their lost camels about 15km W of Baardheere in the afternoon of 13/07. The two men were reportedly accused of spying for anti-al Shabaab forces based in Ceel Waaq District.

Unidentified men armed with pistols and AK-47 rifles shot and killed a staff of a local NGO in front of Tawqa Mosque in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) after the evening prayer on 13/07. The motive of the killing is unclear. However, reports indicate that the victim had been working with the Transitional Puntland Electoral Commission.

A child was shot and killed by Raskamboni militiamen who opened fire at a group of bystanders in Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the morning of 13/07. The reason for the shooting is unknown. No arrests were made after the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attacked pirates from Majeerten/Ali Saleeban in Carmo (205km S of Bosasso)they had been tracking in the evening of 13/07. Six civilian bystanders were injured in the attack.
Suspected al Shabaab members attacked a group of soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of the ex-cigarette factory along Industrial road in the night of 13/07. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Heliwa police station in the night of 13/07. Police officers fired back in the suspected direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol in Radaar neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 13/07. The soldiers fired back after the blast. Casualties could not be established.
A hand grenade targeting Somali forces explodes in Bakaara Market, causing three civilian deaths and ten injures.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 13/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police on patrol in Suuq Bacad (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 13/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a military position in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 13/07. The soldiers manning the position opened fire immediately after the blast. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a NSA officer near Wadajir Police station (Wadajir District) in the evening of 13/07. The victim was reportedly the son of the Custodial Commissioner.

Suspected al Shabaab forces shot and killed two soldiers who were sitting in a shop chewing khat in the vicinity of Dayniile hospital in the evening of 13/07. One civilian was also killed and five others injured.

An IED exploded under a Raskamboni vehicle in Fanoole neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the morning of 14/07. Raskamboni militias opened indiscriminate fire after the incident, killing two girls. The driver of the vehicle was injured in the blast. Two other explosives were found in the area later in the day.

About hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xaafuun (115km NE of Iskushuban) on 14/07 in protest against the democratization process being spearheaded by Puntland government. The demonstration was organized by the community leaders.

Non-violent activity: Local militiamen hailing from the Majeerten Omar Mohamud seized about 15 ballot boxes being transported to Buuhoodle from Galkacyo North in the morning of 14/07. The group later burned the election materials. The Omar Mahmud sub-clan are a part of an anti-democratic movement reacting against the Puntland government pushing for a culture of greater democracy.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Marka police station (Marka) in the evening of 14/07. Police opened fire immediately after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base in Shalaambood (Marka District) in the evening of 14/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about an hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Local residents said the fighting was heavy, though casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attacked anti-democratic militia group hailing from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud in Qardho on 14/07. The fighting broke after the militiamen reportedly ordered the government forces to surrender the ballot boxes. Two Puntland soldiers and two militia men were killed in the clash. Five other people including civilians were injured.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a NSA officer close to Bakara Junction (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 14/07. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against security forces manning a checkpoint in Bakara Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 14/07. The soldiers fired back in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade at a barber shop in the livestock market area in Heliwa district in the afternoon of 14/07. The barber died in the explosion and two of his clients were injured. Unconfirmed reports indicate that one of the clients was a government soldier.

Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit-and-run attack against a military position in Ex-control Balcad in the night of 12-14/07. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. No casualties were reported.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a young civilian returning home from mosque in the Livestock Market area (Heliwa District) in the night of 14/07. The motive for the attack is unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces on patrol at Sanaa Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 14/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Abdi ""Dhagaf"" Jama Ilmi, the commander of the First Brigade of the Puntland commando division, was killed when a large calibre bullet struck him during a clash between Puntland forces and an armed group opposed to local council elections
Gunmen from Warsangeli-Reer Garaad carjack a vehicle belonging to a man from Habar-Yoonis-Urursuge. The motive is likely clan related.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds at Sierra Leonean forces based in Kismaayo in the night of 15/07. The Sierra Leonean forces responded with artillery and small arms fire, forcing al Shabaab withdraw. There were no reports of casualties.

The Dhulbahante sub-clans of Jamac Siyaad and Mohamed Siyaad clashed in Abeesalay near Adhicadeeye, (31km NW of Laas Caanood) on 15/07 following an escalated dispute over pastureland. One combatant was killed in the clash.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Wanla Weyne in the afternoon of 15/07 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. Two soldiers were reportedly killed while two others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF in Bilis Qoqani Village (Afmadow District) in the morning of 15/07. The attack lasted only a few minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

The body of a man hailing from Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar sub-clan was found in the outskirts of Buuhoodle on 15/07. The body had knife wounds. The motive and the identity of the perpetrators remain unknown.
Four men hailing from Isse Muse clan reportedly shot at employees of oil company conducting a survey in Xangay (63km SW of Burao). The motivation for the attack is unknown. Causalities unknown.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Afgooye Secondary School in Afgooye in the evening of 15/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a Somali government forces officer in Macmacanka neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 15/07. The device exploded outside the house. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Two masked men armed with pistols shot and killed a young man in Jamacadaha neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/07. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escaped. Police arrived at the scene but made no arrest.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Towfiiq Hotel in Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 15/07. The soldiers responded by firing in the suspected directions. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers in Dahablaha Section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 15/07. The attackers escaped. Somali forces arrived at the scene and launched a security operation, and arrested a number of people they suspected of being behind the killings.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces moving near Shaqaalaha Building, (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/07. A civilian bystander was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces manning a checkpoint in Shanta Geed neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) on 15/07. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces at Bakaara Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/07. The soldiers responded by firing in the suspected directions. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Sheikh Adan Dhere building in Wardhiigley District, where the commander of Somali government forces in Dharkeynley stays. Soldiers responded by firing in the suspected directions. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based near Marka police station (Marka) in the evening of 16/07. No casualties reported. The attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces stationed in Janaale (18 NE of Qoryooley) in the morning of 16/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about seven minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Somali forces clashed with a clan militia (not identified) in Mareerey Village (6km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 16/07. The fighting was reportedly started by Somali forces in unclear circumstance. Two combatants were killed and two others were injured. Somali forces also arrested six militiamen and seized 11 guns during the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing near Maslah base in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 16/07. An AMISOM water bowser was reportedly damaged in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.
An IED targeted security guards at a hospital in Hodan District. Causalities unknown.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Biyo Degaanka area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 16/07. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

Conflict among security forces: SNA clashed with SNG army and police on one side in Olympic area (Shibis District) in the afternoon of 16/07. The fighting broke out after SNA soldiers opened fire at a vehicle belonging to police and also arrested the brother of the commander of SNG army in Shibis District, prompting the army and police to jointly attack the SNA soldiers. Causalities could not be established.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on foot patrol near the former milk factory (Hodan District)in the evening of 16/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on foot patrol in Radaar neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 16/07. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Five soldiers and two civilians are wounded, and several other injured after am IED targeting AMISOM forces detonates. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility immediately following the bombing.

Three persons including the Deputy Mayor of Baidoa district were injured in a shootout between Somali Federal government soldiers and the security guards of Baidoas Deputy Mayor. The clash spurred from a clash over contractor work taking place in Baidoa market.
Raskamboni forces shot and injured two local journalists in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 17/07. The two were shot after they refused to stop at a driver checkpoint.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds at Aawdiinle Village in Baidoa District in the night of 18 17/07. AMISOM forces responded by firing artillery guns in the direction of the al Shabaab attackers. No casualties were reported.
An ENDF convoy estimated to be about one battalion (800 +/- soldiers) arrived in Doolow from Baidoa in the morning of 17/07. The forces set up a base just outside the airstrip.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on patrol in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar town in the night of 17/07. The soldiers opened fire indiscriminately after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab attacked Afmadow police station (Afmadow) in the night of 17/07. The fighters started the attack with hand grenades and RPGs followed by an armed clash that went on for 10 minutes, after which the attackers withdrew. Al Shabaab were reportedly seen dragging injured colleagues as they retreated. It is unclear if the attack occurred on 07/16 or 07/17.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Xawa Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the night of 17/07. The motive is unclear but local residents say the victim used to interact with the Somali government forces in Afgooye. The perpetrators escaped.

A Hadame clan/pro-SNG militia opened fire on at Bay regional and district officials at the old livestock market in Baidoa in the morning of 17/07. The deputy District Commissioner and his body guard were injured in the shooting. The militiamen were reportedly targeting the governor but not the deputy District Commissioner in the attack. The attack papered to be over jurisdictional control and money. No causalities reported.
An IED targeted police based near Madina Hotel (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 17/07. One police officer was injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Three unidentified armed men shot and killed the deputy District Commissioner of Yaaqshiid District near Fagax Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 17/07. Somali forces conducted a security operation in the area and arrested two men they suspected of behind the killing.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police based at Xera Ruush (Hodan District) in the evening of 17/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police officers on foot patrol close to Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 17/07. A bystander was reportedly injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Heavy fighting reported between Raskamboni and al Shabaab forces in the Mahelaay Village of Kismayo. The clash occurred late in the evening. Both sides suffered losses, though any specific numbers are unclear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces in Bilis Qooqani (48km SW of Afmadow) in the night of 17/07. AMISOM used artillery guns against al Shabaab during the clash which lasted for five minutes. Eight AMISOM deaths, seventeen injures reported. There was a similar clash in the town two days previous.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against Marka police station in the night of 18/07. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab ambushed an ENDF convoy near Yurkud Village (40km SE of Luuq) in the noon of 18/07. The attack started with an explosion believed to have been a land mine followed by an armed confrontation that lasted briefly. The ENDF convoy had left the village and was heading to Luuq when the attack took place. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab militias ambushed a vehicle transporting local security forces based in Afmadow on the alternative road linking Afmadow and Dhoobley in the morning of 18/07. Four soldiers were killed and three seriously injured.

Al Shabaab supporting Sheikh Ahmed Godane shot and injured Mukhtar Ganey - a top al Shabaab commander from Bay/Bakool regions supporting Sheikh Mukhtar Roobow - in Rama-Cadey (Diinsoor District) on 18/07. The commander was arrested and handed over to the al Shabaab-Amnyat after the shooting.

Unidentified attackers threw two hand grenades against Somali forces in Biyo Degaanka area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 18/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that two soldiers may have been killed. The perpetrators managed to escape. A security operation was conducted after the attack and an unknown number of persons were arrested.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a police officer close to the Dayniile bus stand (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the end of the afternoon of 18/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a man in Bakara Market (Abdalla Shideeye section) in the evening of 18/07. The victim was leaving a local mosque. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A IED targeted Somali forces on foot patrol in Ali Kamiin neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 18/07. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. An unknown number of soldiers were killed or injured. Several arrests were made after the attack.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Bakara market (Abdalla Shideeye section) in the evening of 18/07. The perpetrators stole the gun of the victim and escaped from the area.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two NSA officers in Bakara market in the end of the afternoon of 18/07. Both victims were wearing civilian clothes when attacked. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab forces attack government bases in Awdiinle, beginning an attack lasting for several hours. Causalities reported, though numbers are not clear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road near Siinka-Dheer in the evening of 19/07. Causalities could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a local doctor in Ceelasha Biyaha in the night of 19/07. The victim is reported to be a relative of the former NSA chief Mohamed Moalim Fiqi. The victim was attacked and killed as he was coming back home from mosque. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab opened at the residence of the chairperson of Cows-Qurun village (Baardheere District) in the night of 22:00. A man sleeping in the house was killed. Al Shabaab was reportedly looking for the chairperson of the village, who was absent from his house at the time of the attack.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in Sei-Biano area (Hodan District) in the end of the afternoon of 19/07. The attackers stole the victims AK-47 before escaping.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab operatives threw a hand grenade against AMISOM forces based in Jalle Siyaad Military Academy (Hodan District) in the evening of 19/07. Reports indicate that a brief armed clash which lasted for around 10 minutes followed the blast. No casualties were reported.
Clash reported between Raskamboni forces and al Shabaab along the outskirts of Kismayo. ""Damages"" reported by each side.
Unidentified gunmen killed a doctor after he left a mosque in suburban Ceelesha Biyaha. Motive unknown.

512 Khatumo militiamen with 13 technicals defected from Khatumo forces in Taalex and reached Biyo-Gaduud and Fiqi-Fuliye on 19/07. Most of the defectors hailed from a Dhulbahante sub-clan, though it is not clear if their allegiance played a role in their defection. Additionally, several other Khatumo soldiers defected in Sarmaanyo village (61km NW of Taleex) on 18/07. Reports indicate that all defectors in Sarmaanyo were hailing from the same sub-clan of Dhulbahante.

Government soldiers are targeted in an explosion at Bar Ismail junction. Two soldiers were killed in the attack and an unconfirmed number injured among government troops. Security forces begun to fire indiscriminately soon after the attack.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against Marka police station in the night of 20/07. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against the NSA base in the Afgooye secondary school in the evening of 20/07. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit-and run-attack against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Shalaambood in the night of 20/07. The clash lasted for a few minutes. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and run-attack against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Janaale in the night of 20/07. The clash lasted for a few minutes. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed an al Shabaab militiaman in Buulo Baaqey village in the evening of 20/07. The militiaman had reportedly been threatening the local villagers for an unknown reason in the days prior to the incident.

Al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces based in Yaaq-Bari-Weyne (Lidow Jallaad bridge) Wanlaweyn District in the night of 20/07. The clash lasted for one hour. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against anti-al Shabaab (not identified) and AMISOM/KDF forces in Badhaade in the night of 20-21/07. The clash was reported as relatively intense and lasted for a few hours. Casualties could not be established. Al Shabaab withdrew after the attack.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed Moallin Hassan Ilmi Ciyow - the second deputy of the Beled Weyne court and a prominent member of the ASWJ movement in Hiraan - in Kooshin neighbourhood the night of 20/07. Motive is unknown.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in New Bossaso on 20/07. The victim was hailing from the Daarood/Dhulmahante clan. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The motive of the killing is unclear.
An unidentified business woman is killed by unidentified assailants. The motive for the killing is not known.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a police officer close to the Heliwa police station in the evening of 20/07. The victim was heading to Heliwa police station when attacked. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A RCIED targeted Somali forces in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 20/07. Reports indicate that the device was planted in a place frequented by the soldiers. Casualties were confirmed but their number is unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw two hand grenades against Somali forces on foot patrol in the clothe market area (Xamar Weyne District) on 20/07. The soldiers opened fire after the blasts. The attackers managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Somali forces based close to Bakaara Junction (Hodan District) in the end of the afternoon of 20/07. The soldiers fired back after the blast. An unknown number of civilians were wounded as the result of the blast and/or the subsequent shooting. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against police officers on foot patrol in Uunlaay neighbourhood (Xamar Weyne District) in the evening of 20/07. The grenade missed its target and did not cause any casualty.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in front of SOS Hospital (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 20/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Somali and AMISOM forces reached the scene after the killing and conducted a security operation arresting several persons in and around the hospital.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against Somali soldiers manning a fixed position in Black Sea Junction area (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 20/07. The grenade missed and exploded away from its target. One civilian was reportedly killed while four others were injured. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Fighting reported after government forces launched an attack late in the evening on an al Shabaab base in Wardheer District. Three people have been confirmed to have been killed, with more injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launches a late-night attack on AMISOM forces base located at Jowhar airport. Causalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A land mine targets AMISOM/Sierra Leone forces near Kismayo hospital. Witnesses claim four civilian deaths. The number of military deaths is unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in Qooqaani and Taabto locations in the night of 21/07. Reports indicate that the clash lasted for a few minutes with both sides using heavy weapons. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in Tabta village in the night of 21/07. Reports indicate that the clash lasted for a few minutes with both sides using heavy weapons. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali positions by the Jowhar airstrip in the night of 21/07. The fighting lasted for around 30 minutes. Casualties are unconfirmed.

Al Shabaab and Somali forces clashed in Wardheer village in the night of 21/07. The incident followed the assassination of an al Shabaab militiamen by residents of Buulo Baaqey on 20/07. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly attempted to retaliate against the villagers in the following night but were confronted by security forces that had been dispatched from Awdiinle to support the local residents. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen armed with AK-47 rifles onboard an unregistered vehicle reportedly shot and injured a civilian in Xero Darawiish area near Kapital hotel in Galkacyo North in the night of 21/07. The motive of the shooting is unascertained.

A man hailing from the Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan armed with an AK-47 rifle shot and killed a man hailing from the Arab Salah sub-clan in Bursaalax (49 km NW of Galkacyo) in the evening of 21/07. Motivation not clear. Local residents arrested the perpetrator.

A man hailing from the Dir clan and armed with a pistol shot and killed another man from the Jararweyne clan in Bulo-Bacley IDP camp close to the green line in Galkacyo in the morning of 21/07. The motive for the attack is not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against Marka police station in the night of 21/07. The hand-grenade hit the gate of a residential house opposite to the police station. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Indented attackers threw a hand grenade against the police station in Kaaraan District in the night of 21/07. The blast injured two policemen and one civilian. Somali forces located near the station opened fire and conducted a security operation after the blast. Two injured men were arrested after the attack and later summarily executed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unconfirmed reports indicate that Kenyan warships patrolling Somali coast off Kismaayo shelled Goob Weyn village (13km N of Kismaayo) in the early morning of 22/07. At least two civilians were reportedly severely wounded. Goob Weyne is a base of forces loyal to Barre Hiraale.
Public transport drivers staged a peaceful demonstration against the customs department and their taxation practices.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle of pro-Somali forces (not identified) in Awdiinle at noon of 22/07. The device exploded few seconds after the vehicle passed its location. No casualties were reported. Pro-Somali forces conducted a security operation after the attack and arrested an unspecific number of people suspected of involvement in it.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali/AMISOM forces in Bilis Qooqaani at night of 22/07. The fighting lasted for about one hour. Casualties are unknown.

Three hand grenades were thrown at Somali forces stationed in Bar Ismail Junction in Afgooye town in the evening of 22/07. The forces fired in the direction of the perpetrators after the attack. The attackers escaped from the scene. Casualties are unknown.

Somali forces led by one of the commanders in Lower Shabelle region (Habr Gedir clan), moving along the Marka-Mogadishu road were ambushed by other Somali soldiers (from Biyomaal clan) based in Muuri village in the morning of 22/07. The clash is believed to be part of the recurring tensions between the Habr Gedir and Biyoomal clans over the control of Marka District. Causalities reported but remain unknown.

Somali forces travelling from Merka to Afgooye were ambushed in KM 60 area by another group of Somali troops. Three soldiers were killed and two others (including the regional chief of intelligence) were injured. The attack was reported to be linked to clan retaliation. The fighting was reported to be motivated by a clan conflict between the Habr Gedir and Biimaal clans.

Three farmers were killed by unknown gunmen in Ceel-wareegow in the night of 22/07. The deceased farmers were taken out from their homes and executed. The killing is believed to be motivated by clan revenge. The farmers hail from the Habr Gedir.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Ali Saleeban sub-clan opened fire at a police pickup on patrol in Bosasso in the night of 22/07. Three bullets hit the vehicle. The reason behind the shooting was reported as revenge attack between the militia and the police. No casualties were reported. Police arrested the gunmen.
Unknown gunmen attacked Yaaqshiid Police Station in the night of 22/07. Small arms and RPGs were used during the attack which lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Unknown attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier near Bar Ubah Junction in Hawl-Wadaag District at noon of 22/07. The perpetrators stole the soldiers gun and escaped from the scene.

Somali security forces exchanged gunfire with an unknown gunman armed with a pistol near Maalin Taajir building in Bakara Market in the afternoon of 22/07. The shooting broke out after the soldiers tried to arrest the man. The gunman managed to escape from the scene.
Unidentified clan militias clash outside Jowhar, three reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AL Shabaab forces attack Kismayo airport, base for AMISOM forces in the area. Causalities not reported. The Somali Memo is typically biased toward al Shabaab.

Al Shabaab operatives and the security guards escorting a prominent elder exchanged gunfire in Beled Weyne in the morning of 23/07. The elder and one of his security guards were injured in the shootout. The al Shabaab operatives were reportedly planning to kill the elder. The attackers managed to escape.

The security guards of the District Commissioner of Guri Ceel shot in the air to disperse a group of people who staged a demonstration in front of the Commissioners office on 23/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the decision to ban the new Somali currency that was reportedly printed illegally. The protestors claimed that they money was already in circulation and it was too late to withdraw it. An elderly man was killed by a stray bullet.

An IED targeted a Raskamboni truck in Farjano neighbourhood in Kismaayo on 23/07. Two RKB soldiers and two bystanders (children) were slightly injured and the vehicle was partially destroyed. The RKB forces launched a security operation after the blast and arrested several people they suspected of being involved in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali forces in Arbacow settlement (13km E of Afgoye) in the evening of 23/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces near Balli Dogle Airport (Wanla Weyne District) in the evening of 23/07. The two sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. Two al Shabaab deaths reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces in Aawdinle Village (Baidoa District) in the evening of 23/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire at a truck carrying khat near Laag Village in Bosasso District in the afternoon of 23/07. The motive of the attack is currently unclear. The vehicle managed to escape.
Biyo Maal militiamen kill two men from Habar Gidir sub clan for unknown reason. The attack likely occurred in Marka district.

Al Shabaab operatives and the security guards escorting a prominent elder exchanged gunfire in Beled Weyne in the morning of 23/07. The elder and one of his security guards were injured in the shootout. The al Shabaab operatives were reportedly planning to kill the elder. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on patrol in Irid-Amin area in Koshin neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 23/07. The device landed in an open area. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces clashed with a militia group in Galbarwaaqo Village (86km W of Cadaado) in the afternoon of 23/07. The fighting broke out after the militiamen, who reportedly vandalized water pipes to the village, resisted arrest. One militiaman was killed and another injured. One Galmudug soldier was also injured in the clash. The security forces managed to arrest three other militiamen.

Hundreds of protesters, mainly women and children, gathered in the streets of Guri Ceel to protest against usage of fake banknotes in the town. The demonstrators burned tires and threw stones. Police dispersed the demonstration by firing in the air.

Three unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a NSA officer in KPP neighbourhood (Hodan District) on 23/07. The victim was unarmed and was heading to his home when he was attacked. The perpetrators escaped. Military forces arrived in the area but made no arrest.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on patrol at Al-Baraka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 23/07. A civilian bystander was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.
Unknown men stabbed and killed a young man in Total neighbourhood in Ahmed Dhagax District (Hargeisa) in the evening of 23/07. The motive of the killing is unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols men shot and killed a staff of a local NGO, Abdinasir Muhammad Ilmi, in Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo in the evening of 23/07. The motive of the killing is currently unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 24/07. An AMISOM truck was reportedly damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.
Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 24/07 in protest against the new illegally printed Somali currency.

A al Shabaab planted RCIED targeted a public transport mini-bus in Leego Village (48km SW of Buur Hakaba), in the afternoon of 24/07. The device was planted on the road and was reportedly aimed to target Somali/AMISOM forces who frequently use the road. No casualties were reported but the explosion damaged the rear side of the bus.

Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds at the position of Somali forces in Barirre Village (27km SW of Afgooye) on 24/07 followed by armed clash between the two sides. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established, though pro-al Shabaab news sources declare there to be without providing numbers or degree of injury.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked the residence of the Baidoa District Commissioner (Baidoa) in the night of 24/07. The attackers started the attack with a RPG followed by an armed confrontation that lasted for about an hour. AMISOM forces arrived in the area and backed the Somali forces protecting the Comissioner, forcing al Shabaab forces to withdraw. Three Somali soldiers were wounded in the clash. Casualties from the al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab attacked the residence of the Baidoa District Commissioner (Baidoa) in the night of 24/07. The attackers started the attack with a RPG followed by an armed confrontation that lasted for about an hour. AMISOM forces arrived in the area and backed the Somali forces protecting the Comissioner, forcing al Shabaab forces to withdraw. Three Somali soldiers were wounded in the clash. Casualties from the al Shabaab side could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Daryeel Market (Heliwa District) in the noon of 24/07. The assailants stole the gun of their victim and escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces in Sarta Qabyada area (Heliwa District) in the night of 24/07. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at private residential house for military officers in Arafaat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 24/07. Security forces responded by firing in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run against Somali/AMISOM forces based at the former Perfume Factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 24/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A IED targeted a vehicle carrying two MPs along the Via Egito road in Xamar Weyne District in the morning of 24/07. There are conflicting reports about the incident: some reports claim that the device was planted in the car while other versions suggest that the IED was buried on road side. Two civilian bystanders were killed and seven others injured. Two body guards of the MPs were also injured in the attack but the two MPs escaped unhurt.

Unidentified attackers hurled several hand grenades at Yaaqshiid police station (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 24/07. Police manning the station opened fire in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fired two RPG rounds and threw a hand grenade at soldiers and police on foot patrol at Towfiiq Junction in the evening of 24/07. The security forces responded to the attack and a brief armed clash followed. One policeman was reportedly injured.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man near the former Defence Ministry (Hodan District)in the evening of 24/07. The motive is unclear. The victim was attacked as he headed home. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces based at the former milk factory (Hodan District) in the evening of 24/07. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
A car bomb targeting an MP, Sheikh Adan Mader, explodes but leaves the lawmaker unhurt. One civilian was killed and several other bystandards were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacked an AMISOM base in Banaaney (2km NE of Beled Weyne airstrip) in the night of 25/07. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the attackers withdraw. Casualties are unknown.

Relatives of an alleged rape victim staged a demonstration in front of Sanaag regional court in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 25/07. The group was protesting against a court ruling in which the suspected perpetrator was released for lack of evidence. Police arrived and arrested a number of the protestors but released them in the evening.

Unknown attackers threw a hand grenade against Somali forces based at Xawo Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the night of 25/07. The Somali opened gunfire in response to the explosion. No casualties were reported.

Armed militiamen hailing from Habar Gidir attacked militias from Biyo Maal sub-clan in Ceel-Wareegow Village (11km NE of Marka) in the morning of 25/06. The attack was reportedly in revenge of murder of two men hailing from Habar Gidir by Biyo Maal militias on 23/07. Casualties remain unknown.
