Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and injured a local businessman hailing from the Darood-Ogaden clan in Midnimo market of south Galkacyo in the evening of 25/07. The motivation for the attack is not known.

Soldiers travelling on a technical opened fire at civilians on Maka Al-Mukarama road in the evening of 25/07. The shooting was reportedly aimed at dispersing the crowd blocking the road. One civilian was killed. It is not clear if the crowd was protesting.

Somali soldiers shot and killed a young man in Jungal Neighbourhood of Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 26/07. The soldiers shot the man after he refused to hand over his mobile phone to the soldiers during a robbery.

Security guards of MPs living in Taleex neighbourhood fired at a mini-bus in Taleex Neighbourhood of Hodan District in the evening of 25/07. One civilian was killed. The reason for the shooting is unknown.

Al Shabaab and local pastoralists clashed in Qoran Gog area (approx. 40kms NE of Garbaharey) in the afternoon of 26/07. The clash was reported to had broken out after al Shabaab forces attempted to confiscate several camels. Two al Shabaab members killed, several others wounded.

Habar Gedir and Biyamal clan militias clashed in Muuri village (16km SW of Afgooye town) in the morning of 26/07. The clash is a part of a series of clan motivated confrontations between the two groups in the area. At least 6 people were killed in the fighting.
Unknown attackers threw a hand grenade against a base of security forces at military hospital in Hodan in the evening of 26/07. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Three unknown gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a young woman in Livestock Market area of Heliwa District in the afternoon of 26/07. The reason for the killing is currently unknown.

An RCIED exploded at the entrance of Hawl Wadaag Police Station in the evening of 26/07. A secondary RCIED targeted the policemen helping their colleagues injured in the first blast. Casualties could not be confirmed.
Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG foot patrol in livestock market area of Heliwa District in the afternoon of 26/07. One civilian was killed and five others were injured.

A civilian man was shot and killed in his house in Daryeel market area of Heliwa in the night of 26/07. Unconfirmed reports suggest that his murder may be linked to his frequent visits to the a government military base in former Warshadda Nanaca. The victim previously received death threats over the phone.
Five civilians are wounded when unidentified gunmen hurled grenades at government soldiers guarding a market in Hodan District.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED attack targeted an AMISOM convoy on the Afgooye - Marka road in Ceel-wareegow on 27/07. The explosion reportedly damaged a water tanker. No other casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab attacked a local pro-SNG, anti-al Shabaab militias base (militia not named) in Isha Neighbourhood of Baidoa in the early morning of 27/07. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes. One militiaman was reportedly injured.
Two al Shabaab fighters exchanged fire in the centre of Wajid town for unknown reason on 27/07. No causalities.
Unconfirmed reports indicates that al Shabaab attacked positions of Somali forces outside Janaale in the night of 27/07. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

A man hailing from the Osman Mohamoud/Reer Issa sub-clan shot and killed a Khat dealer hailing from the Osman Mohamoud/Bah Dhulmahante sub-clan near Alla-Amin Hotel in Qardho in the evening of 27/07. The victim was sitting at a tea shop when the gunman shot him. The killing is motivated by clan revenge.

Unknown attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in livestock market area of Heliwa District in the evening of 27/07. The perpetrators stole the gun from the soldier and escaped from the scene.
Unknown attackers assassinated a well known local businessman outside a mosques in Heliwa District in the evening of 27/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A RCIED attack targeted a vehicle belonging to the Ministry of Transport at Sana Junction in the morning of 27/07. It was not immediately clear if the IED was placed inside the vehicle or on the road. A person travelling in the vehicle was killed and several bystanders were injured.
Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at Yaaqshiid police station in the evening of 27/07. The grenade exploded outside the station. No casualties were reported.
Unknown gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Sei-Biano area of Hodan District in the evening of 27/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Somali forces reportedly exchanged gunfire with two men armed with pistols in Ajabka neighbourhood in Dharkeynley District in the evening of 27/07. The two men were overpowered in the gunfight and were arrested. It is not clear what sparked the clash.
Suspected al Shabaab attacked Somali forces in Xero Jarmal Neighbourhood of Dayniile District at night of 27/07. The fight was initiated by RPG fire. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired several mortars at Somali/AMISOM base at the former perfume factory in Heliwa District in the early morning of 27/07. No casualties were reported.
Unknown gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a member of NSA in Afar-Irdood area of Hamar Weyne in the night of 27/07. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab conducted an attack against the Turkish Guest-house in Taleex Neighbourhood of Hodan District in the afternoon of 27/07. The attack was initiated by an explosion of a suicide vehicle (VBIED) on the main road between the guest-house and Shifa Hospital. It is unclear if the vehicle exploded on the road or attempted to ram against the wall/gate of the compound. The explosion was followed by a fire fight during which two other suicide bombers on foot were shot dead. The situation was pacified and the al Shabaab forces failed to gain entry to the compound. Somalias prime minister says a Turkish security official and a Somali student were killed in the attack. Additionally, six Turkish nationals and an unknown number of civilian bystanders were reportedly severely wounded in the attack. Other reports claim Turkish deaths.
Non-violent activity: A freelance militia erected two illegal road block between Dhabad and Cabud Waaq on 28/07 and extorted money from passing travellers.
Al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack against Somali/Ethiopian forces in Garbahaarey in the night of 28/07. Casualties unknown.
A group of youths throw stones at a police vehicle in an effort to prevent the arrest of several of their clan elders. The desire to arrest the elders is not known.

Militiamen hailing from the Saad clan armed with AK-47s shot and killed a pastoralist hailing from the Majerteen/Nuux Jibrail sub-clan in Godod area in the evening of 28/07. A militia group hailing from the Majerteen clan pursued the perpetrators and after they failed to capture them they shot and killed about 20 goats and a camel belonging to Saad pastoralists.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a tea shop commonly used by Somali soldiers in front of AMISOM base in the west side of Beled Weyne in the evening of 28/07. The grenade landed in an open space area next to the shop. No injuries were reported.
Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at Marka police station in the evening of 28/07. Casualties are unknown.
Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Abdiwayel cinema in the early morning hours of 28/07. The grenade exploded outside the building. No casualties were reported.

Unknown attackers threw a hand grenade at Galbeed police station in Dharkeynley District in the evening of 28/07. The forces based at the location opened fire in the direction of the perpetrators after the attack. No casualties were reported.

Unknown attackers threw a hand grenade against Somali forces in Ceelgalow neighbourhood in Medina District in the evening of 28/07. The forces opened fire in the direction of the perpetrators after the attack. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED attack targeted an AMISOM (Burundian) convoy in Buulojaan neighbourhood of Merka town in the morning of 28/07. After the explosion al Shabaab attacked forces the convoy with small arms and RPGs. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted a heavy attack against Somali/AMISOM position in Yaqberiweyne in early morning hours of 29/07. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Unknown attackers threw two hand grenades at a military base in Hantiwadaag neighbourhood of Jowhar District in the evening of 29/07. The soldiers opened fire after the incident. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a position of Somali/AMISOM forces in Aw Dehegle in the night of 29/07. The fighting lasted for about 10 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali forces in Shalaambood in the night of 29/07. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

About one hundred people demonstrated against the Puntland administration in the vicinity of Dharkayn-Geenyo village (67km SW of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 29/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the creation of a new Puntland district with its centre in the area.

Al Shabaab forces reportedly assassinated a local pastoralist in the evening of 29/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the killing was linked to his previous participation in a fight between the local community and al Shabaab forces.
An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces buying khat near Bar Taxi in Yaaqshiid District. The targeted soldier was reportedly killed and the khat salesman was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Arrests: AMISOM and Somali Alpha units conducted a security operation in Medina District at night of 29/07. Around 100 people were arrested.

A RCIED attack reportedly targeted a freelance doctor in front of KPP building in Hodan District in the morning of 29/07. Four civilians were reportedly injured. Unconfirmed reports suggest that the doctor was among those injured. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown.
Unknown attackers armed with pistols assassinated an unarmed soldier near Bar Xadda in Wardhiigley district in the evening of 29/07. The attackers escaped from the scene.
Unknown attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers in Bakara Market in the afternoon of 29/07. The soldiers were guarding tax collectors operating in the market.

Unknown attackers armed with pistols attacked soldiers in Lanta Towfiq in the afternoon of 29/07. The soldiers intercepted the attackers and fighting between the two groups followed for about 10 minutes. Two of the soldiers were reportedly killed and another one was injured. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Residents stage a violent protest against the local government banning the use of a counterfeit currency already in heavy circulation. Many of the protesters threw stones at passing cars and damaged property. No causalities reported.

Al-Shabaab shot dead Ahmed Makaran Abdi, a pastoralist in the Moqokori area of Mahas district, in an attack that also wounded his daughter. The motive for the attack is unknown, but residents said Abdi had been present for previous clashes between locals and al-Shabaab sympathisers in Moqokori.
Suspected al Shabaab shelled Somali positions in Garbaharey in the early morning hours of 29/07. No casualties were reported.

A group of teenagers demonstrated against oil exploration in Balli Hiile (41km S of Burco) in the morning of 29/07. The protesters reportedly burned tires on the main road in the town. The demonstration dispersed upon the arrival of the police.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM position at KM60 in the night of 29/07. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes.
Two rival clans (not named) clash in Number 60 area in Lower Shabeelle Region. Witness claim four deaths, plus several injuries.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab militiamen reportedly destroyed a vehicle belonging to a local resident in Ceel Buur on 30/07. The destruction of the vehicle was imposed as a punishment for smuggling of khat to the district.
Property destruction: Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab militiamen set a private vehicle carrying khat to Ceel-Buur on fire.

An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade at a Somali position in Afgooye secondary school in the afternoon of 30/07. The soldiers reacted with gunfire. Perpetrator escaped from the scene. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM/Somali position close to Iidow Jallad bridge (Yaaq Bari Weyne area) in the night of 30/07. The clash lasted for around 30 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali forces in Lafoole in early morning hours of 30/07. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

A hand grenade was thrown at Somali forces on foot patrol in Hantiwadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar town in the night of 30/07. The soldiers opened fire in the direction of the perpetrator after the attack but the attacker escaped from the scene. No casualties were reported.

Available reports indicate that a IDP returnee and a former gatekeeper in Mogadishu was beheaded in Hawal Barbaare village by al Shabaaab forces. The reason for the beheading are currently unknown. Unconfirmed reports suggest that the beheading may be linked to his connection to the Somali government from the time in Mogadishu or accusations of espionage.

Unknown attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a NSA collaborator in civilian clothes in Xararyaale neighbourhood of Wardhiigley District in the night of 30/07. The deceased was buying medicines in a local pharmacy at the time of the attack.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian in the Daryeel section of the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 29-30/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade at a check-point manned by Somali forces in vicinity of Bakara Junction in the evening of 30/07. One soldier was reportedly injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Kenyan AMISOM forces clash with an unknown group in the outskirts of Kismayo. Precise date of the clash is vague. No causalities reported.

""Two LNGO staff were injured when Somali National Government (SNG) forces opened fire on the LNGO vehicle, allegedly because the vehicle did not stop when ordered to do so. The two staff were taken to a hospital.""
Hundreds of al Shabaab forces arrive in Puntlands Galgala mountains. Analysts believe the aim of the group is to establish a large hub of operations from which to launch attacks.

Unidentified militiamen shot and killed four women and injured three others in Qaydarre in the morning of 31/07. The victims were hailing from the Dir/Qubays sub-clan. The attack is believed to be part of a cycle of clan revenges

A group of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local municipality office to protest against perceived misallocation of shelters provided by an INGO to vulnerable families in Koosaar IDP camp.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali soldiers based in Horseed neighbourhood in Jowhar in the evening of 31/07. The soldiers fired back after the attack. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

At least one person has been confirmed dead while another woman has sustained serious injuries after an explosion in Shalanbod town in the Lower Shabeelle Region. The explosion is believed to have been caused by a land mine buried along a small road and the victims are believed to be locals who used the route.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Mukayga neighbourhood in Afgooye town in the evening of 31/08. The soldiers fired back after the attack. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali base in Janaale (Marka District) in the evening of 19:40. The clash lasted for around 10 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab launched an attack against Habr Gedir militias associated to Somali forces in K-60 areas (Afgooye District) in the night of 30-31/07. The clash lasted for one hour. Reported casualties are six al Shabaab fighters killed and 12 injured, and three Habr-Gedir militiamen killed.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed the deputy chief of the traditional elders of Hiraan Region Mr. Hussein Ilmi in Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 31/07. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali position in ex-Control Balcad area (Heliwa District) in the night of 31/08. The clash lasted for around 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Two unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and wounded a soldier in Bacaadlaha area in Bakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 31/07. The soldier fired back at the attackers to defend himself. Other security forces rushed to the scene and brought the injured soldier to a local hospital where he later died. One woman bystander was killed in the attack.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers on foot patrol in Radaar area along Industrial Road (Dayniile District) in the evening of 31/07. The perpetrators stole the guns of the soldiers after the attack.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in the money exchange section of Bakara Market in the afternoon of 31/07. A woman bystander was also killed by stray bullets. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol in Ali Turcaye area (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 31/07. The soldiers opened fire in the suspected direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Soldiers on foot patrol opened fire at a LNGO vehicle on Industrial Road close to the Military Academy in the morning of 31/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the vehicle failed to stop when ordered to do so. The two staffs on board were injured and brought to a local hospital.

Two groups of Somali soldiers and police officers exchanged fire close to Banadir Junction (Medina District) in the morning of 01/08. Two bystanders were killed and several others injured by stray bullets. The reason behind the clash is believed to be linked to the non-payment of salaries.

A RCIED exploded in Shalaambood (Marka District) in the morning of 01/08. The explosion occurred close to a group of women who were waiting for transport to Marka to sell their vegetables. Three women were killed and two others injured. Somali forces arrested a young man who was recording the incident with a video camera

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a man hailing from the Majerteen/Reer Biciidyahan sub-clan in Israac neighbourhood in the evening of 01/08. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the man was a member of Ethiopias Zone Five New Police. The victims body was taken to the general hospital. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Two RCIEDs targeting solar lamp poles exploded close to the Labour office and in front of Weheliye Hotel on Maka-al-Mukarama road in the early morning of 01/08. A third IED was found attached to another pole along the road after the first explosions. The road between Villa Somalia and Hotel Ambassador was subsequently closed by AMISOM to allow an EOD team to disable the device.

Two RCIEDs targeting solar lamp poles exploded close to the Labour office and in front of Weheliye Hotel on Maka-al-Mukarama road in the early morning of 01/08. A third IED was found attached to another pole along the road after the first explosions. The road between Villa Somalia and Hotel Ambassador was subsequently closed by AMISOM to allow an EOD team to disable the device.

Two RCIEDs targeting solar lamp poles exploded close to the Labour office and in front of Weheliye Hotel on Maka-al-Mukarama road in the early morning of 01/08. A third IED was found attached to another pole along the road after the first explosions. The road between Villa Somalia and Hotel Ambassador was subsequently closed by AMISOM to allow an EOD team to disable the device.

A demonstration in support of Turkey and attended mainly by women and children was organized in Dal Jirka Dahason area in Boondheere District in the morning of 01/08. The demonstrators were addressed by the Governor of Banadir Region who blamed the al Shabaab movement and politicians opposed to the stabilization of Mogadishu for a recent attack on a residence of the Turkish Embassy. The demonstration ended with no incident.

A RCIED targeted a Somali military vehicle in Shalaambood in the morning of 02/08. The device exploded after the vehicle passed the location. The soldiers onboard the vehicle stopped and carried out a quick operation after the attack but no arrests were confirmed.

Two RCIEDs were discovered close to the ex-Milk Factory (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 02/08. One IED reportedly detonated prematurely while a police EOD team managed to disable the other. No casualties were reported. The intended target of the explosives is not known.

Al Shabaab militiamen coming from Baraawe area and loyal to Sheikh Mukhtar Roboow attacked the small village of Gobanle (57km N of Wanla-Weyne) in the early hours of 03/08. Gobanle was under the control of forces loyal to Ahmed Godane. Three militiamen loyal to Ahmed Godane were reportedly killed in the attack.

A RCIED accidentally detonated while being carried by a man close to Ummada School in Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo in the evening of 03/08. The man carrying the device was killed and two other young men who were with him were injured.

Militiamen hailing from the Habr Gedir/Saleban sub-clan reportedly shot and killed a woman and her young girl hailing from the Dir/Qubays sub-clan in Barak Ciise (Hobyo District) the evening of 03/08. The attack is believed to be part of a cycle of clan revenges opposing the Habr Gedir/Saleban and Dir/Qubays sub-clans in Bacad Weyne area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy moving between Afgooye and Bariire (11km NE of Aw Dheegle) in the afternoon of 03/08. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties are unknown.

column6: ASWJ-Sufa: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa (Sufa Faction)
column17: Two groups of ASWJ fighters exchanged gunfire in Dhusamareeb in the night of 03/08. The clash opposed a Sufa group protecting the compound where the self-proclaimed president of Galmudug was staying, and another ASWJ group. It is believed that the clash started after the two groups disputed over the sharing of resources obtained from providing protection to the delegation. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen from Habr Gedir/Saleban and Dir/Qubays sub-clans clashed near Bacad Weyne (Hobyo District) in the afternoon of 03/08. The clash followed the killings of several women and an escalated dispute over grazing areas. Four combatants (one Qubays and three Saleban) were reportedly killed in the clash while two others were injured.

Unidentified attackers threw two hand-grenades at Somali soldiers based in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood in Marka in the night of 03/04. The soldiers opened fire after the blasts. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali forces stationed in Arbacow neighbourhood in Ceelasha area (Afgooye District) in the evening of 03/08. The attack lasted for about 15 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at Somali soldiers on foot patrol in the livestock market area in Afgooye town in the night of 03/08. The soldiers opened fire after the explosion. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces based in Shaan (6km NE of Aw Dheegle) in the early morning of 03/08. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. One Somali soldier was killed and two others reported missing after the clash. Two AK-47 rifles were also stolen by the attackers.
A number of Berbera residents demonstrated in front of the police station in Berbera on 03/08, demanding the release of ten youths that had been arrested in Dara Godle on 31/07.

Militiamen hailing from the Saad clan shot and killed a pastoralist hailing from the Majerteen/Omar Mohamud clan and injured another one in Jeexdin (Godod area) in the evening of 03/08. The attack was reportedly related to clan revenge.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at a military position in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 03/08. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against Somali forces close to the Hawl-Wadaag police station and the Bimalow Mosque in the evening of 03/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab militias fired several mortar rounds against the Ministry of Defence (Dayniile District) in the night of 02-03/08. Two rounds reportedly fell on a civilian house in the area killing a young girl and injuring five other members of her family.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at a police check-point close to Al-Baraka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 03/08. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an unarmed soldier on his way home in Carafat area (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 03/08. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier from the SNAF Third Brigade in African Village area in the afternoon of 03/08. The perpetrators stole the gun of the soldier before escaping from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A driver of a civilian lorry was shot and killed by AMISOM forces while approaching Medina gate (access to AMISOM base in Mogadishu airport) in the afternoon of 03/08. AMISOM soldiers reportedly fired warning shots then attempted to shoot at the tires of the vehicles after the driver had ignored their instructions to stop.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against a military check-point close to ex-Control Afgooye/K-7 in the evening of 04/08. The soldiers opened fire after the attack. Casualties are unknown.
Two mortar rounds fell in open places close to the fish market and the District office in Xamar Weyne District in the evening of 04/08. No casualties or damages were reported.

A RCIED targeted a military pick-up on patrol between Sei-Biano building and Banadir Hospital (Hodan/Medina District) in the evening of 04/08. Four bystanders were killed. The vehicle escaped un-damaged.
A journalist is killed during the early morning hours by unidentified assailants. The motive for the killing is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabaab attacked several African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) bases in Baidoa Sunday night (August 4th), wounding at least ten people.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at Somali soldiers on foot patrol in Hawo-Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the night of 04/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab militiamen launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali position in Janaale (12km NW of Marka) in the night of 04/08. The clash lasted for about 15 minutes. One Somali soldier was confirmed killed.

Al Shabaab militias launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces based in Buufow Bacaad on the Afgooye-Marka road in the night of 04/08. The clash lasted for about 10 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
A RCIED targeted a military vehicle between Badbaado and Xoosh (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 04/08. The device missed its target. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against Somali soldiers on patrol in Afarta-Jardino (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 04/08. No casualties were reported.
A RCIED targeted a solar lamp pole close to the former milk factory (Hodan District) in the night of 04/08. The pole was destroyed.

A RCIED planted in a pile of garbage exploded prematurely in Bulo-Hubey neighbourhood (Medina District) in the evening of 04/08. No casualties were reported. It is not clear who are what the target of the attackers was.

A RCIED targeted a convoy transporting the District Commissioners of Dayniile and Wardhiigley and the chair-person of the National Women Association close to Ifka Halane Junction on Industrial Road in the morning of 04/08. The convoy narrowly escaped the attack. Two by-sanders were injured. It was later learned the attacks in Mogadishu in 04/08 were coordinated.

Al Shabaab militias launched three coordinated hit-and-run attacks against Somali military positions near the ex-Perfume Factory, SOS Hospital and Abdi Wayeel cinema (Heliwa District) in the evening of 04/08. The clashes lasted for around 25 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

A Koranic teacher was reportedly killed by NSA soldiers in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 04/08. The motive of the killing is unclear. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the man was suspected of being an al Shabaab member.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali soldiers on patrol in Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 04/08. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Eight mortar rounds presumably aiming AMISOM/Somali positions fell in the area of the Mogadishu Stadium in the night of 04/08. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at soldiers on patrol close to Dabka Junction (Waaberi District) in the evening of 04/08. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab militiamen launched a series of hit-and-run attacks against Somali positions in Baidoa in Buulo Jameeco (central police station area, NW of town), Cadaada neighbourhood (NE) and the main power station (centre of town on main road) in the night of 04-05/08. A RPG round damaged two generators in the main power station. Some reports indicate that the attackers numbered around 100. Two confirmed al Shabaab deaths reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a Somali outpost close to Liiliiqato bridge in Beled Weyne in the evening of 05/08. No casualties were reported. A security operation was conducted in the area after the attack and several persons were arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against the ENDF base in Jento Kundishe (K115) on the east side of Beled Weyne along the Mogadishu-Dhusamareeb road in the evening of 05/08. Several mortar rounds fired from an unknown location landed in Buundo neighbourhood. The clash lasted for around 30mn.

A group of armed militiamen suspected of being al Shabaab operatives conducted a hit-and-run attack against the residence of the Marka District Commissioner. The attackers exchanged fire with the guards of the Commissioner for around 20 minutes. One guard was reportedly injured.

Suspected al Shabaab militias fired two RPG rounds at the generator house connected to the main town borehole on the north side of Garbahaarey town in the night of 05/08. One round hit the building and seriously wounded an anti-al Shabaab militiaman securing the well.

A member of the Somaliland Coast Guard opened fire at Somaliland policemen from the CID in Koodbuur District of Hargeisa in the morning of 09:30. The incident occurred after the policemen attempted to stop the construction of the house of the coast guard, the house being adjacent to the CID office. The coast guard escaped from the scene after the incident and his construction materials were seized by the police. Causalities not known.

A SNG soldier was shot by other SNG soldiers in Sherey village (20km SE of Wanla-Weyn) on 05/08. The soldier was manning a check-point on the Mogadishu-Baidoa road. The perpetrators stole the gun of the victim. The perpetrators were later arrested by SNG forces and transferred to Wanla-Weyne for investigation. It is not clear if the victim succumbed to their injuries.
Two additional hand-grenade attacks were reported in two different locations of Beled Weyne (unspecified) in the evening of 05/08. The perpetrators, their targets are unknown and causalities.
A Raas Kambooni soldier shot and injured a businessman in the centre of Kismaayo after the two got engaged in a dispute over a piece of land. The soldier escaped from the scene.

A group of armed militiamen suspected of being al Shabaab operatives conducted a hit-and-run attack against the residence of the Marka District Commissioner. The attackers exchanged fire with the guards of the Commissioner for around 20 minutes. One guard was reportedly injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali soldiers manning a check-point in Xawo-Tako neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the morning of 05/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Four Al-Shabab fighters have been killed when a bomb they were planting exploded on them. The target of the bombs are not known, though there are a number of Somali government troops stationed in the city.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack and kill the District Commissioner of Warta Nabada District and injured two of his relatives.

Property destuction: Unidentified gunmen stopped and destroyed by fire two commercial trucks transporting food and fuel between Kariin and Yalho (main road from Bosasso to Garowe) in the night of 06/08. The two trucks, one of which was carrying a UN food consignment, were owned by members of the Majerteen/Omar Mohamoud sub-clan and were travelling from Bosasso towards the central regions.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militias conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM/Somali position in Shalaambood in the night of 06/08. The clash lasted for about 30 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit-and-run attack against a Somali military position in Aawdiinle in the night of 06/08. The clash was reportedly relatively brief. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab militias conducted a hit-and-run attack against a position of the local community police in Isha neighbourhood in Baidoa in the night of 06/08. Al Shabaab militias reportedly fired several RPGs at the position and engaged in a brief fire fight. No casualties were reported.

An armed man forcefully entered and opened fire in the Hormuud compound in Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa in the morning of 06/08. All the glass windows of the building were shattered. No casualties were reported. The shooter escaped from the scene before the arrival of local security forces. The reason for the shooting is unknown.

Al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit-and-run attack against ENDF positions in Qansax-Dhere in the night of 06/08. The militias reportedly fired four mortar rounds towards the Ethiopian positions. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at Somali forces manning a check-point near Hodan police station in the evening of 06/08. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Digfer security guards in the vicinity of the Digfer Hospital (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/08. One guard was reportedly injured. The attackers escaped from the scene. The reason for the attack is not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at a military outpost in Cinema Abdi Wayeel area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 06/08. The soldiers opened fire after the attack. Casualties are unknown. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol near Suuq Yare (small market, Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 06/08. Once civilian bystander was injured. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab militias equipped with six technicals attacked Afmadow town from two directions in the end of the afternoon of 06/08. The al Shabaab militias managed to briefly enter the town. The bodies of 16 al Shabaab militiamen were reportedly found close to the Afmadow police station after al Shabaab militiamen left the town, nine other al Shabaab bodies were found later around the town. Three Raas Kambooni militiamen and three civilians were also reported killed.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle of the Banadir regional administration on Industrial Road close to Carafat Hospital in the evening of 07/08. The vehicle was reportedly carrying foreign engineers involved in reconstruction works in Mogadishu. Two Indian technicians and one of the Governors guards were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militias conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Janaale in the morning of 07/08. The clash lasted for about 15 minutes. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a NSA soldier in El-Qalow area (Medina District) in the afternoon of 07/08. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A Somali soldier shot and killed a young boy suspected of being an al Shabaab Amniyat operative in the vicinity of Bar Ubah Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 07/08. The soldier escaped from the scene after the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 al Shabaab are killed after AMISOM troops and local forces foiled planned attacks in southern city of Afmadow.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A 20-year-old is kidnapped and raped by AMISOM solders.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at Puntland forces in Warshadda Galayda section of Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo North in the evening of 08/08. The soldiers opened fire after the attack. One girl bystander was reportedly killed and three others injured. An unspecified number of Puntland soldiers were also reportedly injured. Unconfirmed reports indicate that one of the attackers was injured in the shooting but no arrests were made.

Armed men hailing from the Ismail Saleeban sub-clan shot and killed a man from the Siwaaqron sub-clan in Baargaal area on 08/08. The incident is believed to be linked to a clan issue. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A group of unidentified men wearing military uniforms onboard a private vehicle reportedly abducted a young woman close to her house in the vicinity of the Wardhiigley district office in the evening of 12/08. The girl reported having been raped after she was found the following morning.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militiamen launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali/AMISOM position in Lafoole College close to the Mogadishu-Afgooye road in the night of 09/08. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Two gunmen hailing from the Habar-Jeclo/Soolomadaw sub-clan stole livestock belonging to members of the Dhulbahante/Muhumad Muse sub-clan in the vicinity of Kalshaleh (Buuhoodle District) in the evening of 09/08. The motive for the crime may be clan related.
A fire destroyed around 20 shelters in Mahad-Alle IDP camp in Galkacyo South in the afternoon of 10/08. Two children were reportedly injured. The cause of the fire is unknown, and arson is suspect.

Two groups of al Shabaab militiamen exchanged fire following a dispute over collection of Zakat (tithe/taxes) in Tarda village (55km SE of Bulo Burte) on 10/08. One al Shabaab local commander (not named) was reportedly killed and another al Shabaab militiaman was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militiamen launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Shalaambood in the evening of 10:08. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade at ASWJ militiamen associated to Somali forces in Hawo-Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the night of 11/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a businesswoman in Haafad-Ruusiya neighbourhood in Marka in the evening of 10/08. The woman was said to have a good relationship with the Somali government and of selling electronics to AMISOM soldiers. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 10/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. One soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a young man sitting in a teashop in K13 area (Dharkeynley District) in the afternoon of 10/08. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

At least six combatants were killed and a dozen others wounded in a heavy battle between Somali government forces and Al-Shabab fighters outside Ceelbarde, Bakool Region. The battle erupted when Somali government forces attacked Al-Shabab military positions outside the town.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle belonging to the finance officer of Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar in the morning of 11:00. The driver of the vehicle and one female bystander were injured. The finance officer was not onboard the vehicle at the time of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy close to Xarunta Gabdha (Girls Orphanage College) in Afgooye in the morning of 11/08. One of the trucks was damaged. Casualties are unknown.
Six people were killed and 20 wounded when Somali government forces raided al-Shabaab bases in Garas Weyne in the evening of 12/08.
Ayr/Yabar Dhowrakece sub-clan clashed with ASWJ/Sufa militiamen in Dabdheer village (Dhusamareeb District) on 12/08. Causalities not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM soldier (Djiboutian contingent) opened fire at some of his colleagues who were sitting in a small tent in an AMISOM military base on the east side of Beled Weyne in the morning of 12/08. One soldier was killed and another one wounded. It is reported that the soldier continued shooting until he emptied his magazine.

A group of ASWJ militiamen reportedly clashed with a group of locals close to Xananbuure in the end of the afternoon of 12/08. ASWJ militiamen were reportedly attempting to stop the locals from cutting wood for charcoal production, an activity that has been banned by the ASWJ administration in its area of control. Members of the local militia, who have an association with Habr Gedir/Ayr/Yabar Dhowra Kece sub-sub-clan, were reportedly killed in the clash.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in Xawo Tako neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the evening of 12/08. The victim was previously a ASWJ soldier (from Hawadle clan) based in Guri-Ceel. The perpetrators stole the rifle of the victim before escaping from the scene. Local security forces conducted a security operation which extended up to the following day but no arrests were made.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militiamen launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali/AMISOM outpost in Arbacow area in Ceelasha in the night of 12/08. The clash lasted for about 25 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Movement of forces: Unconfirmed reports indicate that 120 to 150 al Shabaab militiamen were deployed close to Garbahaarey around 12/08. The militiamen are reported to be usually based in Baardheere and Faafax Dhuun areas in Gedo Region.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and injured a prominent businessman in Baytu-Raas neighbourhood in Marka in the evening of 12/08. The victim was sitting in front of a local pharmacy when attacked. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A pastoralist armed with an AK-47 has shot and killed another pastoralist on the west side of Balambale in the afternoon of 12/08. The shooter was hailing from the Marehan clan while his victim was from the Habr Gedir/Ayr/Sabux sub-sub-clan. The murder is reportedly related to clan revenge.

A man armed with an AK-47 opened fire at a group of people in a teashop in Balambale in the morning of 12/08. One person was killed and another one injured. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. The deputy DC of Balambale later declared that the attack was a case of clan revenge. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim and the perpetrator are both from the Marehan clan.

Clan militias hailing from the Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan attacked a settlement of pastoralists from the Habr Gedir/Saad sub-clan in Sarjimale village (50km E of Galkacyo), in the night of 12/08. A woman was killed in the attack. The incident is part of cycle of revenge attacks/killings that is opposing the two clans in the region.

Four unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier on foot patrol close to the ex-US embassy compound (Medina District) in the afternoon of 12/08. The perpetrators stole the gun of the victim before escaping from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police officers on patrol close to Shaqaalaha building along Maka-al-Mukarama road (Hodan District) in the night of 12/08. A police officer was injured. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers in the gold section of Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 12/08. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 12/08. The victim was on his way home when attacked. Security forces conducted a security operation in the area after the incident but no arrests were made.

Armed militiamen hailing from the Ayr/Yabar Dhowrakece sub-clan clashed with ASWJ/Sufa militiamen in Dabdheer village (Dhusamareeb District) in the afternoon of 13/08. The confrontation followed a previous clash that had opposed ASWJ militiamen and members of the Yabar Dhowrakece sub-clan in Xananbuure the day before, when ASWJ militiamen attempted to arrest illegal charcoal producers. One person was killed in the clash.

Two groups of armed militiamen from the Majerteen/Ugar Saleeban sub-clan exchanged fire in Uurjire village (Rako Raho area, Qardho District) on 13/08. Two militiamen were reportedly killed on each side. The reason for the shooting is unknown.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in the vicinity of Afgooye bridge in the morning of 13/08. The soldier was on foot going to his work station. Somali forces conducted a security operation in the area after the attack and arrested ten suspects.

Pro-Somali soldiers (not named) based in Ceel Barde attacked al Shabaab position in Garas-Weyne (50km W of Xudur) in the morning of 13/08. The clash lasted for about one and a half hour. Pro-Somali forces seized control of the village for a few hours before returning to Ceel Barde. Report indicates that four soldiers were killed and at least eight other injured. Al Shabaab casualties are unknown

A gunman from the Madhiban sub-clan shot and wounded two civilians (Dir/Gaadsan and Majerteen/Osman Mohamoud) in Qardho in the afternoon of 13/08. The shooting was linked to an escalated private dispute between the perpetrator and one of the victims. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali soldiers on foot patrol in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar in the night of 13/08. Two soldiers were injured. The attackers escaped from the scene. A security operation was conducted after the attack and an unspecified number of persons were arrested.

Members of the Idagale and Isaxaaq sub-clans clashed using clubs following an escalated dispute over a piece of land in Sabawanaag village (75km E of Hargeisa) on 13/08. Local police arrested those involved in the clash. Reports indicate that three persons were injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM forces based in Jaale Siyaad military academy (Hodan district) in the evening of 13/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Clashes reported between an unidentified armed group and Al-Shabab militants at the Yacyac locality.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a soldier stationed in Baraka Market.

Government forces captured several Al-Shabab-held villages near Xuddur and plan to capture the town itself. The only captured town named is Rabdhuurre. The government side lost two soldiers and six wounded, while the Al-Shabab side lost 10 fighters and 15 wounded.
Government forces, supported by the ENDF, clash with al Shabaab on the outskirts of Xuddur. The exact figures of casualties on both warring sides are yet to be established.

KDF soldiers discovered a RCIED along Via Afmadow in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 14/08. The device was safely disabled. Telecommunications in the town were switched off during the operation. No casualties were reported. It is not clear what the intended target was.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab elements planted five IEDs on the main road in Marka on 14/08. They then detonated one of them which prompted Somali/AMISOM forces to arrive at the scene. The suspected al Shabaab elements then detonated the remaining four. The perpetrators use of small charges in the IEDs saved the lives of the Somali/AMISOM who rushed to the scene after the first explosion. A number of civilian bystanders were injured in the first explosion. No other casualties were reported in the subsequent explosions.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM position in Tabta (75km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 14/08. There were no reports on whether AMISOM forces responded to the attack. Al Shabaab withdrew immediately. No casualties were reported.

Fractured al Shabaab militias clashed in Labaatan Jirow on 14/08 due to a dispute over the election of a new Malaq (clan leader, for Rahanweyn/Hariin sub-clan) for the area. Reports indicate that the dispute started after the regional al Shabaab authorities from Baidoa refused to accept the victory of a supporter of Sheikh Mukhtar Roobow, against a candidate proposed by the Godane group. One pro-Godane al Shabaab militiaman was killed, and a vehicle from the same group was destroyed.

A member of the Majerteen/Omar Mohamoud sub-clan shot and injured a Saad pastoralist and his daughter in Saaxaqurun village (30km W of Galkacyo, Galdogob District) in the evening of 14/08. The incident is reported as being a case of clan revenge. The two victims are expected to survive.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces guarding the governors office in Marka in the evening of 14/08. The grenade missed it is target and landed in an empty area. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator(s) escaped from the scene.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Security guards of Istanbul Hotel in Garowe opened fire in the air on 14/08 to disperse a group of young men who were trying to forcefully enter the premises, where a group of women were throwing a party. Puntland police arrived later on the scene and arrested an unspecified number of persons. It is not clear why the rioters wanted to enter the building.

Three unidentified men wearing military uniforms onboard a Toyota Carib forcefully abducted two young women walking along the former pasta factory (Heliwa District) in the end of the afternoon of 14/08. The whereabouts of the two women is unknown.

Armed men believed to be government soldiers opened fire on a group of protestors in Mogadishu, killing at least two civilians and injuring two others. A number of Hodan district residents were protesting the demolition of their residences by a group of armed men with bulldozers hired after the Hodan district administration warned residents to vacate the properties.
A bomb attached to a vehicle belonging to a prominent businessman, Husein Goley, exploded, causing 5 injuries and at least one death.

Al Shabaab militias and local pastoralists (group not known) clashed on two occasions close to Yacyac village in the morning of 15/08. The confrontation was reportedly triggered by the killing of a local pastoralist by al Shabaab (reason unknown). In revenge pastoralists from the area ambushed a group of al Shabaab militiamen and stole their battle-wagon, killing in the process two al Shabaab fighters including a well-known local commander. Al Shabaab initiated a second clash shortly afterwards and recovered their vehicle. A total of four persons were killed, and an unknown number were wounded. The local militiamen involved in the clash fled the area.

Disgruntled Raskamboni militiamen were reported to have opened fire in the air and blocked traffic in Kismaayo in the morning of 15/08. The militiamen were protesting against the reduction of their promised salaries from 200 to 100 USD. The incident affected traffic on all major roads and forced some businesses to temporarily suspend their activities.

Unconfirmed reports indicate that unidentified gunmen shot and killed a man who may have been an employee of a humanitarian organization in Sokeela Village (70km NW of Buale) on 15/08. The victim was killed in his house in the village. The motive is unknown.
Somali government troops and Al-Shabab insurgents clash in the town of Qoqani causing unknown causalities.

. A RCIED targeted the car of a local traditional elder in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 16/08. The elder and his driver were killed in the explosion. AMISOM and Ras Kaambooni forces cordoned off the area. It remains unclear whether the security forces made any arrest in connection with the blast.

Arrests: Pro-Godane al Shabaab reportedly arrested the recently elected traditional leader in Labaatan Jirow Village (48km N of Baidoa), on 16/08. The traditional leader was taken to Diinsoor. Godane denounced the election of Mayow for being a supporter of his rival-Mukhtar Robow.
Armed clash between al Shabaab and Somali forces reported in or near Bilis Qooqaani over two consecutive days. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF in Badhaadhe in the night of 16/08. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A civilian woman was injured in the clash. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: The security guards of the mayor of Galkacyo North opened fire at a private vehicle after suspecting it as hostile near the residence of mayor in Israac neighbourhood in the evening of 16/08. The driver of the car was killed in the shooting. The perpetrators were later arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted an AMISOM military convoy at Bar Jowhar area in Heliwa District in the evening of 16/08. One AMISOM truck was reportedly destroyed in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier walking near Mogadishu soccer stadium in Wardhiigley District in the evening of 16/08. The perpetrators escaped.
A journalist is shot and killed at his home in the Kutuba-Xoor neighbourhood of Shibis.
Armed men have killed a local youth leader in charge of young athletes in southern Wadajir. The reason for the attack is unknown.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 17/08. One soldier was reportedly injured in the explosion. The Somali forces managed to arrest the suspected perpetrator.
Armed clash between al Shabaab and Somali forces reported in or near Bilis Qooqaani over two consecutive days. Causalities not known.

Suspected al Shabaab picked five youths from a vehicle that had been travelling from Baidoa to Mogadishu near Leego Village (48km SW of Buur Hakaba) on 17/08. The fighters released four of them after interrogations but killed the fifth one. The motive is unknown.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed the chairman of Somali Cinema youth organization in Medina District in the evening of 17/08. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol at Bulaliyasha section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 17/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
A female who is said to have been an employee of the local administrations tax collection department is shot and killed in Afgooye District.

A well known female resident in Dayniile District identified as Dahabo Ali was shot and killed by armed men at approximately 9 p.m. (local time) last night in Isse Abdi neighbourhood. The reason for the attack is not known.
Al-Shabab fighters attacked Mayow Tesow, former Transitional Federal Governments security chief for Baydhabo, at his home, kidnapping him along with other men.

Militia hailing from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan carjacked three private trucks belonging to Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Qardho on 18/08. The gunmen fired in the air during the incident and took the vehicles to the northern part of the town. It is not clear if this action was linked to clan.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali government soldier during the evening hours.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Almed clash reported between Dhamase and Ceel Cadde. Causalities not known. This is a separate incident from the event with occurred in Ceel Cadde in the same day.
Armed clash reported between al Shabaab and security forces in an area between Leego and Idow Jalad. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Heavy fighting broke out between AMISOM/KDF and al Shabaab fighters in Kulbiyow Village (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in evening of 18/08 after al Shabaab fighters attacked the position of KDF. Casualties could be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces in Goof Gaduud Village (25km SW of Baidoa) in in the afternoon of 18/08. The fighting lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF military convoy in an area between Dhamase and Ceel-Cadde villages in Garbahaarey District in the afternoon of 18/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a young man in the vicinity of Hormud Telecommunication office in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 18/08. The motive of the killing is currently unknown. Report indicates that the victim had close contact with forces in Baidoa. The perpetrators escaped.

An unidentified perpetrator stabbed and killed a-12-year-old boy near Galkacyo North prison in the afternoon of 18/08. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrator escaped. Reports indicate that the boy hailed from Isaq clan, though it is not clear if clan played into the perpetrators motivation.

A group of widows of the SNM (Somalia National Movement) fighters staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the presidential palace in Hargeysa in the morning of 18/08. The group reportedly protested against the governments failure to implement its pledge of including them in the governments pension scheme. Police arrested several women and a local online journalist.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an armed soldier in Carafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 18/08. The perpetrators also took the gun of the slain soldier and escaped.

An unidentified armed man dressed in military uniform shot and killed a soldier in Afar-Irdood neighbourhood (Xamar-Weyne District) in the evening of 18/08. Soldiers nearby managed to arrest the suspected perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Somali forces based in Janaale (18km NE of Qoryooley) in the night of 19/08. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire during the brief clash after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A Puntland police officer shot and killed a fellow officer for unknown reason.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A police officer opened fire at a private car and killed the driver at Gaaca area in Bosasso District in the evening of 19/08. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator escaped. The victim hailed from Darood/Arab Salah, though his clan identity may not have been a motivation for the shooting.

Defusal: Detonate/Dismantle:Somali forces discovered an IED planted between Marion Gate and Police Academy in Hamar Jab Jab District while travelling on this road in the morning of 19/08. The Somali EOD team dismantled the device safely. Somali/AMISOM forces closed the area during the exercise.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a Somali position in Xamar Jadid neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the night of 19/08. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified armed men dressed in military uniforms shot and killed a civilian man in Ansalatoti Market (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the morning of 19/08. The victim use to deliver meat to hotels in Mogadishu using his donkey cart. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw several hand grenades at a military base in Wardhiigley District in the evening of 19/08. The soldiers responded by firing in the suspected directions. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Hundreds of people, mostly women and children, took to the streets of the southern Somali town of Jowhar to protest against the decision by the medical charity, Doctors Without Borders, to pull its staff from Somalia.
Duduble and Murusade militias clashed (20/08). Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a NSA soldier in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the night of 20/08. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of Somali-SNG forces clashed in K50 area in Afgooye District in the afternoon of 20/08 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. Casualties are unknown. Causalities unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the former Hiraan governor, Abdifatah Hassan Afrah, in Kooshin neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 20/08. The device exploded in front of the house, causing no casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a mini market in Kooshin neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 20/08. The incident happened a half an hour after the residence of the former governor of Hiraan was targeted with a hand grenade. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator escaped.
The body of unidentified man with gunshot wounds was reportedly discovered in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo) in the night of 20/08. Puntland police took the body to hospital for investigations.

Armed men shot and injured three civilians in Bulo Xawo in the morning of 20/08. The incident occurred after the victims tried to oppose the installation of electrical poles in the town by a businessman escorted by armed men. Reports indicate that shooting is related to a electric company losing their service monopoly in the town.
A Majerteen-Omar Mahmud members shot and killed in another clan member due to a unarticulated dispute.

A group of women charcoal sellers staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the municipal council office in Borama in the morning of 20/08. The group reportedly protested against municipals act of forcefully evicting them from the business area. Reports indicate that the eviction was aimed to clear the way for the rehabilitation of the road. The protestors called on the municipal council to allocate them a place to sell the charcoal.

Armed men suspected of being Somali National forces stopped a minibus in an area between Yaaq Biri Weyne and Leego villages (Wanla Weyne and Buur Hakaba districts) in the evening of 20/08. They ordered the driver to drive the minibus to the bush and they robbed the passengers. Reports indicate that four women were beaten and raped.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol at Shaqalaha Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 20/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab launches an attack against a Somali military position in Lafoole. Causalities not known.

Security forces conducted a security operation in Kismaayo in the night of 21/08 and arrested a number of people they suspected of being al Shabaab members/sympathizers. The soldiers shot and killed a man after he tried to escape during the operation.

Pastoralists from Habar Jeclo/Bicido and Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub clans clashed in the vicinity of God Heeri Village (51km E of Caynabo) in the afternoon of 21/08. The fighting broke following the killing of a man from Bicido my member of Sacad Yonis after an escalated private dispute. Further reports indicate that three Sacad Yonis militia and a Bicido were killed in the clash while eight others were injured.
A Somali soldier shot and killed a young boy who was attempting to enter a clan conference.

A group of gunmen from Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub clan shot and killed two men hailing from Habar Jeclo/Bicido sub clan near Oog Village in the evening of 21/08. The killing is reportedly related to the armed clash involving the two sub-clans in God Heeri Village. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers assaulted the director of Seylac using sticks as he walked home in the night of 21/08. The motive of the attack is currently unknown. This is the second time the director was attacked this year. The victim was taken to Djibouti for treatment.

A RCIED planted in a teashop frequented by Somali security forces exploded in Arjantin neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 21/08. Reports indicate that one soldier and a civilian bystander were killed and six other people were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men in a vehicle opened gunfire at a vehicle driven by a female NSA officer in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 21/08. Reports indicate that the perpetrators followed the woman for some time before she suspected them as hostile and started driving fast. The attackers then opened fire at her vehicle which led her car to ram into another vehicle. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A young man suspected of being an al Shabaab operative shot and killed a Somali soldier in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 21/08. Somali soldiers in the area shot and killed the perpetrator near Dahabshiil office.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against KDF/AMISOM position at Kismaayo Airport in the evening of 21/08. The KDF responded by firing back in the direction of the attackers, after which the suspected al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified perpetrators suspected of being al Shabaab operatives shot and killed a young boy and another unidentified person in the vegetable section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 21/08. The motive behind the killing is unclear. The perpetrators put a warning note on the bodies of their victim that read ""anybody who dares to pick this body will be targeted"".

Gunmen killed two Somalis and wounded a Swedish female politician (Left Party) in Mogadishu. A security guard and driver were killed in the attack. Details obtained about the incident clearly indicate that the attackers were attempting to kidnap the female Swedish national. There is nothing is known about the perpetrators except that they were wearing military uniforms at the time of the attack.
Military officer Colonel Ali Gure Afdhub is shot by mutinying soldiers. He died later in hospital.
Security measures: Raskamboni forces expel Kismayo residents from their homes and move them outside the city.

Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against an ENDF position in Janta Kundishe Village (3km E of Beled Weyne) in the evening of 22/08. The two side exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Security measures: Al Shabaab bans the presence of the ""takfir"" sect in Bulo Burte.
Security measures: Al Shabaab bans the presence of the ""takfir"" sect in Baraawe.
Al Shabaab attacks a group of Somali soldiers. Causalities not known.
Security forces opened fire after beneficiaries surged forward during a distribution of Turkish food aid in Kismaayo on 22/08. A woman was killed in the shooting.
The residence of the chairman of Bay regional court is targeted with a hand grenade. No report of injury.

A soldier shot and killed a teenager in Ceel Jaale neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 22/08 after a group of teenagers tried to forcefully enter a conference hall where a clan meeting was taking place. Police arrested the perpetrator.
An IED targeted a group of French deminers. Causalities not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Four gunmen from Osman Mohamud/Bah Yacqub sub-clan carjacked a Toyota pick-up belonging to Qardho police station in Xorgoble neighbourhood (Qardho) in the night of 22/08. The gunmen fired several shot at the car during the incident and injured the commander of Qardho police station, who is a member of Osman Mohamud. The gunmen then drove the vehicle towards Balidhidin Village(87km SE of Qandala). Reports on 27/08 indicate that the gunmen sold the vehicle to a prominent pirate hailing from Majeerten/Ali Saleeban in Balidhidin Village (87km SE of Qandala).

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an Imam of a local Mosque in 77 Settlement area (Dayniile District) in the morning of 22/08. The Imam was killed as he headed to the mosque to lead the dawn prayer. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped. This is the first time that an Imam was targeted in Mogadishu.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces launch an attack against allied bases in Janaale, sparking a heavy two day battle. No casualties have been confirmed yet but residents say that both fighting groups have incurred death and injury.
Two unidentified gunmen killed the chairman of the Olympic Committee for Mogadishus Dharkenley district, Amin Ali Mumin.

A suspected RCIED was discovered concealed in a pile of stones by security guards in Garowe in the afternoon of 23/08. The device was found in close proximity of a residence of the President of Puntland, of the residence of the Puntland deputy Minister of Security and of an INGO office. The device was successfully disabled though controlled detonation on 24/08.

A group of youths hold an unsanctioned demonstration and are arrested by Somaliland police several days later. The group staged the demo after they were left out in the recruitment of logistic assistants for a conference to reconcile Isse and Gudabirsi clans.

Militias hailing from Duduble and Murursade sub clans clashed in an area located 17km W of Ceel Buur following an escalated dispute over the digging of a bore hole in the area in the night of 23/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No mention of causalities.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Somali forces based in Muuri Village (Afgooye District) in the morning of 23/08. Four soldiers were reportedly killed in the clash. Al Shabaab took over control of the village briefly. Casualties from the al Shabaab side could not be established.

A device suspected to be an IED exploded in front of anti-al Shabaab forces base in Tabta Village (75km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 23/08. One soldier was killed in the explosion. The device is believed to have been planted by al Shabaab.

Security measures: The District Commissioner of Dhoobley banned the presence of ""takfir"" sect in Dhoobely town (Afmadow District) on 23/08. The DC made the announcement in a local mosque after the Friday prayer. After the statement, members of the group were reportedly spotted heading to Dadaab refugee camp in Kenya, while others went underground.

Al Shabaab shot and killed a former pro-Somali soldier in Hiirey Village (20km E of Ceel Garas in Xudur District) in the evening of 23/08. Reports indicate that the victim had defected from Somali forces in Ceel Barde and killed three members of al Shabaab.

An anti-al Shabaab soldier hailing from Ogaden/Maqaabul sub-clan shot and killed his colleague from Bartire/Jidwaaq sub-clan at a check-point close to Kismaayo airport in the morning of 23/08. Reports indicate that the perpetrator was sentenced and executed the same day.

Militias hailing from Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis and Habar Jeclo/Bicido clashed in an area near Oog Village (23km E of Caynabo) in the evening of 23/08. The fighting is related to the clash God Heeri between the two groups in which six people were killed on 21/08. Six killed in this clash. Somaliland army separated the two sides, arrested and disarmed them. Reports indicate that the army later released the militias.

Property destruction: Gunmen from Saad sub-clan shot and killed two camels and injured three others belonging to Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Jeexdin (Godod area) in the evening of 23/08. The perpetrators shot the camels after they failed to find Omar Mohamud herders looking after the camels. The attack was reportedly related to clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

A man armed with a pistol tried to shoot another man following an escalated private dispute in Wadhan Village (28km NW of Burao) on 23/08 but the gun had a stoppage. The perpetrator hailed from Habar Awal/Sacad Muse while the victim is a member of Habar Awal/Ise Muse. Police arrested the perpetrator.

A body of an unidentified man was found in the vicinity of Sheerbi Village (60 km North of Qardho) in the morning of 24/12. Available reports indicated that the body had knife wounds. The motive and the identity of the perpetrators remain unknown.

Unidentified man armed with pistol shot and killed a man hailing from Shekhal clan near Hargeisa soccer stadium in Ahmed Dhagax District (Hargeisa) on 23/08. The motive of the killing is currently unknown. The deputy police commissioner reportedly said the victim came from Mogadishu and had been in Hargeisa for two months.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabab fighters say they have killed 21 Kenyan and Somali government troops in southern Somalias Lower Shabeelle Region in attacks on their bases. Presice locations of the attacks unknown. The attacks have not been confirmed.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces launch an attack against allied bases in Janaale, sparking a heavy two day battle. No casualties have been confirmed yet but residents say that both fighting groups have incurred death and injury.
Gunmen shot dead Amin Ali Mumin, a clan elder and an author of the countries constitution, in Mogadishus Dharkiinlay district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED exploded at Laami-yaraha road in Afgooye in the afternoon of 24/08 after a private lorry drove over it. Four people in the truck were injured in the blast. Reports indicate that the road is frequented by AMISOM military convoy and it is believed that AMISOM had been the target. Further reports indicate that AMISOM forces disabled two other RCIEDs planted on the same road after a tip off from the public.

Militias hailing from Ayr and Ayanle sub-clans of Habar Gidir briefly clashed in Qarsoon Village (10km W of Guri Ceel) following an escalated dispute over cutting of trees for charcoal burning in the morning of 24/08. Reports indicate that the fighting broke out after one of the groups tried to stop the other from felling trees to burn charcoal. ASWJ fighters arrived at the scene later and arrested several people in connection with the clash. No causalities reported.

Militias hailing from Saleeban and Saad sub-clans of Habar Gidir briefly clashed in Baxdo Village (77 km SE of Cadaado) following an escalated dispute over water points and pasture on 24/08. Reports indicate that the fighting caused tension in the area as both sides mobilize themselves for another clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM military convoy in an area between Leego and Yaaq Biri Weyne (Buur Hakaba and Wanla Weyne Districts) in the afternoon of 24/08. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire in a fighting that lasted for about 40 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
