Police assaulted, then arrested the reporter of the Hargeisa-based Horn Cable TV in Zeylac on 24/08. The reason behind the arrest is currently unclear.

Unidentified gunmen ambushed and opened fire at a vehicle carrying khat near Guud Cad Village (30km N of Qardho) on 24/08. The vehicle managed to pass the ambush. No casualties were reported. The vehicle had left Galkacyo and was heading to Bosasso when the incident happened.

Unidentified armed men opened fire at a group of herbal medicine hawkers comprising of both Somalis and Kenyan nationals in Garboolow Village (20kms NW of Luuq) in the night of 24/08.The reason behind the attack is currently unknown. Two people were injured, among them the chief of the village. Three of the traders (two Somali women and a man) escaped unhurt and their whereabouts are unknown. The perpetrators also took a vehicle belonging to the traders.

An armed man reportedly opened fire at an INGO-rented vehicle close to Arta (110km S of Bosasso) on 24/08. The vehicle was transporting an INGO national staff, an employee of the Puntland Minister of Education and a temporary-contracted engineer. All three passengers were slightly injured and transferred to Qardho Hospital for treatment. The motive of the attack is unascertained. The perpetrator was reportedly from the Majeerten/Ali Saleeban sub-clan. Darawiish and police were deployed to the area and arrested the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab shot and killed a man and his son in Ceel Garas Village (45km E of Xudur) in the afternoon of 24/08. The victims were suspected of having link with a pro-Somali military defector who was killed by al Shabaab the day before.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the chairman of Bay regional court in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 24/08. One the chairmen guard was injured in the blast. The guards responded by firing at the suspected directions. A civilian bystander was injured in the shooting. SNG forces conducted a security operation and arrested a man found with a hand grenade in the area. The security forces also seized several explosives during the operations in Berdale, Isha and ADC neighbourhoods following a tip off from the members of public.

Raskamboni forces loyal to Madobe open fire on protesting civilians and destroy their property. Houses were demolished in Bula Abliko which is situated in the outskirts of Kismaayo. Ten injuries reported.

Suspected Al Shabaab Amniyat (Godane faction)operatives shot and killed a local businessman in Salagle Village (26km NW of Sakow) in the night of 24/08. Reports indicate that the perpetrators wore face masks. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Bar Ismail area in Afgooye on 25/08 after one group tried to stop the other against extorting money from public transport vehicles using the road. A third group of security forces arrived and separated the warring sides. No casualties were reported.

Two clan militias hailing from Jareer Weyne and Dir clashed Defow Village (35km NE of Beled Weyne) following an escalated dispute over farms ownership in the morning of 25/08. Two people were killed and another injured in the clash. All the victims are from the Dir clan. Reports indicate that tension is running high in the village. Traditional elders from the two clans stepped in to resolve the conflict. Conflicting reports hold five deaths in the conflict.
Two men armed with AK-47 shot and slightly injured an INGO project officer in his home in Cabud Waaq in the night of 25/08. The attack was reportedly related to a dispute over vehicle hiring.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a pastoralist from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan in Godod Village (30km NE of Galkacyo) in the night of 25/08. The killing is reportedly linked to clan revenge between the two sub-clans.
Al Shabaab forces claims to have killed Ethiopian government officials in Mustahil, Hiiraan region, though this claim was not confirmed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces launched a simultaneous attack against AMISOM and Raskamboni forces stationed at the cities airport and university. The attack occurred in the evening. Causalities not reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces in Bariire Village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 26/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. Several mortar rounds hit inside the village but no casualties were reported from the civilians as well as the warring sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against KDF/ Ras Kaambooni forces based in Badhaadhe in the evening of 26/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Pirates from Majeerten/Isse Mohamud carjacked a private vehicle belonging to Warsangeli near Dangoroyo Village (90km SE of Qardho) on 26/08. Reports indicate that the perpetrators mistook the vehicle of being belonging to Majeerten/Osman Mohamud.
Non-violent activity: Three Gunmen (Warsangeli) carjacked a Toyota Land cruiser carrying a UN staff in Cell-Buh.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed three pastoralists from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan in Qaidarre (95km E of Galkacyo) in the night of 26/08. The killing is reportedly linked to clan revenge between the two sub-clans.
Suspected al Shabaab operatives shot and killed three men who were reportedly connected to the Somali government on their farms in Oowdherow (18kms S of Qurac Joome), Ceel Barde District.

Gunmen from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan stole 24 camels belonging to Dhulbahante/Hayaag sub-clan from the vicinity of Sool-Joogto Village (23km N of Buhoodle) in the evening of 26/08. The theft was in revenge of camels stolen by Dhulbahante gunmen from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw during the clashes between the Somaliland forces and the SSC/ Khatumo militia last year. Latest reports indicate that local elders and police in Qorilugud are searching for the 24 camels in order to return them to their owners.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Galgala/al Shabaab fighters attacked Darwish forces stationed in Sugure Village (33km S of Bosasso), in the morning of 27/08. The al Shabaab fighters also reportedly used RPGs and heavy machine guns against the Darwish forces during the clash. Two Darwish soldiers were reportedly killed and three others were injured in clash. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somali National forces based in Misaanka Dhuhusha neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 26/08. Reports indicate that al Shabaab started the attack with RPGs followed by confrontation that lasted for about 10 minutes. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Radaarka neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 26/08. The perpetrators escaped.
Al-Shabab fighters launched attacks on Mustahil town in Hiiraan Region, which resulted in heavy casualties, including the death of civilians, though numbers were not provided.
A unidentified clan militia attacks Qaydare locality, 90km north of Galkacyo, killing three in an apparent revenge attack.

Al Shabaab launched an attack against pro-Somali forces in Qurac Joome Village (73km NE of Ceel Barde) in the morning of 26/08. Reports indicate that the Somali and Ethiopian forces and other officials left prior to al Shabaab attack on the village. One person was reportedly killed and another one injured during the takeover of the village. It is not clear if the victims were soldiers or civilians. Other reports hold four were killed during the operation.
A large blast targets Ethiopian forces in Beled Wayne. Two civilians were killed in the blast and destroyed businesses premises in the central downtown area.

Heavily armed ENDF accompanied by pro-Somali forces (not named) took over control of Qurac Joome Village (73km NE of Ceel Barde) without firing a single shot in the evening of 27/08. Al Shabaab pulled out of the village prior to the arrival of the ENDF. The allied forces came from Ceel Barde. Reports indicate that the district commissioners of Ceel Barde and Xudur accompanied the troops.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired a number of mortar rounds towards Baidoa airport from Makuudo Village (8km SW of Baidoa) in the night of 27/08. No casualties or damages were reported. AMISOM forces went to the village the following morning but they did not find the attackers. It is not clear if the target of the rounds was civilian or military.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab forces (likely AMISOM) based near Kismaayo airport (Kismaayo) in the night of 27/08. The fighting lasted for about five minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against KDF and anti-al Shabaab forces in Fafaax Dhuun Village (Baardheere District) in the morning of 27/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Two anti-al Shabaab soldiers were reportedly wounded in the clash. Casualties from the KDF and al Shabaab could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the Hiiraan governor, as well as in a marker area. Causalities not reported. Security forces launched a security operation the following day in response to the attacks.

A RCIED apparently targeting police soldiers exploded followed by another at an interval of five minutes in Caymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 27/08. Reports indicate that the RCIED was planted inside a police post in the neighbourhood. Two police officers were reportedly killed while four others were injured. AMISOM forces reportedly disabled an IED planted in the same police post.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on foot patrol near Sheikh Ali Sufi Mosque (Hodan District) in the evening of 27/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Xerada Tolmada (Hodan District) in the evening of 27/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Wadada Jacaylka along SOS neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM/Somalia forces position in Janaale Village (18km NE of Qoryooley) in the evening of 28/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali soldiers base at the bridge that divides Hanti-Wadaag and Horseed neighbourhoods (Jowhar) in the morning of 28/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces based in Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the evening of 28/08. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ENDF and pro-Somali forces left Qurac Joome and took over control of Abeesale (25km E of Qurac Joome) without any resistance from al Shabaab on 28/08. Al Shabaab pulled out of the village before the allied troops arrived. The ENDF later returned to Qurac Joome but pro-SNG forces remained in the village.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud/Bah Yacqub sub-clan burnt a fuel station in Qardho belonging to a businessman hailing from Osman Mohamud/Warfa Ali sub-clan in the night of 28/08. The militia opened fire before setting the fuel station on fire. It is not clear if the owner himself was a target. The motive of the attack is reportedly related to revenge attack dating back to several years. Other reports indicate that the incident could be motivated by business rivalry.

A RCIED targeted the vehicle of the deputy District Commissioner of Karaan District in Karaan on the morning of 28/08. The deputy District Commissioner escaped unhurt. A female doctor bystander - working for the Ministry of Health- was reportedly injured in the blast. It is unclear whether the device was attached to the vehicle or planted on the roadside.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces base in Hoosh neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in night of 28/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a police officer armed with an AK-47 in Medicine Section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 28/08. The attackers escaped without taking the gun of their victim. SNG forces arrived at the scene but made no arrest.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a surprise hit and run attack against a Somali forces base in Kaax Shiiqaal neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 28/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab withdrew. A SNA officer and two soldiers were killed in the clash.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a young woman in Xamar Jadiid (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 28/08. The motive is unknown. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim is the daughter of a businesswoman who runs a restaurant frequented by Somali forces in the neighbourhood. The attackers escaped.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate Mogadishus Kahda District security chief. The attackers and the security chiefs bodyguards engaged in a brief shoot-out.
More than hundred pro-Khatumo supporters staged a demonstration in Taleex on 28/08 in protest against the visit of the vice-president of Puntland.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against KDF/anti-al Shabaab (not named) forces in Faafax Dhuun Village in the evening of 28/08. Al Shabaab reportedly used mortars during the attack. The two sides exchanged fire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government forces on foot patrol in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar in the evening of 29/09. A female bystander was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against pro-SNG Ethiopia forces in Ceel Barde in the night of 29/08. The attackers fired PRGs and light arms briefly and withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab elements launched simultaneous attacks against Somali forces bases in Abdi Wayel Cinema, former Perfume Factory and Pasta Factory in Heliwa District. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a house frequented by MPs and other Somali officials from Habar Gidir sub-clan in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 29/08. The house is located near the Turkish Embassy and the residence of Mohamed Siyad Indha Adde-a SNG army general. The security guards responded by opening fire. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces clash with al Shabaab in the Barafuunka and Salaxa areas of Heliwa. No casualties were reported.
Two explosions were heard the evening of 29/08 at the Hiliwaa police station causing a ""heavy"" battle at SOS intersection. Causalities not known. Perpetrators not identified.

A former member of the al Shabaab local administration in Wanla-Weyne was reportedly publicly executed by al Shabaab militiamen in Jilib on 30/08. The man had reportedly been captured while attempting to defect in Kamsuuma village (Lower Juba).

An armed man hailing from the Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a man hailing from the Majerteen/Biciid Yahan sub-clan in Xero Dayax area in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the night of 30/08. The shooting followed an escalated private dispute between the two men. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. No arrest was reported.

A group of al Shabaab militiamen reportedly reached Buscbusc area (30km S of Badhaade) on 30/08 and announced to the villagers that the production of charcoal would be banned. Two local charcoal burners were reportedly arrested after they expressed their dissatisfaction. One was later found after having apparently been beaten. The second one remained missing.

Members of the Essa and Gadabursi clans clashed using clubs and stones in Garbo Dadar Village (38km NE of Baki) in the morning of 30/08. The clash broke out after one the groups tried to divert irrigation water pipes to their farms. Police officers intervened and dispersed the two sides. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A Puntland police officer shoots and injures the driver of a taxi when he attempted to enter the regional airport.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A clash opposed two groups of Jubaland forces at an illegal road-block between Kismaayo town center and Kismaayo northern airstrip in the afternoon of 30/08. The incident occurred after a group assigned to maintain law and order in the town attempted to dismantle the road-block that had been set-up to intercept khat deliveries from the airport. One of the militiamen manning the road-block was killed and another one was injured. The road-block was removed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Two groups of Jubaland fighters exchanged fire in Calanley neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 30/08. The incident was reportedly related to a previous clash that had occurred in the morning on the north airport road. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 30/08. The attackers escaped from the scene.
A soldier shot and killed a civilian riding on a motorcycle close to Martino Hospital (Xamar Weyne District) in the evening of 30/08. The soldier was arrested. The reason for the shooting is unknown.
Government soldiers clash with unidentified gunmen in Heliwa district during the evening hours. Causalities not known.

Somali forces backed by Ethiopian troops have clashed against Al-Shabab militants in Ceelbarde, Bakool region in south western Somalia. The fighting started after Al-Shabab fighters attacked the town controlled by Somali and Ethiopian forces. Both combatants and residents suffered an unknown number of causalities.

A group protests against a national reconciliation agreement reached in Addis Abba with the Somali government two days prior. The agreement reached articulated that Jubaland will be administered for a two year period in a semi-autonomous fashion by a Juba Interim Administration and led by the regions incumbent president, Ahmed Mohamed Islam.

A RCIED targeted a armored personal carrier transporting the Ministry of Interior and Governor of Lower Shabelle Region in the evening of 30/08. The vehicle was slightly damaged but no injuries were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a municipal council police officer in Afgooye in the afternoon of 30/08. The perpetrators escaped.
Gadabuursi and Issa clash clash with primative weapons over a common water point. Casualties not known.

Two gunmen from the Rahanweyn/Leysan sub-clan shot and killed a member of the Rahanweyn/Hariin sub-clan in Baidoa in the morning of 30/08. The assassination was reportedly in revenge of a previous killing that had occurred several months before.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and al Shabab clash in Yaaqbari District, southern Lower Shabeellee Region. Causalities not known.

ENDF and al Shabaab clash for several hours outside Qansadheer in a location known as Koronbood. Several Ethiopian soldiers are reported killed (not numbers provided), as well as four locals, victims of ENDF shelling.

Hundreds of residents in the city of Baidoa in Bay region took to the streets in protest against the agreement that the Somali government signed with officials from Jubbaland. The group wished to retain greater autonomy.
Al Shabaab captures an executes a former member who had defected to Somali forces.

Gunmen from the Ayr/Yabar Dhowrakace sub-clan reportedly opened indiscriminate fire at a group of ASWJ soldiers and civilians sitting in front of Bar Dhegacade restaurant in Dhusamareeb in the evening of 31/08. The attack was reportedly in revenge to a killing of a member of the Yabar Dhowrakace sub-clan by ASWJ/Sufa militiamen implementing a ban on charcoal production. The ASWJ police commander (Ayr/Yabar Dhowrakece) who was sitting in the restaurant was killed. Another ASWJ/Sufa militiamen was killed and three other civilians injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. ASWJ authorities imposed a night curfew in the town after the incident.

Somali and Ethiopian forces attacked Al Shabaab militias in Korunbod (11km SE of Qansax-Dhere) in the morning of 31/08. Allied forces remained in the village until the evening and were attacked on several occasions by al Shabaab. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab militiamen reoccupied Qurac Joome village (Ceel Barde District, along Ethiopian border) in the morning of 31/08, days after Somali and Ethiopian forces left the village and returned to Ceel Barde. Al Shabaab militiamen stayed in Qurac Joome until the morning of 01/09.

Al Shabaab militiamen attacked and killed a well-known Sheikh - also member of the al Shabaab movement - in his residence in Diinsoor in the evening of 31/08. The Sheikh had reportedly strongly criticized al Shabaab management of the local administration during his preaches in a local mosque. It is believed that the attackers were supporters of Sheikh Ahmed Godane.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand-grenade against a Somali position in Ceel Dhere neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 31/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. The attackers escaped from the scene. No casualties were reported.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run against a Somali position in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) on 31/08. The clash lasted for a few minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Two groups forces exchanged fire in Bakara Junction area (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 31/08. The shooting lasted only for a few minutes and did not cause any casualties.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a young man and injured two others in the cigarettes and matches factory (Dayniile District) in the evening of 31/08. The victims were reportedly sitting in front of a shop when they were attacked. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab beheads a village leader for unknown reason.
Gunmen kill a ASWJ official in Dhusamareb District.
""Two UN-contracted employees were shot and wounded by police as they were trying to enter the seaport.""

A peaceful demonstration was organized in Boondheere District in the morning of 01/09 to support the Addis Ababa agreement on Jubaland. The demonstration was attended by the Somali Minister of Interior and the Governor of Banadir Region.
Two police officers are killed by unidentified gunmen wearing government military uniform at 15 May Square near Villa Somalia. The perpetrators were later arrested.

Somali immigration official Qasim Hassan Takow is killed in a landmine explosion near his home in Mogadishus Shibis district. Takow was driving when a remote control bomb detonated in his car. The motive for the attack is not known.

A security guard protecting a local shop was kidnapped by unidentified militiamen in the main market area of Kismaayo in the night of 31/08-01/09. His body was later found in Calanley neighbourhood. The motive of the killing and identity of the perpetrators are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit-and-run attack against a Somali position close to Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla-Weyn) in the evening of 20:30. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Employees of Al-Jaabiri Livestock Company staged a peaceful demonstration in Berbera on 01/08 in protest against unpaid salaries and benefits. The demonstrators accused the company of violating Somaliland laws and called on the government to address the matter with the company.

Armed militiamen from the Majerteen/Osman Mohamud/Bah Dhulmahante sub-clan carjacked a private truck belonging to a member of the Majerteen/Issa Mohamud sub-clan in Sanjilbo village (8Km N of Qardho) in the night of 01/09. Reports indicate that the truc

Two gunmen from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud carjacked a private vehicle belonging to a member of the Hawadle clan along the Galkacyo-Burtinle road near Bacaadweyn village (48 km N of Galkacyo) on 01/09. The gunmen opened fire in the air to stop the vehicle. The gunmen then drove the vehicle towards Tuulo Jalam in Nugaal Region. The motive of the carjacking is unknown.

A Raskamboni militiaman opened fire at a group of civilians in Dhoobley in the morning of 01/09. One woman was reportedly injured. The incident was reportedly related to a land dispute between the militiaman and some other residents. The shooter was arrested.

An unidentified gunman shot and seriously injured a civilian man in Gacan Libaax district in Hargeisa in the night of 01/09. The victim was rushed to Hargeisa Group Hospital for treatment. The motive of the shooting is unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the scene but was arrested one hour later by the police.

Soldiers shot and killed two policemen in 15-May neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 01/09. The reason for the killing is unclear. Some sources suggest that the attack could have been in retaliation to a police operation conducted in the airport area the same day and targeting un-uniformed soldiers carrying weapons. The perpetrators were arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired a RPG round at a private mini-bus close to Leego village (Buur Hakaba District) in the afternoon of 02/09. The driver of the mini-bus was killed and four other passengers were injured in the attack. Reports indicate that the vehicle was carrying khat.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a Somali convoy in Jiiro Mad Sheeg village (16km E of Berdaale) in the night of 02/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Two soldiers were reportedly injured in the clash. The convoy had left Berdaale and was heading to Baidoa. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Reports indicate that two mid-levels al Shabaab members were killed by al Shabaab fighters in Dhiil village, 70kms west of Xudur town. The victims were involved in the collection of Zakat and one of them was a close associate of the former district commissioner of Xudur for al Shabaab administration (Sheik Abdullahi Dherow). The reason behind their killing is not yet clear. It is suspected that both men are pro-Robow.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali soldier and injured another one in Jariirow village (19km NW of Jowhar) in the morning of 02/09. The men also stole the guns of the soldiers. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the soldier may have moved to Jariirow to establish illegal road-blocks or rob transport vehicles that are obliged to leave the main road that is currently cut by floods around Mahadaay.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud/Bah Yacqub clashed with members of the local community in Xabaal-Reer Village (50Km NE Qardho) on 02/09. Reports indicate that the fighting broke out after the gunmen refused to dismantle an illegal checkpoint in the village as instructed by their elders, prompting the locals to attack them. One gunman was injured and another arrested and handed over to Qardho police, while the rest fled.
An unidentified gunman assassinates a soldier.

Somali forces manning a checkpoint in Muuri village (16km SW of Afgooye) opened fire at a public minibus in the afternoon of 02/09. The soldiers opened fire after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop. One passenger was killed. The vehicle had left Marka and was heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened.

Somali forces exchanged fire with three suspected al Shabaab fighters in Al-Baraka neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 02/09. One al Shabaab fighter was killed and a Somali soldier injured in the clash. The other al Shabaab fighters managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 02/09. The soldiers reacted by opening fire. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 02/09. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
A clan elder is shot and killed by unidentified gunmen during the evening hours.

Militia hailing fromHabar Gidir/Ayr/Yabardhowrakace sub-clan on 03/09 stormed Dhusamareeb police station and forcefully freed their clansman suspected of murdering the local police commander. The slain police commander was a member of Ayr/Cabsiye sub-clan. The attackers and Cabisye militia exchanged gunfire briefly during the incident.

Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at a Somali government vehicle in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 03/09. The device missed it is target. A bystander (young man) was injured in the explosion.

An Al Shabaab fighter was shot and killed in Mooro-Gabey village (30km W of Xudur) in the morning of 03/09 by two of his colleagues. Reports indicate that the perpetrators, who had reportedly raped the wife of another al Shabaab fighter, shot the victim after discovering that he was about to report them to their commander

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the office of an international private company contracted by a UN agency in Beled Weyne in the evening of 03/09. The motive of the attack is unknown. No casualties were reported. Somali/AMISOM forces conducted a security operation in the area after the blast but made no arrest.

A man armed with a knife stabbed and killed another man in Bosasso on 03/09 following an escalated private dispute. The perpetrator hails from Majeerten/Wadalmuge while the victim was a member of the Dashishe sub-clan. The perpetrator was arrested by the police.

International and Somali media reports indicate that a large AMISOM/Somali convoy transporting the Somali President and Cabinet from Mogadishu to Marka was ambushed by al Shabaab militiamen in Buufow Bacaad in the morning of 03/09. At least one vehicle was reportedly damaged and 7 to 11 soldiers were injured. The attack was also quickly reported by pro-al Shabaab websites. The Somali authorities however denied that any ambush took place and attributed the casualties to a road accident. The President was unhurt and reached Marka shortly after the attack took place. Following the attack several journalists are arrested for reporting the incident.

Three unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers walking in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 03/09. The attackers escaped. Government forces arrived at the scene and launched a security operation but made no arrest.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government forces on foot patrol at Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 03/09. The soldiers responded by opening fire. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A government soldier riding in a Toyota Carib opened fire at a public mini-bus in Godey neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the morning of 03/09. Reports indicate that the mini-bus blocked the road and the soldier apparently fired to clear the traffic jam. Two passengers were reportedly injured in the shooting.
Al Shabaab detonates four blasts at Naasa Hablood Hotel in one of many coordinated attacks throughout the city.
An explosion targets soldiers in Seybiyaano neighbourhood in a series of coordinated attacks throughout the city.
Two explosions hit Laanta Suuq Bacaad neighbourhoods headquarters in Yaaqshiid District in one of several coordinated al Shabaab attacks throughout the city.
An al Shabaab placed bomb detonates at Sayidka intersection in one of many coordinated al Shabaab attacks.
An al Shabaab explosion occurred at a site between Zoope intersection and the [former] hides and skins factory in one of many coordinated al Shabaab attacks.
Al Shabaab detonates an explosion at Shaqaalaha intersection, Waaberi District in one of many coordinated attacks throughout the city.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An explosion occurred on Macalin Nuur Street, near Mogadishu University building housing Burundian troops in a series of coordinated attacks throughout the city.
A powerful explosion occurred in Ceelqalow neighbourhood in one of many coordinated al Shabaab attacks.
Xamarweyne police station was hit by a hand grenade in one of many coordinated al Shabaab attacks.
One explosion happened at a site between Afarta Darjiino and Sanca intersection in one of several coordinated al Shabaab attacks throughout the city.
Al Shabaab detonates an explosion at the gate of Mogadishu Airport in one of many coordinated attacks throughout the city.
Two explosions targeted soldiers at Sanca intersection in Kaaraan District in one of several coordinated al Shabaab attacks throughout the city.
Two explosions, launched by al Shabaab, occurred at Nasiib Buundo intersection in Shibis District.
A ""would-be- suicide"" bomber targeting a police checkpoint was blown off before he could reach his target in Mogadishus Hodan district near Shaykh Ali Sufi mosque.
An explosion occurred at Macruuf in Medina Districts Buulo Xuubey neighbourhood in one of many coordinated al Shabaab attacks.
An al Shabaab explosive hit Villa Baydhabo housing federal government military officers, in one of many coordinated attacks.
Ethiopian forces clash with al Shabaab causing three ENDF deaths. Following the battle al Shabaab paraded the bodies of the dead soldiers through the town.
Two explosions detonated by al Shabaab struck Xamar Jajab Police Station in one of many coordinated attacks throughout the city.

A RCIED targeted a government convoy transporting delegations coming back from Marka in Shalaambood (Marka District) in the morning of 04/09. Reports indicate that the delegates were part of the presidents convoy and were returning to Mogadishu when the attack happened. Two vehicles were slightly damaged.
A government security officer attached to the airport shot and injured his colleague at the entrance of the airport in Kismaayo in the evening of 04/09. The motive is unknown.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Ugaar Saleeban carjacked a Toyota Land Cruiser belonging to Majeerten/Siwaaqron near Kalabayr Village (60km S of Bosasso) in the evening of 04/09. Reports indicate that the perpetrators drove the vehicle towards east. No casualties were reported.

A group of angry Ras Kaambooni soldiers erected an illegal checkpoint near the state house in Kismaayo in the morning of 04/09. The soldiers reportedly opened fire and killed a civilian. Reports indicate that the soldiers were arrested by the military police.
Two grenade bombs are thrown at the main action offices in located in Hawa Taka suburbs, causing returned gunfire from security guards. No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab fighters opened fire at a civilian mini-bus travelling near Leego Village in the midday of 05/09. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters instructed the driver to stop but government soldiers in the mini-bus ordered him not to stop, prompting the al Shabaab fighters to open fire. Three soldiers were killed and three civilian passengers were wounded in the attack. The al Shabaab fighters also executed a fourth soldier they captured alive.
Security forces discover and disable an IED in Medina District. A person of interest was arrested soon after.
Newly enlisted soldiers march to Villa Somalia in protest of government neglect toward their salaries.
Unidentified clan militias clash in Hobyo, one death, plus injuries reported.
Jarerweyne youths from Boqol Bush IDP camp clashed with local youths using stones and sticks in Laanta Hawada neighbourhood in Bosasso on 06/09. Police forces dispersed the two groups.

Somali/ENDF forces conducted a security operation in Qasax Oomane Village in Luuq District and killed two al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 06/09. The allied forces also seized a number of weapons during the operation and returned to their base in Berdaale Village in Baidoa District.

Al Shabaab fighters raided pastoralists and robbed them of several livestock (camels) in Uurweyn Village (25kms NW of Xudur) in the morning of 06/09. Al Shabaab accused the pastoralists of herding camels of apostates in the Somali government.
Clan violence causes three deaths and one injury outside Galkacyo in the Barqo-maal area. The identities of the clans were not provided.
Somali troops backed by Ethiopian soldiers forced al-Shabaab militants to flee the Qansah-Omane area of the Bay region following an hour long battle. At least two killed as result of fighting.
At least one person has been confirmed dead and three others injured after a hand grenade was thrown at a restaurant where civilians gathered to spend the evening in Beled Weyne town.

Several hundred passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa on 07 and 08/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa these two days.
Renewed clan fighting (identities unknown) in two locations in Jowhar.

On 07/09 at around 13:40 two explosions were reported from Village Restaurant in the vicinity of the National Theatre (Xamar-Weyne District) in Mogadishu. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the two explosions were caused by a VBIED and possibly a second suicide bomber on foot. Initial reports indicate that casualties could exceed 18, plus 40 wounded. AMISOM and Somali forces were dispatched to the scene immediately after the attack. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. Rumours linger the adjacent hotel was a hub for spies working for CIA and MI5.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An attack targeting federal government and Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops in Mogadishu caused 10 casualties. The attack, a heavy explosion, occurred near Arafat Hospital at noon.

A group of youths hailing from Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans stoned one of the stores designated to replace the Somali shilling with Somaliland currency in Tule shire neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) in the morning of 08/09. The neighbourhood is dominated by Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans. The replacement of the Somali shillings comes after Somaliland authorities banned the use of Somali currency for all business transactions in Sanaag Region on 05/09. Police fired their weapons into the air to disperse the youths.

Several hundred passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa on 07 and 08/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa over these two days.
A doctor who has associations with al Shabaab is assassinated for reasons unknown.

A gunman from the Dhulbahante/Ali Geri sub-clan killed two members of two other Ali Geri sub-sub-clans (not identified) in Buuhoodle District on 08/09/2013. Tensions escalated very quickly between the three sub-sub-clans involved in the incident but were temporarily resorbed after the intervention of local elders.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Jubaland forces based at University area in Kismaayo in the evening of 08/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Jubaland forces in Marine neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 08/09. One soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab targeted government and AMISOM positions with heavy artillery fire in Mogadishu over the night of 09/09. No causalities reported. The attack in Heliwa occurred near the perfume factory, a local landmark.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched attacks on government and AMISOM forces in Berdaale town. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/Somali forces based in Shalaambood (Marka District) in the night of 09/09. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire, after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a Somali soldier in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 09/09. The attackers escaped.

Heavy fighting between government forces and an unnamed enemy at Kismayo airport. The official figures of the casualties caused by the bombardment have not been released as troops based in the region launched security operations in the early hours of the following morning.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/Somali forces based in Ceel Jaale (7km SW of Marka) in the night of 09/09. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/Somali forces base in Janaale Village (18km NE of Qoryooley) in the night of 09/09. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire, after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on patrol l in the vicinity of the former prison in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 09/09. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 09/09. One soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM soldier in military uniform was found dead along the seaside (about 200m) from the International Camp, inside within the AMISOM protected area in Mogadishu Airport (Medina District) in the morning of 09/09. Although the cause of his death was not identified, reports indicate that the body had bruises.

A military member shot and killed a donkey cart owner in Buulo Hubey market (Medina District) in the afternoon of 09/09. Reports indicate the gunman demanded extortion money from the victim, whose cart was carrying goods.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab targeted government and AMISOM positions with heavy artillery fire in Mogadishu over the night of 09/09. No causalities reported.
Hand grenade attacks against a military base reported in a Marka. Perpetrators not known. Causalities not known.

Heavy confrontations between the Ras Kambooni militia and armed men believed to be Al-Shabab fighters occurred in the Kismaayo airport. The attacks are believed to have caused causalities, but the exact numbers are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED, planted at the water point in Billis Qooqaani (48km SW of Afmadow) exploded in the morning after KDF/AMISOM forces reached the area to draw water. One KDF soldier sustained minor injuries while. The blast also destroyed a KDF vehicle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Arrests: Jubaland special police forces reportedly arrested the manager of Izra Hotel in his residence in the night of 10-11/09/2013. The dead body of the man was recovered in the morning. Some sources suggest that the arrest and killing could be in connection with a previous discovery of a RCIED in front of Izra Hotel.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM/Somali position in Yaaq-Biri-Weyne (Wanla Weyne District) in the evening of 10/09. The clash lasted for about 15 minutes. Casualties are unknown.
Two al Shabaab fighters are killed in an internal fight among factions.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a police outpost in Beytu Raas neighbourhood in Marka town in the evening of 10/09/2013. The police officers fired back after the blast. Casualties are unknown. A security operation was conducted in the area after the attack but no arrests were made.
An explosion hit a mini-bus at Ex-Control Balcad area Heliwa District in the morning of 10/09. The explosion damaged the rear side of the mini-bus. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police officers collecting taxes from business centres in the gold section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 10/09/2013. The officers reportedly fired back after the explosion. A female civilian was reported killed and four others persons - including several policemen - were injured. The attackers escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Kenyan AMISOM forces come under attack in Bilis Qooqaani, three reported deaths.

Two men who used to be members of Al-Shabab were today executed by members of that group in Buulo Berde. They were shot in public gathering and were accused of trying to assassinate Shaykh Fuad MuhammadKhalaf, who is a top Al-Shabab commander in the region.

Al Shabaab militiamen loyal to Sheikh Ahmed Godane attacked a group of al Shabaab foreign fighters, killing two of them including Omar Shafik Hammami ""Al-Amriki"" after an extended firelight in a village about 30km E of Baardheere in Diinsoor District on 11/09. Several Somali al Shabaab militiamen were also reported killed. The bodies of the two foreign fighters were taken from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade attack against Somali forces based in the former Central Bank building in Horseed neighbourhood in Baidoa in the evening of 11/09/2013. The soldiers fired back after the blast. Two civilians bystanders were reportedly injured. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a traditional elder from the Hawiye/Jijeele sub-clan in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the evening of 11/09. The elder had been a member of the National Constituent Assembly in Mogadishu in 2012, and was at the time of the attack the security focal point of Hilaac neighbourhood on the west side of Beled Weyne. The killing is believed to have been perpetrated by al Shabaab operatives, for political reasons. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab militiamen executed a man accused of spying for Somali forces in Hotel Camaloy Square in Bulo Burte on 11/09. Hundreds of residents reportedly attended the execution. Another man accused of theft and of setting up an illegal road-block also had one of his legs and hands cut-off by the al Shabaab militiamen.

A national staff of an INGO was reportedly arrested at his residence by al Shabaab militiamen in Saakow on 11/09 while visiting his family. A sister of the staff was reportedly shot and killed as she was pleading the militiamen not to arrest her relative.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers manning a security outpost close to SOS junction (Heliwa District) in the evening of 11/09/2013, The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties are unknown. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand at Somali police officers walking on Jamahuuriya road (Kaaraan District) in the night of 11/09/2013. The grenade reportedly landed in an empty space causing no casualties. The attackers escaped from the scene.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle belonging to the director of the tax department of Dayniile district in Ciise Abdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 11/09/2013, Reports indicate the device had been placed in the vehicle of the target and exploded immediately after the official boarded his vehicle. The vehicle was damaged but the official escaped unharmed. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali policemen on foot patrol in Hawl-Wadaag junction area in the afternoon of 11/09/2013. The policemen opened fire and arrested the attacker. Two civilian bystanders were injured.

Around 150 passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa in the morning of 11/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa and were requesting that the minister negotiates with the company to have their tickets changed with other airlines. Some demonstrators moved to the Ethiopian Airlines office in the afternoon and were dispersed by elements of the Somaliland police.

On 12 September 2013, Al Shabaab forces shot and killed a woman and injured a man in Aawdiinle Village (Baidoa District). Reports indicate that the woman used to cook for Somali Government forces in the village. Following the incident, the husband of the victim organized a band of vigilantes to travel to Damballi Village to destroy a borehole generator in the town using small arms fire.

Ahmad Muhammad Islam (Ahmad Madobe), the interim president of Jubbaland and Raskamboni head, was been injured in an al Shabaab suicide explosion targeting his convoy which was travelling in the city. Around 30 other persons were reported killed including a minimum of six Jubaland militiamen.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces reportedly shot and killed two security guards of Hormud Telecommunication Company in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 12/09 after they reportedly refused the soldiers to enter the companies premise during a security operation.

Unidentified men armed believed to be Jajeelo sub-clan shot and killed a man hailing from Gaal Jecel in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 12/09. The killing is reportedly related to clan revenge. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A local businessman was killed by another man in Qurac Joome in the morning of 12/09. The victim was from the Galjeceel clan and the perpetrator from the Jijeele clan. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

A man hailing from the Osman Mohamoud/Warfa Ali sub-clan shot and injured four persons in Qardho on 12/09. The victims hail from the Majerteen/Osman Mohamoud/Bahdhulmahante, Majeerteen/Issa Mohamoud and Majerteen/Osman Mohamoud/Bah Yacqub sub-clans. There are conflicting reports about the incident, with one version indicating that it was related to an escalated private dispute, and another suggesting that it was a case of clan revenge between Osman Mohamoud/Bah Yacqub and Osman Mohamoud/Warfa Ali sub-clans.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a traditional elder at SOS Junction (Heliwa District) in the evening of 12/09. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of Somali forces briefly clashed in an area close to Villa Baidoa (Medina District) in the afternoon of 12/09 following an escalated land dispute. One soldier was reportedly killed in the clash.
An hour-long battle erupted in Ceelbarde town, Bakool Region, between Ethiopian troops over weapons and money. The two sides may have been drawn along ethnic lines. Twenty reported causalities.
Traders at Burao livestock market staged a peaceful demonstration in Burao on 13/09 in protest against the new tax increase in livestock.

Local community elders and residents protest in Caroolay Village against a planned visit by the Puntland Vice president. Reports indicate that the elders mobilized their clans militias to prevent against any visit by Puntland officials.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Marka police station in Saraha neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 13/09. The police opened fire in retaliation. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Youths from Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo clashed in central Ceerigaabo using stones and sticks in the afternoon of 13/09. The motive is unknown but it is believed to be related to clan issues. A number of youths were injured in the clash. Police arrested four people they suspected of organizing the clash.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives opened fire at Somali forces in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 13/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. One of the attackers was killed and a soldier was injured in the shootout. Reports indicate that the perpetrators were planning to assassinate the Somali soldiers but government forces quickly spotted them.
Al Shabaab attacks a government military base, three people were killed and many were wounded in the fighting.
Unknown gunmen (possibly Raskamboni forces) killed Jubbaland elder and businessman Noor Olad Gamadid in Kismayo. The motive for the attack is not known.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 14/05. Reports indicate that the victim was heading to his home when he was attacked. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a soldier on foot at Sheikh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 14/09. The soldier responded by opening fire. Three civilians were injured in the shooting. Reports indicate one of the injured (a woman) later succumbed to her injuries in the hospital. The perpetrators escaped.

column8: SSC: Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Militia
column17: SSC/Khaatumo militias launched attacked Somaliland forces based in Gambadha Village (29km NE of Laas Caanood) in the night of 14/09. The attackers fired AK-47 and RPGs fire. Somaliland forces responded with anti-aircraft guns and mortars in the clash which lasted for five minutes, after which the attackers withdrew. One Somaliland soldier was injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab fighters (not identified) in Wargaduudo Village near Ceel-Cadde, (50km SW of Garbahaarey) in the evening of 14/09. One anti-al Shabaab soldier was killed in the clash. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted a high number of young boys aged between 12-15 years from Kurtunwaarey and surrounding villages including Bulo-Mareer in Lower Shabelle Region on 14/09. The boys were reportedly deployed to a big camp in Dacaraha Village (outskirts of Kurtunwaarey) for military training. Some parents who contacted local media anonymously said that al Shabaab militia intimidated them after they demanded their children.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted a high number of young boys aged between 12-15 years from Kurtunwaarey and surrounding villages including Bulo-Mareer in Lower Shabelle Region on 14/09. The boys were reportedly deployed to a big camp in Dacaraha Village (outskirts of Kurtunwaarey) for military training. Some parents who contacted local media anonymously said that al Shabaab militia intimidated them after they demanded their children.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces opened fire to clear traffic jam to allow a convoy of a senior Jubaland administration official to pass in Somali star neighbourhood in Kismaayo on 14/09. The official was returning from the airport after seeing the Jubaland president off. A shopkeeper was killed by a stray bullet.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in Ex-control Balcad area (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 14/09. The reason behind the killing is currently unknown. The attackers escaped.

Two suspected al Shabaab operatives reportedly tried to assassinate an armed government soldier on foot in Ex-control Balcad area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/09. Reports indicate that the perpetrators shot at the soldier but missed him. The soldier responded by opening fire at the attackers, killing both of them on the spot. AMISOM forces later came and collected the bodies.

Unidentified body of a boy was found near the cities old water tank (Kismaayo) in the morning of 15/09. The identity and motive of the perpetrators are unknown. Local authorities transported the body to the morgue for identification.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Ethiopia's Liyu Police paramilitaries exchanged gunfire with a Dhulbahante man in the vicinity of Xamar Lagu Xidh on 15/09 in an attempt to arrest him. The man was injured in the shoot-out. There are different versions on the motive of the incident. One version suggest that the man was suspected of being a member of al Shabaab or ONLF while other reports indicate that he was a part of a group that killed two ENDF soldiers in Ethiopias Somali Region and escaped to Somaliland. The Liyuu police returned to their base in the Ethiopian side of the border.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somali forces based in Dhambal Village in Baidoa District on 15/09. The two sides reportedly engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established. Somali forces late

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces (Burundian contingent) based in Ceel Haji (3km NE of Marka) in the night of 15/09. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire during the fighting that lasted for about 25 minutes, after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against Somali forces position in Shalaambood (9km NW of Marka) in the evening of 15/09. The two sides exchanged light arms fire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in an area close to Buufow Bacaad Village (5km NW of Marka) in the morning of 15/09. Reports indicate that the fighting broke out after one group tried to erect a road block while the other opposed. No casualties were reported.
An armed man shot at the residence of Puntlands minister of finance in the night of 15/09. The motive is unknown.

Arrests: CID officers detained the spokesman of ASWJ, at the CID headquarters in Hodan District in the morning of 15/09. Reports indicate that the spokesman was arrested after being summoned by the CID. The reason behind his arrest is unclear. Further reports indicate that he was later released.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces clash with al Shabaab elements in Kismayo. The fighting is believed to have caused heavy casualties to the fighting sides but the exact number of casualties is still unknown.
Two groups of pro-SNG militias (not identified) clashed briefly in Buulo-Jaan neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 16/09 after suspecting each other as hostile. No casualties were reported.

Somali police and army clashed following an escalated dispute over the control of a check-point used to extort money from public transport vehicles in Aw Dheegle Village (37km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 16/09. Three combatants were reportedly killed and five others were injured.

A number of people, mostly youths, staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the afternoon of 16/09 to express their support to the president of Somaliland for laying the foundation stone for the construction of Burao-Ceerigaabo road. The group reportedly chanted pro-Somaliland president slogans during the demonstration.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces shot and killed a soldier who reportedly erected an illegal road-block near the presidential palace in Kismaayo to extort money from vehicles bringing ferrying materials to the port city on 16/09. Reports indicate that the soldier was killed after he opened fire at the soldiers who were removing the road-block.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on foot patrol at Baar Ubah Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 16/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Security forces raided a sand harvesting centre in Kaabada area (Karaan District) in the afternoon of 16/09. The soldiers are believed to have been directed to the area by two government officers allegedly bribed by contractors to disperse the sand harvesters from the area. Two sand harvesters were reportedly killed and four others were injured in the attack.

Soldiers in a convoy of two vehicles fired at IDPs chatting beside the main road at Baar Haraf area close to K 13 (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 16/09. A soldier in the first vehicle fired two bullets in the air and other soldiers in the second car assumed that they were ambushed and opened fire at the IDPs near the road. Two IDPs (one male and one female) were reportedly killed in the shooting. The convoy then proceeded to Mogadishu.

A peaceful demonstration against Brussels conference was held in Baidoa in the morning of 16/09. The rally was organized by the local authority and elders. Bay regional officials and elders addressed the rally and said that they were opposed to the conference.
Unidentified gunmen wearing government military uniform shot and killed a Ayr Clan elder in Mogadishu.

Somaliland police and a group of pro-Somaliland government counter protesters attack a group of peaceful protesters demonstrated against the ban on Somali currency in Somaliland. At least ten injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab militiamen reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM (Kenya) position in Bilis Qooqani in the evening of 17/09. Casualties are unknown.

A watchman of a local school shot and killed a young man in the vicinity of Al-Furqan school in Laas Caanood in the evening of 17/09. Reports indicate that the victim and his girlfriend were sitting outside the school and were shot at after they refused to obey he watchman who had ordered them to leave the area. The shooter reportedly hail from the Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan and the victim from the Dhulbahante/Jamac Siyaad sub-clan. The owner of the school was arrested after the shooter escaped from the scene.

District authorities in Yaaqshiid District organized a demonstration in support of the New Deal conference on 17/09. Local medias report that hundreds of residents attended the event. No incidents were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a prominent businessman in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 17/09. The motive is unknown. The victim hails from Habar Gidir/Ayanle sub-clan and was a close relative of the NSA commander in the neighbourhood. Reports indicate the victim was involved in negotiations to release Sheikh Hasan Dahir Aweys, a former al Shabaab official detained by Somali forces. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified persons threw a hand grenade at a government military base located at the outskirts of Jowhar, causing a number of causalities. Government soldiers opened heavy gunfire after the explosion occurred.

A young Somali man was shot and killed in Mogadishu while on his way home the evening of 17/09. The victim who does not represent or work for the government or any agency is the brother of a police officer.

A security officer who works at Hotel Amiira in Hodan District, Banaadir Region shot and killed one person before injuring another in a shooting spree. The reason for the attack have not been ascertained, though the attacker may have been mentally unfit.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Government forces backed by African Union troops have clash against Al-Shabab at a locality between Yaaqbari Weyne and Wanaweyn in Lower Shabeelle region. The fighting began after Al-Shabab fighters attacked a convoy of Somali army in the area. Causalities reported, no numbers provided.
Unknown armed gunmen killed a local Somali elder in Mogadishus KM4 intersection. The motive behind the murder is yet to be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militias conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM/Somali position in Yaaq Biri Weyne (Wanla-Weyne District) in the morning of 18/09. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Bosasso police forces protest for unpaid salaries. Many of the protesting officers were arrested by the regional commander.

A group of youths hailing from Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans staged a demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the evening of 19/09. The youths were protesting against the arrest of seven traders hailing from the two sub-clans after they were reportedly found selling goods in Somali shillings, whose used had been banned by Sanaag regional officials on 05/09. The protesters burnt tires during the demonstration. Police came and shot in the air to disperse them but the youth fired at the police, who withdrew. A group of Isaq youths later attacked the protestors using stones. The demonstrators also fired at the Isaq youths injuring three of them. Police later arrested three demonstrators.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in Shalaambood Village (9km NW of Marka) in the morning of 19/09. The victim was unarmed when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier for unknown reason.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle of a SNA officer in Waxara Cadde neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 19/09. Reports indicate that the officer and his body guards entered a residential house in the neighbourhood and the device was detonated while they were inside the house. It is unclear whether the device was attached to the vehicle or planted on the roadside. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali/AMISOM base in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the night of 19/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali and AMISOM forces reportedly took control of Mahadaay (21km N of Jowhar) in the morning of 19/09. The AMISOM/Somali forces entered the village from the SE and SW. Most al Shabaab militias had left the town before the attack. The government forces encountered no resistance except for a brief skirmish with a group of al Shabaab militiamen close to Saabuun bridge at the entrance of the town. One al Shabaab member was reported killed.

A pastoralist hailing from Majeerten/Ise Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed his fellow clansman in Awr-Boogays Village (123km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 20/09 following an escalated a dispute over water for their livestock. The perpetrator escaped.
A group of unidentified men killed a woman who was selling khat.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Shaqaalaha Junction (Waberi District) in the night of 20/09. No casualty was reported. The soldiers arrested a man they suspected of throwing the grenade.

A RCIED targeted a SNG military vehicle in Ciise Abdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 20/09. The soldiers in the vehicle opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The attackers managed to escape.

Hargeisa University students staged a demonstration in front to the university in the morning of 21/09 in protest against fee increment. The university increased the fees per semester from 180 to 200 USD. The students agreed to disperse after the minister of education and the police commissioner addressed them and promised to discuss the issue with the universities administration. No casualties or destruction of property was reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed four militia men loyal to Barre Hiraale at a check-point in outskirts of Gobweyne Village (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 21/09. The motive is unknown.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man hailing from Darood/Lelkase sub-clan and injured two other people sitting in a tea shop in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of21/09. Reports indicate that the perpetrators had been targeting a prominent pharmacist who is the brother of the victim and was also in the tea shop. Reports say that the pharmacist had received several death threat calls from unidentified callers. The targeted man escaped unharmed. The motive of the attack is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier in the Hotel Kismaayo area for unknown reason.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police based at Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 21/09. Police opened fire after the blast. Two civilian passersby were reportedly wounded in the explosion.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces inside Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 21/09. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the targets were foreigners (Yemen and Turkish nationals) shopping in the market. Two soldiers and a civilian woman were confirmed dead and three others injured. The attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces inside Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 21/09. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the targets were foreigners (Yemen and Turkish nationals) shopping in the market. Two soldiers and a civilian woman were confirmed dead and three others injured. The attackers escaped.

More than 20 IDPs from Koosaar Village (in the outskirts of Burao) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the office of governor of Togdheer Region in Burao on 22/09. The protesters complained that the villages head had been diverting their share of humanitarian aid.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a soldier in Ceel Jilibey area in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 22/09. The perpetrators dumped the body of their victim in water well in the neighbourhood. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM forces travelling between Baidoa and Goof-Gaduud/ Shabeelow Village (25KM SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 22/09. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Somali government forces base in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 22/09. The two sides reportedly exchanged heavy gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. One soldier was reportedly injured but reports indicate the casualties could be more.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a former MP in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 21/09. A woman working in the compound was injured in the blast. The former MP was not in the house by the time of the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab/Galgala insurgents erected a road-block at an area between Laag and Yalho villages on Bosasso-Garowe road in the evening of 22/09. The gunmen reportedly opened fire at trucks and robbed cash and food them. They also took a number of AK-47 rifles used by the truck drivers for security purpose.

Somali forces arrested two suspected al Shabaab elements found planting a RCIED in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Daynille District) in the evening of 22/09. The security forces also seized explosives devices during the arrest. Reports indicate that the security forces were tipped off by members of public about the suspects activities. The Somali forces reportedly opened fire before arresting the suspects.

Unidentified armed men shot and injured a MP in Buulo Hubey neighbourhood (Medina District) in the evening of 22/09. The MP succumbed to his injuries in a Mogadishu hospital later. Reports indicate the attackers were in a vehicle and managed to escape.
""One INGO staff member was attacked by refugees, who were upset about the lack of food. The staff member sufferred a broken nose.""

Public transport drivers staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the parliament building (Hargeisa) in the morning of 22/09 in protest against governments plan to increase road taxes. The drivers reportedly submitted a memo to the speaker of parliament urging the parliament not to approve the bill.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces based in Goof-Gaduud (25 km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 23/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Gaal Jecel and Marehan militias clashed in the outskirts of Kismaayo (in the direction of Goob Weyn Village) in the evening of 23/09 following a dispute over sharing food supplies. One Marehan militia man and seven others (three Marehan and four Gaal Jecel) were injured in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A man shot and killed a Jubaland soldier in Baar Caleen neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 23/09. Reports indicate that the motive was in revenge of a soldier killed on 30/09 over Khat dispute. Military police engaged in a gunfight with the perpetrator who was hiding in a house in the neighbourhood but he managed to escape. Two people were injured in the shootout.
Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening 23/09. The reason behind the clash could not be established. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Somali forces based in Shanta Geed neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 23/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. A woman in a nearby house was injured after she was hit by a stray bullet.

A soldier shot and killed another soldier over personal dispute in Jiro Maskiin neighbourhood (Medina District) in the evening of 23/09. Reports indicate that the victim had been away for some time following the dispute with the perpetrator and returned today and got killed.
A bomb plated near a police station Afgooye detonates killed two security forces and injures six others.

A RCIED targeted an ENDF water bowser fetching water in Qansax Dhere in the morning of 22/09. Unconfirmed reports indicate that one ENDF soldier was killed and four others were injured in the blast. The attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military truck in Ceel Jaale Village (7km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 24/09. The explosion hit the rear side of the truck and reportedly caused a big damage. Casualties could not be established.

Somali forces in Mahadaay launched an attack against al Shabaab militants in Biyo Cadde Village (40km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 24/09. The fighting lasted for about an hour. Reports indicate that the Somali forces were pushed back the al Shabaab and they continued to be in control of the village.

A peaceful demonstration in support of the proposed formation of Southwest state which will bring together six south-central regions was held in ADC compound in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 24/09.

Three gunmen hailing from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud carjacked a Toyota Surf belonging to a Warsangeli man in Bosasso but were immediately intercepted and arrested by the police. The motive of the carjacking is unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at an empty area between Golis Telecommunication Company and Abu Huraryra Mosque in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 24/09. No casualty was reported. The motive and the target of the attack were not clear. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters arrested nine people in Buulo-Mareer (29 km W of Marka) on 24/09 after accusing them of spying for the Somali government. A prominent religious leader, believed to have links with Mukhtar Robow (who fell out with the al Shabaab leader), was among those arrested. Reports indicate that local residents are negotiating with al Shabaab for the clerics release.

An armed group hailing from the Habar Gidir/Saad shot and killed two fellow clansmen in Sabacad (17km N of Afbarwaaqo) in Hobyo District in the afternoon of 24/09. Reports indicate that the killing was related to clan revenge. The victims were reportedly businessmen. The perpetrators escaped.
