Unidentified perpetrators hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in Godey neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 24/09. The soldiers responded by opening fire. Reports indicate that the device hit a perimeter wall of a nearby shop. Casualties are unknown. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali police guarding the District Commissioners office in Waberi District in the evening of 24/09. Reports indicate that the device landed on an empty space. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Non-violent activity: A group of Somali soldiers set up an illegal checkpoint in Laanta-Buuro in Afgooye District in the morning of 25/09 and started extorting money from public transport vehicles.
Locals in Ruun-Nirgood Village (64km SE of Aadan -Yabaal) clashed with al Shabaab in the afternoon of 25/09. The reason behind the clash is currently unclear. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/Somali forces based in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22 km W of Wanla Wayne) in the evening of 25/09. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire including RPGs for about one hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established. Reports indicate that AMISOM/Somali forces conducted a security operation in the area prior to the attack and arrested two persons they suspected of being al Shabaab operatives.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM/Somali forces positioned in Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the night of 25/09. Reports indicate that the fighting lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

An unidentified body of a man was discovered in Argo area in Fanoole neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 25/09. The identity and the motive of the perpetrators are unknown. Jubaland forces conducted a search operation and arrested seven Somali soldiers staying in a house near the scene where the body was found.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: The body of a Jubaland soldier discovered near the beach in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 25/09. The identity and the motive of the perpetrators are unknown. Reports indicate that the victim had a record of harassing civilians and was behind the previous attack against the body guard of the vice-president of Jubaland.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali government forces aided by African peacekeepers (AMISOM) seized control of Biyo Cadde town. Three members of al Shabaab reported killed in the fighting.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a government soldier in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 26/09. The attackers escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/Somali forces clash with al Shabaab in Kulbiyow sub-district in the Lower Juba region. The clash lasted for several hours; causalities not yet known.

Two groups of Somali government forces clashed in Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km W of Wanla-Weyne) following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public service vehicles in the afternoon of 27/09. One soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland security forces raided al-Shabaab bases in Sugure village near the Golis Mountains, killing one militant and wounding three others.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols attempted to assassinate a local journalist near Indian Ocean University in Bulo Huubey neighbourhood (Medina District) in the evening of 28/09. The journalist reportedly said the gunmen were dressed in government military uniforms and tried to kill him as he walked out of his home. Somali forces arrived after the perpetrators had already escaped.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood (Las Anod) on 28/09 in protesting against traders from southern Somalia. The protesters claimed that the traders were behind the increasing house rents in the town.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against the residence of Baidoa district commissioner in Adaada neighbourhood in the night of 28/09. The suspected al Shabaab fighters and the DCs security guards exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The district commissioner later claimed that his security guards had killed an al Shabaab fighter and wounded another during the clash.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against the residence of Baidoa district commissioner in Adaada neighbourhood in the night of 28/09. The suspected al Shabaab fighters and the DCs security guards exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The district commissioner later claimed that his security guards had killed an al Shabaab fighter and wounded another during the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab operatives launched hit and run attacks against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Abdi Wayeel area and the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the evening of 28/09. Reports indicate that the attackers also fired mortars at the bases of the allied forces, who also responded with artillery guns. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a base of pro-ASWJ forces in Jaayga Ceeldheere neighbourhood in (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 28/09. The forces responded with gunfire but no casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 28/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. A civilian bystander was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A gunman shot and killed a Somaliland police officer and injured another in Ximan-Gareen (20km E of Ceerigaabo) on 29/09. Reports indicate the police were trying to arrest the man following a dispute over grazing land with another person. The police later shot and injured the perpetrator, and took him to Ceerigaabo police station. The perpetrator hails from the Habar Yonis while the slain police officer was from Warsangeli/Ogays.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces based in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 29/09. The warring sides used both heavy and light weapons during the clash which lasted for 30 minutes. Unconfirmed reports indicate that three combatants were injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces based in Arbacow settlement (13km E of Afgooye) in the evening of 29/09. Both sides used heavy and light weapons during the clash which lasted for 30 minutes. Reports indicate that this attack was launched simultaneously with the one in Lafoole settlement. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of government soldiers briefly exchanged gunfire at Bar-Ismail checkpoint in Afgooye in the midday of 29/09. The clash is believed to have been triggered by a dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. No casualties were reported.

Pro-Somali forces in Ceel Barde on 29/09 reportedly vacated their positions in protest over unpaid salaries. The soldiers reportedly quarrelled with the Bakool governor after they were left out during payment of salaries received from regular forces recently. Reports indicate that the group went to the Ethiopias town of Godey and vowed not to return until they are paid.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Puntland Darwish forces attacked al Shabaab/Galgala militia in Galgala area (Bosasso District) on 29/09. A Darwish officer reportedly said that they had killed an al Shabaab fighter and injured three others, adding that the Darwish forces also took over control of the area. Reports on 30/09 indicate that Puntland forces mobilized themselves for more attacks against the al Shabaab/Galgala insurgents.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 29/09. The fighting broke out after one group attacked the other following reports that they had been robbing civilians of mobile phones and cash. Reports indicate that the shootout was sporadic. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government forces in Gubta (Dayniile District) in the evening of 29/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Two soldiers were injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at AMISOM base near the livestock market in Hawl-Wadaag District (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 29/09. No causalities were reported. The attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government forces based in Abdi Wayeel Cinema area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 29/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based at SOS Junction (Heliwa District) in the evening of 29/09. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. One soldier was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman in Suuq Bacoole neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 29/09. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM personnel come under attack formal Shabaab at their base in Beledweyne. AMISOM forces claim to have ""defeated the group and inflicted losses.""

Burao General Hospital staff held a peaceful demonstration in front of the hospital over a decision to lay off about 30 employees, after a sponsoring NGO pulled out of the country. The group explained their grievances to the media and accused the hospital management for their planned lay off.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali police manning a security outpost in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the evening of 30/09. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against government soldiers based in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 30/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Two soldiers were reportedly injured in the clash. One Somali military truck was also damaged.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Darwish forces engage al Shaabab and Galgala militia positions in the Bosasso area. Causalities not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ex-control Balcad neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 30/09. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Police shot and injured a man whom they suspected of planning to hurl a hand grenade at Turkish nationals constructing the road in 1st March neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the evening of 30/09. Reports indicate that the police later shot and killed the suspect after they found him with a hand grenade. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police on foot patrol in Israac neighbourhood (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 30/09. Reports indicate that the hand grenade missed the target and landed in an empty area. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.
Arrests: Somaliland security personnel arrest a prominent cleric and local leader of Hizbul Islam Party in Hargeysa for his support for al Shabaab.

Arrests: ASWJ police on 01/10 arrested the self-declared president of Gal-Hiraan and Xarardhere state, in Guri Ceel (Dhusamareeb District). The police also arrested his minister of internal affairs. The ASWJ administration accused him of trying to destabilize ASWJ-controlled areas after holding a political meeting in Guri Ceel.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Somali forces based in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the night of 01/10. Both sides reportedly used heavy weapons. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters loyal to Sheikh Mukhtar Robow and Godane clashed in Mindhoobi Village (Xudur District) in the afternoon of 01/10. Report indicates that the fighting broke out after militia loyal Godane attacked the village which was under the control of pro-Robow group. Godanes fighters reportedly abducted a man and a woman related to pro-Robow and took them to unidentified location. No casualties were reported during the clash.
Al Shabaab forces attacked a group of government forces in Yaaq Biri Weyn. Causalities not known.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives/sympathizers hurled two hand grenades at a video hall in Tima Cade neighbourhood (Bulo Xawo) in the evening of 01/10. The attackers also opened fire at the explosion. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A RCIED planted under a tree in a residential house in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) exploded in the afternoon of 02/10. The house is frequented by traditional elders and officials from Absame clan. Reports indicate that the elders had left the scene when the device went off. No casualties were reported. Further reports indicate that another unexploded IED was removed from the house. The identity of the perpetrators remain unclear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Bulo-Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 02/10. The convoy was escorting a water bowser by the time of the attack. Reports indicate that the device missed its target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted a military pick-up patrolling the road between Shalaambood and Buufow Bacaad villages (Marka District) in the afternoon of 02/09. A number of soldiers were killed and others injured. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Somali forces stationed in Ceel-shelling area near K60 in Marka District in the night of 02/10. The fighting continued for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against a Somali soldiers base in Mahadaay Village (Jowhar Distirct) in the night of 02/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. At least one soldier and a young boy were confirmed killed in the clash but the casualties are believed to be more than that although the exact figures could not be established. Reports indicate that AS fighters had been regrouping in the outskirts of Biyo-Cade Village in an attempt to recapture Mahadaay.
Unidentified attackers and police exchanged gunfire briefly in Hawa Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 02/10. A civilian was killed after he was hit by a stray bullet.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers on patrol in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the night of 02/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. One soldier was injured in the blast. The perpetrators managed to escape.
A group of four boys stoned a boy to death in Sheedaha area (Koodbuur District) in the evening of 02/10. The motive is unknown.

A government police officer shot and killed his colleague in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 02/10 following a dispute over money extorted from a local construction company. It remains unclear whether the perpetrator was arrested or not.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an armed a police officer near the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 02/10. The perpetrators also stole the gun of their victim and escaped.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 02/09. The victim was the commander of the SNG police protecting the staff of a Turkish company constructing roads in Mogadishu. The attackers also stole the victims pistol and escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade into the residence of a local district official in Wekio Stadium neighbourhood (Shibis District) in the evening of 02/09. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a soldier collecting tax near the fish market in Aw-baalle neighbourhood in the morning of 03/10. The soldier was injured by the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab militiamen conducted a hit and run attack against Somali soldiers based in Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km NW of Wanla Weyne) in the evening of 03/10. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Causalities are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Lidow Jallaad near Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km NW of Wanla Weyne) in the night of 03/10. The fighting lasted about 20 minutes. Causalities are unknown.
Al Shabaab forces attacked a group of government forces in Yaaq Biri Weyn for the second time in two days. Causalities not known.

A suspected al Shabaab fighter opened fire at government soldiers in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 03/10. The soldiers killed the attacker and took his body to the local police station. One soldier was injured in the attack.

Two groups of government soldiers exchanged gunfire after one group attacked the other for allegedly setting up a road-block at Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 03/10. The shootout lasted for 10 minutes after which the group that had set up the road-block withdrew. Two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A landmine blast targets AMISOM soldiers at Makundi locality in Baidoa town. Somali government soldiers responded to the attack and made several arrests. Causalities list not reported.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Ali Saleebaan/Bicidyahan and Majeerten/Ali Saleebaan Colyahan sub clans clashed in Qandala on 04/10. There are conflicting reports on the reason behind the clash. One version suggests the two groups were pirates and clashed on private issue while another version claims the fighting broke out after a truck hit and destroyed a business premise in Qandala. One militia man was reportedly killed in the clash.

Anti-al Shabaab forces (not named) conducted a security operation outside Kismaayo town and clashed with AS in Goob Weyn Village (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 04/10. Reports indicate that two anti-al Shabaab soldiers were injured while two al Shabaab fighters were captured during the clash.
A police man shot and killed a truck driver in Balayga Cas (30km N of Hargeysa) in the afternoon of 04/10 after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop. Police arrested the perpetrator.
Al Shabaab attacked government soldiers based at the former perfume factory in SOS neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 04/10. One soldier and a civilian were wounded in the clash.

Unidentified attackers shot and injured an Imam sitting in front of a mosque in Macruuf area, Bulo-Hubey neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the evening of 04/10. Reports indicate that the assailants fired four bullets but the victim managed to run into the mosque with injuries. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US Naval forces carried out a pre-dawn (around 3am) strike against a two storey house in Baraawe, suspected home to Ahmed Godane, who is connected to the 1998 bombings. It is not clear if the raid was successful, nor is it clear if there were any causalities. A top al Shabaab lieutenant claimed there was one al Shabaab fatality and ""several"" US injuries. Other witnesses claim at one US sailor death. Officially, the Pentagon has declined comment. Following the assault al Shabaab released a statement claiming Godane is alive and healthy. The Shabelle Media Network claims two al Shabaab deaths.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy in Bariire Village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 05/10. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked ENDF/Somali forces in Qansax Dhere in the night of 05/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for an hour after which the attackers withdrew. No causalities were reported.
Unidentified persons attack a private residence with a hand grenade. The reason for the attack is presumed to be related to be an vengeance.

Al Shabaab fighters opened fired at taxi in Dhanqoob area between Baidoa and Goof-Gaduud Village (Baidoa District) in the afternoon of 05/10. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters thought the car was carrying a traditional elder who had escaped an assassination attempt near Goof-Gaduud earlier. However, the elder was not in the car by the time of the attack. One passenger was killed and four others injured.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a traditional elder visiting his family in Goof-Gaduud Village (Baidoa District) in the morning of 05/10. The elder reportedly ran to the bush where he contacted relatives in Baidoa and requested a taxi with security guards. The al Shabaab fighters got the information and waited for the taxi but he escaped by using another route. The al Shabaab fighters looted the victims house after learning that he had escaped.

A group of people staged a demonstration in front of Burao water agency in Burao on 05/10.The demonstrators, who comprised of women and children, were protesting against acute water shortage that hit the town. They called on the government to sack the manager of the water agency.

A Somali soldier opened fire at a food distribution site in Rajo IDP camp (Wadajir District) in the afternoon of 05/10. Reports indicate that the soldier was trying to disperse a crowd. A man was killed and a woman injured in the shooting. Other soldiers

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade into a residence of a local man hailing from Badhiban clan in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 05/10. A boy was killed and five other civilians were reportedly injured in the explosion.

A pro-al Shabaab new source reported that al Shabaab fighters executed an ENDF under cover soldier in Jilib on 05/10 after an al Shabaab court sentenced him to death. Reports indicate that the victim confessed that he was spying for the Ethiopian government and was a member of Liyuu Police.
Residents of Kismayo protest the killing of a mini-bus driver by a Jubaland soldier. Following the protest authorities arrested the perpetrator.

A civilian truck transporting building materials hit a land mine in an area close to Haji Jamac Mosque in Fanoole neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/10. Reports indicate that three people were injured in the explosion. There are no details on whether the truck was the actual target or not.

Arrests: Al Shabaab fighters arrested a number of people in Middle and Lower Juba regions on 06/10 following the US Navy Seal raid in Baraawe on 05/10. The detained people include staffs of INGOs and LNGOs. Local elders efforts to intervene ended in vain.

Two anti-al Shabaab soldiers (affiliation not named) exchanged gunfire following dispute believed to be related to extortion money at road-block in Bulo Barwaqo Village near Dhoobley in the morning of 06/10. One soldier died while the other sustained injuries.
Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters killed one of their members in Dhiil Village (33km SW of Xudur) in the afternoon of 06/10. The reason behind the murder is currently unknown.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A group of Puntland Darawish forces set up an illegal road-block in the outskirts of Galkacyo north in the afternoon of 06/10 in protest over unpaid salaries. The soldiers reportedly extorted money from public transport using the road and reportedly shot and injured a truck driver who refused to pay the extortion money.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed his colleague at Argo Junction in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 06/10. The motive of the killing is not clear. The security forces managed to arrest the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at a residential house in Farjano neighbourhood in the evening of 06/10. Reports indicate that the house is frequented by Jubaland forces. This is the second time in a week that the house was targeted with hand grenades. A woman was injured in the blast. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a minibus conductor following an escalated dispute over fare in central Kismaayo in the morning of 06/10. The soldier escaped but was later arrested following a protest from the elders of the victim.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a soldiers position between Abdi Wayeel Cinema and Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 06/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Reports indicate that the device missed its target. No casualties were reported.
A soldier shot and killed a civilian man over a private dispute in Macmacanka neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 06/10. The perpetrator was arrested.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Dharkeynley Police Station (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 06/10. The device landed in an open area, casing no casualties. The attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldier in Shalaambood Village (Marka) in the evening of 07/10. The soldier died on the spot. The perpetrators escaped. Somali soldiers arrived at the scene and launched a security operation but made no arrest.

A RCIED targeted anti-al Shabaab soldiers seated in a teashop in Bulo-Xawo in the evening of 07/10. The device was planted in the tea-shop which is frequented by the soldiers. The local police commander and a soldier were killed in the attack while three others, including civilian, were wounded. The perpetrators escaped.

A IED targeted a Somali military vehicle in Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the afternoon of 07/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported in the explosion as well as the shooting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces based in 21st October neighbourhood (Afgooye) in night of 07/10. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Causalities not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali/AMISOM forces clash with al Shabaab in and around Yaaq Biri Weyne Village. Causalities could not established. Security forces conducted a joint security operation following the attack, but made no arrests.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A group of Puntland Darawish forces maintain an illegal road-block in the outskirts of Galkacyo north in the afternoon of 07/10 in protest over unpaid salaries. The group had shot and killed a man the previous day in a toll dispute.

Hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somali Government in Afisiyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the morning of 07/10. The demonstration was triggered by a letter written by the government ordering the IDPs to move from state land in Afisiyoni neighbourhood. The IDPs again staged another demonstration in the morning of 08/10.

Somali soldiers based at the presidential palace (Wardhiigley District) blocked guests from entering the palace in the morning of 07/10 in protest over four month unpaid salary. Reports indicate that the soldiers fired their weapons, though no one reported injury.

Unidentified armed militias attacked soldiers in Aw Dheegle Village 37km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 08/10. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two soldiers were killed and three injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM forces based in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the night of 08/10. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM position in Janaale Village (12km NW of Marka) in the night of 08/10. The clash lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attacker threw a hand grenade at District Commissioners residential house in Beytu Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 08/10. One soldier on guard was injured in the blast. Other soldiers in the area conducted a security operation and arrested several persons they suspected of being behind the attack. Reports indicate that the soldiers confiscated some properties from the houses they searched. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the third consecutive day.
A group of youngsters stabbed and seriously injured a girl for unknown reason at liberty garden in Hargeisa in the evening 08/10. The perpetrators escaped.

Hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration against the SNG in Afisiyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the morning of 07/10. The demonstration was triggered by a letter written by the SNG ordering the IDPs to move from state land in Afisiyoni neighbourhood. The IDPs again staged another demonstration in the morning of 08/10.

Three people were killed and three others injured in an explosion that targeted a small coffee shop near the central police station in Beled Hawo. Among the dead include two police officers and a civilian, others wounded. Other sources claim all victims were members of security forces.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan carjacked a truck in Sanjilbo Village (8Km N of Qardho) in the evening of 08/10. The vehicle belongs to Majeerten/ Omar Mohamud and had left Bosasso, and was heading to Galkacyo when the incident happened. It is not clear if the crime was clan related. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM (Djiboutian contingent) on patrol in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the night of 08/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Two civilian bystanders were injured in the blast and the subsequent shooting. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Somali government forces clash with al Shabaab in a region between Qansax Oomane and Berdaale. Six deaths, plus injuries reported.

Two sub clans of Habar Jeclo clan (Bare Cabdulle and Ahmed Farah) clashed in the vicinity of Qararro Village (27km W of Caynabo) in the afternoon of 09/10 following an escalated dispute over water. One militiaman from Barre Abdulla was killed and a police bystander was injured in the clash. Reports indicate that tension is high in the area as both sides mobilize their militias for more clashes.

Two groups of Somali government soldiers clash in the outskirts of Marka in the afternoon of 09/10 following an escalated dispute of khat. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes and later stopped without any intervention. No casualties were reported.

Nine pro-Somali government forces (not identified) attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Adeegow Village (41km NW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 09/10. Reports indicate that three pro-Somali soldiers and 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. One pro-Somali soldier went missing.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces positioned in Carbiska settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 09/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Anti-al Shabaab forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters in Qansax Oomane Village (Luuq District) in the morning of 09/10. Unconfirmed reports indicate that ENDF took part in the offensive. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man hailing from Dir clan while entering his house in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 09/10. The motive of the attack is unknown but unconfirmed report say that the al Shabaab operatives were behind it. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attacker threw a hand grenade at District Commissioners residential house in Beytu Raas neighbourhood (Marka) for the second time in two days. It is not clear if this was the same group of attackers from the previous day.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters stopped a vehicle carrying Khat to Berdale village (Bay District) at Kureedka area (12kms SE of Luuq) in the afternoon of 09/10 and killed the driver, beheading him. They also burned the khat and the vehicle, and released the passengers. The body of the driver was taken to Luuq town. Report indicates that the al Shabaab fighters had several times warned the victim to stop transporting Khat to Berdale Village. The victim was from Marehan clan.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man from his house in Marerey Village (12km SW of Jilib) in the morning of 09/10. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters physically assaulted the wife of the man during the incident. The motive is unknown.

Traders believed to be Dhulbahante attacked two traders hailing from Rahaweyn clan using clubs in Laas Caanood on 09/10. The victims suffered injuries. The incident was reportedly related to business competition in the town. The locals accuse Rahaweyn traders of selling goods at cheap prices. It remains unclear whether the perpetrators were arrested or not.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the fourth consecutive day.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of a military officer in Jiiro Wacbudhan area (Kaaraan District) in the evening of 09/10. His security guards opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at security forces at the Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 09/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. A passerby woman was reportedly wounded in the explosion. The perpetrator managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a civilian man in the medicine section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 09/10. The motive is unknown. The victim was a drug store owner. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab forces clash with Somali and Ethiopian forces in Ceeldhuun village, 40km from Baidoa on the afternoon of 10/10. At least eight soldiers are reported killed in the fighting. Following the fighters, the wounded members of al Shabaab fled to Baidoa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted a AMISOM/KDF APC in Balacaad neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the morning of 10/10. No casualties were reported but the APC was damaged. Jubaland forces arrested a woman they suspected of being behind the attack. Unconfirmed reports indicate the perpetrators were waiting in a minibus, close to the scene and detonated the device after the APC slowed at the scene. The minibus then drove away.

Two militia groups clashed near Fiat building in Kismaayo in the afternoon 10/10 following a dispute over a government building in the area. The building was first occupied by Majeerten militia but was later given to Ogaden militia. One Majeerten militia man was killed and two others injured in the clash. The incident caused tension in the town. Unconfirmed reports indicate that relatives of the Majeerten militiaman are planning to attack a popular hotel to revenge against the Ogaden. Jubaland police were deployed to guard several hotels in Kismaayo following the rumour.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Beytu Raas neighbourhood in the evening of 10/10. The deceased was a porter and reportedly used to talk about the insecurity incidents in public places. The perpetrators escaped.

Militiamen hailing from the Majeerten/Nuux Jibrahil sub-clan carjacked a truck belonging to Habar Gidir/Ayr in Xarfo in the morning of 10/10. The attackers opened fired at the truck wounding the driver who himself hails from Ayr during the incident. The motive is unknown.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the fifth consecutive day.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces manning Garowe airport attempted to block access to the airport in the morning of 10/10 in protest over unpaid salaries.

A hand grenade was hurled at Sarindi centre (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 10/10. Sarindi is a centre run by the Somali government to rehabilitate al Shabaab defectors. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades at Xamar Weyne Police Station (Xamar Weyne/Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 10/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at General Kahiye Police Station in Xamar Jab Jab District in the evening of 10/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed men dressed in Somali government military uniforms opened fire at workers working at a construction site in the livestock market (Heliwa District) after the workers refused to pay extortion money to the armed men. Two workers were injured. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades at Somali forces at Dabka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 10/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces at Saydinka Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 10/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Several explosion are reported at Dabka junction and Taalada Sayidka in Hamar Jabjab. No report of causality.
A IED planted in a Restaurant frequented by Somali government forces in Wanla Weyne detonated in the evening of 11/10. Two soldiers and two civilians were injured in the blast.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali soldiers on foot patrol in Buulo-Ceelay neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 11/10. Reports indicate that the device missed it is target and landed in an empty place. The soldiers reacted by opening fire. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Lidow Jallaad near Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km NW of Wanla Weyne) in the evening of 11/10. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No causalities were reported.
A man from Habar/Awal/Sacad Muse sub-clan shot and killed his fellow clansman following an escalated dispute of a plot of land in Baliga Cas (Hargeisa District) on 11/10.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Baar-Ismail neighbourhood (Afgooye District) following an escalated dispute over extortion money in the morning of 11/10. Report suggests that one soldier was killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters loyal to Mukhtar Roobow captured two men in Abal Village (16km S of Xudur) in the evening of 11/10 after suspecting them of being loyal to Godane (al Shabaab leader) and were on a mission to assassinate Roobow. Reports indicate that the two hail from Roobows clan.

Armed men believed to be part of the anti-al Shabaab forces attacked and injured a local administration official and his body guards in Bulo-Xawo in the midday of 11/10. The motive is unknown. The victims were taken to Mandera Hospital (Kenya) for treatment.

A pro-government clan militia hailing from Biyo Maal manning K50 checkpoint (Afgooye District) clashed with police in the night of 12/10. The reason behind the clash is unclear. The police were returning from Janaale where they had arrested a suspected criminal. The suspect was killed during the shoot-out between the two sides. Three police officers were also injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters loyal to Godane clashed with the loyalist of Abu-Zakaria in Godan Dhowe (40km S of Bulo-Xawo) in the evening of 12/10. Reports indicate that the pro-Godane militia attacked the village in order to capture Abu Zakaria, who reportedly crossed the border to Kenya the past few days. Abu Zakaria is believed to be a close ally of Sheikh Aweys and disappeared shortly after Aweys surrendered to authorities in Himan and Heeb. Unconfirmed reports indicate that he had facilitated the escape of Aweys from Baraawe by boat.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/anti-al Shahaab forces (not named) based in the outskirts of Afmadow in the night of 12/10. A civilian was hit and injured by a stray bullet.

A pro-government clan militiaman opened fire at Marka General Hospital in the morning of 12/10. The incident happened at a time beds donated by the Somali government were being offloaded from a lorry. The motive remains unclear but reports indicate that militiaman hails from Biyo Maal clan and is a close relative of Marka District Commissioner. No casualties were reported.

The Somali police exchanged gunfire with a gunman dressed in military uniform who had set up an illegal checkpoint and extorting money from motorists in Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 12/10. Police attacked the gunman after motorists tipped them about his activities in the area. A female bystander was killed and three other people including the gunman were injured in the shoot-out. Police also arrested the suspect and took him to the CID headquarters.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed three civilian men sitting in a tea shop in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 12/10. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM positions in Baadhaade, causing ""heavy battle."" Two killed, others wounded.
Two groups of Somali government forces clash outside Mogadishu over the assessment of taxes obtained from illegal tolls. Three soldiers dead, eight others wounded.
A trader operating at Bakaaraha market is shot and killed along with three others. The reason for the attack is not known.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and wounded a civilian man hailing from Majeerten/ Siwaaqron sub-clan in the evening of 13/10. The victim was sitting in a tea shop near his home when he got shot. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab militants attack Arbacow vicinity, 20km southwest of Mogadishu causing an exchange of gunfire that lasted for over an hour. Seven reported deaths.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: Militiamen hailing from Majeerten/Ali Saleebaan/ Bicidyahan sub-clan and Puntland Marine Police Forces clashed in Qandala on 13/10. The PMPF forces were deployed in Qandala to arrest Ali Saleebaan militias involved in a recent armed clash on 09/10. One PMPF soldier was injured in the clash. Two small boats belonging to the PMPF were also destroyed. The PMPF later returned to Bosasso.

Two groups of Somali soldiers clashed at Siinka-Dheer area (Dayniile District) in the morning of 13/10. The fighting broke out after about five soldiers hailing from Abgal entered Al-Birri Hospital in the village and started robbing patients, staff and visitors of mobile phones and other valuables. A patient alerted Habar Gidir Somali forces who rushed to the hospital and engaged with the group in a fighting that lasted for about 30 minutes after which the Abgal soldiers withdrew. Two combatants were killed and five others injured. No civilian casualty was reported.

Two groups of Somali soldiers clashed at Siinka-Dheer area (Dayniile District) in the morning of 13/10. The fighting broke out after about five soldiers hailing from Abgal entered Al-Birri Hospital in the village and started robbing patients, staff and visitors of mobile phones and other valuables. A patient alerted Habar Gidir Somali forces who rushed to the hospital and engaged with the group in a fighting that lasted for about 30 minutes after which the Abgal soldiers withdrew. Two combatants were killed and five others injured. No civilian casualty was reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a group of Somali soldiers who set up an illegal road-block in Cumar-Beerre Village (7km NW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 14/10. The al Shabaab fighters captured two soldiers and beheaded one on the spot. They took away the other soldier and later killed him, and displayed his body to the residents of Totoorow Village (50km NW of Afgooye).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland security forces reportedly entered Galgala Village in Bosasso District on 14/10 without any resistance from Galgala/al Shabaab fighters, who vacated the village before the arrival of the troops.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Somali forces based in Guul Wadayaasha neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 14/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based in the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/10. The soldiers responded by opening fire. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali troops backed by the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) clashed with al-Shabaab near Elasha Biyaha in Lower Shabelle after the militants attacked government bases. No reported injuries or deaths.

Gunmen from Lelkase clan carjacked a car belonging to Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Cagaaran area (30km N of Galkacyo) in the morning of 16/10. The motive of the carjacking is unknown. Elders from Lelkase stepped in to persuade the gunmen to release the vehicle.

A large demonstration against the arrest by the Belgian government of former pirate leader Mohamed Abdi Hasan [aka] Afweyne and former Himan and Heb president Mohamed Abdullahi Adan Tiey has taken place in Cadaado. Protesters at the demonstration demanded that the Belgian government release the two men.

Somali government forces opened gunfire indiscriminately on a group of civilians at a food distribution centre in Mogadishu. Initial reports confirmed that at least 1 person was confirmed dead and two other seriously injured during the incident. It was later reported the soldiers looted the distribution centre following the shootings.

Pro-Somali soldiers (not identified) launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters based in Qaydar Cade (27km NW of Xudur) in the afternoon of 15/10. The clash lasted for about 25 minutes after which pro-Somali forces took over the control of the village. Three al Shabaab fighters and one pro-Somali soldier were injured in the clash. Reports indicate that the pro-Somali forces executed the injured al Shabaab fighters. They then headed to Ceel Barde.

Two groups of Somali forces exchanged fire in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Wayne) in the afternoon of 15/10. The clash followed a dispute over money extorted from public transport. Other security forces intervened and separated the warring sides. One combatant was injured in the clash.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the privately-owned Radio Daljir in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 15/10. The motive is unknown. The stations security guards opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in the vegetable market of Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the evening of 15/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a civilian man after a quarrel over the distribution of killed goats during the Idd festival to IDPs in Kismaayo on 15/10.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a soldier in Ali Turaaye neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 15/10. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified assailants threw two grenades at the Galkayo offices of Radio Daljir, causing property damage but no injury.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack Siinka Dheer and Ceelasha Biyaha positions outside Mogadishu. Amisom troops are believed to have suffered heavy casualties in the attack. Sabaax is pro-al Shabaab.
A lone gunman shot and killed three people and injured eight others at a wedding party in the Ceel Xadi area of northern Somalias breakaway Somaliland region. The motive for the attack is not clear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab/AMISOM forces based in Kulbiyow (33km SW of Badhadhe) in the evening of 16/10. The fighting lasted for 30 minutes after the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Majority of the local residents fled the village during the clash. Reports indicate that the fighting caused tension in the village.
A man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad shot and killed another from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in the eastern outskirts of Galkacyo in the evening of 16/10 following an escalated dispute over piracy issues.

Al Shabaab authority burnt two mini-buses transporting khat in a public ground in Ceel-Baraf (35km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 16/10. These buses were ferrying khat from Jowhar to Jalalaqsi (Hiraan) when they were seized by the al Shabaab fighters. The drivers were detained. The locals in the village and the surrounding areas attended the event.

An identified man stabbed and killed a woman hailing from Madhiban clan in Gacan Libah District (Hargeisa) in the night of 16/10. The woman walked out of her house when a man rushed towards her. She tried to run back to the house but the perpetrator caught up with her and stabbed her twice. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator escaped.

A dead body of a Somali soldier was found in Siinka-Dheer area (Dayniile District) in the evening of 16/10. Reports indicate that the victim left the base with his colleague who was not seen since then. It is unclear whether the dead soldier was killed by his colleague or not.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Hodan District Commissioners Office (Hodan District) in the evening of 16/10. The device reportedly landed in an empty place causing no casualty. Security forces arrived conducted a security operation in the area but made no arrest. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified perpetrators hurled a hand grenade at a private residence of a Somali forces officer near the former military hospital in Trebunka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 16/10. The device hit a perimeter wall nearby causing no casualties. Soldiers opened fire after the blast. The attackers managed to escape.

SNA and police clashed in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 16/10. The reason behind the clash is unknown. One SNA and a police officer were reportedly killed in the clash. An unspecific number of combatants were injured in the clash.

Militiamen from Dashishe sub clan carjacked a car belonging to Majeerten/Issa Mohamud Xiddo (50km N of Qardho) in the afternoon of 17/10. The vehicle had left Garowe and was heading to Bosasso when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a municipal council tax collector in Sheikh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 17/10. One soldier was injured by the blast and later succumbed to his injuries as he was being rushed to Mogadishu. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali position in Iidow Jallaad near Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the evening of 18/10. The fighting lasted for about 10 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Two militias hailing from Shiidle sub clan clashed in Daymasame Village (7km SE of Jowhar) following an escalated dispute over farms ownership in the morning of 18/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. The fighting stopped voluntarily. No casualties were reported.

Militias from Shiidle and Abgal/Mohamed Muse sub clans clashed in Buulo-Banaan Village (10km E of Jowhar) in the evening of 18/10. The fighting broke out after Mohamed Muse militias attacked Shiidle militiamen for confiscating their cattle after claiming the cows had eaten their farm crops. A militia man from Shiidle clan was killed in the clash while three others were injured. Middle Shabelle regional administration stepped in to mediate between the two sub-clans.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against pro-Somali military convoy in Jiiro-Bass Village (38km W of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Berdale in the morning of 18/10. No casualties were reported. Reports indicate that one vehicle in the convoy was damaged in the attack.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the evening of 18/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. Reports indicate that the victim used to sell khat to government soldiers. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the deputy District Commissioner of Fanoole neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 18/10. One woman believed to be his wife and two children were injured in the blast. The perpetrator escaped.

Unidentified armed men shot and injured a security guard working for an INGO in Galkacyo South in the evening of 18/10. The motive is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that the incident was inter-clan revenge attack.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government forces in Siinka Dheer (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 18/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Reports indicate that one soldier was killed and two others were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A RCIED targeted government soldiers sitting in a teashop in Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 19/10. The RCIED was reportedly planted in the teashop which is frequented by soldiers. One soldier was reportedly killed while three others were injured. The attackers escape

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: At 12:00 on 19/10 a suicide bomber on foot (PBIED) attacked a tea-shop in the centre of Beled Weyne town in front of the Hiraan regional administration office. The attack was followed by heavy gunfire. The shop is heavily frequented by AMISOM/Djiboutian and Ethiopian troops and is believed to be the target of the blast. Initial and UNCONFIRMED information received from local medical sources indicate that up to 50 persons may have been killed. Later this number was reduced to 30. 85 others are reported to have been referred to the Beled Weyne regional hospital for treatment of various injuries.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based at Xero Agoon in Baar Ismail neighbourhood in the night of 19/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of Somali government forces hailing from Rahanweyn and Hawiye clashed in Janaale Village (12km NW of Marka) in the morning of 19/10. Reports indicate that clash started after the District Commissioner of Marka sent militias from his clan to join the Somali forces in Buufow Bacaad. The two groups disagree on whether the clan militias will join the forces or not, which led to a shoot-out. Two combatants were injured in the clash.

Tensions ran high in Dhoobley town after an anti-al Shabaab soldier hailing from Mohamed Zubeyr/Reer Isaq-Ali sub-clan who earlier killed another anti-AS soldier (Mohamed Zubeyr/Reer/Isaq-Harun sab-clan was killed on 19/10. Reports indicate that the two sub-clans were supposed to negotiate on blood compensation but the murderer was killed over night and his body dumped on the roadside, contrary to the agreement on public execution.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
column17: A Somali soldier shot and killed an army officer in Buurane Village under Jowhar District in the evening of 19/10. The motive is unknown. The assailant was initially arrested but he later escaped reportedly with the help of some army officers. His escape

A number of people, mostly youths, staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Ministry National Planning office in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 19/10. The demonstrators were reportedly complaining that the ministry used nepotism in the recruitment of enumerators. Sanaag regional governor and the mayor of Ceerigaabo intervened and postponed the recruitment exercise.

Two unidentified men armed with AK-47 rifles riding in a Toyota Surf shot and injured a businessman in Laas Caanood on 19/10. The motive is unknown. The victim hails from Dhulbahante clan. Reports indicate that the perpetrators are believed to be Dhulbahante. The attackers escaped towards the direction of Taleex.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Marka District Commissioner in Beytu Raas neighbourhood in the evening of 19/10. The DCs guards opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed the former chairman of Absame IDP camp in Bosasso in the evening of 19/10. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries shot and killed a local villager in Bali Cabane Village (Hargeisa District) in the evening of 19/10. The motive is currently unknown. Reports indicate that the police came to the village and arrested the man and took him to the Ethiopian side of the border. They reportedly asked his some questions but he refused to answer. They reportedly shot him after he tried to escape. Further reports indicate that the perpetrators also took the body to Harshin town in Ethiopia.
Unidentified assailants shot and kill a civilian in Hodan district.

Unidentified perpetrators armed with pistols shot and killed three men dressed in military uniform in Tawakal neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 19/10. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victims were involved in an armed robbery at the time of the attack. The attackers escaped.

Two militia groups hailing from Begedi and Abgal clans clashed along Liberia road (Waberi District) in the evening of 19/10. Reports indicate the fighting broke out after the Begedi militiamen shot and killed an Abgal businessman, whom one of the Begedi militiamen, suspected him of having an affair with his wife, who is also an Abgal. One combatant was killed and another injured.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a government soldier in Fagax Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 19/10. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on foot patrol in Jamhuuriya neighbourhood (Karaan District) in night of 19/10. The soldiers responded by opening fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers threw three hand grenades at a house near the former milk factory (Hodan District) in the evening of 19/10. Reports indicate that the targeted house was serves as a store for Turkish construction workers. Security guards at the store reportedly opened fire at the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified assailants shot and kill a police officer in Yaaqshid district.
A government soldier is shot and killed by two unidentified armed men.
Somali government soldiers and orphans of deceased service members stage a protest in Mogadishu over not being paid their stipend from the government.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Wanla Weyne on 20/10 in protest against increased in the number of illegal checkpoints in the district on 20/10. Somali government soldiers opened fire to disperse the demonstrators. A civilian was injured in the shooting.

A gunman dressed in military uniform shot and killed a civilian man in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 20/10. Reports indicate that the victim was shot after he refused to pay extortion money demanded by the gunman. The perpetrator escaped.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Afarta Jardiino neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 20/10 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. Two civilians were reportedly injured by stray bullets. The clash lasted for about 10 minutes.

Majeerten/Reer Bicidyahan militiaman shot and killed his fellow clansman following an escalated dispute at an illegal check point in Cagaaran (30km N of Galkacyo) in the morning of 21/10. The perpetrator escaped.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration Cadaado on 21/10 in protest against the arrest of the former president of Himan and Heeb by Belgium police. The protestors asked the SNG to intervene and secure his release. This is the second demonstration held in Cadaado following the arrest of the former regional leader.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceel Saliindi Village (K60 area) in Marka District in the night of 21/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Arbacow settlement (Afgooye District) in the evening of 21/10. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces based in Lidow Jallad near Yaaq Bari Wayne Village (22km W of Wanla Wayne) in the evening of 21/10. Both sides used light and heavy weapons during the clash. Casualties could not be established.

Armed men believed to be Majeerten/Ali Saleeban opened fire at weapon store in Bosasso and stole an AK-47 rifle in the night of 21/10. The store belongs to Majeerten/Osman Mohamud. No casualties were reported.

An unidentified man armed with a pistol shot at a MP from Justice and Welfare Party(UCID) in Jigjiga Yar neighbourhood (Hargeisa) in the evening of 21/10. The attacker, however, missed his target and fled. The motive is unclear. Reports indicate that the MP is strongly opposed to President Silanyos administration and recently urged the president to go for a medical checkup to ascertain his health status on whether he can run the country. On 22/10, Justice and Welfare Party (UCID) strongly condemned the incident and urged the police to bring the person (s) behind the attack to justice.
ENDF opened fire at a group of herders in the outskirts of Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 21/10.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Miir police station in Horumar neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 21/10. Police opened fire after the blast. A woman was killed in the shooting while a police officer was injured in the blast. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government police on foot patrol near Biyo Mallow Mosque (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 21/10. The police opened fire after the blast. A police officer and a woman bystander were injured in the blast. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unknown gun men attacked and injured television reporter in Medina District. The man died of his injuries several days later.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A hit-and-run attack targets a AMISOM/Somali position on the east side of the city. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against anti-al Shabaab/KDF-AMISOM forces in Bilis Qooqaani (48km NW of Afmadow) in the evening of 22/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and run-attack against Somali soldiers based at Jowhar airstrip in the evening of 22/10. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Two Jubaland soldiers exchanged fire following an escalated private dispute near the port of Kismaayo in the evening of 22/10. One of the soldiers was killed in the shoot-out. The deceased hails from Majeerten and while the perpetrator is from Ogaden clan. It remains unclear whether the perpetrator was arrested or not.
""An INGO security guard was shot and injured by an unknown armed man. The attack may have been connected to an inter-clan dispute.""

Somali government forces and al Shabaab clash in Ceel Barde during the early morning hours. The two sides used a variety of weapons against each other in the battle that lasted an hour. Five combatants were killed and many more were wounded on both sides in the fighting.
Government forces took control of numerous localities within Badhaade District after a 48 hour military operation. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and -run attack against Somali forces based in the eastern side of Beled Weyne in the night of 23/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No causalities were reported.

Pastoralists from Dhulbahante and Habar Jeclo clashed in Qocondhaale area near Maygaagle (27km N of Buuhoodle) on 23/10 after Habar Jeclo accused Dhulbahante nomads of stealing their cattle. One Habar Jeclo herder was injured in the clash. Somaliland forces based in Qorilugud intervened and separated the two groups.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali soldiers based at the bridge that divides Buulo-Sheekh and Horseed neighbourhoods in Jowhar in the evening of 22/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters and Somali forces clashed in Damballi Village in Baidoa District in the evening of 23/10. The fighting broke out after government forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in the village. Reports indicate that the government forces were pushed back. The bodies of four government soldiers were reportedly discovered in the village, but the Somali forces claimed the bodies were of al Shabaab fighters. Tension was high in the area after the government sent reinforcement to Aawdiinle to drive out al Shabaab fighters who set up checkpoints and blocking commercial trucks from entering Qansax Dhere.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers based at Baar-Ismail checkpoint (Afgooye) in the evening of 23/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Two soldiers were injured by the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Pro-government forces (not identified) based in Ceel Barde conducted a security operation in Ceel Garas Village (37km NE of Xudur) in the evening of 23/10. The soldiers reportedly killed one al Shabaab fighters during the operation and took his gun.
Al Shabaab begins a blockade on Qansadheer. Somali government forces attempt to open at least of the established roadblocks, but are not successful. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian man in Moro Gabey Village (28km NW of Xudur) in the evening of 23/10. The victim is a father of a pro-government soldier in Ceel Barde. The motive of is unclear but it is believed to be related to kinship.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces accompanying the visiting Puntland vice-president, Gen. Abdisamad Ali Shire, exchanged gunfire with Khatumo militias in Taleex on 23/10. The brief clash caused the delay in the start of the Khatumo conference. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the Puntland vice-president is on a mission to disrupt the Khatumo conference.

More than a hundred people, mostly youths and women, staged a peaceful demonstration in Xabado stadium area in Buuhoodle in the morning of 23/10. The demonstrators expressed their support to the ongoing meeting of Khatumo 3 conference in Taleex.
Government and ENDF forces clash with al Shabaab after allied forces attempted to remove a al Shabaab roadblock situated between Ufurow and Awdiinle. Causalities not known.
Unidentified attackers throw a pair of hand grenades at a police checkpoint, four killed, fourteen injured. The target may have been a tax collector.

Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Goofguduud Shabeelow (27km SW of Baidoa), outside of Baydhabo. The fighting occurred during the early morning hours, causing al Shabaab to gain control of the village. Causalities not known.

A group of youths stoned the Ministry National Planning office in Ceerigaabo on 24/10 after they found their names missing in the list of enumerators recruited by the Ministry. Police shot in the air to disperse them and arrested seven of them. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified) clashed in Luuq in the evening of 24/10 after one of the groups tried to set up an illegal checkpoint to extort money from motorists. One soldier was injured in the shoot-out.

A government soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Kulmis neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 24/10, after the victim reportedly resisted arrest. Reports indicate that the deceased was not mentally ill. Police arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at Jubaland forces based at the former meat factory in Gulwade neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 24/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. The soldiers also cordoned off the area for about one and half an hour and conducted a security a security operation. It remains unclear whether they made arrests or not.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Xeraryale neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the night of 24/10. Reports indicate that the victim had a close link with SNA. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM military convoy in an area between Maslah Camp and the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the evening of 24/10. The two sides exchanged gun fire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 24/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Government troops attack Al-Shabab base in Fool Feyle outside of Baidoa. The exact number of casualties caused by the fighting is not yet unknown, although dead and wounded government soldiers were evacuated to Baydhabo. There has been no word from the warring sides regarding the fighting.
Heavy fighting reported following an al Shabaab ambush along a road connecting Afgooye and Walaweyn in Lower Shabelle region. Causalities not provided.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali and AMISOM forces clash with al Shabaab in Ceelasha Biyaha. Causalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM troops on foot patrol in Janaale Village in the night of 25/10. The AMISOM troops in Janaale started to patrol areas around their base in the village after several hit-and-run attacks by al Shabaab fighters. Both sides suffered casualties but the exact figures are unclear. Al Shabaab fighters brought some of their injured colleagues to Qoryooley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Arbacow settlement (13km E of Afgooye) in the night of 24/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked government forces based in Mukuyga area on the road between Afgooye and Wanla Weyne in the evening of 25/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be est

A government soldier shot and killed a young man in Mahadaay Village (Jowhar District) in the afternoon of 25/10. The motive of the killing remains unknown but it is believed to have followed an escalated dispute over khat. The perpetrator was arrested by security forces.

A man shot and killed another man in Magaley Village in Burtinle District on 25/10. Reports indicate that incident was a clan revenge killing. The perpetrator hails from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud while the victim is from Dhulbahante.

A RCIED targeted Somali forces at Dahablaha section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 25/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Unknown numbers of civilians were reportedly injured in the shooting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A RCIED targeted Somali soldiers in a military pick-up on patrol in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 25/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Two soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified perpetrators threw a hand grenade at Somali forces based in Biyo-Deeganka area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 25/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa militia and Somali government soldiers clash. The SNG soldiers were apparently trying to secure a position in Ahmed Madobes administration through force. Two combatants were killed.

A RCIED exploded pre-maturely in Yasin Market, close to the former meat factory (Kismaayo) in the morning of 26/10. People going to the mosque for dawn prayer saw it and placed stones near the device to warn others. The device went off later and caused no casualties.

Two sub clans of Habar Jeclo (Ali Barre and Reer Bare sub clans) reportedly clashed in the vicinity of Bali Ciise near Habri Heshay Village (12km S of Caynabo) in the morning of 26/10 following dispute over water dams. Traditional elders, local authority and police intervened and managed to separate the two sides. No casualties were reported.
The body a civilian man was found in Yaaq Biri Weyne in the night of 26/10. The deceased was reportedly a former al Shabaab defector. The body had gunshot wounds.

Government forces opened fire at a mini-bus travelling from Mogadishu to Afgooye in Carbiska neighbourhood in the afternoon of 26/10. The incident happened after the driver refused to pay the high amount demanded by the soldiers. The deputy governor of Lower Shabelle Region declared to the local media that there are more than 50 illegal checkpoints currently on the main highway between Afgooye and Wanla Weyne districts.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Jubaland forces based along the airport road in Iskufilan neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 26/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy passing through the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 26/10. An AMISOM water bowser was badly damaged by the explosion. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.
An armed man shot and killed a notable businessman for unknown reason.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab kills five AMISOM-Sierra Leone soldiers in an attack on their base in Taabta. Conflicting reports hold the AMISOM force was of the Kenyan contingent. Further reports dispute the event even occurred.

A group of youths threw stones at Somaliland comedians entertaining the public during a fund raising event for Ceerigaabo-Burao road project at Liberty Garden in Ceerigaabo in the evening of 27/10.
