The comedians came from Hargeisa. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a local cleric, who perceived the concert as un-Islamic, was behind the incident. Police shot in the air to disperse the youth and arrested five of them. No casualties were reported.

Unconfirmed reports indicate that the head of Amniyat (al Shabaab intelligence), Mahad Karate, escaped an attempt on his life by al Shabaab fighters loyal to the al Shabaab leader Godane in Baraawe on 27/10.

The beheaded body of a young man was found near Mudul Baraawe Village (4km N of Baraawe) in the morning of 27/10. The motive and the identity of the perpetrators is unclear but reports indicate that the man was killed by al Shabaab elements after suspecting him of spying for the US Navy Seal who attacked the coastal town on 05/10.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a local judge in Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa in the evening of 27/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

An armed man hailing from Habar Gidir/Cabsiye sub clan shot and killed a businessman hailing from Habar Gidir/Yabardhowrakacay in Gadoon Village (40km E of Dhusamareeb) on 27/10. The murder is motivated by clan revenge. It remains unclear whether the perpetrator was arrested or not.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A US drone strike kills two al Shabaab commanders in the town of Jilib. One of those killed was al-Shabaabs top explosives expert, known as Anta.

A RCIED targeted Somalia forces convoy travelling along the road between Ceelasha Biyaha settlement and K13 (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 28/10. The device hit one of the vehicles. Casualty figures could not be established. Perpetrators managed to escape. The convoy was heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened.

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab fighters forcefully evicted a hundred families from Bulo Barako, Xabaal Barbaar and Rama Cadey villages under Baidoa District on 28/10. The motive is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate the eviction could be related to the increase in drone attacks against al Shabaab fighters.

Awramale militia and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Gal-Sheikh Abikar Village in Jilib District in the afternoon of 28/11. Reports indicate that the fighting broke after al Shabaab fighters demanded Awramale clan to hand over a man who killed a Shekhal man. Casualties could not be establish

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a military officer in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 28/10. The victim had left a tea-shop when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers based in Macmacanka neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 28/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

A RCIED targeted a two- vehicle convoy from a local private company, which was carrying a third party UN contractor and in Caymiska area (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 28/10. A civilian woman bystander was injured in the attack. The second vehicle was slightly damaged by the explosion. Reports indicate that a Somali military pick-up, which was ahead of the convoy, was the target of the RCIED.

NSA officers shot and killed a suspected al Shabaab operatives after he ignored instructions to surrender Arjantin neighbourhood (Kaaraan District) in the evening of 28/10. The officer also arrested his accomplice and found him in possession of a hand grenade.

Kenyan air forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab base of operations 30 miles east of Diinsoor in response to the recent attack on Nairobis Westgate mall. As many as 300 were stationed at the camp at the time of the time of the attack, though causality figures are not known. However, the military speculates ""dozens are dead, plus civilians.""

A vehicle carrying members of the security forces of the federal government was blown up in Arafat neighbourhood, Yaaqshiid District, Mogadishu. The vehicle, a pickup truck, was hit by a roadside bomb, killing most of the soldiers riding in it and wounding a few. No specific numbers provided.

A group of students from Tima-Cade University in Gabiley on 29/10 staged a demonstration in protest against the Minister of National Planning and a UN agency for not recruiting them as population census clerks. The protestors claimed that the clerks conducting the census were not from Gabiley but from Hargesia. Reports indicate that despite the protest, the census went on smoothly in the district. Police dispersed the demonstration. No security incident was reported.

A group of youths in Borama on 29/10 staged a demonstration in protest against the Minister of National Planning and a UN agency for not recruiting them as population census clerks. The protestors claimed that the clerks conducting the census were not from Borama but from Hargesia. The demonstration briefly disrupted the exercise. No security incident was reported.

A RCIED targeted a Somali government forces convoy in Siinka Dheer area (Afgooye District) in the evening of 29/10. The explosion missed its target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Pro-government forces on patrol clashed briefly with al Shabaab fighters in Gubadka village (48km SE of Rabdhuure) in the afternoon of 29/10. Reports indicate that two al Shabaab fighters were killed and another was wounded.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali government soldiers at Bali Doogle airport (Wanla Weyne District) in the afternoon of 29/10. The two sides exchanged light and heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of Somali soldiers clashed in Bulo-Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 29/10 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from motorist. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes. No casualties were reported. Other soldiers intervened and arrested one group.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/Sierra Leone supply convoy on the way from Dhoobley between Gheldezza and Tabta (53 KM E of Dhoobley) in the afternoon on 29/10. Casualties from both sides could not be ascertained.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of Jubaland forces left their base and reportedly created disturbance in Kismaayo in the night of 29/10. The group also engaged in a shoot-out with other Jubaland forces sent to pacify them. No casualties were reported. The renegade group carjacked a vehicle rented by an INGO as they fled but released it after two hours. On the morning of 30/10, another group left their bases and paralyzed business activities in the town. If is not clear if there were any civilian injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades at Jubaland forces in Gulwade area of Shaqaalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 29/10. A soldier was injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers based in Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 29/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. A civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape.

An RCIED targeted a Somali forces vehicle along General Daud road in Wardhiigley District in the afternoon of 29/10. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The vehicle was also damaged. The perpetrators escaped.

Four combatants have been killed after Al-Shabab and Ras Kambooni clashed near Kismaayo airport in southern Somalia. Reports say the fighting started after Al-Shabab attacked Ras Kambooni and a Kenyan army base positioned at the airport.
Two pastoralist groups (not identified) clashed in Madax-maroodi area in Wanla Weyne District in the afternoon of 30/10 over clan revenge dispute. Two combatants were killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a military outpost in Mahadaay Village (22km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 30/10. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two combatants were

A man from Dhulbahante-Ugaadhyahan sub clan stabbed and injured his fellow clansman in the vicinity of Sarmaanyo village (143km SE of Ceerigaabo) in the morning of 30/10. The incident was motivated by revenge killing dating back to 2012. Local militia arrested the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against NSA soldiers at Sarta Qaybyada (Yaaqshiid District)in the night of 30/10. Al Shabaab fighters fired a RPG round before the two sides engaged in a direct exchange of gunfire for 10 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Six are dead in a clash between Puntalnd forces and Galmudug militia in the town of Godod. The clash began after Puntland officials accused Somali Federal Government of arming the militia ""to destabilize Puntland.""

Kenyan military airplanes conducted several airstrikes against an al Shabaab training camp in Bush Madini area (Diinsoor District) on 31/10. Seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed and 11 others wounded. An technical equipped with an anti-aircraft gun was also reportedly destroyed. One of the al Shabaab KIA is said to be a foreign fighter from Yemen.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Bali-Doogle airport (Wanla-Weyne District) in the evening of 31/10/2013. The clash lasted for about 30 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Scuffles broke out between two groups of women and Youths hailing from Warsangeli/Reer-garaad and Warsangeli/Muhumud in Qudaha neighbourhood in Badhan on 31/10. The scuffle broke out following a fist fight between two children. One woman hailing from Warsangeli/Muhumud sub-clan was stabbed and killed, and a number of people were injured during the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Intelligence Agency
column17: Puntland presidential guards opened fire at a speeding car with tinted windows belonging to PIA (Puntland Intelligence Agency) in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Garowe on 31/10. The guards opened fire after suspecting the vehicles as hostile. One PIA officers in the car was injured.

Farmers hailing from Shiidle sub clan opened fire at pastoralists from Mohamed Muse sub clan of Abgaal in Jusleey Village (17km E of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 31/10.The attack is believed to be related to farmland dispute. Three women and a man were injured in the shooting.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a policeman who was busy collecting tax in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 31/10. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen armed with AK-47s shot and killed a NSA officer in Ceymiska neighbourhood in the evening of 31/10. The motive of the killing is unknown. The attackers escaped after taking the gun of the victim.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against police officers manning a checkpoint close to Afar Irdood police station in Xamar Weyne District in the night of 31/10. One policeman was reportedly wounded. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

An Unidentified attacker threw a hand grenade at government soldiers manning a security check-point in Biyo Degaanka area (Heliwa District) in the night of 31/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. One soldier was wounded. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an unarmed NSA officer in the livestock market in Heliwa District in the afternoon of 31/10. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A police officer shot and killed a civilian in Xamar Weyne market in the afternoon of 31/10. The perpetrator was chased by other members of the security forces. The chase degenerated in an exchange of fire during which five civilians were wounded. The reason for the killing is unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against police officers on foot patrol near KPP junction in Hodan district in the night of 31/10. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab backed media reports an attack against a Presidential house in Kismayo. A Somali apostate leader in the house at the time of attack. Causalities not known.

Unconfirmed reports indicate that six senior al Shabaab allied to Sheikh Mukhtar Roboow were arrested in Diinsoor in connection with the bombardment of the training facility in Bush Madini on 31/10. The arrested al Shabaab members include Sheik Abdulkadir Ali Mumin (Marehan), head of education for Baardheere. Similar arrests were also reported in Jilib, Baraawe, Buale and Bule Burte but details could not be confirmed.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Marehan militia and Ethiopia's Liyu Police paramilitaries clashed in Barkada Ina Odowa Village in Cabuud Waaq District on 01-02/11. The fighting was triggered by the arrest of members of Marehan clan by the Liyuu police. Seven militiamen were killed and five others were injured. Casualties from the Liyuu police side could not be established. The dead body of a person detained by the Liyuu police was later found in the bush on 03/11.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy and destroyed a water tanker in Ruusiya neighbourhood in Marka on 01/11/2013. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Two groups of clan militias from Mohamed Muse (Abgaal) and Shidle sub clans clashed in Jilyaale Village (15km E of Jowhar) in the morning of 01/11. The fighting erupted after the Mohamed Muse clan pastoralists launched a retaliation attack against the Shiidle farmers for an attack the day before. At least 10 people were confirmed dead. Tension is still high in the area and no mediation efforts are underway.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against the AMISOM base in Bilis Qooqaani (48km NW of Afmadow) in the evening of 01/11. Both sides exchanged sporadic gunfire which lasted for around one hour. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier on his way home in Beytu Raas neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 01/11. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against the residence of the Luuq District Commissioner on 01/11/2013. The grenade landed in the compound but did not explode. The motivation of the attackers is unknown.

Unidentified gunmen ambushed a campaign vehicle belonging to one of the presidential candidates in Puntland near Burtinle on 01/11. The gunmen opened fire at vehicle. Two passengers were reportedly injured in the attack. The gunmen carjacked the vehicle and also abducted the driver. The presidential candidate whose team was attacked, Abdiweli Mohamed Gass, a former SNG prime minister, condemned the attack. In a press statement issued on 02/11, Mr. Gass accused President Abdirahman Mohamed Farole of being behind the incident. He described the attack as Presidents Faroles ""scare tactic to create insecurity"" aimed to derail the election process. Puntland MPs will go to poll to elect a new president on 08/01/2014.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Saad militiamen armed with at least five battle wagons attacked Puntland Darawish forces based in Godod Village (28 E of Galkacyo) on 01/11. The motive of the attack is currently unclear. Reports indicate that five militiamen Saad militiamen were killed and a number of others, including a Puntland soldier were injured. Puntland forces also seized a battle wagon from the Saad militia. The fighting caused tension in Galkacyo. Reports indicate that Saad militias in Galkacyo are mobilizing themselves for another attack against Puntland forces. Puntland government accused the SNG of being behind the attack. Puntland intelligence claimed that SNG had recently delivered arms to Saad militia in Bandiiradley.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Marehan militia and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries clashed in Barkada Ina Odowa Village in Cabuud Waaq District on 01-02/11. The fighting was triggered by the arrest of members of Marehan clan by the Liyuu police. Seven militiamen were killed and five others were injured. Casualties from the Liyuu police side could not be established. The dead body of a person detained by the Liyuu police was later found in the bush on 03/11.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a mortar attack against Janaale village in Marka district in the evening of 02/11/2013. AMISOM/Somali government forces opened fire after the shelling. No casualties were reported.
The drivers were protesting against the failure by the water agency to repair water generators of bore holes where they used to draw water for sale, resulting in acute water shortage in Burao.

Somalias Criminal Investigation Department headquarters guards shoot dead a luxury vehicle driver after he refused to stop. The car was suspected to be planning suicide explosion attack against the headquarters.

Two groups of pro-Somali militiamen from the Marehan/Reer Hassan and Rahanweyn/Moalim Weyne sub-clans clashed in Luuq District on 02/11. A Marehan militiaman and a Rahanweyn civilian were reportedly killed. Tensions between the two groups erupted after the death of a Marehan/Reer Hassan militiamen who had been injured during an operation that was targeting Rahanweyn/Moalim Weyne militiamen who had abandoned their positions around Luuq due to the non-payment of their salaries. Reports further indicate that Ethiopian military commanders intervened and arrested an unknown number of militiamen from the two sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against AMISOM forces in Ruusiya neighbourhood in Marka District in the evening of 02/11/2013. The AMISOM soldiers were guarding a water tanker that had been destroyed by a RCIED on 01/11. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Somali forces shot and killed two suspected al Shabaab fighters in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 02/11 after the two refused to be searched by the soldiers. The security forces recovered two pistols and three hand grenades from the men after they were killed.
Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against government forces in Shalaambood in the night of 02/11. The clash lasted for 20 minutes. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab forces attack Somali forces at Ceel Jaale village, 7km NW of Marka along a road leading to Shalaamboot. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces base in Ceel-Jaale in the evening of 02/10/2013. The clash lasted for about 10 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

A man hailing from Majeerten/Ali Saleebaan carjacked a truck in Dhadar Village in Qandala Districtin what is believed to be a clan revenge for the carjacking of his parents vehicle some time ago. The vehicle also belongs to Majeerten/Ali Saleeban. Police recovered the vehicle in Kobdhexadh Village (78km S of Bosasso). The perpetrator managed to escape.

ASPU officer attached to a UN agency sub-office in Hargeisa reportedly physically assaulted the director general of the Ministry of Health, who was to take part in a coordination meeting. Reports indicate that it took the intervention of the chief of the UN agency and other colleagues to control the guard.

A family of five - father, mother and three children - were killed in Garsala village (9km E of Baidoa) by unknown gunmen in the night of 02/11. The bodies were discovered by neighbours in the early morning of the following day. It is rumoured that the killing is connected to a long-standing land dispute between the Hariin and Leysan sub-clans of Rahanweyn, which goes back up to Siyaad Barres time. The killed family was from the Leysan sub-clan.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a AMISOM/KDF and Jubaland forces convoy in Hariira village (15KM N of Kolbiyow) in the morning of 02/11. The ensuing clash lasted for around two hours as al Shabaab militiamen were pursuing the joint forces back to their base in Kulbiyow. Eleven deaths, unconfirmed.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier close to the ex-Pasta factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 02/11. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

NSA forces conducted a security operation targeting a specific house in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the evening of 02/11. Security forces exchanged fire with, and killed a gunman in the course of the operation. Five persons including a madrassa teacher were arrested.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali government soldiers, backed by African Union peacekeepers, have clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters on the outskirts of Kolbiyow. Fighting lasted for over an hour. Government forces report the deaths of 30 al Shabaab fighters.

Police dispersed a large group of people who had gathered in front of the Kulmiye (ruling) Party headquarter in Shaab area in the morning of 02/11. The gathering follows the current internal struggle for power and control within the party. The minister of finance and the current interim chairman of the party are competing for the post of the parties chairman.

RCIED exploded in the main market in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 03/11. One civilian was killed and several others injured. The target of the attack is unclear. Phone networks were switched off for two hours after the blast and a number of road-blocks were erected. No arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked the main ENDF military base in Beled Weyne at K115 area in the evening of 03/11. The two sides used heavy artillery fire during the clash which lasted for about 30 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Students from Farah Omar Secondary School staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Ministry of Education in Shaab area in Hargeisa in the morning of 03/11. The students were complaining of lack of sufficient teachers. The students went back to school after the minister of education pledge to respond to their demand.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Somali forces on foot patrol in the eastern side of Beled Weyne in the night of 03/11. No casualties reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers opened fire at two Jubaland soldiers in Guulwaade neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the morning of 03/10. One soldier was injured. The attackers escaped from the scene.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman near Al-Baraka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 03/11. The motive of the killing is unclear but reports indicate that the victim used to run a tea-shop frequented by SNG forces. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a government soldier in Juungaal neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 03/11. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A government soldier shot and killed another following an escalated dispute over the ownership of a residential house in Afisyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the afternoon of 03/11. The perpetrator was arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM supply convoy near Dhoobley (Afmadow District) in the morning of 04/10. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy had left Dhoobley and was heading to Afmadow. Casualties could not be established.

Two militia groups from Saad and Majerteen clashed near Godod Village (28 E of Galkacyo) on 04/11. Reports indicate that the fighting is related to one of 01/11 in the same area. Casualty reports indicate that five combatants-four Saad and one Majeerten-were killed in the clash. The fresh fighting caused tension in the area.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Bar Aleen in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 04/11. The motive is currently unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier killed one of his colleagues during a dispute over khat and extorted money at a check-point on the airport road in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 04/11. The perpetrator was arrested the following day.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a traditional elder in Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 04/11. The motive is unknown. The attackers escaped. Government forces in the neighbourhood conducted a security operation and arrested a number of people they suspected of being behind the murder.

Arrests: Federal government police forcefully evicted families living in the former national library (Xamar Weyne District) in the morning of 04/11. The police arrested a local journalist who took photos during the operation.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a residence of a member of Somali forces near Dabaqeynka Mosque (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 04/11. The device missed its target and landed in an empty area, causing no casualties. Soldiers in the house opened fire after the blast. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an employee of the Ministry of Health (and former UN and INGO casual staff) in Moalim Nuur cemetery area (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 04/11. The man was reportedly involved in a community policing project implemented by the Banadir regional administration.
A government soldier shot and killed a businessman in Xamar Weyne District in the morning of 04/11. The motive is unknown. It remains unclear whether the perpetrator was arrested or not.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces carried out an attack on a AMISOM/Djibouti base in western Beled Weyne town, causing ""massive causalities."" Sabaax is pro-al Shabaab.
A man who was a staff of the Planning Ministrys census department was shot an killed by unidentified persons. It is not clear if the target of the attack was the government official.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al-Shabab fighters launched an attack on Jubbaland administration forces and Kenyan AU troops bases at Kismaayo University in an overnight attack between 04/11-05/11. Independent sources say that there is an unconfirmed number of casualties.
Unidentified gunmen shot dead two Somali policemen in Bakara market in the afternoon of 05/11. A soldier had been killed in the market earlier in the day.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Doonka Weynow Village (12km N of Afgooye) in the evening of 05/11. The fighting erupted when troops led by the area commander of Somali forces arrived in the area to destroy illegal checkpoints that lie on the road between Afgooye and Wanla-Weyne reportedly manned by SNG soldiers. The soldiers on the checkpoint who reportedly received some reinforcement from their clansmen reacted with gunfire. The commander and his troops defeated the group who then fled towards the road to Jowhar. The soldiers also removed the road-blocks left behind by the group. Five combatants were killed in the clash.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire and injured a man hailing from Rahanweyn clan near slaughter house in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 05/11. It is believed the perpetrators were Saad gunmen who mistook him for a Majeerten/Omar Mohamud.

Unidentified attacker threw a hand grenade at a hotel hosting a government delegation in Bulo-Xawo in the evening of 05/11. The device landed in near the hotel but did not cause any casualty. The perpetrator escaped. The delegation is on a fact-finding mission on the cause roots of conflicts between ASWJ and local administrations.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man near Hareed Mosque in Hawl-Wadaag District in the afternoon of 05/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to a SNA officer in Arjatin neighbourhood (Kaaraan District) in the afternoon of 05/11. The officer is based in Kaaraan District. No one was in the vehicle by the time of the blast. The officer and his body guards were sitting in tea-shop when the device went off. It is believed that the device was attached to the vehicle.

A RCIED targeted Somali soldiers in a private car in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 05/11. Three soldiers in the car were killed and the vehicle was badly damaged. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces in Ciise Cabdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 05/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali soldier in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District)in the morning of 05/11. The attackers escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two unarmed SNA officers near Olympic Telecommunication in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 05/11. The assailants escaped.

Militias from Abgal/Mohamed Muse and Shidle clans clashed in Geedo-Barkaan Village (5km NE of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 06/11. The fighting was initiated by the Abgal militia who attacked Shidle farmers. Twenty people were killed in the clash. The fighting broke out at a time when the Somali president was visiting the Jowhar town. The president ordered government security forces to intervene and stop the fighting. Tension remains high in the area. Reports indicate that the two sides were mobilizing their militias.

Youth gang stabbed and killed a boy in the livestock market in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the evening of 06/11. The motive is unknown. Police arrested three suspects in connection with the murder.

Farmers hailing from Gudabirsi and Isse clans clashed using sticks and stones in Xariirad Village (58km SE of Borama) following an escalated dispute on irrigation water for their farms. No casualties were reported. Local elders intervened and managed to separate the two sides.

A man hailing from Habar Jeclo/Baho shot at khat seller (a woman) from Habar Yonis/Abdala Hamud but missed her in Ceerigaabo on 06/10. The incident happened after the woman attacked the man using a stick over unpaid khat debts. Police arrived at the scene but perpetrator had managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 06/11. Reports indicate that the device hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNA officer near Al-Baraka Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/11. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men picked a civilian man from his house in Arjatin neighbourhood ( Kaaraan District) in the night of 06/11 and shot him dead in front of his house. The perpetrators escaped. Reports indicate that the victim was a security guard for an INGO in Mogadishu. The perpetrators are believed to be AS operatives.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed the chairman of Wardhiigley district court in Xararyaale neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 06/11. The perpetrators escaped.
A lorry hit an UXO/Mine on the road betweenHananbuure and Mareer Guur (28km N of Dhusamareeb) in the afternoon o f07/11. Casualties could not be established.

Fresh fighting resumed between Abgal/Mohamed Muse and Shidle clan militias in Geedo-Barkaan (5km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 07/11. The two sides reportedly used both light and heavy weapons during the clash. Latest unconfirmed reports indicate that 15 combatants were killed, seven from each side. Later reports hld ten deaths, plus injuries. Two villages were burnt and 350 people were displaced. The fighting comes at a time when access to Jowhar town is difficult due to the floods that affected villages surrounding the town.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Beytu Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 07/11. The victim was the headmaster of Sheekh Ali Maye Primary School in Marka. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Pro-SNG soldiers shot and killed a man in Qasax Dhere in the midday of 07/11 after suspecting him of being an Amniyat (al Shabaab intelligence) infiltrator.

A man from Habar Jeclo/Soolomadaw sub- clan reportedly stabbed and killed a man hailing from Habar Yonis /Sacad Yonis in Sheikh Bashir neighbourhood (Burao) in the morning of 07/11 following an escalated private dispute. The perpetrator escaped but was later arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Mr. Gabose, a senior Jubaland military officer, in Sinaay neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 07/11. The motive is believed to be related to internal disagreement within the Jubaland forces. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator escaped.

Attack/Shooting, Dabaqeynka Mosque area, Dharkeynley District, Mogadishu, 07/11/2013, 21:00. Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against government forces in Dabaqeynka mosque area (Dharkeyley District) in the night of 07/11. The forces opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman close to ex-Control Afgooye (Hodan District) in the evening of 07/11. The victim was the wife of a government soldier. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM base in Hoosingo village (70km SE of Dhoobley) in the evening of 08/11. Reports suggest that the attack was coordinated with another one occurring in Dhoobley at the same time. The fighting lasted for an hour. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in the main airport in Kismaayo in the evening of 08/11. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base located 3km outside Dhoobley town (Afmadow District) in the evening of 08/11. An exchange of artillery fire was also reported with most rounds being fired from the AMISOM side. A civilian woman was hit by a stray bullet and was transported to AMISOM hospital for treatment. No other casualties were reported. Reports suggest that the attack was coordinated with another one occurring in Hoosingo at the same time.
An unidentified gunman shot and killed a man in front of Janaay Hotel in Berdaale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 08/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator was arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted an employee of Hormuud Telecommunication Company in Jana Cabdalle (59km S of Afmadow). The reason behind his abduction is currently unclear. The man was released several days later.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces based in Furayaasha neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 08/11. The clash lasted for about 15 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a government position in Sarta Qabyada area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 08/11. The clash lasted for a few minutes. Casualties are unknown.

Local medias report that six mortar rounds were fired against Villa Somalia in the night of 08-09/11. Two rounds reportedly landed inside the compound. No casualties were reported. A pro-al Shabaab website (Somali Memo) reported that the al Shabaab spokesman for operations claimed the responsibility of the attack.

Four are killed, including a government official, who was the intended target, and five injured after a car bomb exploded in the evening hours next to a hotel in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. Other reports hold a varying range of deaths.
Fighting continues for a third day between Abgal/Mohamed Muse and Shidle clan militias outside of Jowhar. Ten estimated dead.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the police headquarters in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 09/11. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Biyo Kulule police station in Bossaso in the night of 09/11. Two police officers were reportedly injured. This attack is unrelated to an attack on a nearby prison the same day.

Local medias report that six mortar rounds were fired against Villa Somalia in the night of 08-09/11. Two rounds reportedly landed inside the compound. No casualties were reported. A pro-al Shabaab website (Somali Memo) reported that the al Shabaab spokesman for operations claimed the responsibility of the attack.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a government military position in Abdi Wayeel Cinema area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 09/11. The clash lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A government official reports that about 20 armed members of al Shabaab a prison in northern Somalia in an attempt to free prisoners. Two police guards were wounded in the operation.

Fighting continues for the fourth day between Abgal/Mohamed Muse and Shidle clan militias ini9 Sabuun, outside of Jowhar. Ten estimated dead, fifty in total after four days of fighting. The heaviest fighting occurred near the village of Zabuun.

A youth group attacked with sticks and injured one of the members of the Borama local council in Borama on 09/11. Reports indicate that the victim was attacked when coming out of his office. Four of the youths were later arrested by the police. The attack was motivated by a land dispute between relatives of the youths and the councillor.

A body of a government soldier showing multiple gunshot wounds was found in Baali village (10km W of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 09/11. The motive behind the killing is unclear. Reports indicate that the soldier had left his base the evening before to visit his father in the area.

A mid-level al Shabaab member defected to Jubaland forces in Afmadow in the afternoon of 09/11. Reports indicate that four other al Shabaab members contacted Jubaland forces expressing their willingness to join them. Further reports indicate that most of the defectors are youths who have families in Afmadow.

Two militia groups from of Habar Jeclo/Baho and Habar Jeclo/Aduruxmiin sub-clans reportedly exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of Cadeeyo near Ceeryaan village (25km NE of Ceel-Afweyn) in the morning of 09/11. The clash occurred after gunmen from the Baho sub-clan attempted to steal camels belonging to members of the Aduruxmiin sub-clan. The Sanaag police division commander and local traditional elders stepped in to end the hostility between the two sides.

Government soldiers conducting a security operation between Berdaale and Awdiinle reportedly clashed with al Shabaab militiamen in Jiiro Mad Sheeg (35km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 09/11. Four al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed.

Militiamen believed to be from the Warsangeli /Nuux cumar sub-clan carjacked a Toyota Land Cruiser belonging to a member of the Dhulbahante/Naaleye Ahmed sub-clan in Hadaaftimo village (82km E of Ceerigaabo) on 09/11. Reports indicate that the vehicle was hired by the Somaliland ministry of planning to conduct census activities. The vehicle carrying two enumerators had left Badhan and was heading to Ceerigaabo. The Warsangeli elders in Hadaaftimo reportedly pursued the carjackers. A latest report indicates that the perpetrators were arrested by pro-Somaliland forces in Badhan.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the Mayor office in the centre of Bosasso in the night of 09/11. Casualties are unknown.

An unidentified individual fully dressed in woman's clothing shot and injured a civilian man in Marka main market in the afternoon of 09/11. The victim was transferred to Mogadishu for treatment but later died of his injuries. The motive of the killing is unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

Government soldiers shot and killed a shoeshine boy at Zope junction in Mogadishu while the boy crossing the side road. Witnesses told Radio Dalsan news desk that the soldier killed the boy without reason. Following the shooting the boys colleague and the people in the area start a protest against the Somali military .

Government soldiers shot and killed a shoeshine boy at Zope junction in Mogadishu while the boy crossing the side road. Witnesses told Radio Dalsan news desk that the soldier killed the boy without reason. Following the shooting the boys colleague and the people in the area start a protest against the Somali military .
Al Shabaab leader Ahmad Godane survives an assassination attempt during the evening hours. Increasingly factitious, the attempt on his life may have come from within al Shabaab.
Raas Kaambooni forces took over Koday village (80km NE of Raas Kaambooni) on 10/11.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Siinka Dheer (Afgooye District) in the morning of 10/11. The fighting started after the District Commissioner of Lafoole imposed taxes on lorries going to Mogadishu and allowed his militias to erect roadblocks on the Afgooye-Mogadishu road. In reaction Somali forces based in Ceelasha Biyaaha - also manning illegal roadblocks in the area - attacked the District Commissioners militias. Reports indicate that the fighting lasted for about five minutes after which the DCs militiamen were defeated. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Raas Kaambooni forces in Koday village (52km E of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 11/11. Reports indicate that the clash was relatively intense but al Shabaab forces did not manage to re-enter the village. At least one Raas Kaam

Suspected al Shabaab militiamen launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali position in Wanla-Weyn town in the night of 10/11. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a former NSA officer in front of a teashop in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 10/11. The motive of the killing is unascertained. Reports suggest that the killing may be linked with his former association with the NSA. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

A fire outbreak destroyed IDP shelters in ex-State House compound in Shacabka neighbourhood (Hargeisa) in the afternoon of 10/11. Fire-fighters extinguished the fire after two hours. The cause of the fire is currently unknown, but may have been arson. One woman was reportedly killed and around 20 other persons injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Two Jubaland soldiers exchanged fire in an area close to Golol pharmacy in Argo section (Kismaayo) in the night of 10/11. A young boy was injured by a stray bullet and was taken to hospital where he later died. The reason behind the shooting is not clear. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against government police officers on foot patrol in Xero Ruush compound area (Hodan District) in the evening of 10/11/2013. The officers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped from the scene.

At least ten Al Shabaab militants were reportedly killed in a heavy fighting between two Al Shabaab factions in Lower Shabelle. The battle occurred in Bulo-Marer town; 120 km south of Mogadishu after Al Shabaab militiamen attacked militants loyal to Al Qaeda linked Al Shabaab groups Chief Ahmed Godane.
Al Shabaab forces clash with government forces on the outskirts of Marka district. The number of casualties is not yet known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Heavy fighting broke out in Kudha after Jubba Administration forces launched attacks in the Island where Al-Shabab fighters were. Officials of the Jubba Administration said they attacked the Island and have since taken control by force. Casualitis not reported or known.

Al Shabaab ambushes a group of Somali forces in Yaaqshid. Although extent of losses in the attack is not yet known, sources indicate that three government soldiers were wounded in the attack and that there were no deaths.
Clan elders are forced to flee a peace meeting between Abgal-Mohamed Muse Sub-Clan militia and Shiidle Clan militia after their vehicle is fired upon bu unidentified militia.

A RCIED targeted government soldiers in a teashop in Shalaambood (Marka dst) in the afternoon of 11/11. One soldier was killed and another one injured. Reports indicate that a suspect was arrested at the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed government soldiers on board a vehicle heading to Balli Doogle airport close to Waroos-Maal (Wanla Weyne/Buur Hakaba road) in the night of 11/11. Two of the soldiers were reportedly injured in the ambush. Reports indicate that the attackers were again regrouping in Haakow village (6km SW of Wanla Weyne) after the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a government position in Shalaambood in the early morning of 11/11. Reports indicate that both sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about five minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column9: Majeerteen-Issa Mahmud-Muse Issa Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Health Workers (Somalia)
column17: Unidentified gunmen opened fire at a residential house belonging to a local doctor from the Majerteen/Issa Mohamud/Musse Isse sub-sub-clan in Garoowe in the night of 11/11. It is suspected that the attack was related to clan revenge. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government forces based in Miisanka Dhuhusha neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 11/11. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces based in Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigley District) in the night of 11/11. Reports indicate that the attack started with the shooting of several RPGs. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified armed men shot and injured a SNA member in KKP neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 11/11. Reports indicate that the victim had been called by a friend to meet at the place where he was attacked. The motive of the attackers is unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a government military position in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 11/11. Reports indicate that the attack started with the shooting of several RPGs and lasted for about 20 minutes. Two soldiers were injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a private residential house belonging to a Dayniile district official in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 11/11. Reports indicate that the security guards protecting the compound exchanged gunfire with the attackers. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab forces attack government bases in Yaaqshid and Dayniile districts causing battles lasting several hours. Unknown causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Reports indicate that Kenya military helicopters carried out an airstrike against an al Shabaab position in the vicinity of Koday village on 12/11. Two al Shabaab vehicles were reportedly destroyed. At the same time Raas Kambooni forces carried out a KDF-coordinated military operation in the outskirts of the village. Reports indicate that three Raas Kaambooni soldiers were injured and one killed. Unconfirmed reports indicate that around 12 al Shabaab militiamen were killed in the operation.

A suspected al Shabaab operative armed with pistol shot and injured two government soldiers on foot patrol in Buundo Weyne neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 12/11. The injured soldiers were taken to Beled-Weyne hospital for treatment. Reports indicate that the perpetrator has been arrested.

A group of youths armed with AK-47 rifles threatened the chairman of Gabo Dadar village (Lughaye) in the morning of 12/11. Reports indicate that the chairman and other local officials were taking part in an opening ceremony for Telesom communication company new office. Police officers who were at the scene managed to arrest the group. Reports indicate that the youths were neighbours of the new office and were protesting for not having been recruited by the telecom company.

A group of Somali soldiers manning a check-point singled out and executed a passenger of a public mini-bus in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka) in the morning 12/11. Reports indicate that the victim had been identified as an al Shabaab member by an al Shabaab defector working with the soldiers at the check-point.

Militiamen hailing from the Mareehan/Wagardhac sub-clan ambushed alcohol smugglers in an area between Dhudub village (Ethiopia) and Lanwaaley in the night of 12/11. Reports indicate that the gunmen opened fire at the vehicle and injured two men. The attack was reportedly part of a cycle of clan revenges opposing the two sides. The injured men hail from hail from the Habar-Gedir/ Saad sub-clan. Further reports indicate that elders from the Wagardhac sub-clan intervened and managed to take the injured men to Galkacyo.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of Jubaland militiamen erected a road-block in Somali Star neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 12/11. Reports indicate that another group of Jubaland forces forcefully removed the roadblock after a brief clash. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of Jubaland militiamen erected a road-block in Somali Star neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 12/11. Reports indicate that other Jubaland forces forcefully removed the roadblock after a brief clash. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives exchanged gunfire with government police forces in Hormuud Telecom compound area in Bakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 12/11. One police officer was reportedly injured in the shootout. Reports indicate that the confrontation was accidental. The suspected al Shabaab operatives managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a young civilian man in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 12/11. Reports indicate that the victim was brother to a member of a NSA officer. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Al Shabaab forces attack government bases in Yaaqshid and Dayniile districts causing battles lasting several hours. Unknown causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A Kenyan AMISOM base stationed at Kismayo airport is attacked by al Shabaab fighters. The ensuing clash lasted over an hour. Causalities not known.

Two families hailing from the Mohamed Zubeyr sub-clan clashed in Dhoobley town (Afmadow District) in the evening of 13/11. The incident was related to an escalated land dispute. Reports indicate that a Jubaland soldier was injured in the shooting after he tried to separate the two sides. Elders have been mobilized to solve the issue. No arrests were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM/KDF convoy near Ceel Cadde (50km SW of Garbahareey) on 13/11. Reports indicate that one KDF soldier was injured in the blast and one personal carrier was damaged. Further reports indicate that the attack followed a clash in the area.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed over an illegal road-block in Bariirre village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 13/11. Reports indicate that the fighting started after one group of the soldiers erected a check-point to extort money from public vehicles while another group opposed it. The road-block was dismantled. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali government forces based in Shabeelow village (26km SW of Baidoa) near Goof-Gaduud in the afternoon of 13/11. The clash lasted for 10 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Fighting between Al-Shabaab militiamen and Somali government forces backed by Kenyan troops occurred in Ceel Gaduud region, leaving least six combatants, four of them Al-Shabab militiamen, were killed in the fighting.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces based in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 14/11. The clash lasted for about 30 minutes. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed and a government soldier injured in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces vacated Koday village (52km NE of Badhaadhe) and returned to Mudawa Island in the afternoon of 14/11. The move was reportedly decided after Sheikh Ahmed Madobe advised them to withdraw based on intelligence reports indicating that al Shabaab militias were mobilizing to retake the town. Further reports suggest that Jubaland forces had not received from AMISOM/KDF heavy weapons, military equipment and reinforcements due to heavy rains and access constraints. Al Shabaab militias re-entered the town with no fighting and were again in full control in the evening of 14/11.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of the Jubaland deputy army commander (Ali Gardhub) in Siinay neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the evening of 14/11. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali Memo reports an al Shabaab attack on a joint AMISOM (Burundian)/Somali government base in Carbiska, near Mogadishu. Sources say that the attack killed a number of soldiers and key federal government military officers, though the exact numbers remain unknown. The Somali Memo is pro al Shabaab.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives attacked the residence of General Gobaale, a senior SNA commander and commander of Somali armies 3rd brigade, in Sheekh Ali Suufi neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/11. The commander was not present by the time of the attack. A security guard at the residence exchanged fire with the attackers, killing one of them and injuring another. The security guard was also injured in the shoot-out. The attackers reportedly left behind the body of their colleague, a pistol and a car as they retreated.

Somali army clashed with Biyo Maal clan militia in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 15/11. The fighting is believed to be related to dispute over tax. No casualties were reported. Residents in Janaale staged a demonstration the following day calling on the army to leave the village.

A group of pro-government soldiers attacked the police headquarters in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 15/11 and engaged in an exchange of gunfire with the police. The pro-government soldiers conducted the attack to free their detained colleague who arrested for carrying a gun in the city while on off duty. The attackers managed to release him. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a civilian woman near Heliwa police station (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 15/11. The motive is unclear. The victim used to run a teashop frequented by government soldiers. The perpetrators escaped.

An armed man dressed in government military uniform shot and killed a civilian man after the victim refused to cooperate during a robbery act in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 15/11. The perpetrator escaped.

Somali army clashed with Biyo Maal clan militia in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 15/11. The fighting is believed to be related to dispute over tax. No casualties were reported. Residents in Janaale staged a demonstration the following day (16/11) calling on the army to leave the village.

Militiamen from Biyo Maal clan manning a check-point in Ceel-wareegow Village (11km NE of Marka) stopped a mini-bus and ordered two Somali government soldiers on board to step down in the afternoon of 16/11. The two soldiers responded by opening fire and ran to a nearby bush where they called for reinforcement. Government forces based in Janaale Village rushed to the scene and clashed with the clan militia. Reports indicate that the fighting was related to a clash in Janaale Village the day before. One soldier was reportedly injured in the Ceel-wareegow clash.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed three government soldiers near the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 16/11. The assailants also stole the guns of their victims and escaped.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian man in the livestock area (Heliwa District) in the morning of 16/11. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED reportedly planted on the roadside targeted AMISOM forces in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 17//11. Two AMISOM soldiers were injured and an AMISOM truck was damaged in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Somali government forces based in Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) clashed with Biyo Maal militias in the afternoon of 17/11. Reports indicate that the Biyo Maal militias were heading to K50 Village to support their clansmen who were had been fighting Somali forces. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which the clan militias were defeated. Unconfirmed reports indicate that unspecified numbers of combatants were injured in the clash.

Somali forces clashed with Biyo Maal militia in K50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) in the noon of 17/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the militiamen withdrew. Five combatants were killed and six others were injured in the clash. Reports indicate the government soldiers a short while earlier clashed with another group of Somali forces manning an illegal checkpoint near K50 airstrip.

Two groups of government soldiers clashed over an illegal checkpoint in K50 airstrip (20km SW Afgooye) in the morning of 17/11. The fighting broke after a group of soldiers from Marka tried to dismantle the illegal check-point while the other group resisted. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the group manning the checkpoint withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column9: Suleiman-Habar Gedir Clan Group (Somalia); Health Workers (Somalia); Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: Unidentified armed militias shot and killed a civilian man hailing from Habar Gidir in Buulo-Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon 17/11. The incident was reportedly linked to clan revenge. Reports indicate that the victim was an INGO staff working in TB section of Marka General Hospital.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a civilian man near Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 17/11. The motive is unclear. The victim used to transport AMISOM soldiers from the camp to the market using his motor cycle. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A RCIED targeted a Jubaland military truck in Via Afmadow neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 11/11. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali government forces, backed by Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops, today clashed with Al-Shabaab militiamen in Daynuuney locality after a AMISOM vehicle was hit by a mine. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted AMISOM convoy in Gasala (8km E of Baidoa) in the morning of 18/11. Reports indicate that the blast followed a hit-and-run attack conducted by al Shabaab fighters. An AMISOM truck was slightly damaged in the explosion. Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab suffered heavy casualties.

Fighting between Somali forces and Biyo Maal militias resumed in K50 Village (Afgooye District) in the morning of 18/11. Reports indicate that the fresh fighting was started by government forces in an operation aimed to drive militias from the village and the surrounding areas. Security managed to drive out the militias from the village. MPs and traditional leaders from Biyo Maal clash condemned the Somali military for reportedly killing and terrorizing innocent civilians. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Maal militiamen shot and killed four people hailing from Habar Gidir clan in K50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 18/11. The motive is reportedly clan revenge.

A body guard of Marka District Commissioner reportedly opened fire at a market in Awbaalle neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 18/11. A woman and a child were injured in the shooting. The motive behind the shooting is currently unknown.

Members of Gudabirsi and Isse clans clashed using sticks following an escalated dispute over land ownership in Habas Village near Xariirad (58km SE of Borama). A number of people were injured in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces in Afmadow in the night of 18/11. The Jubaland forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

Two Somali soldiers exchanged gunfire following an escalated dispute over a piece of land located in Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim area (Hodan District) along Mogadishu-Afgooye road in the evening of 18/11. Casualties could not be confirmed.

A RCIED targeted a Somali military truck passing in front of Ahmed Gurey Secondary School in Misaanka Dhuxusha neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 18/11. The soldiers in the vehicle opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy on the road between Ceymiska and ex-Control Balcad (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 18/11. Reports indicate that the device missed the target. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a Somali security outpost near Abdi Wayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the evening of 18/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. A female bystander was injured by a stray bullet.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two soldiers in Banagala neighbourhood in the evening of 18/11. The soldiers were on foot and heading to their homes when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.
A government soldier fires upon another at Mogadishu airport for unknown reason. A civilian is killed in the crossfire.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a complex attack against Beled Weyne police station in the morning of 19/11. The attackers first denoted a VBIED to clear the gate of the station before storming and starting engaging in a serious shoot-out with the police. At least 20 people, including the attackers and police, were killed and scores of others were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and said special forces from its operations brigade carried out the attack. Some reports hold a death total of 19.

Al Shabaab forces attack a Somali government base in in Sarta-Qabyada, in Yaqshiid district on the night of 19 November. The fighting, which lasted several hours, caused ""heavy casualties,"" though no numbers were provided. Radio Andalus is pro-al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali government base in Goof-Gaduud Shabelow (25km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of the 19/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Banaaney Village (7km NE of Beled Weyne) in the evening of 19/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes was followed by mortar shells, after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Five mortar rounds hit the airstrip. Casualties could not be established.

A group of pro-government forces (not identified) clash with al Shabaab fighters in the outskirt of Tuulo Barwaqo (20 km NW of Garbahareey) in the morning of 19/11. Reports indicate that the pro-government group was after a deserter soldier who deserted the base but met al Shabaab fighters where the two sides engaged in exchange of gunfire, after which the pro-government soldiers withdrew to their base. No casualties were reported.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Via Afmadow neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 19/11. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
A man, who was kidnapped by al Shabaab elements in September, dies under torture from his captors. The identity of the man is not known.

A pro-Somali soldier shot and seriously injured a business woman in Bulo-Xawo in the night of 19/11. The woman - a Khat seller had engaged an argument with the soldier over previous khat debt. Other pro-soldiers arrested the perpetrator. The woman succumbed to her injuries later.

Unidentified man shot and injured a government soldier in Korontada neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 19/11. The soldier was walking home when the incident happened. The perpetrator escaped.

Unidentified man armed with a pistol shot and killed another man near Danwadaagaha Junction (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 19/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator reportedly jumped out a car and shot the victim and escaped in the car.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a security outpost in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 19/11. The attackers used RPGs and small arms fire during the clash which lasted for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
A Somali soldier shot and killed a man riding a motor-bike at the civilian gate of Mogadishu airport (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 19/11 following an argument. The perpetrator escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters forcibly took livestock in the name of Zakat (tax) from nomads in Ceel Doon (13km NE of Baidoa) in the night of 20/11. The action reportedly created fear and tension in the village and even in Baidoa town.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a convoy of Amisom troops along the road that links Yaaq Bariweyne and Ballidoogle. No causalities reported. One AMISOM vehicle destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military truck in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 20/11. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. One AMISOM soldier was reportedly killed in the explosion and the truck was damaged. The perpetrators escaped.

A RCIED targeted a Somali military truck carrying soldiers in Carbiska settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 20/11. Reports indicate that the device missed it is target and exploded after the vehicle had passed over. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against government forces base in Mahadaay Village (21km N of Jowhar) in the night of 20/11. Two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One Somali soldier was killed in the clash. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Gunmen believed to be Abgal burnt Buulo-Tayeg, Laba Waab and Buulo Waraay villages (22km E of Jowhar) on 20/11. The villages belong to Shiidle and Makanne (Jareer) clans but the villagers fled the area during previous clashes between Abgal and Shiidle clans.

Gunmen believed to be Abgal burnt Buulo-Tayeg, Laba Waab and Buulo Waraay villages (22km E of Jowhar) on 20/11. The villages belong to Shiidle and Makanne (Jareer) clans but the villagers fled the area during previous clashes between Abgal and Shiidle clans.

Gunmen believed to be Abgal burnt Buulo-Tayeg, Laba Waab and Buulo Waraay villages (22km E of Jowhar) on 20/11. The villages belong to Shiidle and Makanne (Jareer) clans but the villagers fled the area during previous clashes between Abgal and Shiidle clans.
An explosive targets a federal government militia vehicle travelling to KM50 village. The damage caused by the blast is unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Arrests: Joint Somali government/AMISOM forces conducted security search operations in Kooshin and Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhoods (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 21/11. About 100 people, suspected of being al Shabaab sympathizers, were arrested during the operation. Fourty of them were released while the rest are still in police custody, undergoing further interrogation.
A government soldier kills another for unknown reason.

Clan militias from Dir and Hawadle clashed in Deefow Village (29 km NW of Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 22/11 following dispute over farms ownership. One combatant was reportedly killed and three others were injured. Reports indicate that the fresh fighting was meant to draw the attention of a government delegation visiting the region.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters killed a pro-government soldier (not identified) from Luweys sub-clan in Shiida Village (26 km E of Xudur) on 22/11. Reports indicate that the victim went to the village to see his sister and brother in-law and by entering the house, his brother in-law stabbed and killed him. Further reports indicate that al Shabaab elements brought the victims body to Xudur and dumped it on the street until on 24/11.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and- run attack against pro-government base in Qansax Dhere in the night of 22/11. The attack lasted briefly. Government forces did not respond. No casualties were reported.

Suspected Lelkase militias ambushed a passenger vehicle belonging to Majeerteen/ Reer Biciidyahan heading to Galdogob in the afternoon of 22/11. One man hailing from the Majeerteen/Reer Biciidyahan was reportedly killed in the ambush. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the motive of the attack was clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Two Puntland presidential security guards opened fire at Bantu khat traders in Biyo Kulule IDP camp in Bosasso on 22/11 after they resisted attempt by the guards to rob the khat. One khat seller was killed and another was seriously injured. A child was also injured in the attack. The perpetrators were arrested by members of Bantu clan and handed over to the police.
Hundreds of pro-Puntland residents of Garoowe hold a demonstration against the Somali National Government. The protesters believe the central government encourages clan clashes.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at Jubaland forces in K2 section in Fiat neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 22/11. No casualties were reported. Reports indicate that the forces conducted a security operation after the blast but made no arrest.
A government police officer shot and killed his colleague following a heated argument over unspecified issue in Trebunka area (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 22/11. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: At least 21 camels are killed in a bomb blast intended for AMISOM forces. Conflicting report: local herders claim AMISOM forces intentionally killed the camels.

A soldier reportedly shot and killed a civilian woman in her house in Ex-control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the morning of 23/11. Reports indicate that the soldier was pursuing a man who reportedly entered the victims house and jumped over a wall inside the building. Further reports indicate that the woman insisted that she don't know the man after which the soldier shot her. The incident may have been related to the killing of a judge in the district earlier in the day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces base near Beled Weyne airstrip in the night of 23/11. AMISOM responded with artillery fire, forcing the al Shabaab fighters to withdraw. Al Shabaab fighters regrouped again and attacked the same location where high level al Shabaab members reportedly took part in the new assault. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM military convoy in the outskirts of Iidow Jallaad Village near Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 23/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy was heading to Baidoa when the ambush took place. Casualties could not be established.

Two men exchanged gunfire following an escalated argument on al Shabaab issues in Carmo Village (205km S of Bosasso) on 23/11. One of the two, identified as a former al Shabaab militant, was injured in the shoot-out and later succumbed to his injuries. The perpetrator was arrested.

An unidentified perpetrator shot and killed a civilian man in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 23/11. The reason behind the killing is currently unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the incident might be linked to clan revenge though no clan was mentioned. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces based in Afmadow town in the evening of 23/11. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier hailing from Majerteen shot and killed his colleague from Ogaden near the State House (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 23/11 following a dispute over land ownership. The perpetrator was arrested, sentenced to death and executed the next day, following an agreement between the two clans.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a district judge and a female bystander near Heliwa main market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 23/11. Reports indicate that the judge was heading to his office at the time of the incident and the woman was reportedly shot screamed when the perpetrators shot the judge. The attackers escaped.

A government soldier survived an assassination attempt after three men armed with pistols tried to kill him while riding his motorbike to work in the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 23/11. The targeted soldier reportedly exchanged gunfire with the attackers and managed to escape. A female bystander was killed in the cross fire. The attackers managed to escape.

An unidentified man armed with a pistol shot and killed a soldier near the main Market in Heliwa District in the morning of 23/11. The perpetrator escaped. Government forces launched a security operation after the incident but made no arrest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces clash with AMISOM and Somali government forces in Jeelow location, near Beledweyne. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/Somali forces took over several villages under Beled Weyne District (most notably Luuqjelow and Raangaabo) which were under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 24/11. Reports indicate that al Shabaab vacated the villages prior to the arrival of the allied forces. Further reports indicate that one al Shabaab fighter was arrested in Luuq Jeelow village while sleeping under a tree. The allied forces handed to their owners about 150 collected by al Shabaab in the name of Zakat in the villages. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/Somali forces took over several villages under Beled Weyne District (most notably Luuqjelow and Raangaabo) which were under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 24/11. Reports indicate that al Shabaab vacated the villages prior to the arrival of the allied forces.
