Further reports indicate that one al Shabaab fighter was arrested in Luuq Jeelow village while sleeping under a tree. The allied forces handed to their owners about 150 collected by al Shabaab in the name of Zakat in the villages. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Xero Agoonta (Orphanage Centre) in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the morning of 24/11. Al Shabaab fighters started the attack with RPGs followed by a direct confrontation that lasted for about 10 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a group of pro-Somali government forces (affiliation not provided) near Jana Cabdalle Village (57km SE of Afmadow) in the morning of 24/11. The two sides engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire. Reports indicate that one soldier was not accounted for. It is unclear whether he defected to the al Shabaab side or lost his way. The pro-government forces had left Afmadow and were heading to Kismaayo when the ambushed took place. Further reports indicate that the pro-government forces abducted an armed civilian in the ambush area and his body was found in the outskirts of Kismaayo on 26/11. It is not clear if he was killed because of being an al Shabaab suspect or because of his gun, which has a street value of 1200 USD. Casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces launched a series of attacks on a AMISOM base located in Lafoole during the late evening hours. AMISOM forces responded with mortar fire. Combatant injuries not known. Two civilians injured.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 24/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified man armed with a pistol shot and injured an elder from Garre clan in the main Marka market in the evening of 24/11. The motive is unknown. The elder was taken to Mogadishu for treatment. The perpetrator escaped.

Three unidentified armed men shot and killed a government soldier in Barwaqo neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 24/11. The soldier was on foot heading to his home when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian man in his residence in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 24/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali military officials, backed by AMISOM forces take control of Shabelley, Buqkoosaar and Ceelbaar in Beledweyne district. Details, including date(s) of the battles not provided.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali military officials, backed by AMISOM forces take control of Shabelley, Buqkoosaar and Ceelbaar in Beledweyne district. Details, including date(s) of the battles not provided.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali military officials, backed by AMISOM forces take control of Shabelley, Buqkoosaar and Ceelbaar in Beledweyne district. Details, including date(s) of the battles not provided.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM forces passing in Hawindha Village (94km E of Afmadow) in the morning of 25/11. One AMISOM truck was damaged in the blast. The explosion was followed by heavy exchange of assorted firearms that could be heard in Dhoobley town. The convoy had left Tabta and was heading to Dhoobley when the ambush took place. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An RCIED targeted a vehicle belonging to the spokesman of Jubaland forces which was passing in Via Afmadow neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 25/11. The spokesman was in the car by the time of the incident. One soldier was killed and six others were injured, three of them seriously in the blast. Following the attack Jubaland forces conducted a security operation in the area and made 25 arrests.

Unidentified attackers threw two hand grenades at a building occupied by an INGO in K6 area (Hodan District) in the evening of 25/11. The motive is unknown. Two bystanders were reportedly injured in the blast. The attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against government soldiers based in the former Pasta Factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 25/11. The two sides engaged in exchange of gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Four people were injured in an explosion targeting Jubaland security forces. Several al Shabaab arrests were made the following day.

Al-Shabab fighters carry out two consecutive attacks, targeting a building housing the Iranian embassy in Seybiyaano neighbourhood, Hodan district during the night of 25 November. Reports of casualties are not yet known, but this is the first time al Shabaab have targeted a Shia establishment in Somalia. Radio Andalus is pro al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Pro-al Shabaab radio reports a al Shabaab attack on AMISOM-Djibouti forces in Ceelkabeer area, 18km to the west of Beled Weyne town. Heavy fighting over several hours was reported. Causalities not reported.

At least three civilians, including a well-known businessman, are killed by suspected Raskamboni forces during the evening hours. It was reported the assailants shot the civilians after detonating an explosive in the downtown area.

Arrests: Police arrested four officials of Wadani (Somaliland National) Party in Hargeisa over the course of two days - 26-27/11. The motive of the arrest is currently unclear. In response the parties supporters staged a demonstration in protest against the arrest of the officials.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit-and- run attack against AMISOM/Somali government forces position in Luuq Jeelow Village (21km SE of Beled Weyne) in the night of 26/11. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. At least two government soldiers were reportedly injured in the clash. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Security guards manning a hotel in Suweyto neighbourhood (Bosasso) shot in the air to prevent a group of businessmen from storming the hotel in the afternoon of 26/11. The businessmen reportedly wanted to seize Yemeni businessmen for not paying them for their livestock exported to Yemen.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base at the airstrip in Beled Weyne in the evening of 26/11. AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

A police officer shot and injured a security guard working for an INGO near Baidoa police headquarters in the morning of 26/11 over unconfirmed reason, probably related to dispute over employment by the INGO.

Three Saad militia men carjacked a vehicle rented by a UN agency in an area 4km south of Galmudug check point in Galkacyo South in the morning of 26/11. There was one UN agency staff on board who was travelling to Cadaado on a mission. The militia men forced the vehicle to an isolated area 15km east of South Galkacyo and stole personal items from the staff and the driver, before taking the vehicle to unknown location. The driver and the staff member managed to return to Galkacyo. The driver hails from Marehan clan and according to the Galmudug police which launched investigation, the incident is related to Saad/Marehan clan revenge.

Armed men dressed in government military uniforms opened fire at a public service mini-bus near Balcad in the afternoon of 26/11 after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop. The incident may have been an attempt at robbery. Three passengers-two men and a woman-were reportedly killed in the attack.
Three men armed with pistols have shot dead a government soldier and injured another one in Mogadishus Siinaay junction.

Police arrested four officials of Wadani (Somaliland National) Party in Hargeisa over the course of two days - 26-27/11. The motive of the arrest is currently unclear. In response the parties supporters staged a demonstration in protest against the arrest of the officials.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Somali/AMISOM forces stationed in Luuq Jeeloow Village (21km SE of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 27/11. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that went on for two hours. The allied forces reportedly later returned to their bases in Beled Weyne. One government soldier was reportedly killed and two others were injured. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Somali government forces and Biyo Maal militia clashed in Ugunji Village (23km NE of Qoryooley)in the morning of 27/11. The fighting broke out after the government forces from Janaale Village attacked the Biyo Maal militia manning checkpoint in the area. The government forces managed to remove the roadblock. A female bystander was killed in the crossfire. The warring sides suffered unconfirmed number of injuries.

Two militia groups led by two governing leaders of Khatumo (Ahmed Karash and Mohamud Indho Sheel) clashed in the vicinity of God Qaboobe (53km E of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 27/11 following disagreements over who to lead the second phase of Khatumo III conference. The two sides clashed after a militia group led by Indho Sheel reportedly heading to Taleex to organize the general assembly meeting of Khatumo, was blocked by another group led by Ahmed Karash. Indho Sheel group later proceeded to Taleex after the brief clash and the withdrawal of Karash group. The Khatumos deputy minister of interior, who was part of Indho Sheel convoy, was injured in the clash. Indho Sheel reportedly accused Puntland of backing his rival.

A soldier shot and killed his colleague in Mareerey (7km W of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 27/11 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public service vehicles plying Afgooye-Mareerey toad. The perpetrator, who attempted to escape, was reportedly arrested by other government soldiers.

An RCIED targeted a truck belonging to government security forces in front of Hormuud building located between SOS and ex-control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the evening of 27/11. Soldiers in the truck opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

A suspected al Shabaab operative opened fire at a group of government soldiers at their patrol base in Haji Pasta area (Hodan District) in the evening of 27/11. The soldiers responded in the direction of the attacker. They also chased him and managed to arrest him, then handed him to officers at the CID headquarters. No report of causalities.

Two men armed with pistols shot and killed a woman in Macalin Nuur neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 27/11. The motive is unknown. The victim used to work in cash for work projects like cleaning the roads in Mogadishu. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a government soldier and seriously injured another in Siinaay neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 27/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped. Somali forces later conducted a security operation in the area but made no arrest.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Eight persons are killed during an armed clash between Jubaland soldiers and an armed Khatumo militia loyal to Mr Muhammad Yusuf Jama (Indhoshel), self-proclaimed politician and member of Somali Diaspora in Europe

A hand grenade targeted government soldiers in Jowhar walking along the road but there has been no report of casualties among the soldiers. However, a female khat vendor who was injured died later in hospital.

Militias hailing from Hawadle/Adan Warsame and Dir/Fiqi Umar sub-clans clashed in Kabxanleey Village in the morning of 28/11. Both sub-clans are farmers and the clash was reportedly triggered by a dispute over farms ownership. Initial reports indicate four people were killed and eight others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters and pastoralists clashed in the remote villages near Maxaas (83 NE of Bulo Burte), on 28/11 after al Shabaab elements tried to forcefully take livestock from the herders in the name of Zakat (tax). Reports indicate that the pastoralists managed to recover livestock seized previously by al Shabaab fighters. Causalities not known.

Shidle militiamen shot and killed two men - an Abgal and a Baadi Cadde-in Timire Village (5km NE of Jowhar) in the midday of 28/11. Reports indicate the victims were looking for maize and Sesame to loot when the incident happened. The killing comes a day after elders from Abgal and Shidle clans reached an agreement to end hostility among the two groups.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A bomb explosion at the khat market targeting security forces in Jowhar town has caused death and injury of bystander civilians.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM military convoy in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 28/11. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly fired a RPG at the convoy. No casualties or damages were reported. The convoy continued with its
A gunman in the government forces uniform has killed a civilian in Arjantiin neighbourhood of Mogadishus Kaaraan District for unknown reason.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 29 November 2013, Al shabaab militants launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The two sides exchanged gunfire and Al shabaab retreated from the area.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers based at ADC compound in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening of 29/11. The soldiers opened gunfire after the blast. A woman bystander was killed and four others (civilians) were injured in the blast.

A Somali soldier reportedly shot and killed a young boy at a playground located near Ex-control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the evening of 29/11. The incident occurred when the soldier with his AK-47 passed near the playground where some boys in the neig
Unknown gunmen shot and killed a Somali Government judge in Mogadishus Yaqshiid District. Unconfirmed reports suggest that the judge was involved in a land dispute. The assailants escaped.

A RCIED targeted government soldiers in Baar Ismail neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 301/11. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. They then conducted a security operation in the area and arrested many people they suspected of being involved in the attack. Reports indicate that at least five soldiers were killed in the explosion and a number of others were injured in the blast. A government forces truck was also damaged in the attack.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Kaaraan police Station (Kaaraan District) in the evening of 29/11. No casualties were reported. Police immediately conducted a security operation and arrested a number of people they suspected on being behind the attack.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot a civilian man in Dahablaha Section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 30/11. The deceased was working for a private bank in located in Bakaara Market and was heading home when the incident happened. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the attackers wanted to kill a woman, who reported previous planted IEDS to the authorities, but missed her. The woman managed to escape.

Gunman believed to be Dhulbahante-Naalaye Ahmed sub-clan carjacked a lorry belonging to Warsangeli-Ogayslabeh in Fiqi Fuliye Village (80km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 01/12. The motive of the carjacking is unknown. The vehicle had left Burao and was transporting goods to Fiqi Fuliye when the incident happened. Reports indicate that Dhulbahante elders went after the gunmen in a bid to persuade them to release the truck.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somalia forces in Mahadaay Village in (22km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 01/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a Somali forces position in Goof-Gaduud Village (25km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 01/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported. The attack occurred during the daytime hours.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 01/12. The fighting broke out after a group of government army (mixed clan) stationed in Buunda Yariisey was attacked by militia loyal to the District Commissioner of Afgooye (Geledi). The motive behind the attack remains unknown. One government soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base at the new airport in Kismaayo in the evening of 01/12. AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 01/12. The motive is unknown but reports indicate that the victim was a khat seller and most of his customers were government soldiers. The perpetrators escaped.

A young translator working for African Union Mission in Somalia troops was killed by suspected al Shabaab in Huriwaa Districts Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood. In response, government soldiers fired on the attackers, killing them.

A young translator working for African Union Mission in Somalia troops was killed this afternoon in Huriwaa Districts Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood. In response, government soldiers fired on the attackers, killing them.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali government in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the night of 02/12. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Geledi clan militias attacked Afgooye police station to release a Geledi detainee in the morning of 02/11. The fighting lasted for about 10 minutes and the militia withdrew without releasing their kinsman. Reports indicate that the army backed the police during the clash. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government forces at Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 02/12. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A device suspected to be a RCIED targeted pro-government forces (not named) on patrol in Ceel Waaq in the afternoon of 03/12. One pro-government soldier and two civilians were killed and eight others, including civilians, were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted an AMISOM water bowser in Aawdiinle Village in Baidoa District in the morning of 03/12. No casualties or damages were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali government forces based at Beled Weyne airstrip in the evening of 03/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against the AMISOM/Somali government forces base in the outskirts of Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 03/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of government forces clashed in Doonka Weynow (12km N of Afgooye) in the morning of 03/12. The fighting broke after one group attacked the other for setting up an illegal checkpoint and extorting money from public services vehicles. The check-point was removed following the clash. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM water bowser in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 03/12. The soldiers opened gunfire after the blast. One soldier was reportedly injured while the water bowser was completely destroyed by the explosion.

The Somalilands RRU (Rapid Response Unit) police dispersed a group of journalists who held a peaceful demonstration in front of Hubaal newspaper premises in 26 June District in Hargeisa in the morning of 03/12. The journalists were reportedly protesting against the release of one the masked gunmen who attacked Hubaal newspaper premise in the night of 24/04/13. The journalists claimed that the man was released without being taken to court. The RRU police reportedly used clubs to disperse the journalist and arrested four of them. They also confiscated equipment from the journalist during the arrest.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante-Hayaag two men from Habar Jeclo-Ahmed Farah in the vicinity of Ceegaag Village (47km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 03/12. The gunmen reportedly called the two-a driver and an assistant driver-purporting to be businessmen who wanted to hire their lorry to transport goods. The gunmen reportedly shot and injured the assistant driver during the incident. They also deflated the tires of the lorry before taking their hostage towards Buuhoodle town. The motive of the abduction is currently unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that it was related to inter-clan revenge.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against government forces based at Abdi Wayeel Cinema area (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The District Commissioner of Heliwa reportedly said two al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were captured. He also claimed that security forces seized small arms during the clash.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers walking in Ali Turcaaye neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 03/12. The device reportedly missed its target and landed in an empty place, causing no casualty. The soldiers opened fired after the blast. They also searched the area but made no arrest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Pro-al Shabaab media reported that al Shabaab fighters carried out a mortar attack against AMISOM and government forces based at Maslax camp (Heliwa District) on 03/12. The report stated that the al Shabaab fighters fired about 4-5 mortar rounds at the camp but AMISOM forces did not respond. The attack occurred in the early morning hours.

Dhulbanhate clan militia exchanged gunfire with two Habar Jeclo gunmen trying to steal goats in Qocondhaale Village, near Sool-Joogto (23km N of Buuhoodle) on 04/12. The militia managed to arrest one of the gunmen and later handed him to Somaliland police in Qorilugud Village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Somali government base in Lafoole settlement (7km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 04/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers to withdrew. No casualties were reported. Government forces conducted a security operation in Ceelasha settlement (Afgooye-Mogadishu road) in the morning of 05/12 and arrested unspecified number of people following the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against government forces based in Mahadaay Village (22km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 04/12. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Armed men shot and killed a civilian man and injured another in Qiracbuul neighbourhood in Luuq over unknown dispute in the night of 04/12. The perpetrators escaped but later surrendered to the ENDF.

A small group of people staged a peaceful demonstration at Sayidka Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 04/12 in support of the vote of no confidence in which the Somali prime minister was ousted. NSA officers dispersed the demonstrators.

A RCIED of unknown origin exploded in the area between Gulwade and Fanoole neighbourhoods (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 05/12. The device reportedly missed its target, which was an AMISOM convoy carrying the president of Jubaland towards the state house in Kismaayo. The president reportedly returned from the airport after meeting with an IGAD delegation.

Two rival militia groups (not identified) clashed over an unknown reason in K50 airstrip Village (20km SW Afgooye) in the afternoon of 05/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes. One militiaman was reportedly killed. Local elders stepped in to resolve the conflict.

A unidentified man threw a hand grenade Janaale market (14km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 05/12. The incident happened at a time when people were busy in the market. There were some soldiers in a nearby teashop by the time of the attack. One person was killed in the blast, five others injured. Police managed to arrest the perpetrator who was reportedly found with four other grenades.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: A person-borne IED targeted a Puntland Marine Police Forces (PMPF) convoy near Rowda Mosque in Bosasso in the morning of 05/12. Reports indicate that two foreign trainers working for Seracen were in the convoy. Seven people - three soldiers and four civilians - were killed in attack. A total of 37 persons, six soldiers and 31 civilians, were also wounded. The two trainers were unhurt. Latest reports on 07/12 indicate that the suicide bomber hails from Majeerten and came from Kismaayo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED exploded in the area between Gulwade and Fanoole neighbourhoods (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 05/12. The device reportedly missed its target, which was an AMISOM convoy carrying the president of Jubaland towards the state house in Kismaayo. The president reportedly returned from the airport after meeting with an IGAD delegation.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a government soldier in Dabakaayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 05/12. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the morning of 05/12. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Two militia groups hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad clashed following an escalated dispute over the control of an illegal checkpoint in Galkacyo South in the morning of 06/12. One militiaman was killed and another injured in the clash.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a prominent elder in near Ceel-Lahelay Village (65km NW of Ceel Buur) on 06/12. His body was found by locals near the village and had gunshot wounds. Unconfirmed reports suggest that he was killed by al Shabaab elements for reportedly opposing the collection of Zakat from the community.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at Puntland Darwish base in Sugure Village (35km S Bosasso) in the night of 06/12. Puntland forces did not respond to the shelling. One Darwish soldier was injured in the attack.

Unidentified attackers fired about four mortar rounds in Xamar Jadiid neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the night of 06/12. Two rounds reportedly landed in Xamar Jadiid neighbourhood while the other two hit near Sheekh Aadan Dheere neighbourhood. The motive behind the mortar attack remains unknown but it is believed that the attackers were targeting the presidential palace. Two civilians were injured in the attack. An unspecified number of houses were reportedly damaged.
A member of parliament is killed and another injured in an explosion near Villa Somalia. It is not clear if the MP was specifically targeted in the blast.

Unidentified gunmen driving in a small car opened fire and seriously injured a woman (a foreigner, not identified) in Baar Ubax neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 06/12. Reports indicate that the woman later succumbed to her injuries in a Mogadishu hospital. The incident happened after the victim left University of Somalias campus in the K4 area where she used to work as a lecturer. There is a conflicting report about her nationality; one version suggests that she was a Ugandan while the other reports indicate that she is from Zanzibar. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces come under mortar fire outside of Bosasso. Causalities not known.

About 10 people protested against a planned drilling of a borehole in Ina Xayir Village near Suryo Village (22km S of Burao) in the morning of 07/12. The protestors claimed the ownership of the land earmarked for the drilling of the borehole and shot in the air to stop the project. Police arrived and arrested more than five protestors.

Unidentified gunman shot and killed a man hailing from Jeron clan in Boqoley market in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 07/12. The motive is unknown. The victim was currently a driver of an INGO-rented vehicle but used to be a driver of an intelligence officer and pro-Somali government officials from Buur Hakaba.

Government soldiers manning a checkpoint in Lafoole settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) opened fire after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop in the morning of 07/12. The mini bus was heading to Afgooye town when the incident happened. One passenger was killed in the shooting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters in Banaadir governorate launched a missile attack on the AMISOM base at Stadium Mogadishu. No causalities reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers walking on the bridge in 21st October neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 08/12. The device missed its target and hit a nearby house, killing a woman and injuring four others, including a five year old boy who lost his leg. The perpetrators escaped.

A group of Somali government forces attacked the residence of a government forces officer in Kooshin neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the night of 08/12. It is not yet clear if it the attack was an intentional or a friendly fire. Some sources suggest that the soldiers were on foot patrol and the shoot-out broke out when they saw an armed man sitting in front of his residence, while other sources insist that it was a planned mission. Three soldiers were killed in the clash.

Hundreds of residents of K-50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) on 08/12 staged a peaceful demonstration calling on the Somali government to liberate the region (Lower Shabelle) from al Shabaab. The demonstrators waved banners with anti-al Shabaab slogans and called on the army to continue with the operations to liberate the whole region from al Shabaab. The villages chairman said the demonstration was the first of its kind in the region since government forces backed by AMISOM took over a number of districts in the region which were under al Shabaab control last year.

ASWJ forces attacked al Shabaab forces in Birta Dheer Village (11km SE of Garbarhaarey) in the morning of 8/12. Reports indicate that ASWJ forces were called back by ENDF before they took over the village since the offensive was not a coordinated military operation. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali forces base in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the night of 08/12. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash that lasted for about 15 minutes after which

Two groups of Somali soldiers clashed over extortion money at a road block in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 08/12. One of the two groups was reportedly forced to withdraw. Causalities not reported.

Gunmen hailing from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud carjacked a Toyota Mark II near Guud Cad Village (30km E of Qardho) on 08/12. The vehicle was transporting khat from Garowe to Bosasso by the time of the incident. The motive and the whereabouts the vehicle is currently unknown.

Militiamen hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad shot and killed two men hailing from Dir clan near Af-Barwaaqo Village (128 NE of Hobyo) in the morning of 08/12. The motive is reportedly clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacks a military base for the Kenyan contingent of AMISOM in Afmadow. Locals confirmed that they have heard heavy bombardment followed by fierce gun shooting over the midnight hour. Casualties not reported.

A man shot and killed another man in Ubaale Village (15km S of Hargeisa) in the morning of 08/12 following an escalated dispute on land ownership. Both the victim and perpetrator are from Cidagale sub-clan. Police arrested the perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Jubaland forces in the outskirts of Afmadow in the evening of 08/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

An ASNG police officer shot and injured two civilians in K4 neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the morning of 08/12. The reason behind the shooting is not yet clear but reports indicate that the incident happened following an argument over unknown issue. Police arrested the perpetrator.

column7: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
column17: Police dispersed supporters of UCID (opposition) Party after they gathered at the parties office in Hargeisa on 09/12. The move followed a call made by the parties leaders for nationwide rallies in protest against the blocking of the parties presidential candidate from visiting Gabiley town by the government. Police were also deployed in the parties office in Berbera and Borama, though there was no reported protests in those cities.

Hundreds of residents staged a demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 09/12. The demonstrators were reportedly demanding the arrest of Somali government forces who reportedly killed an army colonel in Kooshin neighbourhood in the night of 08/12. The protestors marched in the streets of Beled Weyne and reportedly burnt tires, and disrupted traffic. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in Kurtun Village (29km NE of Qansax Dhere) in the afternoon of 09/12. No casualties were reported. Kurtun is the main check-point in Qansax Dhere District, where al Shabaab fighters try to impose an economic siege on Qansax Dhere.

Two groups of government soldiers clashed in Lafoole settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 09/12. The fighting broke out after one group set up a road-block on the main road and was immediately attacked by other soldiers manning a nearby checkpoint. A woman in a nearby house was killed by a stray bullet.

Two groups of Somali government forces (Rahanweyn and Abgaal) clashed in Wanla Weyne in the night of 09/12 over an unknown issue. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly and stopped without intervention. One soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a tax collector and a civilian man in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 09/12. The two men were transferred to Mogadishu for treatment. The perpetrators escaped.
Somali soldiers manning a checkpoint in Lafoole settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) shot and injured a taxi driver in the afternoon of 09/12. The motive is currently unclear.

Somali government forces shot and injured a woman during food and non-food items distribution in Koongo Village (8km SW of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 09/12. The soldiers reportedly opened fire to disperse the surging crowd. The woman was among the families displaced by recent floods in Jowhar.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a government soldier in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 09/12. The perpetrators escaped.
Heavy battles reported between Somali and Ehtniopian forces and al Shabaab near the Beled Weyne airport. Causalities reported, though not confirmed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM water bowser in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 10/12. The water bowser was transporting water from Ceel-Jaale (8km NW of Marka) when the incident happened. AMISOM forces conducted a security operation in the area immediately after the blast and arrested an unspecified number of people. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of Somali government forces clashed in Qalimow Village (11km NW of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 10/12. The reason behind the clash is currently unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the fighting broke out following a dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. Two soldiers were killed and another injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces in Shalaambood in the evening of 10/12. The fighting lasted for about few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit -and-run attack against government forces in Afmadow in the evening of 10/12. The two sides exchanged small arms fire for about 10 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A group of journalists staged a peaceful demonstration in Borama on 10/12 in protest against the arrest of journalists and continued harassment of media workers. Reports indicate that the protest coincided with the World Human Rights Day.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a customs officer in Argada area (Kismaayo) in the evening of 10/12. The motive is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers ambushed a civilian vehicle near Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 10/12. The vehicle managed to escape. Although the reason behind the attack is not clear, it is believed that the target was a Somali government official travelling in the vehicle. A female passenger was killed and another injured in the shooting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against the new airport in Kismaayo in the evening of 10/12. Neither the Jubaland forces nor the KDF responded to the brief shooting by the al Shabaab fighters. No casualties were reported.

An armed man hailing from Habar Jeclo/Ahmed Abokor shot in the air to disperse a group of boys who were throwing stones at a wedding party in Hodan Qaylo neighbourhood in the evening of 11/12. It is not known why the group was causing the disturbance. A stray bullet hit and killed passerby hailing from Habar Jeclo/Reer Yusuf. Police arrested the perpetrator. Following the incident, tensions in the town reportedly ran high between Habar Jeclo/Reer Yusuf and Habar Jeclo/Abokor Ahmed on 14/12 after the Reer Yusuf clan refused to bury the deceased person.

Unidentified perpetrators hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Horseed neighbourhood judge in Baidoa in the evening of 11/12. A civilian by-stander was injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

An armed man hailing from Habar Jeclo/Ahmed Abokor shot in the air to disperse a group of boys who were throwing stones at a wedding party in Hodan Qaylo neighbourhood in the evening of 11/12. It is not known why the group was causing the disturbance. A stray bullet hit and killed passerby hailing from Habar Jeclo/Reer Yusuf. Police arrested the perpetrator. Following the incident, tensions in the town reportedly ran high between Habar Jeclo/Reer Yusuf and Habar Jeclo/Abokor Ahmed on 14/12 after the Reer Yusuf clan refused to bury the deceased person.

An unidentified gunman shot and wounded a man hailing from a minority clan (Bantu) in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 11/12. The motive apparently is related to a land dispute and the perpetrator escaped. The man is stable in hospital.

Two groups of Somali forces clashed in Odweyne settlement (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 11/12. The fighting broke out as a result of an escalated land dispute. The fighting went on for about 10 minutes and stopped without any intervention. One soldier killed in the clash.
Twelve are killed in a battle between Somali government/Ethiopian forces and al Shabaab in Qansadheer. The fighting began after joint forces attacked an al Shabaab position.
Somali military infighting kills two soldiers in Middle Shabeelle. Exact location and specific circumstances not known.
Unidentified persons shot and killed two government soldiers who were collecting taxes in Dayniile district. It is not clear if the tax collecting was legitimate.

Armed militias from Xawadle/Aadan Warsame and Dir/Fiqi Cumar clashed in Kabxanley Village (24km N of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 12/12. Reports indicate that the Xawadle militias burnt the village, sparing only the mosque. The fighting is believed to be related to farm ownership in the area. Seven people were reportedly killed and 11 others injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired five mortar rounds towards Shatiguduud airport in Baidoa in the night of 12/12. The mortar rounds landed inside AMISOM compound. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces in Baidoa on three fronts in the night of 12/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire during the clashes that went on for about an hour. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters were about 100 in number. Four government soldiers were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Unidentified body of a young man was found in Lafoole area (6km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 12/12. The body had gunshot wounds. The motive and the identity of the perpetrators are currently unknown.

A privately-owned lorry en route to Garowe from Bosasso was carjacked by gunmen from the Majeerten/Osman Mohamud in Guud Cad Village (30Km N of Qardho) on 12/12. The vehicle belongs to Dhulbahante sub-clan. The gunmen fired into the air during the carjacking and took the vehicle to Habaal Reer (40km E of Qardho).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces hailing from Ogaden clan conducted security operations in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 12/12 following the killing of a security officer (an Ogaden). The security forces searched houses in the neighbourhood and Qiilmawaye Hotel, where Majeerten militias are based. Reports indicate that the security forces assaulted youths and arrested others. A soldier from Majerteen clan was shot and killed and his colleague injured after they refused to surrender.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Jubaland forces officer hailing from Ogaden clan in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 12/12. The victim was shot after leaving Express Mosque near Dahabshil office. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces hailing from Ogaden clan conducted security operations in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 12/12 following the killing of a security officer (an Ogaden). The security forces searched houses in the neighbourhood and Qiilmawaye Hotel, where Majeerten militias are based. Reports indicate that the security forces assaulted youths and arrested others. A soldier from Majerteen clan was shot and killed and his colleague injured after they refused to surrender.

A RCIED targeted government soldiers sitting in teashop near Baar Ubax Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 12/12. The device was planted in the teashop which is frequented by Somali soldiers. One soldier and a female bystander were reportedly killed in the explosion while two other soldiers were injured.

A group of unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Dayniile District Commissioner in Isse Abdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 12/12. The incident was followed by exchange of gunfire between the attackers and the security guards at the residence. The motive remains unknown and the attackers escaped.
Fighting for land dominance, warring clan militias clash over three consecutive days in Aybutey/Gumesi Diid Village (23km NE of Marka). 20 reported dead total.
Al Shabaab forces attack Baidoa, targeting the homes of government officials. No causalities reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at government soldiers in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 13/12. The device missed its target and hit landed in a residential house nearby. Three children were injured. One of them later succumbed to his injuries. The perpetrators escaped.

Somali government soldiers shot and killed an elder in Mukayga neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 13/12. Reports add that the elder had a pistol and he was shot as the soldiers tried to disarm him after he refused to surrender it. The elder hails from Habar Gidir/Duduble sub clan. Three other people were injured by stray bullets.

Unidentified perpetrators hurled a hand grenade at pro-Somali government forces (not identified) on patrol at Olympic Junction in Berdaale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 13/12. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. A small boy was hit on the arm by the gunfire opened by the soldiers. The hand grenade caused no casualties.
Arrests: Police raided the Hargeisa offices of the Hubaal newspaper, arrested two staff members, and ordered the publication to be shut down after the paper published a story critical of police.
Fighting for land dominance, warring clan militias clash over three consecutive days in Aybutey/Gumesi Diid Village (23km NE of Marka). 20 reported dead total.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against government forces in Sabuun Village (12km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 14/12. The soldiers were deployed to the area to prevent clashes between Abgal and Shidle clans. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters managed to take over control of the village. The Somali forces withdrew to Jowhar. Casualties could not be established.

A man hailing from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud shot and injured his fellow clansman in Dahabshiil area (Galkacyo North) in the afternoon of 14/12 following an escalated dispute. Local militia arrested the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab attackers launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali forces in Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night 14/12. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire for 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Three people were killed in the clash. Security forces conducted a door-to-door security operation in the area the following morning but it is unclear whether they made arrests.

Al Shabaab launched an attack on government bases in Arafat neighbourhood of Yaaqshid Ditrict.The reports add that the attack caused deaths and injuries although the exact number cannot be ascertained.

Somali government forces kill a prominent elder after stopping him while driving along Geedka Mukayga area of Afgooye. There have been conflicting reports on incident in which Somali government forces are said to have sprayed the elders vehicle with bullets.
A powerful explosion targets government soldiers at Seybiyano neighbourhood in Hodan District during the evening hours. Causalities and perpetrators not known.
Warring clan militias clash over three consecutive days in Aybutey/Gumesi Diid Village (23km NE of Marka). 20 reported dead in total. Military forces entered fighting on the third day.

Habar Gidir and Biyo Maal clan militias clashed in Busley Daud Village (25km NE of Qoryooley) in the morning of 15/12. The fighting is related to the sporadic fighting between the two clans in some parts of Afgooye and Marka districts. Casualties could be established.

Habar Gidir and Biyo Maal clan militias clashed in an area near Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 15/12 following disputes over farmlands ownership. Casualties could not be established.

Arrests: Somali forces conducted security operations in Baidoa over two days, 14-15/12 and arrested about 400 people suspected of being al Shabaab.sympathizers/operatives. Three hundred and fifty of them were later released after they were interrogated with the help of AS defectors. Most of those arrested were from Baidoa.

Three men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man inside a mosque in Xamar Bile neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 15/12. The deceased used to make the call for the prayer in the mosque and was well-known in the neighbourhood. The motive is unknown. Security forces arrived in the area but made no arrests.

Habar Gidir militia took over control of K50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 16/12 after a brief clash with Biyo Maal militia. The village used to be a base of Biyo Maal militia. No casualties were reported.

Youths hailing from a minority clan (Muse Dheriyo) staged a demonstration in Daami neighbourhood in Hargeisa in the evening of 16/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the murder of a woman hailing from the clan by youths from Habar Awal/Isse Muse, date and circumstances unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Ceeljaale, outside of Marka. Casualties include the towns administrator, as well as several of his security guards.

Habar Gidir and Biyo Maal militias renew clashes near K50 village, 20km SW of Afgooye, leading to ""deaths and injuries."" Habar Gidir forces had recently gained control of the area. No specific numbers provided.
Military forces repel an al Shabab attack in Wanlaweyn district. Two local residents died after al-Shabab attacked the area.
A government soldier shot and killed his colleague following an escalated dispute over khat in Garbahaarey in the morning of 17/12. The perpetrator was immediately arrested.

Two groups of gunmen dressed in military uniforms clashed in Uurkus area (Balcad) in the afternoon of 17/12 following an escalated dispute over money extorted from public transport vehicles. No casualties were reported.

A group of people-prominent elders, councillors, and other prominent individual-staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo liberty garden on 17/12. The group was protesting against the chairman of Somaliland food coordination whom they accused of stopping food aid donated by a UN agency to Sanaag Region. The demonstrators reportedly called on Somaliland government to address the matter.

A man hailing from Darood/Lelkase stabbed and injured a man from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the morning of 17/12 following an escalated private dispute. The perpetrator escaped.
A notable elder is shot and killed in a town north of Galkacayo. The reason for the assassination is not clear. A woman who was near to the place was also killed in the attack.
Al Shabaab forces killed a civilian khat trader on the outskirts of Baardheere district. Al Shabaab are opposed to the consumption of khat, which is considered a narcotic.

Taxi drivers staged a demonstration at Hargeisa airport on 18/12 protesting against the Ministry of Aviation for awarding picking of passengers service to a local private taxi company. The demonstration translated into a fist fight between the protestors and the drivers of the taxi company. Police arrested a number drivers involved in the scuffle.

Clan militias from Habar Gidir and Biyo Maal clashed in K50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 18/12. The fighting started after the Biyo Maal militias launched an attack against the Habar Gidir in order to regain control of K50 Village. Both sides exchanged light and heavy gunfire during the clash. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM position at Kismaayo airport in the evening of 18/12. The al Shabaab fighters used small arms fire during the attack. AMISOM forces did not respond. No casualties were reported.

group of people staged a demonstration in Borama in the morning of 18/12 in protest against the arrival of the former leaders of Awdal state. The visit followed talks between Somaliland authorities and the Awdal state officials in Dubai and Hargeisa.
Suspected al Shabaab shot dead three Syrian doctors and their three Somali colleagues along a road connecting Mogadishu and Afgooye as they travelled to a hospital in Medina district.

Militias from Habar Gidir and Biyo Maal clashed in Kali-Caafimaad Village (19km NE of Marka) in the afternoon of 19/12. The fighting erupted after Habar Gidir militias attacked Biyo Maal militia base in Kali-Caafimaad Village. Both sides exchanged light and heavy gunfire during the clash. At least six combatants were killed in the clash.

Somali forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Ufuurow Village (30km SW of Qansax Dheere) in the late morning of 19/12. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and three others were injured in the clash. Government forces later returned to the base in Qansax Dheere.

Women hailing from Habar Jeclo/Adurihim and Habar Yonis/Abdala Hamud sub-clans clashed in Ceerigaabo town using stones and other crude weapons in the evening of 19/12. The incident happened after women from Habar Jeclo attacked shops belonging to Habar Yonis women. The reason behind the clash is currently unclear. A number were injured. Police dispersed the rival groups.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Reports from Lafoole district indicate that heavy fighting between al Shabaab and AMISOM troops took place in Ceelgaroon area on the night of 19 December. The fighting started after the al Shabaab forces attacked an AMISOM base in the area. Causalities not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Government forces backed by Kenyan troops have clashed against Al-Shabab militants in southern Somali town of Kulibiyow. The fighting erupted after a group of Al-Shabab fighters carried out a surprise attack on the Somali and Kenyan army bases in the area. Causalities not known.

Police in Lawya Caddo Village (Zeylac District) reportedly assaulted a local a reporter for the Hargeisa-based TV on 20/12 for covering a demonstration staged by local residents and a group of travellers. The demonstrators were reportedly protesting against the new tax rates imposed on commercial vehicles and passengers crossing the border to Djibouti. The reporter managed to escape from the police but they later picked him from his home and detained him. Reports indicate that he was released after two hours.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at AMISOM forces position at Shati Guduud airport in Baidoa in the morning of 20/12. Al Shabaab fighters also fired anti-aircraft fire in the direction of Baidoa town. No casualties were reported in both attacks. AMISOM forces conducted a security operation in the direction of the mortar attacks but there were reports of armed clashes with the al Shabaab fighters or arrests.

The body of a man dressed in a military uniform was found near Wanla Weyne town in the morning of 20/12. The body had gunshot wounds. The identity and the motive of the perpetrators are currently unclear.

A group of people staged a demonstration against the inland revenue office in Lawya Caddo Village in Zeylac District on 20/12 in protest against the new tax rates imposed on commercial vehicles and passengers crossing the border to Djibouti. The demonstrators comprised of local residents and passengers of five vehicles held in the village. The protestors reportedly burned tires during the demonstration. Police arrested a number of people.

A man from Dir/Fiqi Umar shot and injured a man hailing from Xawadle in Kabxanley Village (40km N of Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 20/12. The incident is related to clan retaliation between the two clans.

An unidentified gunman shot and seriously injured the human resources manager of Hargeisa Electricity Company in Geed Goble neighbourhood in Hargeisa on 20/13. The motive of the attack is currently unclear. The perpetrator escaped.

A RCIED exploded as government police EOD team try to dismantle it in Xamar Jab Jab District in the morning of 20/12. It is believed that the device was detonated by a remote control. Reports indicate that the device was planted in a big dustbin distributed to Mogadishu districts by the Turkish government. One police officer was reportedly injured in the blast.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers based near Black Sea Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 20/12. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceelasha settlement in the night of 21/12. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after that the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A number of people, mostly drivers and business people staged a demonstration in front of the custom and inland revenue office in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 21/10. The demonstrators were reportedly protesting against new tax rates imposed on goods being ferried from Bosasso and Burao. Police arrived at the scene and arrested four demonstrators.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy near Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Hodan District) in the evening of 21/12. The convoy was heading to AMISOM base located in the military academy when the incident happened. Casualties could not be established. An unspecified number of AMISOM vehicles were damaged in the explosion.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Somali government soldier in Zone K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 21/12. The victim was heading to his base after leaving a teashop nearby where he was chewing khat when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped. Security forces later came to the scene and took the body.

Government soldiers infighting causes ten deaths in Raqeyle neighbourhood of Afgooye town. Following an hour of fighting, AMISOM forces in the town separated the two sides. The reason for the clash is not known.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Somali government forces based in Guufaale Village east of Beled Weyne in the night of 21/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab elements withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police guarding customs office in Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo (North) in the evening of 21/12. The police opened fire after the blast. One police officer was reportedly killed and an unspecified number of others were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali forces base in Lafoole settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 21/12. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The Somali forces in the area co

Seven are dead and others wounded during a clash between government forces and a unidentified militia. The militia had established an illegal checkpoint in the area. Days earlier Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud announced any soldiers found manning an illegal checkpoint would be shot.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Presidential Security Unit
column17: Puntland Presidential candidate Abdi Dahir Yusufs convoy is attack by presidential guards of the current officer holder. The candidate escaped unharmed.

A group of people staged a demonstration in central Burao in the evening of 22/12 in protest against the transfer of the divisional police commander. The protestors accused the police commissioner of contributing insecurity in Togdheer by transferring the competent commander who had improved security in the region. The demonstrators reportedly stoned vehicles using the main road and damaged some of them. Police arrived at the scene but did not manage to disperse them. The protesters dispersed after local traditional elders intervened.

Pro-government police militia (not identified) conducted a security operation in Cabuud Waaq in the afternoon of 22/12. The operation was reportedly aimed to confiscate unregistered arms in the town. The security forces shot and killed an armed man who refused to surrender his gun.

Fishermen in Berbera staged a demonstration in front of the offices of the mayor and the governor on 22/12 in protest against plans by the government to hand over a local fishing company to a businessman. The fishermen reportedly called on the government to stop the transfer.

Two groups of Somali soldiers hailing from Abgaal and Murusade sub-clans clashed in Afgooye in the morning of 22/12. The fighting erupted when the Abgaal soldiers attacked the Murusade group who were manning a checkpoint in Mukayga area within Afgooye town. The fighting went on for about two hours after which the Abgaal soldiers took over the control of the checkpoint. The motive is believed to be related to money extorted from motorists. At least eight people, most of them civilians, were killed and more than eight others were injured in the clash.

A group of militiamen hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad, who control illegal checkpoints in the outskirts of Galkacyo (South), clashed among themselves in the morning of 22/12. The brief shoot-out broke out after some members of the militia blocked vehicles from Galkacyo from proceeding to Galinsoor. The shoot-out stopped without any intervention. The incident disrupted traffic temporarily. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-an-run attack against Janaale police station (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 22/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two soldiers were reportedly killed while four civilian bystanders were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against government forces position in Lafoole settlement (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 22/12. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against pro-government forces (not identified) in Garbahaarey in the evening of 22/12. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire during the clash. No casualties were reported.

A group of university students staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Mogadishu airport in the morning of 22/12 in protest against the killings of Syrian doctors by unidentified gunmen in Sinka Dheer area on 18/12. The students called on security agencies to arrest the perpetrators. The student staged the demonstration at a time when two Syrian doctors, who were injured in the attack, were being evacuated from Mogadishu airport for further treatment. Reports indicate that some of the slain doctors were lectures at local universities.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at soldiers based at SOS Junction (Heliwa District) in the evening of 22/12. The soldiers opened fire after the blast but no casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified armed men kill a member of the Presidential staff while he shopped in Bakaaraha Market.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Malin Taajir area of Bakaara Market (Hawl- Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 22/12. The motive remains unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Unconfirmed report - Al Shabaab forces overtake several locations around Janaale following clashes with government forces. Radio Andalus is pro-al Shabaab. Causalities not reported or not known.

A delegation led by four cabinet ministers arrived in Burao in the morning of 23/12 on a mission to defuse the tension resulting from violent demonstrations over the transfer of Togdheer police divisional commander. The ministers held a protest against the violence, asking the public to remain calm.

Pro-Somali (not identified) forces attacked a home of an al Shabaab fighter in Qeydar Edi Village (28km NW of Xudur) in the night of 23/12. The al Shabaab fighters and the pro-government forces exchanged gunfire briefly. The wife and a child of the al Shabaab fighter were killed while the al Shabaab fighter himself was injured. The pro-Somali forces took his gun and left the village.

Two groups of Somali government forces clashed in Doonka Weynow (12km N of Afgooye) in the morning of 23/12. The fighting broke out after one group attacked the other for allegedly extorting money from public service vehicles at an illegal checkpoint. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the group manning the checkpoint withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Armed militias manning a checkpoint in Ceel-Wareegow Village (11km NE of Marka) shot and killed a civilian man in the morning 23/12. The victim was travelling in a mini-bus heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened. The victim hails from Dir/Qubeys. He was probably mistakenly shot by Biyo Maal militias thinking that he was Habar Gidir.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Puntland police on patrol opened fire at a speeding car in Garowe in the evening of 23/12 after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop. The police arrested the driver as he tried to escape. No casualties were reported.

More than a hundred people, mostly youths and women, staged a violent demonstration in central Burao in the morning of 23/12 in protest against the transfer of the divisional police commander. The demonstrators burned tires in the middle of the roads and marched to the governors office. Police fired in the air to disperse the protestors. One person was reportedly killed and twenty others - including a police officer - were injured during the demonstration. This was the second day of protests. Local authorities implemented a curfew to counter the protests.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Village Restaurant in Zone K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 23/12. The device hit the perimeter wall of the restaurant and caused no casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of government forces clash outside of Beled Weyne, near Kalabayr junction. Two injuries reported. The cause of the clash is not known. Ethiopian forces intervene and separate the two sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attack a AMISOM base near K60 village the night of 24/12. No causalities figures released. Radio Andalus is pro al Shabaab.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a mortar attack against the new Kismaayo airport in the evening of 24/12. Three mortar rounds landed in the airports perimeter but did not cause any damage. No casualties were reported. It is not clear if military installations or civilians were targeted in the attack.

ENDF and pro-Somali government soldiers (not identified) clashed briefly at an ENDF check-point in Ceel Gaal (13km NE of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 24/12. The incident happened after a pro-government vehicle failed to stop at the ENDF check-point. Reports indicate that a pro-government soldier fell from the vehicle and got injured during the shoot-out. No other casualty was reported. It is not clear if this clash is related to a similar one near Kalabayr junction.

Unidentified warplanes attacked Jadecaley Village (19km NW of Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 24/12. Reports indicate that the planes took off from Kismaayo airport. No civilian casualties were reported. Al Shabaab casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF military convoy in Guraa Village (31km NW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 24/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The convoy had left Bulo-Xawo and was heading to Garbahaarey when the ambush happened. Five casualties reported.

A RCIED targeted an ENDF military convoy in Bursagaar Village (27km NW of Garbarhaarey) in the morning of 24/12. The RCIED attack was followed by armed clash between al Shabaab fighters and the ENDF that went on for about an hour. The 14-truck convoy was carrying supplies to Garbahaarey and had left Bulo-Xawo when the attack happened. Latest reports indicate that the convoy finally reached Garbahaarey in the afternoon after the two ambushes. Casualties not known.

A RCIED targeted an ENDF military convoy in Bursagaar Village (27km NW of Garbarhaarey) in the morning of 24/12. The RCIED attack was followed by armed clash between al Shabaab fighters and the ENDF that went on for about an hour. Reports indicate that four ENDF soldiers were killed and two others were injured in the blast. Seven al Shabaab fighters were killed and a number of others wounded in the clash. The 14-truck convoy was carrying supplies to Garbahaarey and had left Bulo-Xawo when the attack happened.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Garbarhaarey which is under the control of pro-Somali government forces (not identified) in the afternoon of 24/12. The al Shabaab fighters and pro-government forces exchanged heavy gunfire for about half an hour after which

Gunmen hailing from the Lelkase clan carjacked a lorry belonging to Habar Gidir/Saleeban at the green line market (Galkacyo) in the morning of 24/12. The motive is believed to be a revenge for the carjacking of a lorry belonging to Lelkase by Saleeban gunmen in Cadaado. The gunmen opened fire at the lorry during the carjacking. No casualties were reported. The whereabouts of the vehicle is currently unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: Puntland Marine Police Forces (PMPF) on foot patrol clashed with the security guards of Ali Haji (Candidate) in the night of 24/12. The incident happened after the PMPF saw an armed man sitting in front of the residence while other sources insist that it was a planned mission. Some sources suggest that the guards opened fire at the PMPF who responded with gunfire. It is not yet clear if the attack was an intentional or a friendly fire. The operational commander arrived at the scene and managed to separate the two sides. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 24/12. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Militiamen hailing from Marehan attacked pro-Somali government police (not identified) on foot patrol in Cabuud Waaq in the evening of 25/12. The two sides exchanged gun fire for about 20 minutes. One police officer was killed and three others injured. The motive of the attack is believed to in revenge for the killing of one of their clan member during a disarmament operation two days earlier.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against an ENDF position in Janta-Kundisho (5km E of Beled Weyne) in the evening of 25/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A security guard of one the presidential candidates in Puntland reportedly assaulted a local TV reporter in Garowe in the morning of 25/12. The incident happened at a time when 10 presidential candidates were holding a meeting in a Garowe.

Groups of students from 15th May Primary School in Burao clashed using stones on 24/12. The incident is related to the clashes between youths from eastern and western neighbourhoods of Burao following escalated protests against the transfer of Togdheer police divisional commander. The RRU (Rapid Response Unit) police shot in the air and managed to disperse the rival students. The school principal and a number of teachers were injured by the stone-throwing students.

Drivers of water bowsers staged a demonstration in Hargeisa in protest against Hargeisa Municipal Council on 26/12 for imposing tax on water ferried by the bowsers. The drivers parked the more than 100 water bowsers near Araweello and Shiracle hotels during the protest.

A RCIED targeted a civilian vehicle along the airport road in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 26/12. A woman was injured in the blast. It is nor clear if the intended target was indeed the civilian vehicle.

Leysan clan militia burned a farm and a house belonging to a Harin farmer in Dambale (21km NW of Baidoa) in a long standing clan dispute between the two Rahanweyn sub-clans on 26/12. No causalities or injuries reported. Soon after, Pro-Somali government forces (Leysan) based in Goof-Gaduud and Shabeellow (29km NW of Baidoa) went to the village to back their clan members but were confronted by al Shabaab fighters in Dambale. Five combatants were killed and nine others were injured in the subsequent clash.

Local media reported that two al Shabaab groups clashed along the outskirts of Baraawe in the midday of 26/12 over unknown reason. Casualties could not be established. This information could not be independently verified.

Taxi drivers operating at Egal airport in Hargeisa staged a demonstration in the morning of 26/12. The taxi drivers were reportedly protesting against a decision in which the minister of civil aviation awarded the passengers services at the airport to a private taxi company.

About 12 militias loyal to Barre Hiraale attacked the residence the Jubaland minister of commerce and a neighbouring building occupied by Jubaland forces in Farjano neighbourhood in the evening of 26/12. The attackers and the Jubaland forces exchanged small arms fire for about 20 minutes after which the Hiraales militia withdrew. One injured Hiraales militiaman was captured by the Jubaland forces and later died of torture. Two other attackers were injured in the clash but were taken by their colleagues as they withdrew.

Leysan clan militia burned a farm and a house belonging to a Harin farmer in Dambale (21km NW of Baidoa) in a long standing clan dispute between the two Rahanweyn sub-clans on 26/12. No causalities or injuries reported. Soon after, Pro-Somali government forces (Leysan) based in Goof-Gaduud and Shabeellow (29km NW of Baidoa) went to the village to back their clan members but were confronted by al Shabaab fighters in Dambale. Five combatants were killed and nine others were injured in the subsequent clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: About 12 militias loyal to Barre Hiraale attacked the residence the Jubaland minister of commerce and a neighbouring building occupied by Jubaland forces in Farjano neighbourhood in the evening of 26/12. The attackers and the Jubaland forces exchanged small arms fire for about 20 minutes after which the Hiraales militia withdrew. One injured Hiraales militiaman was captured by the Jubaland forces and later died of torture. Two other attackers were injured in the clash but were taken by their colleagues as they withdrew.
Suspected al Shabaab targets a military convoy with a remote-controlled road side bomb in Mogadishu (district not named) causing 12 deaths.

At least four soldiers were killed and 11 people wounded in an explosion at Mogadishu restaurant often frequented by soldiers (district not named). Of the wounded, four included civilians. Authorities attribute al Shabaab for the violence.

Unidentified gunmen attack the home of the water minister in the interim Jubba administration. Witnesses confirmed that the ministers bodyguards and the gunmen briefly exchanged gunfire. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based at Beled Weyne airstrip in the night of the 27/12. The al Shabaab fighters used RPGs and mortars during the clash that lasted for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not been established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeting an AMISOM military convoy in Marka on 27/12. Unconfirmed reports indicate that four Burundian soldiers were killed in the blast and a number of others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at an AMISOM military convoy in Rusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 27/12. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. Three bystanders were injured in the explosion. The AMISOM forces conducted a security operation after the blast but made no arrest.

An unidentified man shot and killed an elder in Afgooye in the evening of 27/12. Security forces conducted an operation and arrested a number of people in connection with the murder. Reports further indicate that the perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces base in Bilis Qooqaani Village (48km NW of Afmadow) in the evening of 27/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified armed men attacked the residence of Heliwa District Commissioner close to the district police station in the evening of 27/12.
