Two clan militias from Biimaal and Habagidir clashed in K-50 settlement in the morning of 26/07/2014. The clashes reportedly started when militiamen from Biimaal clan attacked Habargidir militiamen based in the K-50 settlements. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 17 people from both sides died in the clashes. Biimaal Militias were later pushed back.

Two armed militiamen from Biimaal and Habargidir clans clashed in K-50 settlement in the night of 26/07. The clashes followed another clash between them in the village in the morning hours of the same day. Casualties from the both sides could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM in Danow village (8 KM NW of Shalaambood) on 26/07. There was an exchange of gun fire for around 15 minutes and after that, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No reports of casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters reportedly beheaded a civilian person hailing from Leysaan sub clan of Rahanweyne in Haawey Qoromay which locates close to Kurtun (20 Km N of Berdaale)in the morning of 26/07. The al Shabaab fighters had arrested the civilian man from Kurtun village two days before and took him to Haawey Qoromay, where they beheaded him and later reported the death to his parents.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JLF on night security patrol encountered a group of 6 suspected al Shabaab members who were trying to plant an RCIED in Farjano neighbourhood on the 26/07. A heavy gun fire exchange between the JLF and suspected al Shabaab group occurred and the perpetrators managed to escape. No casualties or arrests were reported. The materials were recovered.

Al Shabaab fighters have launched a hit and run attack on SNG forces position in SOS neighbourhood in the night of 26/07. Clashes lasted for few minutes and casualties from both sides could not be established.
Two groups of SNGF exchanged gun fire after a dispute escalated on the 26/07. Four soldiers were killed and two more injured.

Unidentified armed men driving tri-cycle motor-bikes shot and killed a man in Yaaqshid Police station area in the afternoon of 26/07. The victim reportedly was a former member of Hisbul Islam that joint al Shabaab but the victim reportedly defected from al Shabaab a year before. The reason for the killing remains unclear but the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against SNG forces base in Gubta neighbourhood in the evening of 26/07. The forces responded with gunfire. One soldier was reportedly killed and two others wounded. The attackers managed to escape from the scene.
A hand grenade was hurled against a SNGF security outpost in Oodweyne on the 26/07. Soldiers started to shoot in all direction as a response and no casualties or arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Towfiiq neighbourhood in the night of 26/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire including RPGs during the clashes but casualties could not be established.

Three unidentified gunmen armed with pistols have killed a former Al-Shabaab officer in Mogadishus Yaaqshid District. The gunmen shot dead their former who had earlier defected to the federal government of Somalia at a place very close to Mogadishus Yaaqshid District police station.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMISOM position in Rabdhure in the night of 27/07. Both sides exchanged gun fire which lasted a few minutes after that al Shabaab withdrew from the town. No casualties were reported from any side.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds at the positions of Jubaland forces based in Mudawa Island (96km SW of Kismaayo) in the morning and afternoon of 27/07. No casualties were reported but reports indicate that a number of houses were destroyed.

The convoy of Mayor/Governor Mungab was targeted with an RCIED (most likely a VBIED) which exploded as his convoy passed the area of Hotel Lafa-weyn. Mayor/Governor Mungab, who was travelling in a special armoured vehicle, survived the assassination attempt but his vehicle was damaged. Two Security forces travelling in the convoy were killed by the explosion.

A number of Somali government soldiers were last night killed in various incidents in Mogadishu districts of Wardhigley and Wadajir (Medina). The first soldier was gunned down in the neighbourhood of Hararyaale. The men who are armed with pistols shot dead the soldier as he was walking along a street in the area. The second soldier is also said to have been killed behind Madina Hospital and was shot in the upper body several times. Al Shabaab is suspected.

A number of Somali government soldiers were last night killed in various incidents in Mogadishu districts of Wardhigley and Wadajir (Medina). The first soldier was gunned down in the neighbourhood of Hararyaale. The men who are armed with pistols shot dead the soldier as he was walking along a street in the area. The second soldier is also said to have been killed behind Madina Hospital and was shot in the upper body several times. Al Shabaab is suspected.

A car is discovered by security forces loaded with explosives at Liido Beach (Cabdulcasis District) and detonated in a safe manner. The explosives were found at a time when the beach was crowded. Discovery occurred on or around 29/07.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Dhagax Tuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in protest against new tax increase on taxi business on 29/07. A SNG police officer opened fire at the demonstrators, injuring two.

Gunmen from Dir/Qubays sub-clan carjacked a truck belonging to Habar Gidir/Saleban in an area near Bajeelo Village (110 km N of Hobyo) in the afternoon of 29/07. The motive is reportedly a revenge for previous carjacking by Saleban gunmen. Elders from the two sides stepped in to secure the release of the truck.

Non-violent activity: A group of men entered the premise of Ogaal-a local Somalia newspaper in Hargeisa in the evening of 29/07 and threatened journalists. One of the men was reportedly armed with a pistol. The group warned the journalists against publishing reports against the government and the minister in the office of the president.

Al Shabaab fighters seized a vehicle transporting charcoal destined for Kismaayo in the outskirts of Abdi-Dhore Village (30km W Kismaayo) on 29/07. The al Shaaab fighters beheaded the driver and burnt the vehicle and its cargo. The body of the driver was dumped on the road to Kismaayo.
Three combatants have been killed and many others injured as Al-Shabaab fighters attacked government forces in south-western Somali town of Bardaale. Exact date not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab gunmen attack Jubba and AMISOM forces at the Kismayo Universities area late in the evening. Causality numbers not provided.

Jubaland forces led by Iftin Basto (Awramale sub-clan) conducted a security operation in villages west of Kismaayo on 30/07. The Jubaland forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Abdi-Dhore Village a day after al Shabaab fighters beheaded a driver of a vehicle transporting charcoal in the village. Seven al Shabaab fighters and one Jubaland soldier were killed in the clash. Jubaland forces managed to take over the village.

Residents of Xarrirad Village (58km SE of Borama) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authorities office on 30/07 in protest against acute water shortage that hit the village. The demonstrators also demanded the election of a new local council after claiming the current was incompetent.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a prominent elder hailing from Rahaweyn/Elaay sub-clan in Dooyada Ugaarey Village, which is close to Buur Hakaba in the night of 30/07. The motive is unknown. The elder was reportedly a member of a local committee tasked to distribute food aid donated by Arab countries.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A Darawish soldier shot and killed his colleague in Garowe in the morning of 30/07. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator hails from Dhulbahante while the victim is from Majerteen. Police arrested the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a woman operating a small tea shop in front of her house in Bagdhad Village (Badhaadhe District) in the morning of 30/07. The woman was not wearing the Islamic veil and was reportedly shot after arguing with the al Shabaab fighters who ordered her to wear the veil.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces based in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 30/07. The SNG forces opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

NISA forces conducted a security operation in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 30/07. Five al Shabaab operatives armed with pistols in Toyota Noah attacked the NISA forces conducting the operation. Two al Shabaab fighters and a NISA soldier were killed in the clash while another soldier was injured. Two al Shabaab fighters were captured while the fifth one managed to escape with the vehicle.

NISA forces shot and killed a civilian man who was reportedly chasing a SNG soldier in K4 check point in Wadajir District in the evening of 30/07. The shooting happened after the soldier being chased called for help from the NISA forces at the checkpoint. The NISA soldiers opened fire and killed the civilian after he ignored instructions to stop. The reason behind the conflict between the soldier and the civilian is unknown.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a shopkeeper in Kaaraans main market (Kaaraan District) over dispute of extortion money demanded by the soldier. The perpetrator escaped.
A woman in southern Somalia town of Jamame was killed by Al-Shabaab after refusing to wear the Hijab.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces sitting in teashop near Aargada area (Marka) in the afternoon of 31/07. Nine soldiers and the teashop lady were injured in the blast. SNG soldiers launched an operation and arrested an injured young man with a pistol, who went to the hospital for treatment. The SNG soldiers claimed that he was the perpetrator and executed him the following day.
Unidentified assailants shot and killed a Raskamboni commander during the night-time hours in Calanley [Alanley] neighbourhood. In retaliation, Raskamboni forces arrested a number of suspects.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and al Shabaab forces clash near the K50 area. Reports of severe fatalities but the precise number has not been specified. Locals have reported exchange of gunfire for which they could hear it for hours. Precise date not entirely clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: According to news reports from Kismaayo armed assailants opened gunfire at soldiers of the Interim Jubba Administration in the city. The lengthy exchange of gunfire was reported to have significant casualties and losses but to what extent is not known as it was not specified. The clash may have had occurred the previous day. No yet claim of responsibility.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a businessman in Ceelasha Biyaha Settlement (Afgooye District) in the evening of 01/08. The motive is unknown but it remains unclear whether the incident is related to the SNG forces who frequent his business premise. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces (mainly Awramale sub-clan) clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Berkeda Sharifada and Turquta areas (20km NW of Kismaayo) in the noon of 01/08. Four al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed and 10 Jubaland soldiers and an al Shabaab fighter were injured in the clash. The armed clashes between Jubaland forces from Awramale sub-clan intensified since the al Shabaab economic blockade on Kismaayo which has interrupted the charcoal business.
Somali gunmen shot dead a lawmaker (MP) in Mogadishu as he left prayers at mosque. There are no claims of responsibility, though al Shabaab is suspected.

Gunmen armed with pistols killed an interpreter working for AMISOM troops in Huriwaa Districts Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood, Mogadishu. Witnesses reported that pistol-armed men shot and killed the interpreter. The incident occurred during the evening hours in Cali Turcaaye. The killers identity remains unknown.

A gun battle erupted this evening between Somali government forces in Buulo Xuubey neighbourhood, Medina, Mogadishu, killing at least four soldiers. The fighting came when security forces attacked the house of an army officer. Reports say that the house contained an arms cache and that was why it was attacked.

Militias from Abdalla Arab and Habar Jeclo/Reer Biniin sub clans clashed near Diriye Guled Village (20km N of Burao) in the afternoon of 02/08 after the former reportedly dug water reservoirs in an area claimed ownership by the latter. SPU officers intervened and managed to stop the fighting. One militiaman from Abdalla Arab was injured in the clash. Reports on 03/08 indicated that the Abdalla Arab clan militias attacked Reer Biniin militias but police again intervened. One combatant from Abdalla Arab was injured in the second clash. The governor of Togdheer Region, Mohamed Diriye, reportedly said that the regional security committee had decided to demolish all the new water reservoirs before the reconciliation process starts.

Habar Gidir and Bimal militias reportedly engaged in heavy fighting in K50 area in the morning of 02/08. The fighting went on for an hour. Five combatants were killed and unconfirmed number of others injured.
Two SNG soldiers exchanged fire over land dispute in Beled Xawo in the morning of 02/08. One of the soldiers was injured. The other was arrested by SNG forces.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man hailing from the Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 02/08. Some reports suggest that the victim was a former al Shabaab official while other sources indicate is a member of Puntland Intelligence Agency (PIA).

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based at Ex-control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the evening of 02/08. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified gunmen shot and injured a civilian man in KPP neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 02/08. The attackers escaped. SNG forces arrived in the area but made no arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Raskamboni forces attack al Shabaab locations along the outskirts of Kismayo. AMISOM-Kenyan air forces also took part in the attack, presumably providing air cover. At least 20 dead and 30 injured. The assault is likely a reaction to an attack on a Raskamboni commander the previous evening.

A car filled with explosive devices blasted in between the Dabka and Bakara intersections, specifically near the Dhagaxtuur School in the Hodan district of Mogadishu. The explosive destroyed several automobiles, but caused no reported injuries. It is not clear who or what the target of the blast was.

Militias from Abdalla Arab and Habar Jeclo/Reer Biniin sub clans clashed near Diriye Guled Village (20km N of Burao) in the afternoon of 02/08 after the former reportedly dug water reservoirs in an area claimed ownership by the latter. SPU officers intervened and managed to stop the fighting. One militiaman from Abdalla Arab was injured in the clash. Reports on 03/08 indicated that the Abdalla Arab clan militias attacked Reer Biniin militias but police again intervened. One combatant from Abdalla Arab was injured in the second clash. The governor of Togdheer Region, Mohamed Diriye, reportedly said that the regional security committee had decided to demolish all the new water reservoirs before the reconciliation process starts.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Lower Shabelle officials in Xawa Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 03/08. The deputy governor in charge of social affairs of Lower Shabelle Region sustained light injuries. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters seized two donkey carts transporting food in Aleemow Village (19km S of Waajid) in the early morning of 03/08 but the cart owners reportedly managed to escape despite indiscriminate fire opened by the al Shabaab fighters The al Shabaab fighters killed the two donkeys and burnt the food.

A device believed to be a RCIED planted in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) exploded in the morning of 03/08. The device was reportedly planted in a garbage collection point. The motive is unknown. Four women (sanitation workers) were killed and seven others injured in the blast.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces near Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 03/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly wounded in the clash.

Al Shabaab and Hawadle pastoralists clashed in Jameeco Village (40km S of Bulo Burte) in the morning on 04/08 after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by al Shabaab. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire for an hour. Two combatants were killed and another injured.
Two groups of the SNG police exchanged gunfire briefly after a dispute over tax collected from business premises in Afgooye in the mid-day of 04/08. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters and SNG/Leysan militias clashed in Toos Weyne Village (50km W of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 04/08. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters in three battle-wagons. Reports indicate that most soldiers from the allied forces went to Berdaale town (14km N of Toos Weyne) to collect food when the al Shabaab fighters attacked the village. The fighting went for an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters took over control of the village. Four allied soldiers and two civilians were killed and seven other people were injured in the clash. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly burnt several houses and shops during the clash. Sources indicate that four civilians died in the burnt houses after the al Shabaab fighters locked them inside. There are also two children casualties, one child was killed by a stray bullet and the other died in one of the burnt houses. The village remained under al Shabaab control till the night after which they left.

Al Shabaab fighters and SNG/Leysan militias clashed in Toos Weyne Village (50km W of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 04/08. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters in three battle-wagons. Reports indicate that most soldiers from the allied forces went to Berdaale town (14km N of Toos Weyne) to collect food when the al Shabaab fighters attacked the village (Berdaale). The fighting went for an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters took over control of the village. Four allied soldiers and two civilians were killed and seven other people were injured in the clash. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly burnt several houses and shops during (or after) the clash. Sources indicate that four civilians died in the burnt houses after the al Shabaab fighters locked them inside. There are also two children casualties, one child was killed by a stray bullet and the other died in one of the burnt houses. The village remained under al Shabaab control till the night after which they left.

Suspected Bimal militias shot and killed two men in an area located between Gandarshe and K60 villages (Marka District) in the afternoon of 04/08. The victims were local wood cutters and were probably killed for clan revenge. One of the victims hail from Abgaal while the other reportedly hails from Rahaweyn. The attackers also stole a camel which the victims had been using for transport.
Militia men manning an illegal checkpoint between Galkacyo and Galinsoor opened fire at a public transport vehicle on 04/08. Two passengers were injured in the shooting.

Al Shabaab fighters and SNG/Leysan militias clashed in Toos Weyne Village (50km W of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 04/08. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters in three battle-wagons. Reports indicate that most soldiers from the allied forces went to Berdaale town (14km N of Toos Weyne) to collect food when the al Shabaab fighters attacked the village. The fighting went for an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters took over control of the village. Four allied soldiers and two civilians were killed and seven other people were injured in the clash. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly burnt several houses and shops during the clash. Sources indicate that four civilians died in the burnt houses after the al Shabaab fighters locked them inside. There are also two children casualties, one child was killed by a stray bullet and the other died in one of the burnt houses. The village remained under al Shabaab control till the night after which they left.

Al Shabaab fighters and SNG/Leysan militias clashed in Toos Weyne Village (50km W of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 04/08. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters in three battle-wagons. Reports indicate that most soldiers from the allied forces went to Berdaale town (14km N of Toos Weyne) to collect food when the al Shabaab fighters attacked the village. The fighting went for an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters took over control of the village. Four allied soldiers and two civilians were killed and seven other people were injured in the clash. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly burnt several houses and shops during the clash. Sources indicate that four civilians died in the burnt houses after the al Shabaab fighters locked them inside. There are also two children casualties, one child was killed by a stray bullet and the other died in one of the burnt houses. The village remained under al Shabaab control till the night after which they left.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A PBIED targeted Bosasso central police station in Bosasso in the afternoon of 04/08. Five people including Bari regional police commander were killed and nine others were injured in the explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The al Shabaab operation spokesman, Abdiaziz Abu Muscab, said that a member of al Shabaab had carried out the attack and killed senior police officers including the regional police commander.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Militia loyal to Barre Hirale numbering 25 clashed with Jubaland and Raskamboni forces near Goob Weyn Village (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 04/08. The fighting was reportedly initiated by Hirales militia, who crossed River Juba to attack their rivals. Two combatants and a civilian were injured.

Three unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured three SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Somali University Campus in Hodan District in the evening of 04/08. Reports indicate that the attackers and the SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire resulting in the injuries of the three soldiers and one of the attackers. The SNG forces managed to arrest the wounded perpetrator but his colleagues managed to escape.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a SNG soldier near Digfeer Hospital (Hodan District) in the evening of 04/08. Reports show that the perpetrators escaped.
The security guards at the office of the prime minister shot and killed a civilian man near the office (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 04/08 after suspecting him of being hostile.

Militiamen headed by Colonel Barre ""Hirale"" Adan Shire say they have peacefully captured a village near the city of Kismaayo known as Sabca Casharaad from Raskamboni forces. The two group had clash near this area the previous day.
Military forces attack al Shabaab in Toosweyne on 05/08. The ensuing clash caused 10 deaths on both sides.

SNG forces based in Aawdiinle (30km W of Baidoa) conducted a surprise attack against al Shabaab fighters based in Dambal-Calin Village (27km W of Baidoa) in the night of 05/08. Two SNG soldiers were wounded as a result of the attack while al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Two groups of SNG forces exchanged fire briefly over the control of an illegal checkpoint in the outskirts of the Beled Amin Village (16km W of Afgooye) in the morning of 05/08. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at two tax collection officers in the livestock market (Afgooye) in the morning of 05/08. The victims were busy collecting tax when the incident happened and both of them died. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed militias believed to be Majerten/Isse Mohamud took over control of the state-owned television and radio premise in Garowe in the noon of 05/08. The take-over follows after President Abdiweli Mohamed Gas on 04/08 sacked the director general of the state broadcaster, Ahmed Kismaayo, who is a close relative of the former Puntland president, Abdirahman Mohamed Farole. The militias fired warning shots after Nugal regional police commander tried to access the premise. Traditional elders reportedly stepped in to resolve the matter. A large number of Puntland security forces have been reportedly deployed on the streets of Garowe. Police report gunfire coming from the station, though who it is directed toward is not entirely clear.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG forces outpost near Muna Hotel (Xamar Weyne District) in the night of 05/08. The SNG forces opened fire after the blast. No casualty was reported and the perpetrators managed to escape.
Two people were killed while more others were injured after a bomb exploded in southern Somali town of Marka. The blast, caused by a hand grenade, was targeted at government forces in the area.

Pro-SNG forces conducted on security operation and clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Abaq Beeday (16km W of Xudur) in the afternoon of 06/08.Four al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. Casualties from the pro-SNG forces could not be established.

SNG forces based in Aawdiinle (30km W of Baidoa) attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Dambal-Calin Village (27km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 06/08.The fighting is reportedly linked to an overnight attack carried out by the SNG forces against the same al Shabaab base. The SNG forces took over control of the village but later returned to their base in Aawdiinle Village. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. SNGs casualties could not be established.
A clash between al Shabaab and local farmers causes 20 deaths. He clash began after a group of Berdaale farmers refused to pay extortion money to al Shabaab.

Agreement: A group of Somaliland soldiers with five battle wagons reportedly defected to Khatumo forces in Saalax Dheer Village in the evening of 07/08. The reason behind their defection is not yet clear but is believed to be related to the conflict within Somaliland local commanders (from Dhulbahante sub-clans) in Kalabaydh. The defected soldiers, who hail from Dhulbahante/Baharsame, are led by a prominent Somaliland local commander called Dolaal.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Beled Xawo in the noon of 07/08. The fighting broke out after a group based in Bulo Xawo attacked the other which reportedly stole a PKM (heavy machine gun) from other SNG forces based in Garbahaarey. The Garbahaarey group reportedly withdrew and later left the town to unknown destination. A civilian bystander was reportedly killed.

Habar Gidir and Bimal militias clashed in K50 Village (21km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 07/08. The Bimal militia reportedly initiated the attack but withdrew after an hour-long gun battle. Two combatants were reportedly killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab target a group of Jubaland militia with an explosive. Causalities not known.
Somali military members shot and kill two members of al Shabaab in the Livestock Market area.

Clan militias from Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar and Habar Jeclo/Solo Madaw clashed in near Beras Village (35km N of Buuhoodle) in the evening of 08/08. The fighting was initiated by Dhulbahante militia and was reportedly motivated by revenge killings between the two sub-clans. A Dhulbahante militiaman was killed and a Habar Jeclo man injured. The two are currently mobilizing themselves for further clashes.
Al Shabaab attacks civilians in Toosweyne. Ten deaths, most of them elders, property destroyed. Al-Shabab usually attack locals for refusing to pay extortion money.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack a joint military base on the outskirts of Bulo Burde late in the night-time hours. Six to nine reported al Shabaab deaths. Al Shabaab made several more attempts at the base the following day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack an AMISOM base at Bulo Barde after a failed attempt the previous night. Eighteen reported dead on both sides. Note: it is not clear is the count of 18 is the total of the fighting on 09/08 only, or a total of the two days of fighting.

ASWJ fighters manning a check point in Waberi neighbourhood in Cabuud Waaq opened fire at a vehicle belonging to SNG police in the afternoon of 09/08 after the police on board tried to prevent ASWJ fighters from searching the vehicle. One policeman was killed and another injured. The ASWJ set up the road-block in the neighbourhood to prevent fresh clashes between Cili and Wagardhac sub-clans of Marehan following the armed clash on 23/07, thus all vehicles were subjected to arms search.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy hit a RCIED planted on the roadside in Rusiya neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 09/08. The AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. The soldiers also beat a woman bystander and reportedly looted food stuff from some shops in the area. There were no reports of AMISOM casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces base at the northern checkpoint (towards Mogadishu) in Bulo Burte in the night of 09/08. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that went on for an hour. Al Shabaab forces withdrew, regrouped and launched anoth

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed the vehicle of Puntland military court chief judge near Laag Village (30km S of Bosasso) on 09/08. The judge was not in the car by the time of the attack. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen opened fire towards Jazeera Gate of Mogadishu Airport (Wadajir-Medina District) in the night of 09/08. AMISOM forces guarding the gate reportedly did not respond to the incoming fire. The attackers escaped.

SNG forces shot and killed the al Shabaab deputy intelligence chief in Banaadir Region, Nur Barahow, near SOS Hospital (Heliwa District) after the reportedly refused to surrender during a security operation on 09/08.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali National Army forces together with AU peacekeeping troops fought against Al Shabaab militants outside Qoryooley town. The witness said the fighting erupted after Al Shabaab fighters armed with launchers propelled grenades and machine guns attacked on allied forces, conducting security operation in Xero 1-aad and Xero 2-aad at outside in the town. Causalities not known.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Residents of Rusiya neighbourhood (Marka) closed roads and burnt tires in protest against AMISOMs harassment of civilians following a RCIED attack against their convoy a day ago. AMISOM troops arrived at the scene to clear the roads but the unrest turned into an armed clash between the locals and AMISOM forces. It remains unclear whether al Shabaab was involved in the armed clash. AMISOM forces responded with heavy weaponry fire during the clash. Casualties are unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG/AMISOM forces based on the outskirts of Bulo Burte in the night of 10/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters took over control of Toos Weyne Village (50km W of Baidoa), after SNG/Leysan militia vacated on 10/08. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly burnt many business premises and houses in the village after the take-over. The motive is reportedly in revenge against the loss of fighters in clashes with the allied forces in the village. The village had been a scene of a number of armed clashes between SNG/Leysan militia and the al Shabaab fighters.

NISA soldiers and security guards of a SNG MP (Abdiweli Qanyare) clashed at the residence of the lawmaker near Jazeera Hotel (Wadajir-Medina District) in the evening of 10/08. The NISA soldiers wanted to arrest an arms dealers staying in the MPs house but were repulsed by the security guards. One NISA was killed and two of the MPs security guards injured.

Gunmen attacked a convoy of a Norwegian oil exploration company, DNO, near Hudun town of Sool region during the night-time hours shortly after they left their base. No casualties were reported. Causalities are not known, but it should be notes the area is disputed by the Somaliland and Puntland governments.

Angry residents of Rusiya neighbourhood in Marka on 11/08 staged a demonstration for the second day in protest against the shooting of civilians by AMISOM whenever they come under RCIED/IED attack in Marka. The protestors closed the roads and burnt tires.

Pro-SNG forces based in Xudur town conducted a security operation on the outskirts of the town and clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Sarman Village (22km SE of Xudur) in the night of 11/08. One pro-SNG soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.
The body of beheaded young man was found in Lafoole in the morning of 11/08. The identities and the motive of the perpetrators are unknown. The date of the killing is not known.

Dhulbahante militia open fire at a convoy carrying staff of a Kenyan-based company contracted by an international oil company in an area near Lo Subko (25km SW of Xudun) on 11/08. The motive of the shooting is believed to be related to conflict over resources. The company reportedly temporarily suspended its operations on 09/08 after elders ordered it to suspend its activities until they solve the conflict among their local community. The incident happened as the convoy was heading to Hargeisa. A Kenyan national was slightly injured in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Independent sources confirm that AMISOM forces opened fire at civilians, killing one person and injuring at least six others, when AMISOM forces came under RCIED attack. AMISOM and governor deny the claim.

Al Shabaab fighters executed a fellow al Shabaab by firing squad in Ceel-Axmed (17km SW of Marka) in the evening of 11/08 after accusing them of spying for the enemy. The victim was reportedly a Kenyan national.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA officer in Suuqa Beerta neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the night of 11/08. The perpetrators escaped.
A government solider shoots and kills a civilian for unknown reason. The source claims the attack occurred Wednesday (13/08), but is dated 12/08.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a Puntland military base in the Galgala Mountains - exact location unreported. The soldiers repelled the attack. Causalities not known, though the fighting was describes as ""bloody.""

An RCIED targeted a group of Shabelle State militia in a pickup near the orphanage centre in Xawa Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 12/08. The device missed the target and caused no casualty. The vehicle came back from Ceel-Wareegow and was heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Bulo Burte on 12/8. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Angry residents of Rusiya neighbourhood in Marka on 11/08 staged a demonstration for the second day in protest against the shooting of civilians by AMISOM whenever they come under RCIED/IED attack in Marka. The protestors closed the roads and burnt tires.

A group of charcoal traders hailing from Majerteen/Osman Mohamud and Isse Mohamud clashed with Ali Saleeban militias in Iskushuban in the morning of 12/08. Reports indicate that Ali Saleeban militias reportedly blocked transportation of illegal charcoal from the town. Two militiamen-one from Isse Mohamud and another from Osman Mohamud-were injured in the clash.

Two groups of SNG forces (Abgaal) clashed over control of a checkpoint in Mooro-Mareerey Village (35km NE of Afgooye) in the night of 12/08. The two exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which one group was forced to withdraw. At least five combatants were killed in the clash.
Three unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man believed to be a NISA informer in 1st March neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the evening of 12/08. The perpetrators escaped.
Puntlands chairman military court survived an assassination attempt after unidentified gunmen sprayed his car with bullets outside of Bossaso. The chairman survived the attack.

Commuter buses and taxi drivers staged a demonstration in front of Borama municipal council on 13/08 in protest over a new private transport company licensed in Hargeisa to operate in Borama. The drivers reportedly blocked the road to the municipal council with their buses and taxis.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces based at Jiirogarob area in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 13/08. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in Ceelasha settlement (Afgooye) in the night of 13/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters executed two civilians by firing squad in Abdale Biroole Village (43km SW of Kismaayo) after accusing them of spying for Jubaland forces and KDF during recent clashes. The two were executed in front of the villagers.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Shanta Geed neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 13/08. The fighting broke out after they suspected each other as being al Shabaab fighters. The two sides exchanged gunfire for 10 minutes. A soldier and three civilians were injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab forces attacked a checkpoint belonging to the ""Somali apostate militias"" on the outskirts of Mogadishu, Siinka Dheer. Causalities reported, no solid numbers reported. Radio Andalus is pro al Shabaab.
A group of 2,000+ students hold an anti-Israeli protest in Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubba forces attack Barre Hiiraale militia after they learned Barre Hiiraale was planning an attack on Kismayo. Causalities not known.

Pastoralists from Dir and Marehan clashed in Laanta Yibirey Village located between Xerale and Cabud Waaq (Cabud Waaq District) twice on 14/08. The fighting broke out after Marehan herders tried to dig water reservoirs in the area which was opposed by Dir clan. In the first clash, one Marehan herder was killed while the second fighting claimed the lives of three Dir pastoralists. Clan elders reportedly stepped in to resolve the conflict.

Gunmen from Abdalla Arab sub-clan reportedly opened fire at a SPU vehicle in the vicinity of Dindinta Village (20km N of Burao) in the evening of 14/08. The incident is reportedly related to the recent security operation jointly conducted by the SPU and the army, in which the demolished all water reservoirs dug by the Abdalla Arab sub-clan near Dindita area as per the clan reconciliation mediated by four cabinet ministers. No casualties were reported. The gunmen escaped immediately.

More than a hundred people a staged peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched on the streets of Laas Caanood chanting pro-Khatumo slogans. Police reportedly fired in the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties were reported.

More than a hundred people staged peaceful demonstrations in Buuhoodle and Taleex towns to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched in the streets of the two towns chanting pro-Khatumo slogans.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a SNG forces in Lafoole (Afgooye District) in the night of 14/08. The two sides exchanged gun fire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported. Conflicting: S

More than a hundred people staged peaceful demonstrations in Buuhoodle and Taleex towns to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched in the streets of the two towns chanting pro-Khatumo slogans.

Militia from Abdala Arab sub-clan opened fire at the governor of Togdheer Region and Somaliland police and army, who were a mission to destroy water reservoirs dug by the sub-clan in Diriye Guleed (16km N of Burao) on 17/08. Two officers-one police and one army-were injured in the attack. Somaliland MPs from Arab sub-clan went to the village to restart negotiation between their sub-clan and Habar Jeclo, who are involved in land dispute in the village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Rusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 15/08. One AMISOM vehicle was damaged but no human casualties reported. This is the second RCIED attack against AMISOM forces in the same neighbourhood in a week.
Non-violent activity: Somaliland police confiscated the equipment of two television journalists in Laas Caanood on 15/08 for reportedly covering the election of Khatumo president.

Pro-SNG forces from Waajid took over control of Kulunjerer Village (39km NE of Waajid) after a brief exchange of gunfire with al Shabaab fighters in the dawn of 15/08. The al Shabaab fighters did not show a strong resistance and withdrew quickly. No casualties were reported. The pro-SNG forces seized a lorry loaded with food belonging al Shabaab during the take over.

Residents of Wadajir (Medina) and Kaaraan districts staged demonstrations in the streets of the two districts on 15/08 protesting against the lethal force that AMISOM and NISA forces used during the operation against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir District, Ahmed Hassan Cadow ""Daci"", in which the eight people including civilians were killed. SNG forces opened fire and killed one protestor.

Residents of Wadajir (Medina) and Kaaraan districts staged demonstrations in the streets of the two districts on 15/08 in protesting against the lethal force that AMISOM and NISA forces used during the operation against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir District, Ahmed Hassan Cadow ""Daci"", in which the eight people including civilians were killed. The demonstrators burned tires and blocked roads. SNG forces opened fire and killed one protestor.

Arrests: NISA forces confiscated radio equipment of Shabelle and Sky FM Radios in Hodan District on 19/08. The raid came after the radio stations resumed transmission on 19/08. The NISA forces arrested about 18 staff working for the two radio stations on 15/08 after broadcasting inflammatory reports about SNG/AMISOM operations against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir. The staffs were all released later except for two who are still being held.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: NISA forces and militia loyal to the former District Commissioner of Wadajir, Ahmed Hassan Cadow ""Daci"" clashed in Argada area (Wadajir/Medina District) in the dawn of 15/08. The fighting was initiated by the NISA forces who attacked the residence of the former DC. The fighting intensified after NISA reportedly sought the support of AMISOM while Dacis militia was reinforced by other militias from Abgal/Daud/Iroole Muse. Media reports indicate that the residences of Omar Mohamed Finish, a SNG MP and another politician called Abdullahi Sheikh Hassan (all Abgal) were also attacked and their militias fought a united front against AMISOM/SNG forces. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash. Unconfirmed reports indicate that Ahmed Daci escaped towards Jazeera, along the coast of Mogadishu. Shabelle Media Network reports five dead, some witnesses claim a greater range. Several arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Ceel Cade (57km W of Beled Weyne), Farlibaax (40km NE of Beled Weyne), Buq Goosaar (51km SW of Beled Weyne), Baadikeen (105km E of Ceel Barde) and Abeesale (95km E Ceel Barde) on the 16/8/14 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Regional and district authorities travelled to the locations taken from al Shabaab on the 17/8 to mobilize the communities to form local authorities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Ceel Cade (57km W of Beled Weyne), Farlibaax (40km NE of Beled Weyne), Buq Goosaar (51km SW of Beled Weyne), Baadikeen (105km E of Ceel Barde) and Abeesale (95km E Ceel Barde) on the 16/8/14 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Regional and district authorities travelled to the locations taken from al Shabaab on the 17/8 to mobilize the communities to form local authorities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Ceel Cade (57km W of Beled Weyne), Farlibaax (40km NE of Beled Weyne), Buq Goosaar (51km SW of Beled Weyne), Baadikeen (105km E of Ceel Barde) and Abeesale (95km E Ceel Barde) on the 16/8/14 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Regional and district authorities travelled to the locations taken from al Shabaab on the 17/8 to mobilize the communities to form local authorities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Ceel Cade (57km W of Beled Weyne), Farlibaax (40km NE of Beled Weyne), Buq Goosaar (51km SW of Beled Weyne), Baadikeen (105km E of Ceel Barde) and Abeesale (95km E Ceel Barde) on the 16/8/14 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Regional and district authorities travelled to the locations taken from al Shabaab on the 17/8 to mobilize the communities to form local authorities.

SNG forces conducted a surprise attack against al Shabaab base in Xagarka Village (42km SW of Baidoa) in the night of 16/08. One al Shabaab fighter, believed to be the commander of the base, was killed in the attack. The SNG forces returned to Goofgaduud Shabellow after the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against KDF/SNG forces in Faafax Dhuun (75km W of Baardheere) in the night of 16/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Ceel Cade (57km W of Beled Weyne), Farlibaax (40km NE of Beled Weyne), Buq Goosaar (51km SW of Beled Weyne), Baadikeen (105km E of Ceel Barde) and Abeesale (95km E Ceel Barde) on the 16/8/14 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Regional and district authorities travelled to the locations taken from al Shabaab on the 17/8 to mobilize the communities to form local authorities.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based at the former Ceymiska building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 16/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a government army base in Kaxda neighbourhood. After an hours-long battle, al Shabaab managed to take complete control of the base and seized materiel left behind by fleeing troops. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters hit a government army base in Miizaanka Dhuxusha (Yaaqshid District). Locals said the two sides pounded each other with heavy and light weapons. Extensive damage to base from the attack was visible this morning. Because the attack occurred at night, the full extent of the casualties remains unknown.

Police fired in the air to disperse a group of youths who started throwing stones at a hotel where a graduation ceremony of a local school was ongoing in the evening of 17/08. The youth gang started throwing stones after police denied them access to the venue. Four policemen were injured in the incident. Police arrested seven of the youths.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at two different occasions in Xudur in the night of 17/08. AMISOM/pro-SNG forces did not respond to the attack since the rounds landed in an area far from their positions. No casualties were reported.

Armed Clash, Iskushuban, Bari Region, 17/08/2014. Ali Saleban militia attacked charcoal burners from Usman Mohamud in area located 40km NE of Iskushuban on 17/08. The two sides engaged in a brief shoot-out. Two combatants were killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed the convoy of Hiraan governor near Buq Goosaar Village (51km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 17/08. A staff of Hiraan regions administration was injured in the attack. The governor was accompanied by local officials and was on a mission to establish administrations in villages seized from al Shabaab fighters by AMISOM/SNG forces.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at prison guards on duty at Beled Weyne prison in Bundo Weyn neighbourhood in the night of 17/08. Two civilians were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Kaxda police station (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 17/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire more than 20 minutes after the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A pro-al Shabaab website claimed that al Shabaab fighters took control of the police station and seized weapons. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG police based at Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 17/08. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after a brief exchange of gunfire. Casualties could not be established.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces took over control of Farxaane, Ay Aarta and Bandar villages (Qoryooley District) on 18/08. No reported clash or violence. AMISOM also deployed additional troops in Qoryooley frontline. The take-over and the fresh deployment is believed to part of preparations by AMISOM/SNG force offensive against Buulo Mareer (29 Km SW of Marka) which is under the control of al Shabaab.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces took over control of Farxaane, Ay Aarta and Bandar villages (Qoryooley District) on 18/08. No reported clash or violence. AMISOM also deployed additional troops in Qoryooley frontline. The take-over and the fresh deployment is believed to part of preparations by AMISOM/SNG force offensive against Buulo Mareer (29 Km SW of Marka) which is under the control of al Shabaab.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces took over control of Farxaane, Ay Aarta and Bandar villages (Qoryooley District) on 18/08. No reported clash or violence. AMISOM also deployed additional troops in Qoryooley frontline. The take-over and the fresh deployment is believed to part of preparations by AMISOM/SNG force offensive against Buulo Mareer (29 Km SW of Marka) which is under the control of al Shabaab.

A demonstration in protest against the arrest of traditional elders from Abdala Arab sub-clan took place in Burao on 18/08. The protestors reportedly burnt tires and closed the road during the protest. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators. No casualty reported.
Two groups of SNG forces exchanged gunfire over the control of an illegal checkpoint in Warmahan Village (30km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 18/08. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the car of Waberi District Commissioner at Buundo Koowaad area (Waberi District) in the evening of 18/08. His bodyguards opened fire after the explosion. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab clashes with a group of Xarardheere residents when the villagers refuse to pay extortion payments to the sect. Two al Shabaab killed, ""scores"" injured.

Agreement: Militiamen and officers who defected from Ahmed Madobes Ras Kamboni militia have joined Colonel Barre Hirales militia based in Goob Weyn. Col. Barre Hirale said the militiamen defected from Ras Kamboni militia after they could not tolerate the constant abuse and violations they were subjected to by Kenyan troops occupying Kismaayo. The defectors numbered about 100.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: The convoy of the Governor of Hiraan region was ambushed around Doonmalayka village (11 Km SW of Beleteeyn) in the afternoon of 19/09 when the convoy was returning from his tour to newly recovered villages to set up an interim administration. AMISOM escorts responded with heavy weaponry. One al Shabaab fighter whose body was left behind is confirmed dead while two AMISOM soldiers were wounded in the attack. The convoy reached safely Beletweyne.

A SNG soldier reportedly opened fire at a wedding party near Badbaado IDP camp (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 19/08. A woman was killed and two others injured. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator was not arrested.

Arrests: NISA forces confiscated radio equipment of Shabelle and Sky FM Radios in Hodan District on 19/08. The raid came after the radio stations resumed transmission on 19/08. The NISA forces arrested about 18 staff working for the two radio stations on 15/08 after broadcasting inflammatory reports about SNG/AMISOM operations against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir, Ahmed Daaci. The staffs were all released later except for two who are still being held.

Unidentified gunmen in a car shot and killed three people including a SNG police officer in the vicinity of Boondheere District headquarters in the evening of 19/08. The perpetrators were targeting the police officer and the two other victims were hit by stray bullets.

A pro-al Shabaab website (Somali Memo) indicates that al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Ubad-kaal area (Dayniile District) in the evening of 19/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

SNG forces exchanged gunfire with unidentified gunmen in the vicinity of Digfeer Hospital (Hodan District) in the evening of 19/08. A civilian was killed and a number of others were injured in the shootout. There conflicting reports on the identity of the gunmen. One version indicates that they were armed criminals while another suggests they were al Shabaab operatives.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM troops convoy was targeted with an RCIED in Ceel Jaale on the 20/08 by unknown attackers. AMISOM forces cordoned off the area and search of the perpetrator. No casualties and no arrests were reported. The convoy continued the trip to its destination.

Unidentified armed men raided the house of the first deputy governor in Farjano neighbourhood of Daanyaanbo section in the evening of 20/08. Reportedly, it was an assassination attempt meant to kill the deputy. The plan was aborted following resistance from the deputys security guards, who engaged in a brief exchange of gun fire with the attackers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM (KDF) warplanes bombed al Shabaab bases in Khadijo Haji Village and Gaddoondhowe villages (39km and 82km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 20/08. AMISOM and al Shabaab fighters also clashed in the two villages. Allied forces were able to overtake and gain control of Gaddoondhowe. Casualties could not be initially established, though it was later learned 17 were reported dead in total.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against pro-SNG forces (not identified) in Qurac Joome Village (72km E of Ceel Barde) in the morning of 20/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A pastoralist was killed by a stray bullet and a number of other civilians injured in the clash. The al Shabaab fighters took away a man they accused of spying for SNG forces. The al Shabaab fighters attacked the village after reportedly receiving a tipoff from unknown sources that AMISOM/SNG forces had left the village.
Unidentified men shoot and kill two soldiers.

More than one hundred people held a demonstration in front of the Hargeisa local Government, shouting and denouncing that the Mayor of Hargeisa had taken land illegally and sold it out. The demonstrators claimed ownership of a land which is in front of the Ministry of health.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM (KDF) warplanes bombed al Shabaab bases in Khadijo Haji Village and Gaddoondhowe villages (39km and 82km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 20/08. AMISOM and al Shabaab fighters also clashed in the two villages. Allied forces were able to overtake and gain control of Gaddoondhowe. Casualties could not be initially established, though it was later learned 17 were reported dead in total.
A RCIED targeted SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint in the vicinity of the Defence Ministry (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 20/08. One soldier was killed in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.
A group of civilian locals battle al Shabaab in Ceel Cadde, kill eight. Date not known - event was reported on 20/08.
Military forces clash along with ASWJ militia clash with al Shabaab at Ceel Macow location. Three al Shabaab fighters dead and a SNG Colonel has broken his arm.

A truck from Mudug region was hijacked by Warsangeli militias 35Km South of Bossaso in an unspecified on the morning of 21/08. The vehicle ownership is not yet confirmed but reports indicate it belongs to Hawiye and Omar Mohamud clansmen.

Pastoralists from Abgaal engaged in an armed clash with Biimaal militia in Cadcadeey grazing area (approx. 10 Km NE of Merka), in the morning of 21/08. The clash started after Biimaal militia demanded livestock used for food. Two members of the competing sides died in the clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Abaq Beeday (17km E of Xudur) in the mid-night of 21/08. Reports indicate that clash lasted for a few minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers retreated. No casualties were reported.

Biimaal militia attacked a SNGF post in Ceel Jaale in the afternoon of 21/8. Three SNG soldiers were killed in the fight. Other SNGF rushed to the scene and at least 6 Biimaal clan militia men were killed during the clashes.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against SNG military convoy from Luuq passing on Maykaareebi village (15km NE of Garbahareey) in the afternoon of 21/08. Reports indicate that the ambush was followed an armed clash which lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Six al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed while a SNG soldier was apparently injured. The convoy proceeds to Garbahareey after the clash.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade to the compound of a LNGO in Farjano. Four staff from an international organization (two national staff and two international) were on the compound attending a meeting. Nobody was harmed. The perpetrators escaped.

The body of a dead man was found under the east bridge of Garowe in the morning of 21/08. The dead man is believed to belong to Jambeel clan of Harti. There were signs of torture on the corpse. The police took it for further investigation. No one has claimed the responsibility of the killing. The date of the actual crime was either not articulated or not known.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a man hailing from the Darood/Geri sub-clan in Garsoor neighbourhood Galkacyo North in the evening of 21/08. The motive of the attempted assassination is unknown but reports suggest that the victim was a former al Shabaab sympathizer. The victim was heading home when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a house where some members of the SNG-appointed three-state technical committee were staying in Busley neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 21/08. No casualty was reported and the perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing on Fagax Junction near Kaah Hotel (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 21/08. A civilian bystander was injured in the blast. AMISOM casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
A publicly anti-al Shabaab security official is killed in Heliwa when a explosive attached to his car detonates. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.

Hundreds of people from the Somali Bantu Wagosha community demonstrate in Kismaayo in protest of killings, arrest and many other forms of alleged mistreatment against the community by Ahmed Madobes clan administration.

Vendors staged a demonstration in protest against an alleged decision by the local municipal council to allocate the towns livestock market to investors from the diaspora on 22/08. The demonstration started from the livestock market and ended at the municipal council office. No incident was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A pro-al Shabaab website published a report that al Shabaab fighters targeted AMISOM convoy with a RCIED on the road between Yaaq Biri Weyne (Wanla Weyne District), and Leego (Buur Hakaba District) on 22/08. The website stated that a water tanker was damaged in the explosion but did not report any human casualty.

Residents of Bulo Burte on 23/08 staged a demonstration in protest against AMISOMs failure to open the road towards Beled Weyn which is under AS economic blockade. The demonstrators demanded AMISOM to either open the road or leave the town. They accused AMISOM of establishing a helicopter-landing site to receive their food supplies but doing nothing to help the starving residents due to the AS blockade on the town. AMISOM forces stayed in their base during the protest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds at Waajid in the night of 23/08. Two of the rounds exploded in an empty area while the other two failed to explode. AMISOM/pro-SNG forces did not respond to the attack.

SNG forces in Bulo Burte protested against three months unpaid salaries in the morning of 23/08. The soldiers complained that they cannot buy food anymore. The soldiers reportedly ordered all business premises to close during the protest.

Militiamen suspected of being Bimal shot and killed a SNG soldier near Ceel-Jaale Village (7km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 23/08. The victim had left his base to buy stuff from a nearby shop when he got captured by militia and later executed. The motive behind the killing is unknown.
Two unidentified groups exchange gunfire over the ownership of land in the Jigjig area. No reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters fired heavy machine guns rounds towards AMISOM base in Rabdhure in the evening of 23/08 and withdrew quickly. The AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting khat in Jeexin Village (29km NE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 23/08. Reports indicate that the driver and a passenger were killed in the ambush. The al Shabaab fighters drove the vehicle and its cargo to unknown destination. Al Shabaab banned both the consumption and sale of khat in areas under its control.

A Somaliland soldier shot and killed a driver of khat vehicle at Xargega Bridge (15km N of Laas Canood) on 23/08 after driver refused to give him khat demanded by the soldier. Both the perpetrator and the victim hail from Dhulbhante/Jamac Siyad sub-clan. The perpetrator was arrested.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a woman in Waxaracadde neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 23/08. The victim used to work as a cook for SNG forces in Mogadishu. It remains unclear where the incident is related to her work with the SNG forces. The perpetrators escaped.

Kenyan warplanes bombed Godoondhawe Village (79km SE of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 24/08. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters vacated the village before the attack. Casualties could not be established.

Traders at Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) closed their premises on 24/08 in protest against tax increase. The traders reportedly said that the government is taxing them twice; at the port and in the market. The closure of premises affected business in the market. Reports on 25/08 indicate that the market remained closed. Latest reports on 26/08 indicate that the market was opened after the government and the markets business committee agreed that the traders to pay tax only once.

A big demonstration in support of the disarmament operation launched by the SNG and AMISOM forces took place at Daljirka Dahsoon square (Boondheere District) on 24/08. SNG forces backed by AMISOM forces tightened the security in the area. The demonstrators expressed their support to the governments disarmament operations and the improved security in the capital. One of the clerics in Mogadishu, Sheikh Abdikadir Somow, who addressed the crowd, explained the importance of security to the population and urged them cooperate with the security agencies in maintaining the general security in the country and Mogadishu in particular.

Pro-SW6 (SouthWest 6) staged a demonstration in Adaada area in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in protest against the planned arrival of the SNG prime minister in the morning of 25/08. The demonstration started at ADC compound (the headquarters of the SW6). The protesters marched towards Bakiin Hotel (the headquarters of SW3) where militia of SW3 tried to block them by shooting in the air. One person was hit by a stray bullet and another injured after he was hit by a vehicle. Later reports record two deaths.

SNG forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Xagarka Village (44km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 25/08. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One al Shabaab fighter was reportedly killed and a SNG soldier wounded in the clash. The SNG forces also freed 14 civilians detained by al Shabaab fighters for petty crimes. The security forces later conducted security operations in Buulo Barako and Goorisine villages (22km SE and 31km SE of Baidoa) but no armed clashes were reported in these villages. The soldiers later returned to their base in Goof-Gaduud Shabelow (26km SW of Baidoa).

Gunmen from Majerteen/Osman Mohamud shot and killed two policemen hailing from Ali Saleban in Iskushuban in the morning of 25/08. The incident happened at a time when the police officers went to the area to prevent clan-based conflict between Osman Mohamud and Ali Saleban.

Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire in Raqeyle Village (11km W of Afgooye District) following an escalated dispute over money extorted from motorists at an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 25/08. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM (ENDF) took over control of Tayeeglow in the afternoon of 25/08 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters who vacated the town before its fall to the AMISOM forces. There are 30 people in the town after al Shabaab ordered the residents to leave or otherwise be punished. The locals reportedly went to Biyoole (14 SW of Tayeeglow), Dhanawe, (15km SE of Tayeeglow) and Hererti (SW of Tayeeglow) and Ceel Gudu (20km NW of Tayeeglow) which are all under the control of al Shabaab.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a driver of a minibus in Afar-Irdood area (Xamar Weyne District) in the morning of 25/08 after the driver refused to pay extortion money. The perpetrator escaped.
Military forces claim they have killed an al Shabaab official and three others in a gun battle in an area between Janaale and Mubaarak.
Two groups of SNAF exchanged gunfire in Mahadaay (Jowhar) over a dispute over khat. Causalities not known.
A man hailing from Habar Jeclo/Idle Biciide attempted to kill the mayor of Ceel-Afweyn on 26/08 over land dispute.

Somali military confronted ""another group"" who had set a roadblock in a shootout near the parliament building. Eyewitnesses say that both sides opened fire on each other leading to the death of three people from both sides.

Agreement: Unconfirmed reports indicate that the Somaliland force captured the former Laas Caanood Mayor for Somaliland Mr. Kayse Mohamed Haji Hussein ""Tumbul"" who reportedly defected to Khatumo in Saalax Dheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) on 26/08.

A group of students and parents staged a demonstration in Duruqsi Village (112km S of Burao) in protest against lack of teachers on 27/08. Police arrested a number of students who tried to throw stones at the local education office.

Non-violent activity: A gunman attempted to kidnap a local female UN staff in the outskirts of Beled Xaawo in a food distribution site in the afternoon of 27/08. Reports indicate that other militias in the area managed to rescue the individual unharmed. The reason behind the failed abduction is currently unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG/AMISOM convoy near Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 27/08. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire that lasted for more than 30 minutes. The convoy came from Baidoa and was heading Bali Doogle when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab operatives shot and injured a tax collector in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the night of 27/08. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters seized three pastoralists over disagreement on payment of Zakat in Gelaf (25km E of Tabta Village) in the afternoon of 27/8. One pastoralist was later released but the whereabouts of the other two is unknown.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols tried to kill an armed SNG soldier on foot in Arjentin neighbourhood (Kaaraan District) in the morning of 27/08. The soldier, who was armed with an AK-47 rifle, engaged in a shoot-out with the gunmen forcing them to withdraw.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed following an escalated dispute over the control of a checkpoint in Ceel Cadde neighbourhood (Kaaraan District) in the morning of 27/08/2014. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters fired four mortar rounds in Baidoa in the morning of 28/08. Reports indicate the target of the mortar rounds was the airport. However, one round hit an IDP camp in ADC area, injuring one person and destroying two houses. It is still unclear where the other three rounds hit.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Buur Weyn Village (30km S Bulo Burte) in the morning of 28/08 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters, who withdrew before the arrival of the allied forces. The allied forces returned to their base in Bulo Burte at around 11:30.

Hundreds pro-Khatumo supporters staged a demonstration in Laas Canood in protest against the takeover of Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) by Somaliland forces on 28/08. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Laas Canood chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces escorting food aid donated by Arab agency at Dooyada Ugaari (14km NW of Buur Hakaba) in the evening of 28/08. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters shot at the convoy from a distance and later disappeared. The convoy was coming from Mogadishu and heading to Bakool Region when the incident happened. The convoy safely reached Baidoa. No casualties were reported.

Somaliland forces attacked Khatumo forces in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 28/08. The Somaliland forces attacked the village from three directions as preparations to inaugurate Dr. Ali Khalif Galaydh as the president of Khatumo state were underway. Somaliland forces took over the village after a fierce fighting that went on for four hours. Khatumo officials crossed the border to Ethiopia. The attack began early in the morning. Casualties were initially not known, though a witness to the fighting claims 20 dead, 30 injured.
Al Shabaab ambush against a convoy of Arab food aid escorted by SNG forces in Buur Hakaba on 28/08. No casualties.

A gunman hailing from Hawaadle shot and killed a civilian man (Ayr) in Hees Village (43km S Matabaan) in the morning of 28/08. Reports indicate that the killing was reportedly clan revenge. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Presidential Security Unit
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Presidential Security Unit
column17: A presidential guard shot and injured his colleague at Garowe airport on 28/08. The motive is unknown. The incident happened at time when the perpetrators and the victim, who were part of the presidential guards, were waiting to escort Puntland president from the airport.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed a SNG Police officer in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 28/08. The reason behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG police officer in Siliga neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the evening of 27/08. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Witnesses claim a SNG/AMISOM shelling of Bulo Mareer, a al Shabaab held town, on the evening of 29/08. Causalities not known. The following day military and government officials declared a new offensive in the region, with an aim of recapturing al Shabaab held areas.

A gunman from Habar-Yonis/Jibriil Turwa sub-clan shot and injured a man hailing from Dhulbahante/Naalaye Ahmed sub-clan in Masa-Gan (19km S of Ceerigaabo) on 29/08. Reports indicate that the motive behind the shooting is a dispute related to a land ownership. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Jubaland forces based at Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 29/08. Reports indicate that six Jubaland soldiers were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters near Buulo Mareer (30km SW of Marka) in the morning of 30/08. Reports indicate that an intensive fight broke out between the two sides which lasted for three hours after which the allied forces managed to take over the town. Casualties from both sides could not be established. Later in the evening al Shabaab retaliated with heavy mortar fire toward the town. Al Shabaab later claims to have killed 20 solders between this operation and a clash in nearby Golweyn, despite the loss of territory.

A group of Khatumo militias clashed with Somaliland forces in the vicinity of Saalax Dheer Village (60km SW of Laas Caanood) on 30/08. Causalities not known. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the Somaliland force captured the former Laas Caanood Mayor for Somaliland Mr. Kayse Mohamed Haji Hussein ""Tumbul"" who reportedly defected to Khatumo in Saalax Dheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) on 26/08.

An IED targeted a vehicle belongs to a tax collector near Nasrudiin mosque in Bar Ubah neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 30/08. The vehicle was parked at in front of the owners house and its not clear whether the device was planted in it while in the parking or not. The targeted officer was not in the car when the incident happened. Three civilians bystanders were injured. The perpetrator escaped.

A group of al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a group of NISA forces on a security patrol in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 30/08. Reports indicate that two NISA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters side could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab clashes with AMISOM at Golweyn. Al Shabaab later claims to have killed 20 AMISOM soldiers between Bulo Mareer and Golweyn.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces take-over Dhiingaras and Kiliga-Shiinaha (30 & 38km N of Jowhar) in the morning of 31/08. The allied forces faced no resistance from al Shabaab fighters during the take-over. The SNG officials stated that they will continue their offensive against al Shabaab fighters towards Hiraan Region.

A Toyota Land Cruiser travelling in Ceel Cad (25km S of Buulo Burte) hit a landmine or UXO on 31/08. The vehicle was damaged by the blast. It is currently unclear whether the device was an old UXO or planted recently by al Shabaab fighters. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
