column17: SNG/AMISOM forces take-over Dhiingaras and Kiliga-Shiinaha (30 & 38km N of Jowhar) in the morning of 31/08. The allied forces faced no resistance from al Shabaab fighters during the take-over. The SNG officials stated that they will continue their offensive against al Shabaab fighters towards Hiraan Region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces take-over Fiidow Village (50km N of Jowhar District) in the morning of 31/08 without any resistance from al Shabaab. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters evacuated the village before the arrival of the allied forces.
Trucks from Bosasso stopped their movements from Bosasso to Garowe on 31/08 to protest on rising insecurity and fears of possible al Shabaab raids.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces at Mukai Dumis (12km E of Kurtunwaarey) in the afternoon of 31/08. The ambush followed by a brief armed clash before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew towards Kurtunwaarey town. The allied forces proceed and captured Kurtunwaarey town without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in Jeerow village (11km SW of Qoryooley) in the night of 31/08. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire including RPGs during the fight which lasted for about fi
A Somali soldier shot and killed two of this colleagues in Gadoon Dhowe, near Beled Hawo, and surrendered to al Shabaab, presumably to defect.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces at Mukai Dumis (12km E of Kurtunwaarey) in the afternoon of 31/08. The ambush followed by a brief armed clash before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew towards Kurtunwaarey town. The allied forces proceed and captured Kurtunwaarey town without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Buulo Mareer opened fire at a vehicle carrying Khat in the evening of 31/08 after suspecting it as a hostile. Four Khat dealers were killed and the vehicle was also seriously damaged.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A SPU police officer hailing from the Darood/Dhulbahante armed with AK 47 rifle reportedly shot and injured two fellow SPU hailing from the Majerteen (Omar Mohamud and Reer Biciidyahan sub-clans) in the night of 31/08. Reports indicate that the perpetrator shot one of the victim at the shelter house in the compound while the other one at the main gate. One of the SPU injured shot and killed the attacker while escaping. The incident happened in front of UN compound while UN international staffs and An INGO international staff were present at the guest house. Latest reports on 01/09 indicate that one of the injured SPU succumbed to his injuries. Tension reportedly run high following the incident after the relatives of the perpetrator refused to bury him asking the government to handover to them the man who killed their kinsman.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers passing in Abdalla Shideeye section of Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 31/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator escaped.

A group of al Shabaal fighters in NISA uniform carried out a complex attack against Godka Jilicow (NISA detention centre) in Bondheere District in the morning of 31/08. The incident started with a VBIED attack against the exterior gate to pave the way for armed men to enter the facility. Apparently a second VBIED detonated at the second barrier allowing seven al Shabaab fighters to enter the premises and engaged serious exchange of gunfire with NISA forces which lasted up to 13:00 noon. Alpha group was called in and managed to kill the remaining al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate that the NISA commander for Banadir Region and his deputy were in the premises when the incident happened. Both officers escaped unhurt. Further reports suggest that the attack was designed to release number of al Shabaab operatives accused of killing a guard at Xamar Weyne prison and recently transferred to Godka Jilicow after they were convicted to death sentences. Seven al Shabaab attackers and three NISA soldiers were killed in the attack while 11 other NISA soldiers were injured. Available information confirmed that none of the al Shabaab attackers were wearing suicide belt/vest.

Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire at Karaan Junction (Karaan District) in the afternoon of 31/08. Reports show that the clash lasted for about 7 minutes. The reason behind the clash could not be established. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A US drone conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab fighters convoy near Haawaay Bridge (14km SW of Sablaale) in the evening of 01/09. Reports indicate that the drone fired at least six missiles on the target. The pentagon press secretary stated that they have conducted counter terrorism operation and they are still assessing the results. Somali intelligence stated the strike was targeting at al Shabaabs senior officials convoy (Abu-Zubayr or Ahmed Abdi Godane). Later sources declare six dead in the attack, and al Shabaabs Twitter account declared that the bombings did in fact target and kill Godane, its leader. The Pentagon again confirmed this. Swearing revenge, al Shabaab appointed Sheikh Ahmad Umar Abu Ubaidah to be their new leader.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar shells against AMISOM forces based at Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) after mid-night of 01/09. No casualties reported.

SNG forces based in Waajid attacked Lafaale village (27km SW of Waajid) an al Shabaab base in the afternoon of 01/09. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged heavy fighting which lasted for an hour. Further reports indicate that the SNG forces seized a NOAH car and an old mini-bus which had flat tires and later the forces burnt down the old mini-bus. Eight al Shabaab fighters were killed, two SNG soldiers and unspecified al Shabaab fighters were reportedly injured

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and run attack against remaining SNG/AMISOM positions in Fiidow (50km N of Jowhar) in the night of 01/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab had gained control of the village the previous day.

SNG forces on security patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Tiirka (5km SW of Qansax Dheere) in the morning of 01/09. One al Shabaab fighter was killed and another was injured. Casualties from the SNG side could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen manning an illegal road block shot and killed two civilian men (Bimal) in Ceel-Wareegow (17km SW of Marka) on 01/09. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. Some reports suggest that it might be related to a dispute aroused over blood compensation which could also lead revenge killing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Presidential Security Unit
column17: Security forces guarding the vice presidents house open fire after suspecting a passerby man as hostile. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces reportedly clashed with local militiamen extorting illegal money from public transports in Godey neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the morning of 01/09. Reports indicate that the SNG forces managed to disperse the militia group from the area. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 01/09. Reports indicate that a SNG soldier was killed while two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 01/09. Reports indicate that one SNG soldier was killed in the clash. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNG forces position near ex-Perfume Factory Building (Heliwa District) in the night of 01/09. Casualties could not be established.

Suspected Bimal militia launched an attack against the positions of Habar Gidir militia in Buulo Jan neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 02/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a brief after which the attackers withdrew. One combatant from the attackers side was reportedly injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighter ambushed against SNG/AMISOM convoy near Fiidow village (50km N of Jowhar) in the evening of 02/09. Reports indicate that the two sides clashed for 20 minutes. The convoy left Fiidow and were heading towards Hareo Lugoole (19km SW of Jalalaqsi) when the clash happened. Al Shabaab later announced through Radio Andalus that the attack killed a AMISOM-Brundi commander.

Suspected Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters open fire at a vehicle carrying the newly appointed Director of Puntland Television and Radio in Laag village (28km S of Bossaso) in the evening of 02/09. Reports indicate that a Landmine/IED detonated a long side the road followed by gun shoot while driving at Meer Meerka escarpment. The Director escaped unhurt.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces take-over Jalalaqsi town in the morning of 03/09 with no resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters vacated the town before the arrival of the allied forces. Jalalaqsi have been under al Shabaab control for the last five years.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out three successive hit and run attacks against SNG/AMISOM convoy in Garasiyaani village (53km SE of Beled-weyne) in the morning of 03/09. Reports indicate that the two sides clashed for 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy was heading to Buulo Burte. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar shells against AMISOM positions in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the night of 03/09. Reports indicate that AMISOM forces reacted with anti-aircraft missiles and mortars. No casualties were reported.
A RCIED targeted a NISA vehicle in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 03/09. Three NISA personnel were reportedly killed while three others were seriously injured.

Unidentified attackers fired several mortar rounds which landed at Buulo Hubey and Korontada neighbourhoods (Wadajir-Medina District) in the night of 03/09. Reports indicate that the mortar shells were fired from ex-control Afgooye that is (K7 neighbourhood). The target is so far unknown but probably could be the airport. A civilian person was killed while three others were reportedly injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted an ambush against SNG/AMISOM forces escorting food aid convoy at Beero Yabaal village (22km NW of Buulo Burte) in the morning of 04/09. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged fighting for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two soldiers (SNG & Djiboutian) were killed while on al Shabaab side 10 fighters were reportedly killed. The convoy proceeds after the ambush and safely reached Buulo Burte.

Residents of Arabsiyo held a demonstration and blocked the main road connecting Hargeisa to eastern part of Somaliland in the afternoon of 04/09. Reports indicate that some of the protestors threw stones and later were dispersed by local elders. The demonstrators were from two religious sects who disagreed over the control of the central mosque in the village.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM joint forces that were dispatched to capture Ceel Buur have successfully take-over three villages; Ceel Garas and Ceel-Lahelay under Dhusamareeb and Ceel Qooxle (22km NW of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 04/09. No reported violence.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM joint forces that were dispatched to capture Ceel Buur have successfully taken-over three villages; Ceel Garas and Ceel-Lahelay under Dhusamareeb and Ceel Qooxle (22km NW of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 04/09. No reported violence.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM joint forces that were dispatched to capture Ceel Buur have successfully take-over three villages; Ceel Garas and Ceel-Lahelay under Dhusamareeb and Ceel Qooxle (22km NW of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 04/09. No reported violence.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and injured a SNG soldier in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 04/09. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian man in Ceel Hindi area of Sayidka neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 04/09. The motive behind the killing is unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim had business relations with SNG forces. The perpetrators escaped.

Militiamen hailing from the Majerteen/Ali Suleiman sub-clan shot and killed a civilian man from the Majerteen/Osman Mohamud in the morning of 05/09. The motive behind the killing is reportedly clan revenge following recent clash between the two sun-clans in Iskushuban. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Security guards of the former governor of Bari region open fire at a public transport in Bossaso on 05/09. The motive behind the shooting is currently unclear. Three civilians (a female & 2 male) were reportedly injured. No arrest was reported following the incident.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Buulo Hubey market (Wadajir District) in the evening of 05/09. Reports indicate that the incident happened after undisclosed dispute aroused between the perpetrator and the victim. The perpetrator escaped.

Hundreds of Mogadishu residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Banadir Regional Administration (Heliwa District) on 05/09 in support of the ongoing Anti-al Shabaab military offensives known as ""Indian Ocean Operations"". Reports indicate that the demo was organized by Banadir administration and the protestors were shouting anti-al Shabaab slogans. Some of the SNG Ministers and other officials addressed the gathering.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED/Landmine targeted AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn village (21km SW of Marka) in the morning of 06/09. The device which was reportedly a landmine was planted on the road side and exploded before the AMISOM convoy reached the place. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a food convoy donated by Arab agency and escorted by AMISOM/SNG forces in an area between Qansax Dheere and Buur dhuubo in the afternoon of 06/09. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters reportedly open fire against the convoy from a distance and disappeared in to the bush. No casualties were reported. The convoy safely reached Buur dhuubo.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a SNG soldier in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 06/09. Reports indicate that the victim was manning an illegal checkpoint when the incident happened. The attackers also took the victims gun. The perpetrators escaped.

Two males bodies with gun shots were found near Ceel-Wareegow (17km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 06/09. The motive and the identity of the killers are currently unknown but its believed that it could be related to clan revenge. The date of the killings is not known.

Unidentified two armed men dressed in SNG police uniform shot and killed a SNG military officer dressed in civilian attire driving a car in Haji Basto section of Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 06/09. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMSOM/SNG base in Goof-Gaduud Shabeelow (26km SW of Baidoa District) in the morning of 07/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A SNG soldier was killed while casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed a Food aid convoy escorted by AMISOM/SNG forces near Washaaq Baar (16km NW of Garbahareey) in the afternoon of 07/09. Reports indicate that both sides briefly exchanged heavy gunfire after which the attackers were reportedly overwhelmed. The convoy was coming from Buur Dhuubo and heading to Garbahareey when the ambush happened. Six al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed while about 10 others were injured. Casualties from the allied forces could not be established.

Unidentified attackers fired three mortar rounds or B10 at Ceel Gaabta neighbourhood (Xamar Jajab District) in the evening of 07/09. Reports indicate that one of the rounds landed on a residential house and killed a child while both his parents were injured.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed a NISA Soldier near Makah Al-Mukaram Hotel (Hodan District) in the night of 07/09. Reports indicate that the victim was a former al Shabaab defector who joined NISA forces in Mogadishu. The motive behind the killing remained unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A VBIED targeted AMISOM convoy near Xawo-Cabdi settlement (9km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 08/09. Reports indicate that a Toyota NOAH laden with explosives driven by a self-suicide detonated in to the AMISOM convoy. The convoy was coming from Lower Shabelle Region and heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened. Further reports indicate that two civilian mini-buses who were using the road behind the convoy had also involved the incident. The governor of Lower Shabelle, who survived from the attack, confirmed that; two international military advisers - an American and South African - and two AMISOM soldiers were among the injured. At least 16 civilians were killed while about 27 others were injured. Al Shabaab spokesman, Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab stated that they carried out the attack targeting American officials who were travelling with the convoy and was aimed to avenge for the killing of their leader (GODANE). A Pentagon spokeswoman when contacted said that; there were no US personnel hurt in the attack but not commented whether American officials were with the convoy. Despite the claims of the State Department, following the attack al Shabaab claimed they have ""killed an American General."" On the same note, an executive Director for an American company providing mentorship services for AMISOM said that their employees had involved the attack, but said none of them was injured and neither is an American.

A VBIED (likely detonated from al Shabaab) targeted a convoy of Deputy Commander of Banadir intelligence passing at Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 08/09. Reports indicate that a Toyota Carib laden with explosives detonated in to the targeted vehicle. The targeted Officer survived from the attack with minor injuries. Earlier the Minister of National Security warned a wave of retaliatory attacks from al Shahaab to avenge the killing of their leader (Gordano).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted an ambush against AMISOM/SNG convoy passing near Buur weyn village (30km SW of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 08/09. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged fighting for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy was from Buulo Burte heading to Jalalaqsi town when they were ambush happened. Casualties could not be established.

A RCIED targeted SNG forces convoy in Jimbiley village (10km W of Jalalaqsi) in the afternoon of 08/09. The convoy came from Buulo Burte and was heading to Jalalaqsi when the incident happened. A clan elder was killed in the explosion.

Two groups of farmers clashed in Mandheere (38km NE of Balcad) following an escalated dispute over ownership of farmlands in the morning of 08/09. The rival groups hail from Bantu/Shidle sub-clan. SNG forces were deployed in the village and managed to stop further clashes between the two sides. Causalities not known.

Two groups from al Shabaab fighters (Amniyat and Hizba units) clashed in Baraawe in the night of 08/09 following an escalated dispute over the release of suspects in Baraawe prison. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab prison guards (Hisba) reportedly released a group of suspects from the prison but they were immediately attacked by the Amniyat fighters who were opposing the release. The prisoners were re-arrested. One al Shabaab fighter from the guards (Hisba) side was reportedly killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel Saliini (32km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 08/09. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire during the fight. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers ambushed a vehicle transporting Khat near K50 (21km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 08/09. Reports indicate that the vehicle was from Mogadishu and was heading to Buulo Mareer when the ambush happened. The driver managed to drive off without stopping. Three passengers were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED targeted a vehicle belongs to Jubaland forces passing in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 08/09. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 08/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about fifteen minutes after that the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Galkacyo (South) the morning of 09/09 in protest against reports that the Saudi government is planning to remove Prophet Mohammed from the Medina. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Galkacyo South chanting anti-Saudi slogans. The VOAs Somali service and several British newspapers reported last weeks that the Saudi monarch is planning to remove the tomb from Medina-a claim strongly denied by the Saudi government.

Hundreds of pro-SW6 supporters staged a peaceful demonstration in front of ADC Compound (the headquarters of SW6) in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 09/09. The protesters were reportedly opposed to the SNGs plan to establish a three-state administration.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired some small arms fire towards the airport in the evening of 09/09 and withdrew quickly. AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters open fire at the airport and withdrew quickly (09/09). AMISOM did not respond.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM position in Buurdhuubo Village (36km SE Garbahaarey) on 09/09. AMISOM responded with artillery guns and al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A RCIED targeted SNG forces vehicle near Banaadir Junction (Wadajir-Medina District) in the afternoon of 09/09. The device exploded after the vehicle passed the area. SNG forces based at Banaadir Junction opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushes a group of AMISOM-Ethiopian fighters at Bur-sagaar area, about five kilometres from Barwaaqo village. Al Shabaab reports six AMISOM dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in Tuulo Barwaqo Village (20km NW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 10/09. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed and a number of others were captured. AMISOM casualties could not be established. The convoy had left Luuq and was heading to Garbahaarey when the ambush took place.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM position in Xudur in the night of 10/09. AMISOM responded with artillery and al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired at AMISOM base in Waajid from a far distance in the night of 10/09 and retreated quickly. AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM position in Rabdhuure Village (Yeed District) on 10/09. AMISOM responded with artillery and al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed over the control of an illegal checkpoint in Bulo Xansholey Village (7km W of Balcad) in the morning of 10/09. No casualties were reported.

Militias loyal to Haji Bakin (the former governor of Bari Region) shot and injured a civilian man in the morning of 10/09. The reason behind the shooting is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters opened fire at a vehicle and injured at a man and a woman who were visiting a farm in Haar Cadey Village (15km NW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 10/09. The al Shabaab fighters suspected that the car was carrying khat but later identified that the victims were farmers.

Two suspected al Shabaab operatives shot and killed a local municipality officer in Zone K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 10/09. Local residents responded to the shooting and managed to arrest the perpetrators. The attackers were later handed over to police.
A ""massive"" demonstration against al Shabaab is held in Buulobarde.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab clashes with AMISOM-Ethiopian forces in Ceel Garas, eventually overtaking the town. Causalities not known,

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces clash with al Shabaab in Buurdhuubo after an al Shabaab attack. Al Shabaab claims ""great losses"", but did not include specifics.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit-and-run attacks against ENDF forces based at Ceel Garas village (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the night of 12/09. Reports indicate that the two sides exchanged gunfire for about three hours after which the attackers withdrew. Further reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters reportedly managed to push back ENDF from their original base. Casualties could not be established.

SNG forces based in Tayeeglow attacked al Shabaab fighters base in Bioyooley village (14km SW of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 12/09. Reports indicate that the two sides briefly clashed after which the al Shgabaab fighters withdrew from the village. SNG forces reportedly seized three trucks loaded with goods and four tri-motor cycles owned by civilians and later released. One al Shabaab sympathizer was killed. Casualties from SNG sides could not be established.

Public passengers staged a demonstration in Lawya Caddo (27km NW of Zeylac) on 12/09 following after Somaliland authorities introduced custom fees of ($31) both entry and exit at the border. The protestors were opposing the new law which had caused many travelers to be stuck at the border.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces on patrol opened fire at suspected al Shabaab fighters digging a hole at Asha Derrow Junction in Kismaayo in the night of 12/09. The suspects managed to escape unhurt. The soldiers discovered an IED left behind by the suspect. The device was later detonated safely.

Heavy fighting reported between al Shabaab and SNG forces at Dinlaabe, a base of operations for al Shabaab. Reports indicate the fighting lasted over an hour, causing al Shabaab to retreat from their base. Even though the exact number of casualties caused by this fighting is yet to be confirmed, reports say that at least five people were killed and more than that number wounded in the fighting.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces based in Maxaas conducted joint operation and took over Abooreey and Yasooman villages (62 & 53km SW of Maxaas) in the morning of 13/09. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters reportedly vacated the villages prior to the arrival of the allied forces.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces conducted an operation and peacefully took over Muqakoori village (70KM SE of Buulo Burte) in the morning of 13/09. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters reportedly abandoned the village before the allied forces reached at the village.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces based in Maxaas conducted joint operation and took over Abooreey and Yasooman villages (62 & 53km SW of Maxaas) in the morning of 13/09. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters reportedly vacated the villages prior to the arrival of the allied forces.

SNG/ENDF forces jointly take-over Ceel-Shiil village (3km W of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 13/09. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters reportedly left the area before the allied forces reached at the village. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM position in Ceel-Saliini (Ceel Shiikh?) (32km SW Afgooye) in the afternoon of 13/09. Both sides exchanged different types of weapons for about 20 minutes. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Mashalaay (9km SE of Qoryooley) in the night of 13/09. Casualties are unknown.
A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG soldiers manning an illegal check-point at Bariirre village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 13/09. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 13/09. Reports indicate that victim used to sell sim-cards to AMISOM troops based in the outskirts of Marka and its believed that killing is related to his relationship with the forces. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers shot and injured a NISA Officer in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the evening of 13/09. The Perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy opened fire at a public mini-bus in Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 13/09. Reports indicate that the soldiers open fire after the mini-bus approached at the convoy. The conductor of the mini-bus was killed. The AMISOM convoy continues its journey after the incident.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Hodan District) in the night of 13/09. Reports indicate that the two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a Molotov cocktail at an AMISOM convoy near Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 13/09. Reports indicate that the AMISOM convoy reacted with gunfire after the blast. A civilian bystander was injured in the subsequent shooting.

Unidentified attackers driving in a private vehicle opened fire and killed a NISA Officer in Zoobe neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 13/09. Reports indicate that the victim was recently appointed as NISA Deputy Commander in charge of anti-terrorism activities. The gunmen used their car to block the officers vehicle and subsequent shooting. Further reports indicate that the victim had replaced another senior officer who had been killed two months ago in Xamar Jajab. Two of his security guards were also injured. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Jamhuuriya neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the night of 13/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. A SNG soldier was reportedly killed in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters publicly executed two men hailing from (Rahanweyn) in Diinsor in the morning of 14/09, the men were allegedly accused of spying. Reports indicate that the men were initially captured from Gedo and one of them was accused of working with NISA.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 14/09. Reports indicate that the AMISOM forces opened fire in response to the blast. The convoy was coming back from Kurtunwaarey when the incident happened. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/Pro-SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters based at Lagta Berta (25km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 14/09 where both sides reportedly engaged heavy fighting. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Two groups of SNG soldiers guarding the Mayor of Mogadishu clashed briefly in Sanaa neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the morning of 14/09. The clash reportedly followed after the arrival of the Mayor from Turkey over unknown reason. A soldier was killed and another was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy inside Buulo Mareer town (29km SW of Marka) in the morning of 15/09. Reports indicate that the blast reportedly damaged an AMISOM Casper carrier. The perpetrators escaped.

A group of people (Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan) stormed a police station in Huluul village (57km W of Ceel-Afweyn) on 15/09 in a bid to free their kinsman who was detained in the station. Reports indicate that the man was arrested earlier following after he allegedly raped a woman from Habar-Jeclo/Omar sub-clan. Police later transferred the man in to Ceel-Afweyn.

Two groups of SNG soldiers clashed over unknown dispute in Baar Ismail neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 15/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes and stopped after intervention of other SNG officers. Two soldiers were killed while another one was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Qansax Dheere in the morning of 15/09. The two sides exchanged gun fire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Hundreds of street vendors staged a demonstration in Borama market after police and municipal council workers tried to evict them their business places on 15/09. Reports indicate that the protestors reportedly stoned the police. Police used tear gas and life bullets to disperse the street vendors. Six people were reportedly injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a crowd of people in a market in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) who were by then busy buying and selling Khat in the afternoon of 15/09. Two people were killed while three others were reportedly injured. The perpetrators escaped.

A police officer shot and killed a man in Kooshin neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) on 15/09 after the victim reportedly refused to pay tax the police officer had been collecting from traders in the neighbourhood. The perpetrator was arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly punished a madrasa teacher on 15/09 by whipping him 100 lashes in public for impregnating one of his female students in Diinsoor. AS fighters closed business premises and ordered all to attend the event.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based at Towfiiq neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 15/09. Casualties are unknown.

Six government soldiers are killed in a battle with al Shabaab outside of Kismayo. Note: Three soldiers were killed during the fighting, while the other three were captured alive and executed on the spot.

Al Shabaab forces launched an attack on SNG forces manning an illegal roadblock outside Afgooye. Reliable sources state that after 25 minutes of fighting Al-Shabaab fighters beheaded one soldier, shot or stabbed five others.
SNG forces killed four Al-Shabab fighters in southwestern Goofgaduud locality in Bay Region.

Gunmen hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud clashed in near UNHCR compound in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 16/09. Reports indicate that the clash followed after a heated dispute over an ownership of a piece of land between the two warring sides. Local elders intervened and separated the two fighting militias. A militia man was reportedly injured.

Khatumo forces hailing from Dhulbahante (Hayaag, Wacays Aden and Cigaal Naleeye sub-clans) with two battle wagons conducted an attack against Somaliland forces based at Ceegaag village (47km NE of Buuhoodle) on 16/09. Reports indicate that the two sides clashed briefly after which the attackers withdrew. The attackers later erected a road block between Caro Wayn and Ceegaag villages and blocked two trucks heading to Ceegag. Somaliland police were dispatched in to the scene and upon arrival the Khatumo Militias escaped abandoning the road block.

Habar Gidir and Biimaal militias clashed again near Ceel-Wareegow village (17km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 16/09. Reports indicate that the Habar Gidir militias initiated the attack which lasted for about 20 minutes after they reportedly received information suggesting that the Bimal militias are regrouping to attack them. Two combatants were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against an AMISOM convoy passing at Sarta Minashiibiyo area (Marka) in the afternoon of 16/09. Reports indicate that the convoy stopped following the blast and the attackers open fire at the forces before escaping. The AMISOM forces responded by firing towards to the attackers. Casualties are unknown.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle carrying SNG forces near former Milk Factory (Hodan District) in the morning of 16/09. Reports indicate that the blast destroyed the vehicle. Two soldiers were killed while a dozen of others were injured. SNG forces in the area arrived at the scene and arrested unspecified numbers of people suspected of having link with the incident.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in Daljirka Dahsoon area (Bondheere District) on 16/09 to express their supporting to the on-going military offensive ""Indian Ocean Offensive"" against al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate that the protestors were chanting anti-al Shabaab slogans. Bondheere District Commissioner and a spokesman for Banadir Regional Administration addressed the protestors and urged them to collaborate with SNG security apparatus.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman near Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 16/09. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim reportedly had business relations with AMISOM based at the Stadium. The perpetrators escaped.
Three Al-Shabab fighters have been killed in fighting between Somali government forces and the group in Ceelasha Biyaha locality. Note: Date unknown. Source dated 19/09.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a group of eight pro-SNG soldiers in an area between Goof Gaduud and Kurta villages (Baidoa District) in the afternoon of 17/09. Two SNG soldiers were killed in the ambush but no al Shabaab casualties were reported. SNG forces in Baidoa sent soldiers and two battle wagons to the ambushed soldiers, collected of the bodies of the two soldiers and brought the rest Baidoa. The attacked soldiers left Waajid and were heading to Baidoa when the ambush took place.

Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG forces manning an illegal checkpoint near Cumar-Beere Village (10km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 17/09. The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly killed and at least three others injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG military convoy near Aw Dheegle Village (37km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 17/09. The SNG convoy came from Afgooye and was probably heading to Aw Dheegle when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.
A Somaliland solider shot and killed two military officers, motivation unknown.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local farmer in Geedo-Barkaan Village (7km NE of Jowhar) in the evening of 17/09. The motive behind the killing is unknown but it is believed to be related to clan revenge.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Xararyaale neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 18/09 to express their anger against AMISOM following yesterdays accident where an AMISOM police vehicle hit and killed a small boy in the neighbourhood. The demonstrators called for the perpetrators to be brought to justice. The demonstrations ended peacefully.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked Habar Gidir militias in Ceel-Wareegow Village (17km SW of Marka) in the morning of 18/09. The suspected al Shabaab fighters took over control of the village after a brief clash but vacated later. Two combatants were reportedly killed and three others injured in the clash.

Two men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier near Sarta Minashiibiyo (Marka) in the morning of 18/09. The victim had left a local teashop and was heading to his base when the incident happened.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Wargodka area (Afgooye District) in the night of 18/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

SNG forces conducted a security operation after the shooting of a soldier and arrested a large number of youths. Some angry SNG soldiers opened fire at a group of the detainees who were released by other soldiers, injuring five of them. The killing and the subsequent security operation caused tension in the town.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces shell Kismayo airport (which houses a AMISOM base) for two consecutive nights. Causalities not known or not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM forces in Xawa Cabdi village around the noon hour. Al Shabaab was reported to have recovered several weapons. Causalities not known.

More than a hundred people staged a demonstration in Gabiley on 19/09 in protest against the killing of the base of commander of Somaliland army in Qoriligud on 17/09. The base commander hails from Gabiley town. The demonstrators blocked the road to Kalabaydh and disrupted traffic. The demonstrators hurled stones at the police who fired in the air to disperse them. A speeding khat vehicle hit and killed a mother and her baby. Nine demonstrators were injured in the shooting. Local elders managed to disperse the protestors.

A small group of people staged a demonstration in Dila town on 19/09 in protest against the killing of the commander Somaliland forces in Qorilugud Village on 17/09 by a Somaliland soldier. The demonstrators blocked the main road in the town and called on the government to arrest the perpetrator. No incident was reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces on foot patrol near Mukayga area in Afgooye in the evening of 19/09. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM forces in Buulo Mareer Village (29km SW of Marka) in the evening of 19/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab forces shell Kismayo airport (which houses a AMISOM base) for two consecutive nights. Causalities not known or not reported.
Al Shabaab members shoot and kill the manager of Aden Adde airport. The assassination may be in connection to the arrival of a new session a parliament.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Via Afmadow Market in Shaqaalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 20/09. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. Jubaland forces arrived and checked the area for other RCIEDs.

Two groups of SNG soldiers briefly clashed at Mursal Junction in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the afternoon of 20/09. The incident happened after several SNG soldiers travelling in a wedding convoy fired in the air, prompting other SNG soldiers at the junction to respond in their direction. One person (a civilian) was killed and five others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 20/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

At least four people were killed and several others sustained various injuries after Al-Shabaab attacked a base of government troops in Qansadheer. Date not entirely known: attack may have occurred on 21/09.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: At least five civilians are killed after a road-side blast targeting AMISOM-Burundi forces in the Dalcadda area of Calanley neighbourhood.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed near Balad Aamin (16km W of Afgooye) in Afgooye over the control of an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 21/09. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over control of Wabxo Village (40 km W of Ceel Buur) on 21/09. Al Shabaab fighters pulled out before the arrival of the allied forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier shot and killed a civilian woman during a security operation after he suspected her as hostile.

SNG soldiers based near the livestock market (Heliwa District) shot and killed a man they suspected of being an al Shabaab operative in the morning of 21/09. It is not clear if the victim was in fact a members of al Shabaab.
A protest against a reconciliation meeting between and takes place in Baidoa. The protest was mainly against the proposals and plans of the SW-6 group.

Al Shabaab attacked and overran a Ethiopian base in Ceel Garas. Al Shabaab claimed they had ""badly defeated"" the Ethiopian soldiers after gaining control of the area. Casualties not known. Ethiopian forces returned to the area the following day, though it is not known if they regained control of the base.

Drivers of commuter buses staged a demonstration in Borama on 22/09 in protest of a new transport company that started operating on Borama-Hargeisa route. The drivers complained that the new company is not registered with Borama municipal company but with the central government in Hargeisa. The drivers reportedly blocked the road to the municipal council offices in Borama.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and- run attack against AMISOM base in Tayeeglow in the night of 22/09. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire that went on for about an hour, after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A number of al Shabaab fighters were killed (no number provided) and one captured. AMISOMs casualties could not be established.

Pro-SNG forces in Luuq attacked al Shabaab fighters in Maganey Village (10km S of Luuq) in the afternoon of 22/09. The soldiers launched the attack after a tip off that a group of al Shabaab fighters arrived in the village to collect zakat from the locals. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A pro-SNG soldier and a number of al Shabaab fighters were injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG police travelling near Balad-Aamin village (20km NE of Afgooye) in the morning of 22/09. The deputy police commander of Balcad was in the convoy, thus he was the perceived target. The two sides exchanged gunfire for almost an hour before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One police man was killed and three others injured. The al Shabaab fighters also seized a Toyota pick-up from the police.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Goof Gaduud Shabellow (26km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 22/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked the village after some SNG forces left for a security operation in Buulo Barako Village (22km SW of Baidoa). No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab launches an attack on AMISOM-Kenya forces in Badhaadhe Distirct, exact location not known. Two AMISOM deaths reported.
Al-Shabaab reportedly kills 13 police in a Balcad ambush. The local police chief was among the dead.
Somali security forces shot dead a suspected Al-Shabaab member at Mogadishus Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood while the suspected was attempting to plant a explosive.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab targets AMISOM-Kenya soldiers in Badhaadhe for the second time in two days. Two AMISOM vehicles were reportedly destroyed in the battle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab targets AMISOM soldiers with a roadside blast in Marka, destroying their vechicle. No word of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 23/09. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. The convoy was heading towards Ceel-Jaale (7km SW of Marka) when the incident happened. Two AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed in the blast while a civilian was injured in the shooting. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces took over control of Baar Ganlave (33km SW of Beled Weyne) on 23/09 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters who pulled out before the arrival of the allied forces. The take-over is part of operations aimed to open the road between the Beled Weyne and the village after the al Shabaab fighters blocked vehicles transporting goods from using it.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces overtake Baar Gacallawe from al Shabaab, no reported violence.

Khatumo forces attacked Somaliland army based at Waqdari checkpoint in the southern outskirts of Laas Caanood in the evening of 23/09. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with heavy artillery fire that lasted for about 40 minutes after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces manning an illegal check-point in Cumar Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the SNG forces withdrew from the checkpoint. No

Dockworkers at Mogadishu port (Xamar Jab Jab District) demonstrated over plans to reduce the workforce in the morning of 24/09. The protest follows after Al Bayrak, a Turkish company, managing the port, announced that it will reduce the dockworkers from 6000 down to 3500. SNG police opened fire to disperse the dockworkers, injuring two. Another demonstration took place in the vicinity of the port.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a SNG forces in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 23/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are u
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a SNG forces on patrol in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 23/09.No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces based in Ceel Garas (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the night of 24/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Ten combatants were reportedly killed while unspecified numbers were injured. Following the clash Ethiopian forces killed two civilians, despite not believing they were associated with al Shabaab. The reasons for the violence against civilians are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces took over Derri Village (33km SW of Ceel Buur) on 24/09 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters who pulled out before the arrival of the allied forces.

Khatumo forces launched a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Gambadha (29km NE of Laas Caanood) in the night of 24/09. The two sides exchanged fire briefly after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen in a vehicle opened gunfire at car carrying Puntland Highway Engineer in Bulsho Junction of Hodan neighbourhood in the night of 24/09. The engineer was killed in the shooting. The victim hails from the Majerteen/Osman Mohamud. Reports indicate that the motive is reportedly related to clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A RCIED targeted Jubaland forces patrol vehicle in Shaqalaha area in Via Afmadow in the evening of 24/09. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces based in Ceel Garas (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the night of 24/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Ten combatants were reportedly killed while unspecified numbers were injured. Following the clash Ethiopian forces killed two civilians, despite not believe they were associated with al Shabaab. The reasons for the killings are not known.

Tensions reportedly ran high after militiamen (Habar-Gidir/Saad reer Jalaf sub-clan) blocked the security guards of Gen. Abdi Qaybdid on the road between Galkacyo and Cadaado in the afternoon of 25/09. Reports indicate that the two sides briefly clashed after which the security guards over powered the militiamen and forcefully passed the road block with three battle wagons while other soldiers with seven battle wagons remained at the road block scene. The security guards were heading to Cadaado to escort president Qaybdid back to Galkacyo. Both sides are reportedly calling for more reinforcement. Two reer Jalaf militiamen and a local sheikh who was trying to mediate between the two sides were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and attack against AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces based in Ceel Garas (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) on 25/09. Reports indicate that the two sides exchanged fire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Pro-Somaliland militias (Warsangeli/Dubeys sub-clan) attacked pro-Puntland militias of the same sub-clan based in Dhahar (170km S Laas-Qoray) in the afternoon of 25/09. Reports indicate that the clash followed after Puntland delegations led by the minister of livestock and the deputy minister of justice (both Warsangeli) visited Dhahar on a mission to mobilize the local residents to nominate members of the local councilors and to open a local government office. Local traditional elders intervened and managed to stop the brief clash between the two sides. A pro-Puntland militia was reportedly killed while a pro-Somaliland militia was also injured. Latest reports on 26/09 indicate that Somaliland deployed five battle wagons in Dhahar following the clash.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a vehicle carrying the deputy District Commissioner of Afgooye near the DCs office in Afgooye in the morning of 25/09. One of the guards of the deputy DC was injured by the explosion. SNG forces conducted a security operation immediately after the blast and arrested unspecified number of suspects. The perpetrators reportedly managed to escape.

Unidentified gunman armed with pistol shot and killed chief of Buqda village in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled-weyne) in the evening of 25/09. Reports indicate that the attacker were reportedly al Shabaab operatives. The perpetrator is escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Livestock market area (Heliwa District) in the night of 25/09. Both sides exchanged gun fire for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG police manning a check-point in Zoobe Junction (Wadajir District) in the evening of 25/09. Reports indicate that the police responded by firing after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

The employees of sheikh Hospital (fatouh Hospital) and Sheikh Water Agency staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Mayors office (Sheikh) on 26/09. The protestors were complaining about unpaid salaries over several months and they demanded from the government to dismiss both managers of (the Hospital and the Water Agency).

Two pastoralist groups (camel-herders) hailing from Habar-Yunis and Habar-Jeclo exchanged gunfire in Dhagaxyo-weylo near Xamilka village (17km E of Ceel-Afweyn) following an escalated dispute over grassland ownership in the morning of 26/09. Ceel-Afweyn police and local authorities stepped in to end hostiles between the two warring sides. A man from Habar-Jeclo/Mohamed Abokor sub-clan was injured.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly killed a civilian man hailing from Rahanweyn/Yantaar sub-clan in unnamed location near Diinsor town in the morning of 26/09. Reports indicate that the victim was accused of being a spy for SNG forces and have been arrested in Korunbod village (11km SE of Qansax dheere) four months ago.
Gunmen armed with pistols have shot dead a Somali army commander of Hiiraan region in central town of Beled Weyne.

A group of fishermen and their families staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Lughaye local government office on 27/09 following the arrest of Djiboutian fishermen and suspension of the fishing station. The protestors also requested from the government to be allowed to export fuel from Djibouti for their fishing boats.

Staffs working for Puntland state TV staged a demonstration on 27/09 following unpaid salaries over two months. Following the protest Puntland forces arrested some of the staffs from their houses. Latest reports on 28/09 indicate that most of the detainees have been released and the TV is back to the air.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against an AMISOM forces based at the Kismaayo airport in the evening of 27/09. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces Based in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 27/09. Reports indicate that the clash lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly injured.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against a SNG position in Olympic Junction of Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 27/09. Reports indicate that the SNG forces received reinforcement of three technical after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 27/09. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear but reports indicate that the victim used to sell alcoholic substances inside his residence.

A civilian man hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Reer Yunis sub-clan reportedly stabbed and injured his fellow clansman near Dhudhun Dhiilo village (33km N of Caynabo) on 27/09 following a dispute over land. The police arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A militiaman hailing from the Majerteen/Osman Mohamud shot and injured the Puntland deputy Commander of SPU (Osman Mohamud) in Alhamdulillah village (60km N of Qardho) on 27/09. The motive behind the incident is reportedly a personal dispute between the victim and the perpetrator. Police arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland security forces in Xarfo conducted a security operation on the road between Xarfo (70km N of Galkacyo) and Burtinle in the evening of 27/09. Reports indicate that the forces were targeting unidentified armed group who erected an illegal road block to rob public passengers using the road. The forces seized Puntland Darawish uniforms, an AK-47 rifle and a Toyota Land Cruiser used by the perpetrators. A Puntland soldier was injured during the operation. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces based at former Meat Factory in Gulwade neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 27/09. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Members of al Shabaab stone a woman to death for alleged polyandry. Exact date not known - may have occurred on 26/09.

A RCIED apparently targeting a teashop frequented by SNG soldiers in Kabooley market (Baled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 28/09. Two civilians were reportedly killed while a SNG police man and a civilian were injured.

Two pastoral groups hailing from Abgal and Biimaal clashed in Bulo Siidow (16km N of Marka) in the morning of 28/09. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged fighting for about 30 minutes. The motive behind the renewed inter-clan clash was reportedly based on clan revenge and dispute over grazing land. At least four combatants were reportedly killed while Abgal militias steal unspecified numbers of livestock from Habar-Gidir.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attacked against SNG soldiers manning a check-point near Cumar Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 28/09. Reports indicate that the two sides clashed briefly after which the SNG soldiers pull back. A SNG soldier was killed while two others were injured.

NISA forces briefly clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Wargodka (9km S of Afgooye) in the morning of 28/09. Reports indicate that the NISA forces were on special security operation when the fighting happened. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Ugaar Saleeban shot and killed a civilian man from Ali Saleeban in Dharoor village (49km NW of Iskushuban) on 28/09. The motive is reportedly clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against a public vehicle travelling to Qoryooley in the afternoon of 28/09. Reports indicate that the driver managed to pass at the ambush scene while the gunfire is continuing. The town is currently under al Shabaab blockade. At least four passengers were reportedly inured.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG base in Biyo degaanka area (Heliwa District) in the night of 28/09. Reports indicate that the two sides clashed about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A group of street vendors stage a peaceful demonstration in front of Zeylac local government offices on 29/09 following a security operation targeting to demolish temporary shops built along the main roads. The protestors requested from the government to allow them to conduct their businesses.

Two pastoralist groups from Marehan/Reer Ahmed sub-clan and Rahanweyn/Gobaaweyn clashed using axes and sticks in Geer Boolow village (13km NW of Luuq) in the morning of 29/09. Reports indicate that the clash was triggered following escalated land dispute between the two sides. 14 people from both sides were reportedly injured. SNG and local elders stepped in to mediate but its currently unclear whether an agreement was reached or not.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man inside his house in Beytu-Raas neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 29/09. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The victim hails from Rahanweyn and he use to work in the police station during Indho Cades administration. The Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a prominent Sheikh inside a mosque in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled-weyne) in the night of 29/09. Reports indicate that the victim was an imam for the mosque. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The perpetrators escape.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly executed four men in a firing squad in a public ground (Baraawe) in the evening of 29/09. The men were accused of been spy for the SNG or its allies. Reports indicate that one the executed man was working for CRD.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Jubaland forces based at the outskirts of Afmadow town in the night of 29/09. Reports indicate that the attackers withdrew immediately. No casualties were reported.
Believing their jobs in jeopardy to foreign Turkish labour, port workers protest outside the Parliament building to express their grievance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 30/09. Reports indicate that the forces open fire in response to the blast. The convoy was coming back from AMISOM base in Ceel-Haji when the incident happened. One civilian was killed, three others were injured and two shops were caught up by fire in the subsequent shooting while an AMISOM vehicle was damaged.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces managed to took over Rage-Ceelle village (46km NE of Warsheikh) in the afternoon of 30/09. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters vacated the village before arrival of the allied forces. Further information suggests that al Shabaab fighters also vacated nearby Cadale town.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade giants SNG forces based at Buunda Weyne Bridge (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 30/09. Reports indicate that the device landed in an empty place causing no casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters heavily armed launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Danow village (16km W of Marka) in the night of 30/09. Reports indicate that the two sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for more than an hour. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out three hit and run attacks against SNG positions in Boqoleey, Olympic Junction of Berdale and Mursal neighbourhoods (Baidoa) in the evening of 30/09. Reports indicate that the fighting lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A gunman armed with AK-47 hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Baho Sub-clan shot at his fellow clansman in Masle near Beer Weyso(97km S of Ceerigaabo) on 30/09. Reports indicate that the victim escaped unhurt after the shooter missed the target and instead killed two camels grazing nearby. The motive behind the incident is reportedly related to dispute over grazing land. Police from Ceel-Afweyn arrived at the scene and arrested the perpetrator.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM took-over Cadale town in the afternoon of 01/10 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters vacated the town a day earlier before the allied forces reached at the town. Further reports indicate that the residents also vacated the town following after the al Shabaab fighters issued the order.

Two opposite clan militias hailing from Hawaadle and Dir clashed in Deefow village (30km NW of Beled-weyne) in the morning of 01/10. Reports indicate that Dir militias initiated the fighting that lasted for about an hour after which the Dir militias managed to take control of the village. Two combatants were injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces took-over Mariin-Gubaay and Abaq Talaal villages (48km NE of Baraawe) on 01/10. The Governor of Lower Shabelle who spoke to Radio Mogadishu confirmed that the al Shabaab fighters vacated the villages heading towards Baraawe before the arrival of the allied forces.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces took-over Mariin-Gubaay and Abaq Talaal villages (48km NE of Baraawe) on 01/10. The Governor of Lower Shabelle who spoke to Radio Mogadishu confirmed that the AS fighters vacated the villages heading towards Baraawe before the arrival of the allied forces.

Al Shabaab militia ambush SNG/ENDF forces conducting a security operation in an area east of Maxaas along the road connecting to Waxbo in the morning of 01/10. Reports indicate that the two sides exchanged gunfire for about 45 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A RCIED targeted SNG military vehicle on the road near Yaaq Biri Weyne in the morning of 01/10. A SNG soldier was reportedly injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/10. The convoy was heading to Buulo Mareer when the incident happened. One AMISOM carrier was damaged by the blast.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: The fighting was initiated by Puntland forces after two soldiers were killed and a battle wagon destroyed in an IED explosion planted by al Shabaab/Galgala fighters on the road side. The two sides reportedly engaged in a fierce fighting that caused casualties which could not be established. The fighting caused tension in the area and along the highway to Bossaso in the Galgala Hills.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces on security patrol briefly clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters near Maryam Kassim Hospital in Gulwade neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 01/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Five causalities were later reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A RCIED targeted Jubaland forces riding on vehicle conducting a security patrol in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 01/10. Two soldiers and two civilians bystanders were injured while the vehicle was partially destroyed.
Al Shabaab fighters attack and overtake Daynuunay location after a brief battle with Somali government forces. Causalities not known. The date of the attack is not known, the source is dated 03/10.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante in a pick-up tried to forcefully drive into Somaliland army base in Qorilugud (38km NW of Buuhoodle)on 02/10. The Somaliland forces managed to repulse the gunmen. The motive of the attack is believed to be a revenge attack in which a brother of one of the gunmen who was killed in Buuhoodle, during an armed clash between Somaliland and Khatumo forces in 2012. One gunman was killed in the Qorilugud clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired shots towards Waajid town in the night of 02/10 and withdrew quickly. AMISOM/pro-SNG forces did not respond to the shooting. No casualties were reported.

A man shot and seriously injured a SNG soldier in an IDP camp in Luuq in the evening of 02/10. The motive is unknown. The soldier is based in Yurkud (40km SE of Luuq) and was visiting his sick father in the camp when the incident happened - it is not clear if the soldier was in uniform. The perpetrator, a former al Shabaab fighter who current affiliation is not known, was immediately arrested by pro-SNG forces and handed over to AMISOM (ENDF).

A RCIED targeted a SNG forces convoy near Ceelesha settlement (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 03/10. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. One soldier was killed and two others injured in the blast.

SNG forces from Baidoa took over the village without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters who withdrew before their arrival. Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters took with them three civilians.

Al Shabaab fighters took over control of Daynuunay Village (19km SE of Baidoa) in a dawn attack against SNG forces on 03/10. SNG forces withdrew after a brief exchange of gunfire. One SNG soldier was killed and two others injured.
Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in Gafuule neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the morning of 03/10. No casualties reported.

Pro-SNG forces from Wajiid conducting security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Aleemow Village (19km NE of Waajid) in the morning of 03/10. Seven al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. The pro-SNG forces also seized four guns during the clash. Their bodies were brought to Waajid and displayed to the public.

Khatumo forces reportedly attacked Somaliland forces based in Wadada Dogob near Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 03/10. Somaliland forces responded with heavy artillery after which the Khatumo forces to withdraw. No casualties were reported.
A RCIED targeted SNG forces in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 03/10. Two soldiers were injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Clan militias from Hawadle and Dir clashed in Debow Village (30km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 04/10. The fighting was initiated by Hawadle militias. The two sides engaged in a serious fighting that went on for about an hour. Reports indicate that 11 combatants were killed and 30 others injured. The village is still under the control of Dir militia.

ASWJ forces attacked a residence in Guri Ceel where two ASWJ militiamen who deserted the force were chewing khat in the afternoon of 04/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the ASWJ forces withdrew. One ASWJ soldier was killed and another wounded. The two defectors (target men) escaped from the scene unhurt. The ASWJ forces involved in the attack were later arrested.

ASWJ forces and the body guards of the Guri Ceel District Commissioner exchanged fire in the town in the morning of 04/10. The shootout started after ASWJ forces tried to arrest the DC of Guri Ceel, who had been holding a meeting with a youth group, whose top agenda was supporting the SNGs efforts of establishing the central Somali state. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the ASWJ forces withdrew. The meeting resumed after the shootout.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces convoy in Roobow Village (22km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 04/10. The two sides engaged in a gun-battle that lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Eleven al Shabaab fighters and two SNG soldiers were reportedly killed and a number of combatants injured. The convoy had left Bulo Mareer and was heading to Baraawe when the ambush took place.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG police on foot patrol at Sanca Junction (Kaaraan District) in the morning of 04/10. The police officers opened fire after the blast. Two civilians were injured in the shooting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over control of Baraawe without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 05/10. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly withdrew before the arrival of the allied forces. The allied forces entered the town on foot.

SNG forces ambushed al Shabaab fighters escorting vehicles transporting commercial goods near Hugey Village (16kms SW of Tayeeglow) in the afternoon of 05/10. The two sides engaged in a serious fighting that went on for about an hour. Ten al Shabaab fighters and two SNG soldiers were reportedly killed in the clash.
RCIED targeted SNG forces on foot patrol in Afgooyes livestock market in the afternoon of 06/10. The device was reportedly planted in a garbage container. Three soldiers were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Goobweyne (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/10. A KDF armoured vehicle was damaged in the explosion. Casualties are unknown.
