column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and AMISOM/SNG forces clashed in Baraawe a short while after the allied forces entered the town on foot in the morning of 06/10. SNG forces denied any clash with al Shabaab fighters in Baraawe but locals confirmed the fighting.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces manning a check-point in Gandarshe Village (26km NE of Marka) in the morning of 06/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three soldiers were reportedly killed in

Unidentified pro-Khatumo gunmen killed a Somaliland soldier in Saalax Dheer Village on 06/10. The incident happened after the soldier entered the village alone for shopping. The victim, who was also armed, was killed in a shoot-out with the perpetrators. Two women bystanders were injured by stray bullets. Somaliland intelligence officers launched an operation to hunt the perpetrators.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters arrested a business man travelling in Jiriq-Gaab village (15km W of Buulo Burte) on 03/10. The reason behind the arrest is unknown but it might be linked with the economic blockade on Buulo Burte by al Shabaab fighters. The man was executed after three days (10/06).

Biimaal militia manning a checkpoint shot and killed a driver hailing from Habar-Gidir near Gol-Weyn (Marka District) in the night of 06/10. The motive behind the killing is believed to be clan revenge. The incident comes one week after representatives from Habar Gidir and Biimaal clans agreed on a six point peace deal brokered by Abgal elders in Mogadishu.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM/Jubaland forces on security operations, clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Yoontoy Yare Village (28km N of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/10. Three Jubaland soldiers were reportedly killed and seven others wounded. AMISOM and al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A RCIED targeted Jubaland forces vehicle in Lugloow Village (19km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/10. Three soldiers were killed and eight others were injured in the blast.

Two men armed with pistols shot and injured a SNG police officer in the vicinity of Bakaara Junction (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 06/10. A bus conductor was killed in the same incident. It is not known if both victims were targeted or if the conductor was a bystander. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-Ethiopia and al Shabaab forces clash in Bulacle, outside of Dhuusamarreeb the evening of 06/10. The two hour battle caused 10 Ethiopian deaths according to the Somali Memo, which is pro-al Shabaab. Other reports do not confirm deaths.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM and Juba forces overtake Buulo Gaduud from al Shabaab, killing 22. One Conflicting report: Hiiran Online reported no violence in the takeover.

Unidentified gunman shot and killed a SNG soldier in Suuq Bocle (Dharkenley District) in the evening of 07/10. The motive behind the killed is currently unclear. Reports indicate that both the perpetrator and the victim reportedly hail from Abgal. The perpetrator escaped.

A group of SNG police and NISA forces clashed twice between Mogadishu Port and General Kahiye Police Academy (Xamar Jajab District) in the evening of 07/10. Reports indicate that the clash followed after NISA forces killed a police officer at Israac Junction for unknown reasons. Senior SNG personnel intervened and managed to stop the fighting. Two NISA soldiers and a police were killed while three other soldiers and two civilians were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM and Jubaland forces clash with al Shabaab in Kamsuma, one al Shabaab member reported killing in the fighting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan AMISOM forces kill a reported 60 members of al Shabaab and recovered five vehicles during a battle in Buulo Gaduud. The operation included a series of air strikes. The AMISOM effort was launched to liberate the area, which was ultimately successful.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: War planes belong to Kenyan forces conducted air strike against al Shabaab locations in Jilib town in the morning of 07/10. Reports indicate that some local residents fled to Kismaayo or other safer places following the air strike. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Buur Dhuxunle (34km SE of Rabdhure) in the night of 07/10. No casualties were reported.

Two opposite clan militia hailing from Dir and Marehan engaged in an escalated dispute of water point and clashed in Lan-xirey neighbourhood in the of outskirts of Xeraale town in the afternoon of 8/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes. One person was killed and five others wounded. The situation is tense while traditional elders are trying to reconcile the warring sides.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against ENDF (association with AMISOM not reported) based in Ceel-lahelay (32km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the night of 08/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about one and half hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are could not be established.

Two militia groups from Habar-Jeclo Sub-clans (Faahiye & Roobsuge) exchanged gunfire in Dhadhinyahya (15km E of Ceel-Afweyn) on 08/10 following a dispute over land ownership. Reports indicate that police from Ceel-Afweyn arrived at the scene and arrested four people from both sides to end the tension. Tension is reportedly building up where both sides are reportedly mobilizing their militias. No causalities reported.

SNG forces on security patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Laanta Garaska (8km N of Waajid) in the afternoon of 08/10. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged heavy fighting after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A SNG soldier was killed and another one was injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNAF position in Bullo Mareer on the 8/10. Both sides exchange heavy and light gun fire for around 20 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters stopped and opened fire in to a public vehicle in Shawliga area (6km NW of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 08/10. Reports indicate that a woman was killed while a man was injured and a third person was taken to unknown location. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly shot and killed a civilian man accused of spying in an unnamed location between Ceel Ure village (62km E of Luuq) and Waajid town in the afternoon of 07/10. The victim was allegedly accused of spying for AMISOM/SNG.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM troops stationed in Danow opened fire against a vehicle carrying a group SNG soldiers near Danow (Marka District) in the afternoon of 09/10 after they were informed that the vehicle was carrying explosives. The soldiers were reportedly transporting Khat to Buulo Mareer town when the incident happened. One SNAF soldier was killed and another one got injured.
SNG forces attacked a group of al Shabaab fighters in Abdulkarim neighbourhood on 09/10. The two sides engaged fighting for about 30 minutes. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed.

A group of armed militiamen opened fire and killed another militiaman in Buulo jaan neighbourhood (Marka) following a dispute over the tax collected from an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 09/10. Both the attackers and the victim hail from Habar Gidir sub clan of Hawiye. Perpetrators were not arrested.

Two armed groups from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan clashed in the vicinity of Saalax Dheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) on 09/10. The groups clashed over a dispute aroused looted a gun and a pistol from the Somaliland soldier who killed in Saalax Dheer on 06/10. One combatant was killed while another one was injured.

A unidentified man stabbed four people in 26 June District (Hargeisa) in the afternoon of 10/10. The attacker was willing to be nominated as a candidate for the coming parliamentary election in 2015, whereby the victims opposed his candidature according to clan elders preferences. The local people managed to apprehend the perpetrator and handed over to the police.

An IED believed to be magnetic detonated in a car at Cinema Super area (Xamar Weyne District) in the evening of 10/10. The device was attached to the vehicle. SNG police arrived at the scene and arrested the driver of the car for further questioning. No casualties were reported. Causalities/injuries not reported. It was later learned the car belonged to the former Mogadishu mayor.

An IED accidentally exploded in Black Sea Junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 10/10. Apparently al Shabaab operatives were planting the device in a vehicle belonging to a SNG military officer. Three al Shabaab operatives were killed.

Khatumo forces reportedly launched a hit and run attack against Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh (lasted for an hour against the Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh village on 11/10. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with heavy artillery and shells in which Khatumo forces withdraw from the scene. Causalities not known.

A RCIED targeted SNG convoy near Roobow village (22km NE of Baraawe) in the morning 11/10. Al Shabaab fighters carried an ambush against the SNG convoy following the blast. A SNG military carrier was damaged. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceelasha Biyaaha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 11/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers retreated back. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Jubaland forces base in Bulo Gaduud (35km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 11/10. AMISOM forces responded with heavy gunfire which lasted 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Al Shabaab had recently lost control of the area to allied forces and were attempting to recover the area. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed a SNG Soldier in Trebuunka area (Hodan District) in the evening of 11/10. SNG soldiers in the area arrived at the scene but made no arrest. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces outpost in Miisanka Dhuhusha neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 11/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and severely injure a local journalist during an attack in Hawl Wadaag District.

""A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated in front of Aroma Restaurant at Makah Al-Mukaram Road (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening. The restaurant was hosting an event to mark 60th anniversary of the founding of the Somali flag. Thirteen people were killed while 18 others were injured, one of the casualties was a local staff member of a INGO.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces withdrew from Buur Dhuxunle Village (59kms SE of Yeed) in the afternoon of 12/10 after a five-day stay. The reason behind the withdrawal is unknown. The troops were part of AMISOM forces that had escorted food from Ethiopia to Waajid a few days ago. Al Shabaab fighters took over the village immediately after the pull out of the allied forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM-Djibouti forces clash with al Shabaab for several hours in Bulo Burte. Causalities reported, numbers not known. Radio Andalus is pro-al Shabaab.

SNG forces on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Dameeralays area located in the western outskirts of Beled Weyne in the morning of 12/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two pastoralist groups (camel-herders) hailing from Habar-Yunis/Sacad-Yunis Sub-clans clashed in Siigo-dheer (117km S of Ceerigaabo, in Sool) on 12/10. Reports indicate that the fighting was triggered after one of the groups stole 40 camels from the other side a day earlier. Causalities not known.
Unidentified attackers shot and injured a local journalist in Black Sea neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 12/10. Reports indicate that the victim was the head of Somali Channel TV.

Unidentified armed men dressed in SNG uniform open fire at public transport vehicle at Fagax Junction (Yaaqshiid District). It is not clear if the attackers were legitimate soldiers. The reason behind the shooting is currently unknown. A woman was killed. The perpetrators escaped.

A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated in front of Aroma Restaurant at Makah Al-Mukaram Road (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 12/10. The vehicle was at the parking yard when the incident happened. Reports indicate that Hawl-Wadaag District Commissioner and other government officials were present in the hotel at the time of the incident but none of them were hurt. The restaurant was hosting an event to mark 60th anniversary when Somalia flag was found. Thirteen (13) people were killed while 18 others were injured.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked a SNG forces based in former Perfume Factory area (Heliwa District) in the night of 12/10. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired an unspecific number of Mortar or B10 rounds which landed in the vicinity of Banadir Governors Office near Hotel Ramadan (Heliwa District) in the night of 12/10.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces position near former Pasta factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 12/10. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire for a short period after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Causalities from both sides could
An unidentified assailants attacks and beheads a men as he left a mosque following evening prayers. The reason for the attack is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Militiamen loyal to Bare Hiiraale attacked Jubaland forces fetching water from River Juba in Goob Weyn (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 13/10. The attackers are part of Bare Hiraales militias who didn't surrender themselves to Jubaland authorities. Two Jubaland soldiers were injured.

A RCIED targeted a SNG police vehicle at Adan Ade Road in Hawl-Wadaag District in the afternoon of 13/10. Casualties could not be established. A pro-al Shabaab website reported that al Shabaab was behind the attack.

Al Shabaab forces attack four Somali bases in Baraawe, engage in ""heavy fighting."" The source cites SNG-AMISOM fatalities in the area, but does not expressly report any at Baraawe. Radio Andalus is pro-al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacked a Puntland military vehicle during the afternoon hours, ten Puntland deaths reported. Somali Memo is pro-al Shabaab and often times exaggerates its exploits.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces fired artillery shells against al Shabaab positions in Kurta. Some shells were also launched in the Weeley area. No causalities reported.

Pro-SNG (not identified) forces based in Xudur conducted a security operation in Qeedi area (25kms N of Xudur) in the afternoon of 13/10. The security forces reportedly killed an al Shabaab fighter in the area and returned to their base in Xudur.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG forces convoy in Leego Village (52km E of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 13/10. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

More than a hundred people staged anti-Somaliland and Puntland demonstration in Buuhoodle on 13/10. The rally was organized by Khatumo officials and reportedly follows reports that Puntlands vice-president is planning to visit Buuhoodle. The rally ended peacefully.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces base in Yoontoy Yare Village (27km N of Kismaayo) in the morning of 13/10. The two sides engaged in a serious exchange of assorted weapons fire. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly left behind two bodies. Jubaland forces casualties could be established.

A device believed to be an IED was discovered near Ramadan Hotel (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 13/10. The device went off before the EOD team, who had arrived in the area, began to disable it.

A VBIED exploded in a garage in Black Sea neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 13/10. A NISA vehicle was being repaired in the garage when the incident happened. It remains unclear whether it was an accidental explosion or detonated intentionally. The VBIED driver was killed and a mechanic repairing the NISA vehicle was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM troops on foot patrol in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 14/10. The attack started with hand grenade followed by gunshot which lasted for about an hour. Three AMISOM soldiers and a civilian bystander were killed.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Qoryooley in the evening of 14/10. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim defected from al Shabaab and used to run a restaurant in the town frequented by SNG soldiers. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 14/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces fired mortar rounds to the positions of Bare Hiraales militias in Goob Weyn (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 14/10 in retaliation to an earlier attack by the militias. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a businessman and injured another person near the District Commissioners office in Dayniile District in the morning of 14/10. The motive is unknown but reports indicate that the victim was an engineer working for Dayniile District administration on road reconstruction projects. The perpetrators took away his car but later abandoned it in the vicinity of the incident scene.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces near Sarta Qabyada (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 14/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A Somali man who recently returned from Canada has beheaded a worshipper at a mosque. The location of the mosque within Mogadishu is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM (ENDF) convoy in Bulacle Village (30km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the evening of 15/10. The two sides have exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the attackers withdrew. The AMISOM forces had left Dhusamareeb and were heading to Ceel Garas Village, when the ambush took place. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG positions in Rage-Ceele village (45km NE of Warsheikh) in the night of 15/10. The two sides engaged fighting for about 20 minutes after which the attackers. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces at the livestock market neighbourhood in Baidoa in the evening of 15/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were wounded. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters seized a businessman hailing from Rahaweyn/Hadame from Kurta Village (40km NE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 15/10 and took him to their al Shabaab base in Labatan Jirow Village (48km N of Baidoa). The motive is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 15/10. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers fired four mortar or B10 rounds in Wardhiigley, Boondheere and Shibis districts in the evening of 15/10. All the mortars landed in open areas and caused no casualties.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle belonging to NISA in the vicinity of Afarta Jardiino neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 15/10. The device is believed to have been planted in the vehicle. Two NISA soldiers were killed and at least six civilians injured.
Unidentified attackers fired four mortar or B10 rounds in Wardhiigley, Boondheere and Shibis districts in the evening of 15/10. All the mortars landed in open areas and caused no casualties.

A vehicle parked in front of Panorama Hotel (Xamar Weyne District) exploded in the evening of 15/10. Eight people including two children were killed while unspecified numbers were injured. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack. The restaurant is frequented by SNG officials, journalists and Diaspora.
Unidentified attackers fired four mortar or B10 rounds in Wardhiigley, Boondheere and Shibis districts in the evening of 15/10. All the mortars landed in open areas and caused no casualties.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 15/10. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Clashes between AMISOM-Ethiopia forces and al Shabaab erupts in Wabxo the night of 16/10 and lasts at least until the following afternoon. Officers who spoke for Al-Shabaab said that their fighters had taken control of most parts of Wabxo locality and that the fighting was continuing. Causalities not reported.

Somaliland forces set up a base in Dabo-Taag Village (45km S of Laas Caanood) on 16/10 after they reportedly withdrew from Saalax Dheer (59km S of Laas Caanood). The motive behind the troop movement is unclear but it is believed that it was related to reports that Khatumo forces are planning to attack Somaliland forces in Kalabaydh Village.

Two Arab sub-clans (Samane and Duulane) clashed following dispute aroused over landownership in Masalaha area (Ahmed Dhagah District) in the afternoon of 16/10. Police arrived at the scene and stopped the skirmish but made no arrest. Two civilians were injured during the clash.
Al Shabaab hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in chicken market in Isha neighbourhood on 16/10. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab operatives beheaded an old man inside Baraawe town in the night in 16/10. The motive is unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim welcomed SNG forces to Baraawe.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 16/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Ahmad Madobes militiamen (those loyal to southern Somalia regional administration) and al Shabaab clash in the village of Khaam Khaam, near Yoontoy Yarey. Casualties reported, though numbers were not provided. Later reports indicate the causality totals could be as high as 60 - Radio Al-Furqaan, which is pro-al Shabaab.
A group of traders protest over tax increases.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Clashes between AMISOM-Ethiopia forces and al Shabaab erupts in Wabxo the night of 16/10 and lasts at least until the following afternoon. Officers who spoke for Al-Shabab said that their fighters had taken control of most parts of Wabxo locality and that the fighting was continuing. Causalities not reported.

Al Shabaab fighters and Eyle (Elay) clan militia clashed in Showliga Village (6km SW of Bulo Burte) on 17/10. The fighting broke out after the al Shabaab fighters killed an elder from Eyle clan earlier in the day. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes. Four people were killed and 7 others were wounded. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after SNG/AMISOM forces backed the clan militia.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (ENDF) in Waxbo Village (40km W of Ceel Buur) in the dawn of 17/10. The two sides engaged in a fierce fighting that went on for about four hours. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (KDF) base in Bula Gudud (32km N of Kismaayo) in the evening of 17/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were

Unidentified gunmen ambushed a vehicle transporting khat near Ceel-Wareegow Village (17km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 17/10. The khat traders were also armed and exchanged gunfire with the gunmen. Two Khat traders were reportedly injured in the shoot-out. The vehicle came from Mogadishu and was heading to Shalaambood and Buulo Mareer villages when the incident happened.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against NISA base in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 17/10. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes. One of NISA officer was reportedly killed two others injured. Al Shabaab casualties could not be ascertained.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base near Kismaayo University in the evening of 17/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in Kiliga-Shiinaha Village (38km N of Jowhar) in the evening of 17/10. The fighting lasted for about 15 minutes. One soldier was killed and t
Al Shabaab fighters kill an elder of the Elay clan in Sigaalow (Showliga). The murder caused a clash between the two groups later in the day.
A suspected al Shabaab operative, who was in SNG custody in Dollow succumbed to his injuries resulting from torture during interrogation in the night of 17/10.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 17/10. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces position in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 17/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about twenty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab attack a military base in Siinka Dheer, kills a army commander and four other soldiers. Following the incident, al Shabaab formally declared responsibility.

Habar Jeclo/Reer Biniin clan militia carried out a hit-and-run against police based in Diiriye Guuleed Village (16km N of Burao) in the morning of 18/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the clan militia withdrew. Police arrested six militias during the brief clash. The police were deployed to the area to prevent clashes between Reer Binin and Abdala Arab sub-clans following a dispute over land ownership in the area. The attack is believed to be related to the recent ruling by the mediation team from the house of elders, which ruled that the disputed land belongs to Abdala Arab, a decision strongly opposed by Habar Jeclo/Reer Binin. Causalities/injuries not known.

Pro-SNG (not named) forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Baana Village (16km SE of Xudur) in the morning of 18/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the pro-SNG forces withdrew. Two pro-SNG solders and three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed a pro-SNG soldier was also injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces in Gol-Weyn Village (21km SW of Marka) in the night of 18/10. The two sides exchanged both heavy and light gunfire for about an hour. The al Shabaab fighters were on mission to forcefully rescue colleagues held by the SNG forces. Casualties are unknown.

Gunmen from Habar-Gidir/Saad shot and killed their clansman near Astan Golol area in Galkacyo South in the afternoon of 18/01. The motive behind the killing is believed to be clan revenge following the killing of three pirates during a clash among pirates over sharing of ransom reportedly received from the release of a German-American journalist last month. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The killing caused tension in Galkacyo South.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 18/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/Jubaland forces in Bula Gudud (32km N of Kismaayo) in the evening of 18/10. The two sides used both light and heavy gunfire. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed over an illegal checkpoint in Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon 18/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan naval forces launch deck guns toward al Shabaab positions on Kudhaa Island causing ""deaths and injuries"", the extent of which is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Hawadle militia ambushed AMISOM (Djiboutian contingent) convoy near Ceel Gaal Village (13km NE of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 19/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes. One Hawadle militia was injured and another captured. The convoy had left Beled Weyne and was heading to Deefow to stop the fighting between Hawadle and Dir clan militias, when the ambush took place. The AMISOM convoy suspended their mission and returned to their base in Beled Weyne.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 19/10 accusing AMISOM (Djiboutian contingent) of siding with the Dir clan in the ongoing conflict between Dir and Hawadle clans in Deefow Village (29km NW of Beled Weyne). The demonstration follows after the Djiboutian forces left for Deefow Village but returned before reaching the village.

Kenyan navy bombed al Shabaab bases in Koday Village (53km E of Badhaadhe) and Mudawa Island (91km SE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 19/10. Reports say 15 al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attacks bombardment.

Kenyan navy bombed al Shabaab bases in Koday Village (53km E of Badhaadhe) and Mudawa Island (91km SE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 19/10. Reports say 15 al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attacks bombardment.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two men near Carwo Limoni (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 19/10. The motive is currently unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the victims used to sell khat to SNG soldiers in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of SOS Junction (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 19/10. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

A NISA soldier reportedly shot and killed a truck driver in Sariindi neighbourhood (Xamar Jab District) in the morning of 19/10 following an escalated dispute. The perpetrator was later arrested by NISA officers.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a convoy transporting a UN agency food aid near Wardagaal Village (24km W of Beled Weyne) on 20/10. The private escort of the convoy engaged in a fierce fighting with the al Shabaab fighters. Seven combatants were killed and three others wounded.
A pro-SNG soldier tried to block a UN agency plane from landing at Xudur airstrip (20/10). The soldier was in protest against unpaid salary. AMISOM forces arrested him.

SNG forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Makoon and Qodqoda villages near Manaas (31km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 20/10. Both sides engaged an extensive fighting for a few minutes after which the SNG forces managed to take-over the village. Reports indicate that the SNG forces later returned to their base in Goof Gaduud Shabeelow. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 20/10. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Black sea neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 20/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack and kill 35 Jubba forces in an overnight surprise attack on Qam-Qam location, near Kismayo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy passing near Beerta Liinta in the vicinity of Mooda-Mooda village (25km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 21/10. The device reportedly hit a fuel tanker burning it completely. Local farmers in the area run away immediately from the incident scene but AMISOM forces chased them and managed to arrest one of the farmers. Its currently unclear if the farmers had connection with attack.

SNG soldier hailing from Rahanweyn/Maalim Weyne sub-clan shot and injured his colleague from the same sub-clan in Bardaale town (52km NW of Baidoa) in the morning of 21/10. The victim has been taken to Baidoa for treatment. SNG soldiers in the area arrested the perpetrator.

Unidentified attackers ambushed SNG soldiers escorting a lorry carrying food stuffs in Kali-Caafimaad area (20km NE of Marka) in the afternoon of 21/10. The ambush followed extensive fighting where SNG soldiers called for reinforcement from Shalaambood forcing the attackers to withdraw. At least five combatants from both sides and a civilian were killed while around 10 others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted an ambush against SNG convoy in Jiiro Gurey village (8km E of Baidoa) in the morning of 21/10. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers were pushed back. A SNG soldier who falls out of a vehicle sustained injuries. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

SNG forces briefly clashed with al Shabaab fighters in unnamed location between Goof Gaduud Shabeelow and Manaas in the morning of 21/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire in a brief moment after which the al Shabaab fighters retreated back. No casualties were reported.
Marehan/Wagar dhac gunmen open fire at UN agency convoy transporting food in attempt to loot in Cabud Waaq (21/10). No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab authorities in Sablaale executed a man by stoning on 21/10 following a court ruling after he was allegedly accused of raping a woman. A judge presiding over the court said that the man admitted the crime hence the judgment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds at a position of Puntland forces in the vicinity of Galgala Village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 21/10. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Arwo Itka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 21/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear.

SNG forces shot and killed a man they suspected of been an al Shabaab operatives in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 21/10. Reports indicate that the man had a pistol and a hand grenade when the security forces killed him.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces shoot and kill three elders and wounded four others after their convoy was attacked in Markas Ruusiya and Bayturaas neighbourhoods (coded separately). [Witnesses] said the Amisom convoy came under grenade attacks in several locations in the town. Following the attacks, Amisom soldiers entered homes and shot civilians, including the local elders.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy comes under grenade attack in Markas Ruusiya and Bayturaas neighbourhoods. Following the attacks angered AMISOM forces committed atrocities against civilians in the town, including killing three elders.

Suspected al Shabaab militia ambushed a convoy of a UN contractor escorted by SNG soldiers in War-dagaal (24km W of Beled-weyne) in the afternoon of 20/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 40 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy was heading to Qurac Joome village when the ambush happened. At least seven combatants from both sides were killed while three others were injured. Latest reports indicate that convoy safely reached its destination. At least one report holds the attack occurred on 21/10.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a local elder in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 22/10. The victim was coming out of a mosque when the incident happened. The motive behind the attack is not known. The perpetrators escaped.

Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gedir/Saad sub-clan shot and killed three civilians from Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clan in Saaxo village (70km SW of Galkacyo) on 22/10. Reports indicate that the incident is related to be clan revenge. Tensions reportedly run high in the area.

A group of Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a private lorry, transporting fuel and food in Xamiir Gub (27km SE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 22/10 and kidnapped the driver and other passengers. The whereabouts of the vehicle and its passengers are currently unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired several mortar rounds at the position of Puntland forces in Galgala area (35km NW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 22/10. The attack was reportedly in retaliation to an earlier attack by Puntland forces against the insurgents. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces in Luglaaw (19km NE of Kismaayo) in the night of 22/10. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. One Jubaland soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured. Jubaland forces claimed to have killed three al Shabaab fighters.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (KDF) and Jubaland forces based in Bulo Gudud (32km N of Kismaayo) in the night of 22/10. The two sides used heavy and light weapons before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Four al Shabaab

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against KDF/Jubaland forces based in Yoontoy Yare (27km N of Kismaayo) in the night of 22/10. Both sides engaged an extensive fighting after which the al Shabaab fighters withdraw. Causalities could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against at a NISA checkpoint in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 22/10. The hand grenade was followed by exchange of gunfire between the attackers and the NISA forces which lasted for about ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland forces launch an attack on a Galmudug held area. Galmudug forces reportedly ""repulsed the attackers."" Causalities not known .

SNG forces clash with al Shabaab at Sabiib village on the outskirts of Afgooye district. Government forces are reported to have repulsed back the Al-Shabaab fighters who launched the assault. Causalities not known.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at a police post near Afar-irdoodka in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 23/10. SNG police open fire and managed to apprehend the perpetrator. A young boy and a woman selling tea in the area were injured by the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOMs base in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the night of 23/10. The two sides used differently weaponry during the clash which lasted for about twenty minutes, after which the al Shabaab fighters withdraw. Casualties are unknown.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle carrying the District Commissioner of Yaaqshiid near Lafweyn Hotel (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 23/10. The device detonated after the DCs vehicle passed over the area. The security guards of the DC opened fire in response to the blast. A female bystander was injured in the subsequent shooting.
A Somali soldier is shot and killed in the Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: The joint SNG/Kenya Defence Forces (AMISOM) have killed more than 80 members of al-Shabaab in an offensive in Jamaame and Magambo areas near Kismaayo in Somalia.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: The joint SNG/Kenya Defence Forces (AMISOM) have killed more than 80 members of al-Shabaab in an offensive in Jamaame and Magambo areas near Kismaayo in Somalia.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Sabiid village (9km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 24/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen from Bimal shot and killed a driver from Habar-Gidir near K50 (21km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 24/10. The reason behind the killing is believed to be clan revenge between the two clans.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters re-grouped themselves and attacked Jubaland forces in Abdale Birole, where both sides engaged heavy fighting which lasted throughout the day. Jubaland forces received re-enforcement from Kismaayo but were overwhelmed and al Shabaab fighters managed to re-take-over the village. At least 10 Jubaland forces were killed and one vehicle was captured by al Shabaab fighters. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Jubaland forces back up by KDF in logistics and aerial support take-over Abdale Birole village (43km SW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 24/10. Al Shabaab fighters had left the village prior to the arrival of Jubaland forces. No casualties were reported.
A senior Raskamboni official is killed and his bodyguard injured in a blast outside his mosque following Friday prayers. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Fighters loyal to Jubbaland administration backed by African Union troops have captured Kudhaa island in southern Somalia after heavy fighting with Al-Shabaab. The number of casualties still unknown but both sides suffered loses.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces outpost in Embaresso neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon 25/10. Both sides exchanged gun-fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A RCIED targeted SNG battle wagon passing near Jiiro Mad Sheeg (16km E of Bardaale) planted by al Shabaab fighters in the afternoon of 25/10. Reports indicate that the device missed its target. Following the blast, SNG and al Shabaab fighters exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces in Ceel-Barde shot and injured a man suspected to be al Shabaab operative in the morning of 25/10 following after he ignored instructions to stop. The man was taking a camel to the market when the incident happened. The suspected was taken to Ceel Barde police station for investigation.

Two clan militias from Haber-Gidir and Biimaal exchanged heavy gun-fire in Ceel Wareegow (11km NE of Marka) in the afternoon of 15/10. Reports indicate that the clash lasted for two hours. At least five combatants were killed and 10 others were wounded.
Al Shabaab fighters open fire at SNG convoy in the vicinity of Gasarta village (8km SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 25/10. SNG forces responded with gunshot. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen from Majerteen/Ugaar Saleeban shot and killed three men from Majerteen/Ali Saleeban in Xunbays (90km NW of Bandar Beyla) on 25/10. Reports indicate that the incident is reportedly related to clan revenge. The situation remained tensed in the area and both sides are reportedly mobilizing their militias.

A gunman hailing from Dir shot and killed a local NGO staff from Majerteen/Biciidyahan sub-clan in Galkacyo in the morning of 25/10. The motive behind the killing is reportedly linked with verification of IDPs registration. Latest reports on 26/10 indicate that two armed groups clashed following the killing of the staff where one group lobbing for the handover of the murder to Puntland police and the other one opposes. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a public mini-bus transporting civilian passengers in Buundo Midow (6km E of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 25/10. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly received an information indicating that the mini-bus was transporting SNG sold

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces conducted a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Koday (98km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 25/10. Jubaland forces managed to take-over the village. Seven al Shabaab fighters and three Jubaland soldiers were killed in the clash.

A NISA soldier shot and killed a young man at a check-point in the vicinity of Somali Company (Heliwa District) in the morning of 25/10 following after the victim failed to take instructions. Other NISA soldiers arrested the perpetrator.

A vehicle laden with explosive devices detonated in front of Golden Hotel near Shaqalaha junction along Makah Al-Mukaram road (Waberi District) in the morning of 25/10. Reports indicate that the vehicle belongs to a SNG official which could not be independently verified. Two people were killed while four others, mostly civilians were injured.
26 October. An unidentified armed group shot and killed a radio journalist working with Radio Dalsan on media freedom in Mogadishu.

Supporters of SW6 region staged a peaceful demonstration in Baidoa in the morning of 26/10, following the arrival of SNG delegates led by the Speaker. The protestors were shunting anti SW3 region slogans. The demonstration ended peacefully.

A gunman hailing from Dir shot and killed a local NGO staff from Majerteen/Biciidyahan sub-clan in Galkacyo in the morning of 25/10. The motive behind the killing is reportedly linked with verification of IDPs registration. Latest reports on 26/10 indicate that two armed groups clashed following the killing of the staff where one group lobbing for the handover of the murder to Puntland police and the other one opposes. No casualties were reported.

Militiamenfrom Bimal and Habar-Gidir clashed in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow (11km NE of Marka) in the night of 26/10. Reports indicate that the Bimal militias initiated the clash that lasted for about an hour. Casualties are unknown.
A SNG soldier shot and killed his colleague in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) over undisclosed dispute in the afternoon of 26/10. No arrest was reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a surprise attack against SNG and Ethiopian soldiers in Geedweyne village (28km NW of Doolow) in the afternoon of 26/10. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters managed to take-over the village from SNG. Further reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters killed a prisoner held by SNG soldiers and also taken a car belonging to Nation Link Company. Five SNG soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a private house in Argada neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 26/10. The targeted house was hosting an elders meeting (Ogaden/Absame) when the incident happened. Four people including an elder were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces based in Xawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 26/10. SNG forces open in respond to the blast. Two SNG soldiers were killed and three others were injured.

Unidentified gunman driving in a vehicle opens fire against a vehicle belonging to an MP (Dhulbahante) along Taleex road (Hodan District) in the morning of 26/10. The MP survived from the attack. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the NISA soldiers are reportedly after the attackers vehicle but no arrests were reported.
Reports confirm that heavy fighting has erupted between government forces, Al-Shabaab fighters in southcentral Somali town of Rageh Cele [Eleh] of Middle Shabeelle Region. Three injuries reported.

ASWJ security forces conducted security operation in Guri-Ceel in the morning of 27/10 in order to arrest a Khat dealer. The ASWJ forces clashed with security guards of the business man for about 10 minutes. The targeted man escaped while the situation in the town is tense.

More than hundreds of residents of Bossaso staged a peaceful demonstration on 27/10 in support of the Somalia Prime Minister over the recent cabinet reshuffle which led political difference between him and the president. The protestors matched in the streets of Bossaso shunting anti-Somalia president slogans.

KDF war planes bombed Far-wamo area near Kolbiyow in the afternoon of 27/10. The air strike was reportedly targeting an al Shabaab training camp. About 60 al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the attack which could not be independently verified.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in the vicinity of K60 (27km NE of Marka) in the morning of 27/10. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdraw. No casualties were reported.

Two armed militia groups hailing from Majerteen/Ali Saleeban and Ugaar Saleeban sub-clans exchanged fighting for about 15 minutes in UurJire village (61km E of Qardho) on 27/10. No casualties were reported however the situation remained tense in the area.

A group of youth and intellectuals staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Gandhi Public Library 27/10 following after a report emerged regarding the government is reportedly selling the library to private companies.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a taxi driver from Habar-Gidir near Norway Hospital in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 27/10. The gunmen drove off the car in to unknown destination. The motive is reportedly related to an earlier carjacking incident by Saad gunman.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be Dhulbahante/Bihina-Farah sub-clan attacked a vehicle belonging to Warsangeli/Bihi-dor sub-clan in Damale Xagare village (115km SE of Ceerigaabo) in the afternoon of 27/10 and abducted four men.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Armed men hailing from the Majerteen/Reer Biciidyahan reportedly ambushed Puntland police forces between the town and the central police station of Galkacyo north on 27/10. The motive of the ambush was reportedly to seize and kill the Dir man who killed the local NGO staff hailing from Majerteen/Reer Biciidyahan on 25/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the clan militias withdrew. One clan militia man was reportedly wounded.

SNG NISA forces conducted a security operation targeting a house in Ubad-kaalka neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 27/10. The forces briefly clashed with suspected al Shabaab operatives who were in the house and managed to arrest nine suspects and seized unspecified weapons. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols abducted a SNG soldier (armed) in the vicinity of former Milk Factory (Hodan District) in the evening of 27/10. Its not clear whether the abductors were NISA agents or al Shabaab operatives. The whereabouts of the soldier is currently unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces, based in Gubta neighbourhood in the evening of 27/10. Heavy gun fire was exchanged for around half an hour before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported.

KDF war planes bombed an unnamed area in the outskirt of Kudhaa (98km SW of Badhaadhe) in support of Jubaland forces who recently took-over the village from al Shabaab. Later reports indicate there were two separate air strikes carried out in the area. Casualties could not be established.

Hundreds of supporters of SW6 region staged a demonstration in the vicinity of Abshir Kahiye Bridge (Baidoa) in the morning of 28/10. Police shot at the air in order to disperse the protestors and block them from advancing towards the town at Abshir Kahiye Bridge. Reports indicate that SNG forces entered ADC compound (SW6 headquarter), arrested a number of elders and other supporters and confiscated all stuffs in the centre and took it to the police station. A guard at the ADC compound open fire at the SNG forces and injured a soldier - - It was later revealed two civilians were killed in the melee.

A RCIED targeted a tea shop frequented by SNG soldiers in Daynuunay village (18kms SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 28/10. One person was killed and five others, including two children, the owner of the teashop (female) and a SNG soldier were injured.
KDF war planes bombed suspected al Shabaab fighters positions in Jana Cabdalle Village (59km SE of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 28/10. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (ENDF)/SNG forces based in Ceel Garas (39km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the night of 28/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about two hours after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters and local farmers engaged an armed clash near Mahadaay (20km N of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 29/10. The fighting started after the al Shabaab fighters called the farmers in the area to pay Zakat, a call denied by the farmers which turned into armed confrontations. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the clashes.

SNG forces in Tayeeglow conducted a security operation in Biyooley (12kms South of Tayeeglow) in the evening of 29/10. They met some al Shabaab operatives exchanged fire for some minutes, after which the al Shabaab fighters fled from the village. During the clashes the SNG forces killed an al Shabaab amiir hailing from Hadame sub clan of Rahanweyn and collected his gun. Later reports indicate that an al Shabaab commander and five others were killed. The forces later returned to Tayeeglow town.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a car transporting mira in Burjeedka (8kms SE of Baidoa), in the afternoon of 29/10. The al Shabaab fighters opened fire on the car, killing a young boy and slightly wounding a woman, who was the owner of the mira. The woman and the driver managed to get off the car and escaped towards Baidoa town, where they later got assistance from a car that transported her to Baidoa hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab fighters seized the car with the mira and burnt it to ashes.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED targeted AMISOM troops on foot patrol in Sheekh Abroone neighbourhood in Marka in the morning of 30/10. The soldiers started shelling Ruusiya and Sheekh Abroone neighbourhoods after the blast. Two civilians were killed and more than eight others injured.

SNG forces attacked a group of al Shabaab fighters mobilizing themselves in the outskirt of Jalalaqsi town in the night of 30/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.
The SNG commissioner of police is discovered dead under mysterious circumstances on 30/10. Date of death not known.

On 30 October, a powerful explosion occurred at the junction of Ex-Control Balcad in Mogadishus Hiliwaa district and caused death and injuries, which were not numbered. The explosion targeted one of the district commissioners of Banaadir region according to our sources and eyewitnesses.
Suspected al Shabaab target a group of ""apostate militiamen"" with an explosive, killing three. Radio Andalus is pro-al Shabaab.

RCIED targeted a group of SNG soldiers in a teashop in Baraawe in the morning of 31/10. The RCIED was probably planted in the teashop and detonated by use of a remote-control. Two SNG soldiers were killed and another injured in the explosion. SNG forces conducted a security operation after blast and arrested a number of suspects.

Gunmen from Habarjeclo clan clashed with casual labours from Essa Muse sub clan constructing animal quarantine in the area of livestock yard neighbourhood (Berbera) on 03/11, following a dispute over the local animal trade. The ongoing animal quarantine owners and the casual labours apparently mobilized their militias for possible attack against the gunmen from Habarjeclo. Berbera local authority reportedly deployed a large number of security forces including police and army in the area to create a buffer zone and disperse the armed militias. Three men from Essa Muse casual labours were allegedly injured.
Suspected Bimal militias shot and killed a driver hailing from Garre clan in Kali-Caafimaad (20km NE of Marka) in the afternoon of 31/10. The motive is unknown.

An armed group from Dhulbahante/Mohamoud Ugaadhyahan sub clan reportedly shot and injured one of their fellow clansman elders in Saalax Dheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) on 31/10. This happened when the local elders arrived in Saalax Dheer village on mission to persuade the return of their defected clan militias with battle wagon from Somaliland forces based in Xudun to Saalax Dheer on 28/10. Stray bullets reportedly injured an elder from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub clan who was admitted to Galkacyo Hospital. The reason behind the defection of the soldiers is believed to be the mobilization of one of the Khatumo ministers who hails from same sub clan to the soldiers.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a tri-motor cycle transporting khat in Huburka Village (18kms SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 31/10. The driver was injured in the shooting but managed to escape to AMISOM base in Goof Gaduud Shabeelow Village, 7km away. The al Shabaab fighters burned the tri-motor cycle and its cargo. The tri-cycle had left Baidoa and was heading to Ali Mumin and Xagarka villages in Baidoa District when the incident happened.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the night of 01/11. Exchange of gunfire between the two sides lasted for nearly ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

A vehicle laden with explosive devices detonated near Trebuunka Junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 01/11. The driver (owner) was killed in the blast and a civilian passer-by injured. The motive of the attack is currently unknown. The driver/owner owned a local travel agency owner.
A RCIED targeted a SNG forces vehicle in Jiiro Garoob neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 01/11. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly wounded in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Two suspected al Shabaab operatives shot and killed a SNG soldier and injured another in Abdalla Shideeye section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 01/11. SNG forces in the vicinity responded and engaged in a shoot-out with the perpetrators, killing both of them.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Somalias Puntland troops have seized Galgala Mountains, a region in northeastern Somalia following intensified fighting against Al-Shabab fighters. Fighting reportedly lasted several hours, causalities not reported. Al Shabaab have had a foothold in the Galgala area since 2010. Date of takeover not known - source dated 01/11.
At least one is dead (possibly two) after a car laden with explosives is detonated in Hodan district. There was no immediate claim of responsibility, though authorities suspect al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab beheads two in Abdala Biroole, accusing them of spying for the SNG. Date not known - source dated 01/11.

column8: ASWJ-Sufa: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa (Sufa Faction)
column17: ASWJ (Sufa) militia and SNG police forces exchanged gunfire for about 5 minutes in Dhusamareeb on 2/10 after the two sides suspected each other. One ASWJ soldier was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM (KDF) convoy in Yoontooy Village (30 Km N of Kismaayo) on 02/11. The ambush started with detonation of a RCIED planted on the road followed by an armed clash that went on for hours. Kenyan warplanes later supported the soldiers, forcing al Shabaab fighters to withdraw. Local media reported that 10 KDF soldiers were killed in the ambush.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Qansaxdheere town in the evening of 02/11, both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted several minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Other reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters attacked the same AMISOM base again at around 22:00 by firing gunshots from a long distance. AMISOM forces responded with rounds of heavy artillery. Casualties on both sides could not be established.

SNG forces on patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Burjeedka Village (8kms SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 02/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the SNG forces received reinforcement from Baidoa and forced al Shabaab fighters to withdraw.

Armed al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces convoy near Mudul Braawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the morning of 02/11. The convoy came from Buulo Mareer and was heading to Baraawe town when the incident happened. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew after a brief exchange of gunfire with the SNG forces. Casualties could not be established.
Pro-SNG forces (not identified) on security operation clashed with al Shabaab in Moro Gabey (28km NW of Xudur) on 02/11. One al Shabaab fighter was killed. Pro-SNG forces return to Xudur.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland Darawish forces based at Galgala Mountains opened fire at suspected Galgala/al Shabaab fighter in Galgala (35km SW of Bosasso) but he managed to escape. The forces reportedly seized unspecified weapons from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Three RCIEDs were targeted at AMISOM military convoy in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 02/11. Unspecific numbers of AMISOM vehicles were damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified armed men in car shot and killed a man reportedly working for the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs and injured two others in Bulo Hubey neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 02/11. The gunmen used their car to block the victims car and opened fire before speeding off.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two girls in Suuq Boocle neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 02/11. The reason is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab target a vehicle carry government soldiers in Wadajir-Medina, three dead, four injured.
Al Shabaab attack Somali forces in Ceel Salindi area near km 60 (near Marka) in Lower Shabeelle region. Unconfirmed SNG causalities reported, though the source is pro-al Shabaab.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and kill two recent university graduates, both women, in Dharkeynley District.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Heavy fighting between Kenyan-AMISOM forces and al Shabaab causing causalities, numbers not known.

Clashes between two al Shabaab groups reportedly erupted in Kurtun village 50km West of Baidoa district in the morning of 03/11 over escalated dispute of Zakat collection. Both groups allegedly wanted to go to the same nearby villages and collect the Zakat. The two groups exchanged gunfire but casualties could not be established.

Habar Gidir and Biimaal militias engaged in armed conflict in Ceel-Wareegow village (11km NE of Marka) in the night of 03/11. The Biimaal militia reportedly initiated the attack against the base of Habar Gidir militia in Ceel-Wareegow. Casualties are unknown.

SNG forces in Bardaale town attacked al Shabaab fighters in the vicinity of Jiiro Mad Sheeg 16km East of Bardaale town in the morning of 03/11. The SNG troops received a tip off that al Shabaab fighters were planning to ambush a SNG convoy travelling from Baidoa to Bardaale. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters were pushed back, the convoy left Baidoa and reached Bardaale town safely. Causalities not known.

Two groups of SNAF clashed near Janaale (14km NW 0f Marka) following an escalated dispute over the control of an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 03/11. Both sides engaged in exchange of gunfire for nearly twenty minutes after which some SNAF officials and local elders managed to stop the fight. Three soldiers were reportedly killed and a number of civilian bystanders were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jalalaqsi District Commissioner near Koongo (41km N of Balcad) in the morning of 03/11. The DC was returning from Mogadishu and was heading to Jalalaqsi via Jowhar when the incident happened. No reports of casualties.

Unidentified men armed with knives killed a civilian woman in Jamacaddaha neighbourhood of Hodan District in the evening of 03/11. The reason for the killing of the woman is unknown and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene, the woman was reportedly stabbed several times by the attackers.

A nomad man armed with AK-47 raided and opened fire on a hut in the outskirts of Mareer Guur village of Dhusamareeb District in the night of 4/11. Another armed man in the hut responded with fire and killed the attacker. The attack is related to clan revenge. The two men hailed from Saleban sub clan of Habar Gidir. The situation is calm.

Two opposite clan militia from Mareehaan and Dir clan clashed in the outskirts of Xeraale village of Balambale district over clan revenge in the morning of 4/11. One person was reportedly killed and another one injured. The situation remains tense.

column8: ASWJ-Sufa: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa (Sufa Faction)
column17: Pro-SNG militia and Sufa militia exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes in Dhusamareeb in the morning of 4/11 following a heated dispute between the two sides. The situation in Dhusamareeb remains a bit tense. No casualties were reported.

Suspected Al-Shabab gunmen shot and killed a well-known businessman, brother to the former deputy minister of security for Puntland, in front of Karama Hotel (Bossaso) in the evening of 04/11. The reason behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Gunmen from Madhiban abducted a taxi driver (Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad Hillowle with his car and taken to unknown destination (04/11).

Two groups of SNG soldiers briefly exchanged gunfire near Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the evening of 04/11. The reason behind the shooting is currently unclear. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces in Garbahaarey attacked Burco village (al Shabaab base) 11kms NE of Garbahaarey in the morning of 05/11, the troops reportedly engaged a heavy fighting after which they took over the village from al Shabaab fighters and later returned to Garbahaarey. As a result of the clashes, the SNG forces have killed three al Shabaab fighters whilst one SNG soldier was wounded.

Somaliland police from Laas Caanood clashed with local militias from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub-clan in Geed Xamarka village near Carro Weyn (45km NE of Buuhoodle) on 05/11. Reports indicate that the police were after a man who allegedly killed a man (Dhulbahante/Farah Ali sub-clan) and then escaped to the above mentioned area where he allegedly has close tie with the local militias. A police officer was injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab attack against SNG forces in Warcadoy village 4kms SE of Belet Xaawo in the afternoon of 05/11. The clashes allegedly lasted close to an hour after which the al Shabaab fighter withdrew. As a result, a woman was killed, no other casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces engaged an armed clash in Bangaal neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 05/11 over unknown reasons. A civilian man bystander was reportedly injured by stray bullet.

A SNG soldier armed with pistols shot and killed a Madarasa (religious school) teacher in Aba Gedo neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the night of 05/11. The victim was in a class teaching when the incident happened. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator was arrested and in police custody.

column7: ASWJ-Sufa: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa (Sufa Faction)
column17: Somali government troops backed by forces of Ahlu Sunna of southern regions clashed Al-Shabaab fighters engaged in collecting livestock in the village of Baay Ciiro, Gedo Region. The allied forces killed several members of al Shabaab and captured the village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM jointly attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Abooreey village (21km NE of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 06/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew and the joint forces took-over the village. Casualties could not be established.

Two opposite clan militias hailing from Marehan and Ayr have clashed in the outskirts of Balambale town in the morning of 06/11. Two Marehan combatants were killed and the situation remains very tense.

Al Shabaab fighters took a businessman hailing from Jilible sub clan of Rahanweyn from his home in Makuudo village (7kms SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 06/11, the man was accused of spying for the SNG and was taken to unknown location. His whereabouts is so far unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted 6 district health board staff in Carro Case village (33Km SE of Belet-Xaawo) in the afternoon of 06/11. They were travelling from Belet Xaawo to Garbahaarey town when they were arrested. Two women among the six were released on the same day while the rest were released two days later.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceelasha (12kms SE of Afgooye) in the night of 07/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers retreated. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in km 60 locality (27km NE of Marka) in the night of 07/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about fifteen minutes before the attackers withdrew from the scene. Casualties are unknown.
A gunman shot at a INGO vehicle at Garsaal (45km NE of Ceel- Waaq) on 07/11. No casualties.

Al Shabaab militia carried out a hit and run attack against ENDF forces based in Ceel lahelay village, 20km NE of Ceel Buur on 8/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 40 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be confirmed.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit and run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirts of Jalalaqsi town in the night of 8/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 50 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Heavily armed SNAF and NISA personnel launched a road clearing operation on the roads that link Afgooye-Wanla Weyne road to Afgooye-Marka road targeting militias in SNG uniforms manning the illegal checkpoints along those roads on 08/11. An armed clash between the SNG forces and a group of militia which erected a road-block in Laantabuur (12km SW of Afgooye) was reported during the operation. Twenty men were arrested from different parts of the region and two vehicles were recovered by the SNG forces. Three militias were also killed.
Unknown men armed with pistols shot and killed the chief of custodial corps of Marka District in Beytu-raas neighbourhood in Marka in the evening of 08/11. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Galgala insurgents fired mortar rounds to the position of Puntland government in Galgala vicinity, 35km SW of Bossaso in the evening of 07/11 in retaliation to an earlier attack by Puntland forces. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked a Jubaland (JL) and Raskamboni forces base in Kudhaa Village, 53kms E of Badhaadhe town in the morning of 08/11. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly took over the village from the JL forces after fierce clashes. More than 40 JL so

Al Shabaab fighters that took over Kudhaa village in the morning of 08/11 from JL and Raskamboni forces conducted search and security operations in the afternoon of the same day. The al Shabaab fighters allegedly picked two women from their homes and beheaded them in the night. The two women had reportedly had business relations with the JL forces and that is seemingly the reason why they were killed.

Unidentified armed militia in a vehicle apparently attempted to assassinate a Turkish construction engineer in Banadir neighbourhood of Hodan District on 08/11. The driver (Somali) of the Turkish engineer was injured in a gunfire opened by the militia. The engineer was in a nearby shop when they opened fire on his vehicle parked in front of the shop. The exact reason behind the attack is not clear.
A RCIED explosion occurred in Guulwade neighbourhood of Kismayo in the evening of 09/11. The blast caused no causalities. The target remains unknown.

SNG forces conducted a security operation in Orogley village, 21km SW of Xudur town in the afternoon of 09/11. The forces reportedly captured and killed one al Shabaab fighter from Jiroon sub clan of Rahanweyn. He allegedly travelled from Kismayo and was on leave when he was killed.

Ayr militiamen shot and killed a man from Ayr sub clan of Habar Gidir for clan revenge in Dameeralay village, 50km N of Dhusamareeb town in the morning of 9/11. The man was killed after he refused to give free Khat to the militia. He was transporting Khat from Guri-Ceel to Xanan Buure when the incident happened. ASWJ security forces arrested 3 of the perpetrators while two of them escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Via Liberia road in Waaberi District in the evening of 09/11. The perpetrators reportedly managed to escape.

A magnetic IED explosion targeted a local journalist at Km-4 Junction of Hodan District in the night of 09/11. The journalist was reportedly injured and lost one leg in the explosion. The reason behind the attack remains unknown. No other casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives ambushed a Somali government vehicle travelling in Mahad Alle neighbourhood of Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 09/11. Both sides reportedly exchanged gunfire. Casualties on both sides could not be established.
An explosion believed to be RCIED was heard from Xaaji Jamac Mosque neighbourhood of Kismayo town in the morning of 10/11. The target and the casualties are so far unknown.

Al Shabaab militia launched a hit and run attack against ENDF forces base in the western outskirts of Wabxo village, 40 km W of Ceel Buur in the night of 10/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 45 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM base in Mudul-Braawe, 5km NW of Baraawe town in the night of 10/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
