column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel Haji (3km NE of Marka) after midnight in 10/11. The fighting started with several mortar rounds targeting AMISOM base followed by an armed confrontation. Both sides u

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Armed al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Carbiska (6km SE of Afgooye) after midnight on 10/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire for fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters arrested two men in Ceel Boon Village (40km SE of Luuq) in afternoon of 10/11. The two men allegedly used to be al Shabaab spies. The reason behind the arrest and whereabouts of the detained men are currently unknown. Latest reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters killed the two men. The motive is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A RCIED targeted a police officer from Puntland police forces as he was passing next to a police checkpoint near Cagaarweyne hotel in Garsoor neighbourhood Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 10/11. Reports indicate that the soldiers opened fire after the blast.

Unidentified armed men in a luxury car shot dead a civilian man (translator for Turkish) in Korontada Junction area in Wadajir (Medina) District in the afternoon of 10/11. The reason behind the killing of the man is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers, later identified as al Shabaab, hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM convoy in Ruusiya neighbourhood of Marka town in the afternoon of 10/11. AMISOM troops allegedly reacted by firing different types of gunfire including RPGs and Mortars and shelled different sections of the town. The shelling reportedly killed three civilians and injured unspecified number of people. Shops and residential homes were also destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing near Rage-Ceele (45km NE of Warsheikh) in the morning of 11/11. The device reportedly hit and damaged one of the convoy vehicles. Rage-Ceele chief said one of AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack but no neutral sources could confirm the exact figure of AMISOM casualties.

Two groups of SNAF soldiers clashed over the control of a road-block near Gol-Weyn, 21km SW of Marka in the afternoon of 11/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes and were later separated by other colleagues. One SNAF soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the compound of Kismaayo District Office in the morning of 11/11. At least 15 people were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Jubaland forces position at Argada neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 11/11. The Jubaland soldiers open fire in response to the blast. Two civilian bystanders were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men opened fire on a car transporting a Somali MP in SIMAD University Campus area of Xamar Jabjab District in the morning of 11/11. The MP apparently survived while his driver and a bodyguard were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab gunmen in a vehicle opened fire on a car transporting the Deputy Head of SNG Immigration and Naturalization Directorate in Km-4 Junction of Hodan District in the afternoon of 11/11. The official was killed and his driver was injured in the attack. The reason behind the attack remains unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A RCIED accidentally detonated by al Shabaab fighters who were planting the device in the centre of Buur Hakaba town near the main market in the midnight of 11/11. The explosion killed one al Shabaab fighter and injured another one. SNG forces exchanged fire with al Shabaab after the explosion. One al Shabaab fighter was reportedly killed and three others captured and detained in Buur Hakaba police station. A teenage girl was allegedly injured in the attack as well and was admitted to Buur Hakaba hospital for treatments.

A group of casual workers staged a violent demonstration in Yiroowe village (12km E of Burco) on 12/11, following after the local authority gave permit to local company of collecting building materials in the area. The protestors use to collect stones in the area for building and later sell it. The protestors burnt tires in the streets. Police arrived at the scene and arrested about 30 protestors.

Residents of Garbahareey staged a peaceful demonstration to express their support to the prime minister in the morning of 12/11. The protestors matched in the street of the town chanting slogan anti SNG president. The protest ended peacefully.

SNG forces conducting a security operation in Haween village (18km NW of Baidoa) clashed with al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 12/11. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The SNG soldiers returned to their base in Baidoa. One SNG soldier was killed. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters have launched attacks in south western Somalia town of Awdinle some 15 kilometres away from Baydhabo. Causalities, date not known - source dated 13/11.

A group of resident of Xariirad (56km NW of Borama) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authorities on 12/11, to protest against the perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town. Officials from water agency in the town addressed the crowd and promised that they will solve the problem.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a mini-bus ferrying Khat near Eeriile village (28km NE of Baraawe) in the afternoon of 12/11. The suspected al Shabaab burnt down the vehicle and its cargo. The driver was killed and three others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a public mini-bus in Gasarta village (8km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 12/11. Reports indicate that some of the passengers were SNG soldiers. One passenger was killed and two others were injured. Its not clear whether the target was SNG soldiers or civilians.

Unidentified armed men in a vehicle killed the Deputy District Commissioner of Hawl-wadaag District and three of his bodyguards after opening fire on his car in Suuq Weyne Area in Wadajir (Medina) District in the morning of 12/11. The perpetrators escaped from the scene shortly after the incident.
Military forces kill a al Shabaab zagat (tax) collector and four other of the sects members in Goof Guduud. Date not known - source dated 14/11.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Sierra Leone)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack Sierra Leone-AMISOM forces in Tabta district, exact location not known. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Danow village (16km W of Marka) in the morning of 13/11. The device reportedly exploded after the convoy passed the place. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM/SNG convoy near Roobow village (21km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 13/11. Heavy exchange of gunfire reportedly followed the explosion which lasted for 15 minutes after which the attacker withdrew. The convoy was reportedly escorting General Mohamed Roble Jimaale aka ""Goobaale"", the commander of SNG third brigade, who was on his way to Shalaambood from Baraawe. One military vehicle destroyed by the blast. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG military based in Mayafulka (6km E of Baidoa) in the midnight of 13/11. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier and his son in Sebiano neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 13/11. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM and Juba military forces in Baraawe on the evening of 13/11. A ""number"" of allied combatants KIA, specific numbers not provided.
Al Shabaab kills a police-prison official in Hodan District, claims responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab forces carry out an attack on Kenyan-AMISOM forces outside of Kismayo, exact location not known. Causalities not reported.

Al Shabaab fighters killed two people in areas between Baydhabo and Daynuunaay in Bay Region. The two men were the driver and the passenger of the mini bus that left from Baydhabo and was headed to Mogadishu. The circumstances around their killing is not yet known, however, the men are said to have died after Al-Shabab fighters in the area spread bullets on the vehicle in which they were travelling.

Gunmen from Marehan shot and killed two khat traders hailing from Majerten/Bicidyahan in Cabud Waaq in the morning of 14/11. The incident is reportedly related to inter-clan revenge killing. The perpetrators escaped.

Two pastoralist groups hailing from Dhulbahante and Habar Yonis exchanged gunfire in Dhabeeda near Dibqarax Village (42km SE of Ceerigaabo) following an escalated dispute over pasture in the morning of 14/11. No casualties were reported. Ceerigaabo police and local elders stepped in to end hostiles between the two sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces positions in Baraawe in the night of 14/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters and herders from Xawadle sub-clan clashed in Yasooman Village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) on 15/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One al Shabaab soldier was confirmed dead. Herders casualties could not be established.

Wadani Party (opposition) supporters staged a demonstration in front of parliament building in Hargeisa in the morning of 15/11 in protest against the ruling Kulmiye Party plan to unseat the Speaker of Somaliland, who is also the chairman of Wadani Party. The demonstrators tried to enter the building. Police shot in the air to disperse them. The party supporters reportedly burnt tires in New Hargeisa and Star Hotel neighbourhoods in Hargeisa.

Wadani Party supporters staged a violent demonstration in Shaab area in Burao on 15/11 in protest against the ruling Kulmiye Party plan to unseat the Speaker of Somaliland, who is also the chairman of Wadani Party. The protestors burnt tires and threw stones. Police fired at the demonstrators to disperse them. A woman was killed and eight others injured. Twenty-two police officers were also injured during the protest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 15/11. The convoy stopped and blocked the road after the explosion. One AMISOM vehicle was badly damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of gunmen hailing from Habarjeclo/Omar and Habar Jeclo/Biciide exchanged gunfire in Qori Dheere Village (39km NE of Caynabo) on 15/11 following dispute over the ownership of the village. The armed clash follows after Caynabo and Garadag districts administrations both claimed ownership of the village. Two militiamen from Habar Jeclo/Omar were injured in the clash. Caynabo district administration on 18/11 deployed police who dispersed the rival groups.

Al Shabaab fighters and local herders engaged an armed clash near Caad settlement (45km N of Xarardheere) in the afternoon of 15/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. One al Shabaab fighter was reportedly killed and other injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Goofo Village (40kms SE of Doolow) in the morning of 15/11. The soldiers reportedly left their base in Geedweyne Village on foot and were visiting their families in nearby village when they got killed. The al Shabaab fighters also took the guns of their victims.

A group of people, mostly youths and women, staged a demonstration at liberty garden in Ceerigaabo on 15/11 to express their anger against the ruling Kulmiye Party to oust the Speaker of parliament in a vote of no confidence. Police and the army dispersed the demonstrators. Five people were reportedly arrested during the demonstrators. On 16/11, police arrested 10 people who reportedly organized the demonstration.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces near Daarta Qabyada (Yaaqshiid District)and at the former Perfume Factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 15/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Abdi Waayeel neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 15/11/2014. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A device believed to be a magnetic IED attached to a private car exploded along Maka al-Mukarama road (Waberi District) in the afternoon of 16/11. The driver was injured in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attack Janaale, engage in battles with AMISOM on the evening of 16/11. Causalities not known.

SNG forces attacked Tijeeg Buul village (20km E of Xudur) in the afternoon of 16/11. The attack follows after SNG forces received a tip off that al Shabaab fighters had been planning to ambush a lorry transporting goods from Ceel Barde to Xudur and launched the attack to pre-empty the al Shabaab fighters. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew and the lorry arrived safely in Xudur.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the evening of 16/11. Heavy gunfire was exchanged for about half an hour before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported.

Al Shabaab fighters fired a number of mortar/B10 rounds at the presidential palace in Wardhiigley District on the evening of 16/11. Two rounds landed near the place, two in Beerta Nabadda (Xamar Jab Jab District) and one in Hawl-Wadaag District. The prime ministers office spokesman said no mortar or B10 rounds hit the palace. No other reported causalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters fired a number of mortar/B10 rounds at the presidential palace in Wardhiigley District on the evening of 16/11. Two rounds landed near the place, two in Beerta Nabadda (Xamar Jab Jab District) and one in Hawl-Wadaag District. The prime ministers office spokesman said no mortar or B10 rounds hit the palace. No other reported causalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters fired a number of mortar/B10 rounds at the presidential palace in Wardhiigley District on the evening of 16/11. Two rounds landed near the place, two in Beerta Nabadda (Xamar Jab Jab District) and one in Hawl-Wadaag District. The prime ministers office spokesman said no mortar or B10 rounds hit the palace. No other reported causalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the morning of 17/11. Two soldiers reported killed in the fighting (Somali Memo). Reliable sources said that Al-Shabab fighters seized most of Buulo Mareers neighbourhoods for hours as the [AMISOM] troops defended their bases. (Somali Memo)

A large number of people took to the streets of Baidoa in the morning of 17/11 in protest against the planned election of SW3 president. The protesters, mostly supporters of SW6, burnt tires in front of the main police station, the general hospital and Afar Irdoodka Junction. The demonstration comes at a time delegates attending the SW3 conference are preparing to elect the president of Southwest Somali state. A teenage boy was killed and two others injured after SW3 militia reportedly opened fire at the demonstrators.

Al Shabaab fighters and Xawadle clan herders clashed in Cunati (40km W of near Maxaas) in Bulo Burte District in the evening of 17/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour. Four combatants were killed and four others injured.

Al Shabaab fighters and Xawadle herders clashed in Habiino Village near Maxaas (84km NE of Bulo Burte) in the evening of 17/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 40 minutes after which the clan militia was forced to withdraw. Two combatants were killed and two others injured.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Aawdiinle Village (27kms NW of Baidoa) in the night of 17/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Three al Shabaab fighters armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Buur Hakaba in the morning of 17/11 and took his gun. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters killed a woman hailing from Rahaweyne/Malim Weyne in Ceel Boon Village (40km SE of Luuq) in the evening of 17/11. The woman was married to an al Shabaab operative and she was allegedly killed for contacting a SNG soldier who happens to be her relative.
A SNG soldier shot and killed another soldier over unknown dispute in Aba-Gedo neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the afternoon of 17/11. The perpetrator reportedly escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM-Djibouti and SNG forces launched an offensive on the al Shabaab held town of Aborey, but are pushed back by its defenders. The Somali Memo, which is pro-al Shabaab, claimed the ""enemy"" sustained causalities, but did not provide numbers.
A London-based, Somali-born journalist is killed in Galkacyo North by unknown assailants.

Scuffles broke out between two groups of students of Ceel-Afweyn Secondary School on 18/11. The scuffle between the students hailing from Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis is reportedly related to clan issues. A number of them were reportedly injured. Police dispersed the rival students and also arrested 10 of them.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and herders from Xawadle sub-clan clashed in Yasooman Village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 18/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. AMISOM (Djiboutian) backed the pastoralist during the clash. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG military convoy in the outskirt of Maxaas in the morning of 18/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceelasha Biyaha settelement (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 18/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Armed man hailing from Hawiye/Fiqishini sub-clan shot and injured a man from Dhulbahante/Elmi Naleeye in Adhicadeeye Village (31km NW of Laas Caanood) on 18/11. The incident was reportedly related to clan revenge killing. Police arrested the perpetrator.
Two herdsmen exchanged gunfire following a dispute over a piece of grazing land in the Garasbaley settlement in the outskirts of Dharkeyleyn District in the afternoon of 18/11. No casualty reported.
Early morning fighting in Faafax Dhuun between al Shabaab and SNG forces causes two al Shabaab deaths.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM (ENDF) in Jeexin in the outskirts of Ceel Buur in the evening of 19/11. Two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (ENDF) in Ceel Garas (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) in the evening of 19/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not b

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces positions in Fiidow (50km N of Jowhar) in the night of 19/11. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Two groups of SNG forces engaged in a shoot-out in Garas Weyne Village (12 km N of Balcad) in the afternoon of 19/11 following dispute over Khat. No casualties were reported.
SNG forces clash over khat near Balcad (19/11). No report of causalities.

A SNG soldier shot and injured a civilian man near Ikow garage in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) on 17/11. Reports indicate that victim was driving and he reportedly ignored an order to stop. The perpetrator was arrested. Latest reports on 20/11 indicate that the victim succumbed to his injuries in Baidoa hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Two groups of Puntland police clashed at west check-point in Garowe in the morning of 20/11. The clash reportedly lasted about 30 minutes after which one group withdrew. Reports indicate that one of the fighting groups was manning the check-point while the other one was off-duty and not allowed to carry arms following orders from the local police commander. Police are looking for the perpetrators. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Biyo degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 20/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were injured.

SNG forces manning a security checkpoint open fire against a taxi carrying SNG soldiers in Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim (Dharkenley District) in the evening of 20/11. The forces manning the check-point suspected the car after it failed an order to stop. A SNG military was killed and another one was injured. The perpetrators were arrested.
A SNG soldier shot and injured a SNG military official in Trebuunka junction (Hodan) in the Morning of 20/11. The motive behind the incident is currently unknown.
A colonel (police or military - unknown) is killed by al Shabaab in Wadajir-Medina district.

More than hundreds of Maydh residents staged a demonstration on 21/11 against Somaliland minister of Interior. The rally was organized by local elders following after Somaliland minister reportedly ordered custodial guards to transfer all Yemen boats to Berbera to get their fishing licenses. Further information suggests that the order was later lifted and the fishing boats will get their licenses in Maydh. The protestors were allegedly accusing the minister of undermining the port of Maydh. Police dispersed the protestors peacefully.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy transporting logistics to Baidoa in Burjeedka (8km E of Baidoa) in the evening of 21/11. The convoy stayed overnight at the scene, following damaged inflicted by the blast in to one of their carrier and reached Baidoa safely in the following morning. The communication network was suspended from morning up to 14:00, to avoid further targeted explosions.

Al Shabaab fighters clashed with Hawaadle militias in Geeda-Samo village (45km E of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 21/11. The clash is reportedly extended fighting between the two sides following after the nomads refused to pay Zakat to al Shabaab. About fifteen people were killed while unspecified numbers were injured since the conflict started from 18/11.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint near ADC compound in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 21/11. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters used machine guns and small fire arms and later disappeared. No casualties were reported.

SNG force in Waajid town conducted a security operation in Baar village (18km NW of Waajid) in the early morning of 21/11. The forces reportedly killed a local Amiir of al Shabaab in the village collected his gun and return to their base in Waajid.

A gunman from Osman Mohamud (a herder) shot and killed a farmer from Arab Salah - minority clan- in Qardho on 21/11 following a dispute over a grassing yard belonging to the victim. No arrest was made following the killing.

A local police man (civilian police) shot and killed a civilian man (Rahanweyn/Elaay sub-clan) in food market in Bulo Nuriye section of Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the afternoon of 21/11. Reports indicate that the victim refused to pay extortion money demanded by the perpetrator and subsequent killing.

Media reports indicate that Kenyan war planes conducted an airstrike in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the evening of 22/11. The airstrike was allegedly in retaliation for the killings of 28 Kenyan nationals who were killed on 21/11 in Kenya Somali border by al Shabaab fighters after they were picked up from a bus they were travelling with. The extent of the damage caused by the bombings is not known. Deputy President William Ruto of Kenya later suggested that over 100 members of al Shabaab were killed in the air strike.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A war plane belonging to Kenya Defence forces conducted an airstrike against Eil Ad village (26km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 22/11. Reports indicate that the target was al Shabaab fighters but information suggests that unspecified numbers of nomads were killed and no al Shabaab fighter was killed - injuries among them not known.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters set on fire in to two villages (Xamiir Gab and Qabadaro) in eastern outskirts of Bulo Burte in the evening of 22/11. Reports indicate that the fighters burnt the villages in connection with Hawaadle refusal of Zakat payment to Al-Shabaab Hawaadle and Somali Bantu were the main community that inhabits the affected villages.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters set on fire in to two villages (Xamiir Gab and Qabadaro) in eastern outskirts of Bulo Burte in the evening of 22/11. Reports indicate that the fighters burnt the villages in connection with Hawaadle refusal of Zakat payment to Al-Shabaab Hawaadle and Somali Bantu were the main community that inhabits the affected villages.

A group of al Shabaab fighters clashed with local militias in Dhato 30km NW of Hagar in the evening of 22/11. The fighting was reportedly triggered by a dispute over Zakat collection. One al Shabaab fighter was killed while the militias managed to recover some livestock.

SNG forces clashed with local militias in Xawaadley village (27km NE of Balcad) in the afternoon of 22/11. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the local militias initiated the fighting following after SNG forces destroyed marijuana plantations. Two combatants were killed while three others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka) in the night of 22/11. The two sides engaged in a serious exchange of gun fire for a period of thirty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Gol-Weyn (21km SW of Marka) in the night of 22/11. No casualties were reported.

The residents of Badhan mostly, women and youths, staged a peaceful protest on 22/11 to express their support to the Somalia prime minister and also to condemned Somali parliament of planning to impeach him. The rally ended peacefully.

Unidentified armed men driving in a car shot and killed a SNG soldier on a security patrol in the vicinity of KM-4 junction (Hodan District) in the night of 22/11. Reports indicate that the officer stopped the car for checking when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a driver in Zoobe junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 22/11, following after a dispute arouse between the victim and the perpetrator over an extortion of money. The perpetrator escaped.
Al Shabaab fighters attack and kill at least three government soldiers in a pair of attacks in Goof Gaduud and Shabeeloow, both outside Baidoa.
Al Shabaab fighters attack and kill at least three government soldiers in a pair of attacks in Goof Gaduud and Shabeeloow, both outside Baidoa.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack on SNG forces outpost in Barawe town in the evening of 23/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire. Casualties are unknown.

Media reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters hijacked a boat in Indian Ocean along the coast between Baraawe and Marka on 23/11. The boat was loaded with Khat and it was heading to Baraawe when the incident happened. The al Shabaab fighters have reportedly killed three men.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Ciise Abdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 23/11. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

SNAF forces based in Maxaas attacked a group of al Shabaab fighters who were re-grouping in the outskirts of Maxaas town in the afternoon of 24/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters fled. Two al Shabaab fighters were confirmed to have been killed.

Al Shabaab reportedly ambushes and kills two men, including one soldier. Present military forces retaliate, causing a gun battle which killed three members of al Shabaab. Later in the afternoon al Shabaab regrouped, attacked, and killed two soldiers.

Clashes broke out between two student groups of Ceel-Afweyn Secondary School in the morning of 24/11. A boy from Habar Yonis/ Sacad Yonis stabbed a boy from Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farax on the neck several times. The exact cause of the clashes is unclear. Rumors are that Habaryonis/Sacad Yonis sub-clan political figures are pushing to ignite fighting among the students to get enough shares of teachers and positions in Ceel-Afweyn Secondary School and the Ministry of Education for their sub clan. Ceel-Afweyn police separated the two sides and arrested eight students. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted two local NGO staff members in Toos Weyne (52km W of Baidoa) on 24/11. The abducted staffs were on a mission to visit a health facility in the area and were taken to Buulo Xaawo village (9km SW of Toos Weyne). Reports indicate that elders have started negotiating with al Shabaab to secure their release. According to latest reports, the staff and their driver were transferred from Buulo Xaawo village to Diinsoor for further interrogations. They are all from Leysan sub clan of Rahanweyn.

Al Shabaab fighters killed a man from Sheeqaal sub clan of Hawiye in Karaban village, 28km NE of Luuq, in the morning of 24/11. The man travelled from Luuq with a tri-motorcycle and was transporting Khat to Karaban and nearby villages when the incident happened.

Al Shabaab fighters picked a businessman from his shop at Jameeco Shiin village (19km SE of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 24/11 and later beheaded him. The attackers also took a vehicle and all the goods in the victims shop. The reason for targeting the victim remains unknown.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the Livestock Market neighbourhood of Heliwa District in the afternoon of 24/11. The perpetrators managed to escape with the victims gun.

Unidentified attackers targeted a SNG vehicle with a RCIED in Taleex neighbourhood in Hodan District in the afternoon of 24/11. The SNG forces in the vehicle opened fire after the explosion. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters set on fire against some residential houses in Jameeco Shiin village (19km SE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 25/11. The motive behind the action is currently unclear but some reports suggest that al Shabaab accused the owners of having link with SNG forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya-AMISOM warplanes bombed Marerey village (90km NE of Afmadow), which is under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the afternoon of 25/11. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan-AMISOM warplanes bomb Hargeysa Yare village, causalities not known.

SNG forces on a security mission to demolish illegal check-points clashed with Biimaal militias at Muuri village (16km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 25/11 following after SNG forces tried to remove an illegal check-point manned by Biimaal militias. SNG forces managed to demolish the check-point. Casualties could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters stopped a taxi carrying passengers at Wareer-Male village (38km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 25/11. The perpetrators ordered five occupants out of the car, burnt down the car and taken the five people in to unknown location. A few hours later the abductees were released. The motive behind the incident and identity of the attackers remains unknown.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Daryeel Market of Livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 25/11. Reports indicate that the soldier suspected the victim as al Shabaab operative and ordered him to put his hands up followed by a heated argument and shots fired. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan-AMISOM jets launch bombing attacks of the al Shabaab locations of (H)Fanoole and Hargeysa Yare south of Jilib. 49 Al-Shabab fighters among them senior commanders of the group are confirmed to have been killed in the airstrikes.

Property destruction: Militiamen from Hawaadle clan set on fire in to two residential houses belonging to al Shabaab fighters in Bulo Burte in the morning of 26/11. The move was considered as retaliatory action by the militias against al Shabaab burning residential houses in Jameeco Shiin village in the previous day.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a group of SNG soldiers travelling from Baled Xaawo at Qodaxley (a water point) near Tulo Barwaqo (21km NW of Garbahareey) in the morning of 26/11. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the SNG soldiers were overwhelmed and fled towards Garbahareey. Three SNG soldiers were reportedly killed. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

A RCIED targeted a SNG military vehicle at Siinka Dheer (Dharkenley District) in the morning of 26/11. The device missed its target and SNG forces open fire following the blast. Two civilians were killed in the subsequent shooting. The perpetrator(s) managed to escape.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG police officer near Khat market in Sei Piano (Hodan District) in the night of 26/11. The motive is unknown, though al Shabaab has a history of targeting kehat sellers, buyers and users. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan-AMISOM jets launch bombing attacks of the al Shabaab locations of (H)Fanoole and Hargeysa Yare south of Jilib. 49 Al-Shabab fighters among them senior commanders of the group are confirmed to have been killed in the airstrikes.

SNG forces based in Waajid town attacked Kurta village - an al Shabaab base - (28km SE of Waajid) in the morning of 27/11. The two sides briefly clashed after which al Shabaab were overwhelmed and fled from the village. SNG forces set up on fire on a pack up generator belonging to Hormuud Company and also threaten to residents saying that; it al Shabaab do not release the fuel tank to Waajid they will come back and put the whole Hormuud system down so that they will stay without mobile network communications. Causalities not reported.

Kenya warplanes conducted an airstrike against Makuuni village (7km SW of Jilib) in the afternoon of 27/11. Reports indicate that nearly 100 families have been displaces due to fear of more airstrike in the future. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan warplanes bombed Jamaame town which is under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the afternoon of 27/11. No casualties were reported but a number of houses were destroyed in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya-AMISOM defence war planes conducted third airstrike in three days against al Shabaab locations in Hargeysa Yare (10km SW of Jilib) in the afternoon of 27/11. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces base in the western part of Buurdhuubo town in the evening of 27/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about half an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported but 50 goats grazing near the scene were killed by stray bullets.

SNG forces and Biimaal militia clashed in Buulo Naagad (17km NE of Marka) in the morning 27/11. Reports indicate that the Biimaal militias were manning an illegal check-point and after 15 minutes of fighting the militias were defeated. Two SNG soldiers and one Biimaal militia were killed while four combatants from both sides were injured.

An engineer working for a Turkish company is killed in a bomb blast at an unknown location in Mogadishu. There was no immediate claim of responsibility. It is not clear if the victim was Turkish, or simply working for a Turkish corporation.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed an elderly traditional healer from Rahanweyn/Geelidle in Qansax Dheere evening of 27/11. The perpetrators reportedly picked the old man from his home but he resisted their attempts to take him out of the town, after which they shot him dead and escaped. The motive is unknown. The victim lived in Diinsoor but later moved to Qansax Dhere for personal safety.

Angry civilians carried out mob justices and set on fire more than 35 houses owned by leaders of al Shabaab in Bulo Burte in the morning of 27/11. The crowd were revenging against al Shabaab act of burning down villages in Bulo Burte District. No casualties were reported as the houses were empty.

Three artillery or B10 rounds fired from an unknown location landed in Cabbicasiis, Xamar Weyne and Shibis Districts in the afternoon of 27/11. One of the rounds landed in the vicinity of Lido Beach (Cabbicasiis), one in the area of Village restaurant (Xamar Weyne) and the third one in an unknown location in Shibis. No casualties or injuries reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces manning a security outpost in Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 27/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew.

Three artillery or B10 rounds fired from an unknown location landed in Cabbicasiis, Xamar Weyne and Shibis Districts in the afternoon of 27/11. One of the rounds landed in the vicinity of Lido Beach (Cabbicasiis), one in the area of Village restaurant (Xamar Weyne) and the third one in an unknown location in Shibis. No casualties or injuries reported.

Three artillery or B10 rounds fired from an unknown location landed in Cabbicasiis, Xamar Weyne and Shibis Districts in the afternoon of 27/11. One of the rounds landed in the vicinity of Lido Beach (Cabbicasiis), one in the area of Village restaurant (Xamar Weyne) and the third one in an unknown location in Shibis. No casualties or injuries reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan AMISOM air forces carry out a strike against several al Shabaab positions on Kudhaa island. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Qoryooley in the evening of 28/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the evening of 28/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two gunmen hailing from Habar Yonis/Sacad yonis sub-clan opened fire at two men from Habar Jeclo/Baho sub-clan in Dogoble Village (128km S of Ceerigaabo) on 28/11. The motive behind the incident is reportedly related to water dispute after perpetrators refused the watering of camel owned by victims at a local borehole. The victims escaped unhurt after the shooters missed their targets. Somaliland police and local elders in Dogoble later arrested the perpetrators and took them to Ceel-Afweyn police station.

Clan militias from Habar Gidir/Ayr and Habar Gidir/Salebaan clashed in Warshubo Village (100km NE of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 29/11. The fighting broke out following revenge killings between the two sub-clans. Sixteen combatants were killed in the clash. Elders have stepped in to prevent further clashes.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG base located near the airstrip in Garbahaarey in the evening of 29/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters also fired two mortar rounds at the airstrip.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a man in Xawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 29/11. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The victim used to run money exchange business but other reports indicate that he was a local traditional elder. The perpetrators escaped. At the same time Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local municipal staff in Xawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 29/11. Again the perpetrators escaped.

SNG police reportedly shot and injured the brother of the SNG prime minister, who was driving his private car near Dabka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 29/11. Available reports say the police opened fire him after suspecting him as hostile since he was driving in a high speed.

A blast targeted a combat vehicle carrying federal government soldiers in Yaaqshiid District, northeast Mogadishu. Witnesses said eight people, six of them federal government soldiers, were killed in the attack. The targeted vehicle is reported to have sustained extensive damage. Though the Somali Memo is pro-al Shabaab, any information as to the identities of the perpetrators is not known.

A group of youths staged demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 30/11 in protest against telecommunication towers erected in the town. The protestors destroyed a new network tower erected by Telesom in the centre of the town. The protesting youths claimed that the network towers emit rays that cause heart diseases which led death of several people in the town. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protestors. No arrested was made.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Embagathi neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 30/11. At the same time, unidentified men killed an SNG soldier in Dhagaxtur neighbourhood. The reason behind both killings is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMISOM forces based in Lafoole settlement (7km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 30/11. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Reports coming out of Hodan District say that a powerful explosion was heard there this evening. The target of the attack remains unknown.

SNG forces based in Waajid attacked Ceel Ure village an al Shabaab base (62km E of Luuq) in the morning of 30/11. The two sides reportedly engaged a heavy fighting after which al Shabaab fighters were overwhelmed. The SNG forces returned to their base in Waajid after the clash. Two al Shabaab fighters and one SNG soldier were killed. It is not clear SNG forces gained control of the base.

AMISOM (KDF) and SNG forces took over Gadoon Dhowe village an al Shabaab base (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 30/11. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters vacated the village after they got a tip-off about the news of the allied forces movements towards the village. No confrontation was reported during the takeover.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed a businessman in Buunda Yaris area (Afgooye) in the evening of 30/11. Reports indicate that the victim had reportedly business link with SNG forces. The perpetrators escape from the scene.
Al Shabaab fighters was executed a woman from Marehan sub-clan in Jilib in the afternoon of 30/11 after an al Shabaab court sentenced her to death for spying activities.

A gunman from Sheekhal shot and killed a fellow clansman over unknown reason in the morning of 30/11. The perpetrators clan elders and youth tried to arrest him at the scene but he shot and killed another man. The youth and the elders rushed and informed the police. The perpetrator engaged in a shoot-out with the police who later killed him.

A gunman from Sheekhal shot and killed a fellow clansman over unknown reason in the morning of 30/11. The perpetrators clan elders and youth tried to arrest him at the scene but he shot and killed another man. The youth and the elders rushed and informed the police. The perpetrator engaged in a shoot-out with the police who later killed him.

The local municipal council conducted an operation of kiosks illegally constructed along the main roads in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 01/12. Three kiosks owners were arrested after they hurled stones the police and municipal council workers during the operation.

Residents of Borama staged a demonstration in front of Borama police station on 01/12 in protest against the arrest of the towns former mayor. The protesters burnt tires and damaged a number of business premises. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators. They also arrested 14 protestors.

Two pro-SNG forces (not identified) exchanged gunfire in Ceelwaq in the afternoon of 01/12. The shoot-out broke out after local authorities attempted to arrest a group of pro-SNG soldiers who shot in the air over unknown reason in the night of 30/11 but the soldiers defended themselves. The soldiers were later arrested. No casualties reported.

SNG forces in Qansax Dheere attacked al Shabaab fighters in Duuray Village (9km SW of Qansax Dheere) in the evening of 01/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village. SNG forces captured an injured al Shabaab fighters and returned to their base. Al Shabaab Zakat collection unit was present in the village during the attack.

Gunmen suspected to be Khatumo militias conducted a hit and run attack against Somaliland forces based in Easter check-point of Laas Caanood in the morning of either 30/11 or 01/12. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with artillery shells and the gunmen withdrew. A Somaliland soldier was reportedly killed.

Hundreds of people staged violent demonstration in central Laas Caanood on 01/12 in protest against the local Somaliland authority for failing to properly investigate the killing of a policeman (Dhulbahante) at the eastern checkpoint on 01/12. Somaliland authorities claimed that the policeman was killed after Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against the checkpoint, which was denied by the Khatumos interior minister. The protestors reportedly burned tires and damaged several business premises. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators. They also arrested number of protestors and suspected organizers. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Gadoon Dhowe Village (40km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 01/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce fighting that went on for four hours after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly destroyed an AMISOM military truck using a RPG round. Casualties are unknown. AMISOM/SNG seized the village from al Shabaab on 30/11.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM (KDF) forces took over the control of Khadija Haji village, an al Shabaab base (38km SW of Beled Xaawo town) in the morning of 01/12. Al Shabaab fighters vacated the village prior to the arrival of the allied forces.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian man hailing from Rahanweyn/Jiroon sub clan in Ceel Ure area (62km E of Luuq) in the morning of 01/12. Reports indicate that the victim is reportedly a brother to a SNG soldier who was killed in the village during a fight between SNG and al Shabaab fighters a day earlier. Further reports indicate that SNG forces in Waajid killed a woman reportedly (mother) to the al Shabaab operatives who allegedly beheaded the man in revenge.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian man hailing from Rahanweyn/Jiroon sub clan in Ceel Ure area (62km E of Luuq) in the morning of 01/12. Reports indicate that the victim is reportedly a brother to a SNG soldier who was killed in the village during a fight between SNG and al Shabaab fighters a day earlier. Further reports indicate that SNG forces in Waajid killed a woman reportedly (mother) to the al Shabaab operatives who allegedly beheaded the man in revenge.

Hundreds of disabled people staged a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Interior at the former Otto Otto Building in protest for lack of assistance from the SNG. The protesters said they were in deplorable situation and accused the government of not even assisting them with basic necessities.
A RCIED attack targeted SNG military vehicle Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 01/12 but it missed the target, causing no casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG police vehicle in the western outskirt of Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 02/12. Two policemen were killed in the attack. The al Shabaab fighters also burnt the vehicle. The vehicle had left Beled Weyne when the ambush took place. Police were deployed in the area to pursue the al Shabaab fighters.

Residents of Buuhoodle town staged a peaceful demonstration on 02/12 to express their solidarity with the people of Laas Caanood who protested against the killing of a policeman (Dhulbahante) at the eastern checkpoint of Laas Caanood on 01/12. Somaliland authorities claimed that the police man was killed by Khatumo forces who attacked the checkpoint earlier in the day but was immediately refuted by Khatumo interior minister. The protestors matched in the streets of the towns chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by the vice-president.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces in Gubta neighbourhood on 02/12. The two sides exchanged fire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
SNG police and NISA forces exchanged gunfire at Ex-Control Balcad area (Heliwa District) in the morning of 03/12 after they suspected the other as hostile. No casualties were reported.

KDF warplanes bombed Bur Sagaar Village (18km SW of Doolow) and Qabri Sheekh (35km SW of Garbahaarey) in Gedo Region in the morning of 03/12. The warplanes also bombed other al Shabaab-controlled remote villages near Gadoon Dhowe and Tuulo Barwaqo in Beled Xawo District - these locations not named. Casualties could not be established. The bombing reportedly caused displacement of civilians in the area.

KDF warplanes bombed Bur Sagaar Village (18km SW of Doolow) and Qabri Sheekh (35km SW of Garbahaarey) in Gedo Region in the morning of 03/12. The warplanes also bombed other al Shabaab-controlled remote villages near Gadoon Dhowe and Tuulo Barwaqo in Beled Xawo District - these locations not named. Casualties could not be established. The bombing reportedly caused displacement of civilians in the area.

KDF warplanes bombed Bur Sagaar Village (18km SW of Doolow) and Qabri Sheekh (35km SW of Garbahaarey) in Gedo Region in the morning of 03/12. The warplanes also bombed other al Shabaab-controlled remote villages near Gadoon Dhowe and Tuulo Barwaqo in Beled Xawo District - these locations not named. Casualties could not be established. The bombing reportedly caused displacement of civilians in the area.

KDF warplanes bombed Bur Sagaar Village (18km SW of Doolow) and Qabri Sheekh (35km SW of Garbahaarey) in Gedo Region in the morning of 03/12. The warplanes also bombed other al Shabaab-controlled remote villages near Gadoon Dhowe and Tuulo Barwaqo in Beled Xawo District - these locations not named. Casualties could not be established. The bombing reportedly caused displacement of civilians in the area.

Al Shabaab fighters and Habar Gidir/Ayr militias clashed in the outskirt of Goonle Village (52 km NW of Ceel Buur) on 03/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The fighting broke out after al Shabaab fighters intruded into Ayr territory while pursuing Murusade pastoralist that fled from al Shabaab militants over the payment of Zakat. No casualties reported.

Hundreds of civilians staged peaceful demonstration in Cadaado town in the morning of 03/12 denouncing the fighting between Saleban and Ayr sub-clans of Habar Gidir in Warshubo Village (100km NE of Ceel Buur). The demonstrators called on the warring sides to end hostility and end their differences through dialogue. This comes a week after the two Habar Gidir sub-clans clashed in the village in which 20 people were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM supply convoy in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the morning of 03/12. A fuel tanker was damaged in the explosion. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in Aqabtalaal Village (50km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 03/12. The attack started with a detonation of a RCIED against the convoy followed by a brief exchange of gunfire. No casualties reported.
A local journalist is believed to have been kidnapped and take to a location near the Ethiopian border.

A man from Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis shot and injured a Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad herder in an area near Laas Mugugle Village (19km NE of Laas Caanood) in the night of 03/12. The incident was clan-revenge attack. The perpetrator escaped but was arrested on 06/12 and was handed over to police in Laas Caanood.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: An IED planted on the road side targeted the commander of Puntland army in Sugure Village (35 km W of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 03/12. The commander survived the attack but one his body guards was injured in the blast. Al Shabaab reportedly claimed responsibility for the attack.

A VBIED targeted a UN convoy near the civilian gate of Mogadishu airport located between Jazeera Hotel and a checkpoint manned by NISA officers (Wadajir District) in the morning of 03/12. Four people-the purported bomber, two NISA soldiers and a civilian bystander-were killed in the explosion, while 12 others, including seven UN escort guards, were injured but no UN staff suffered casualties. Two UN vehicles were also damaged. SNG police and NISA were deployed in the area after the blast to search all public vehicles and pedestrians using the road.

Hundreds of unidentified youths armed with sticks and stones attacked Crown Hotel in Koodbuur District (Hargeisa) where Wadani (opposition) Party was holding a ceremony to welcome officials who have defected from UCID (opposition) Party on 04/12. The youths reportedly injured there people and damaged the hotel and vehicles parked at the parking yard.

A KDF warplane, which conducted air strikes in Jamaame District, crashed in Dasheg Waamo, about 30km N of Kismaayo as it returned to the base in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 04/12. KDF claimed the plane had developed technical problems and crashed but the al Shabaab Waali (governor) of Juba, Sheekh Abdirahman Hudeyfa said al Shabaab fighters had shot down the warplane and the body of the pilot and wreckage of the plane is under their custody. Later, al Shabaab took the body of the pilot to Jilib for public view.

A RCIED targeted a residence where Jubaland intelligence officers stay in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 04/12. The device was reportedly planted on the window of the house. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

KDF warplanes bombed the outskirts of the al Shabaab locations of Far Waamo (23km SW of Jamaame) and Sunguuni Village (12km SW of Jamaame) in the afternoon of 04/12. Civilian casualties were reported but exact figure could not be established.

KDF warplanes bombed the outskirts of the al Shabaab locations of Far Waamo (23km SW of Jamaame) and Sunguuni Village (12km SW of Jamaame) in the afternoon of 04/12. Civilian casualties were reported but exact figure could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG base in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the evening of 04/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Berbera municipal council workers and police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of the town on 14/12. The affected traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council but were immediately dispersed by the police.
Two unidentified gunmen shot and killed a tax collector in Xawo Tako neighbourhood in Afgoye in the evening of 04/12. The motive is unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen picked three men hailing from Biyomaal clan from their houses in Shalanbood settlement of Marka District and killed them in the village in the night of 04/12. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three pastoralists from Hawadle sub-clan Yasooman Village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) on 04/12 and took them to unknown location. The incident is believed to be related to the conflict between Hawadle pastoralist and al Shabaab over the payment of Zakat in the pastoral villages in Bulo Burte.
Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a pastoralist hailing from Hawiye/Jajeelo in the western outskirts of Beled Weyne on 04/12. The reason behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen killed a former SNG MP and seriously injured a sitting MP in a drive by shooting near Dahabshiil office in Xamar Weyne District in the morning of 04/12. The driver of the MP was also killed. NISA officers arrived at the scene and immediately pursued the perpetrator.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack on SNG/AMISOM forces base in the outskirts of Bulo Burte town in the evening of 5/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 40 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. One AMISOM/Djiboutian soldier was confirmed to have been killed in the clashes. Casualties from the al Shabaab side could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces establish a base on the outskirts of Garoowe.

Two pastoralist groups from Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed Farax sub-clans exchange gunfire in Laas-Galool near Fadhi Gaab (36km SW of Ceel-Afwayn) in the morning of 05/12 following a dispute over the ownership of the village. Local elders and police from Ceel-Afweyn intervened and separated the two sides. Police also arrested four combatants.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a residential house of a local staff (Darod/Ogaden) of Golis Telecommunication company in Raf iyo Raaxo neighbourhood (Bosasso) in the evening of 05/12. The perpetrator escaped. Causalities, damage not known.

A suicide bomber detonated his vest in Barwaqo teashop next to Dahabshiil office in Horseed neighbourhood in Baidoa in the afternoon of 05/12. Four minutes later, a VBIED (Toyota double-cabin), parked in front of an adjacent hotel was detonated. Police fired gunshots thinking the suspected al Shabaab operative conducting the explosions is among the people fleeing. The two teashops were popular among the residents of Baidoa who used to spend their evenings there. Bay regional police commander confirmed the death of 20 people (50+ injured), including the two suicide bombers, killed in the twin explosions and more than 30 others injured. The people killed in the attack include a security guard working for local security, journalists a man recently nominated as the deputy speaker of SW6 state. A man from Harin clan was reportedly arrested in the following security operation conducted by AMISOM/SNG for bailing out the suicide bomber and his vehicle after it was detained by police station few days ago.

Armed militia belonging to Ugaar Saleeban opened fire on an INGO convoy passing near Xumbays (90km W of Qardho). The militia suspected the convoy of being a surveillance team. Vehicles were damaged but there were no casualties reported.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland army troops based in Tulo Raq (49km E of Laas Caanood) left for Garowe in protest against unpaid salaries in the in the morning of 05/12. The unit set up a temporary base in the outskirts of Garowe.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 05/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG/AMISOM forces based at Beled Weyne airstrip in the evening of 06/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a surprise attack against AMISOM (KDF) base in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the morning of 06/12. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that involved KDF war planes. Seven AMISOM soldiers and more than 30 al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the clash that went on for about two hours. The AMISOM soldiers were allegedly cutting firewood during the attack.

The bodies of three people-two male and a female-were found in bush near Kismaayo University in the evening of 06/12. The identity and the motive of the perpetrators are unknown. Unconfirmed reports indicate that they were Bare Hirale defectors who escaped from AMISOM.

A man armed with AK-47 rifle, hailing from Marehan sub clan, shot and injured a man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad in Dhabad Village (30km NE of Cabud Waaq) in the night of 06/12. The reason behind the shooting is unclear. The perpetrator escaped.
Al Shabaab fighters picked four men (Ogaden/Bartire) from the homes in Welharey Village (79km NW of Afmadow) in the night of 06/12 and took them to Jilib. The motive is unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a car carrying the new District Commissioner for Buur Hakaba District between Leego and Yaaq Biri Weyne villages in the morning of 06/12, killing the District Commissioner and his three bodyguards. The District Commissioner hails from Rahaweyn/Eelay and was a Somali diaspora from Norway. He was travelling from Buur Hakaba to Mogadishu when the incident happened. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a tri-motor cycle transporting khat to Buur Hakaba in Daynuunay area (18km E of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 06/12. The motor cycle managed to pass the ambush. The driver and the khat trader suffered slight injuries.

A magnetic IED was attached to a car belonging to SNG official near Yaaqshiid District Headquarter (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 06/12. The driver noticed that the IED and asked colleague not to approach the car but the device was detonated causing the death of a civilian person and injury of two others.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in National Television neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 06/12. The two sides exchanged briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Scuffles broke out between two women and youth groups hailing from Habar Yonis and Dhulbahante in Kulmiye neighbourhood in Ceerigaabo on 07/12. The scuffles broke out following a fight between four children who were playing football. Ceerigaabo police arrived at the scene, dispersed the groups and arrested six people from both sides.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack on AMISOM-Kenya forces base in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SE of Belet Xaawo) in the evening of 07/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce battle which lasted for hours after which the al Shabaab fighters were pushed back. Casualties could not be confirmed.

SNG forces in Waajid conducted a security operation in the vicinity of Aleemow Village (18km N of Waajid) in the night of 07/12 and killed an al Shabaab operative. They also seized two camels he was herding and returned to their base. The camels were Zakat collected from pastoralist.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on AMISOM forces base in Ceel Haji (3km NE of Marka) in the night of 07/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on AMISOM forces base in Carbiska in Afgoye District in the evening of 07/12. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted for about an hour. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters killed three civilian men in Ceelbaar village (20 km W of Beled Weyne) on 07/12. The three men were transporting foodstuff with donkey carts from Beled Weyne to Tiyeeglow when the incident happened. The reason behind the killing is unknown but it is believed to have been related to an al Shabaab blockade on towns and villages recently liberated by AMISOM and SNG forces.

A group of local residents mostly youth and women staged a peaceful demonstration in Caynabo town on 07/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the Caynabo Police Commander whom they accused of allowing police torture during security operations. They were chanting slogans calling the government to replace him.

An IED exploded near Hotel Weheliye area on Maka Al-Mukarama Road in Hawl Wadaag District in the night of 07/12. The device was apparently placed on the roadside and prematurely detonated causing no casualties. The target could not be established and the perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNG forces position in Maslah Building in Heliwa District in the midnight of 07/12. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire briefly but casualties could not be known.
Al Shabaab kills five pastoralists who were transporting food on the outskirts of Beled Weyne. In response the SNG sent forces to the region.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Gadoon Dhowe Village (45km SW of Beled Xawo) on the 08/12 after AMISOM (KDF) vacated the village and moved to undisclosed location between Gadoon Dhowe and Khadija Haji (39km SW of Beled Xawo). AMISOM forces had initially overtaken the village from al Shabaab a week earlier.

Hundreds of physically challenged people in Mogadishu gathered in front of the Ministry of Interior in Otto Otto area in Waberi District in the morning of 08/12 to protest the lack of assistance from the Ministry of Interior. Protesters staged a similar protest in the area a week prior.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNG/AMISOM forces base in Siinka Dheer in Dharkenley District in the night of 09/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties from both sides are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against ENDF forces based in Ceel Garas in the evening of 09/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Militias loyal to Barre Hiiraale reportedly opened fire at a warship believed to be a Kenyan that came close to Sabca Asharaf village near Goobweyn Village (14km, NE, Kismaayo) on 09/12. No casualties reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack on SNAF/AMISOM base in Qoryoley town in the night of 09/12. AL Shabaab fighters withdrew after a few minutes of confrontations between the two sides. No casualties were reported.

Two amputated bodies were found in Buur Hakaba town in the early morning of 09/12. The dead bodies were identified as members from Eyle sub clan of Rahanweyn while the motive and the identity of those behind the killings remain unknown.

Gunmen hailing from Ayr/Habar Gidir shot and killed a man from Saleban/Habar Gidir in Balli-Howd village (60km NE of Dhusamareeb) on 09/12 in an apparent revenge attack following previous killings between the two sub clans. Stray bullets also killed a civilian woman. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Galgala insurgents fired mortar rounds at positions of Puntland forces in Galgala Hills (35km NW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 09/12. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An unidentified gunman shot and killed a Puntland policeman manning a security checkpoint in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 09/12. The perpetrator took the gun of the victim and escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters killed two women cooking for the SNG forces in Tayeeglow in the midnight of 09/12 as a retaliatory action against SNG soldiers who killed five women related to al Shabaab operatives in Tayeeglow in the morning of 09/12.
SNG forces shoot and killed five women who were relatives of al Shabaab fighters.

Two hand grenades were thrown at SNG police on patrol in Dabka Junction in Hawl Wadaag District on 09/12. One hand grenade exploded while the second one failed. SNGF forces started shooting in all directions after the explosion. Police EOD team recovered the unexploded device. The perpetrators escaped. Causalities not known.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNG police outpost in Bar Ubax Junction in Wardhigley District on the 09/10. SNG police started shooting in all directions following the explosion. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a suspect was arrested. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNG forces base in Sarta Qabyada in Yaaqshiid District on 9/10. The two sides engaged in a gun battle which lasted for a few minutes before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Non-violent activity: Gunmen opened fire at a municipal council bulldozer demolishing a land reportedly claimed ownership by the municipality of Berbera on 10/12. No casualty was reportedly but the gunmen deflated the tires of the bulldozer forcing it to stop the demolition. The gunmen managed to escape.

Two Dhulbahante sub-clans militias (Samakaab Ali and Faarax Ali) clashed in Taleex on 10/12. While the exact trigger of the armed clash is not clear, unconfirmed reports indicate that the fighting broke out after man hailing from Samakaab Ali tried to rob a gun from a Faarax Ali man and immediately Farax Ali sub-clan incorrectly assumed that their clansman was killed and attacked Samakaab Ali. The two sides used heavy both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for more than an hour.

Two pastoralist groups hailing from Dhulbahante and Habar Yonis exchanged gunfire in Dhabeeda near Dibqarax Village (42km SE of Ceerigaabo) following an escalated dispute over pasture in the morning of 10/12. Local elders went to the area to diffuse the tension. Four causalities reported, as well as several injuries.
SNG forces caught and killed a man on the spot without questioning in the morning of 10/12 for communicating with al Shabaab operatives following the killing of five women by SNG forces in Tayeeglow.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG police in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 10/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed while three policemen were injured. A vehicle belonging to al Shabaab fighters was destroyed by a RPG round.
A businessman was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in Ali Kamiin neighbourhood in Wardhigley District on 10/12. The perpetrators managed to escape and the motive is unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against NISA base in Biyo Degaanka area (Heliwa District) in the night of 10/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

The head of the Academic Department of SIMAD University was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in the morning of 10/12 in KPP neighbourhood in Hodan District. The attackers managed to escape and the motive is so far unknown. Investigations are underway to determine the motive and the identity of the attackers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED planted during the overnight hours accidentally exploded in the centre of Qansax Dhere in the morning of 11/12. The device exploded at a time when AMISOM/EOD team was dismantling it. One AMISOM soldier was killed and two others were wounded. Perpetrators not known.

Al Shabaab militia carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG police forces collecting tax from the locals in Kalabayr (25km NE of Beled Weyne) on 11/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A SNG police officer was injured in the clash and police vehicle destroyed. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly seized three AK-47 rifles in the clash.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Dila (25km SE of Borama) on 11/12 complaining that they have been left out in the recruitment process by an international company involved in mining activities in the village. The demonstration ended peacefully.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG/AMISOM forces conducted a security operation in Ceel-Jaale village (7km SW of Marka) to arrest Habar Gidir militia who reportedly sell arms to al Shabaab fighters. The militia resisted arrest and clashed with the allied forces. Two militiamen were killed and 11 others arrested.

AMISOM (KDF) attacked Gadoon Dhowe Village (45km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 11/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce fighting in which KDF warplanes took part. Over a hundred al Shabaab fighters also were involved in the fighting which was reported as the deadliest of late in the area. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the new al Shabaab leader was present in the area during the clash. The sound of heavy gunfire could be heard in Beled Xawo town. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped the director of the Ministry of Women and Human Rights from his house in Via Liberia neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the night of 11/12. The motive is unknown. It was later found out that the director was arrested by SNG forces. He was released on 12/12.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched a series of attacks on AMISOM bases in Marka during the late overnight hours. Causalities not known. It is not known if the attacks are in any response to AMISOM forces killing three civilians earlier in the day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces reportedly killed three civilians, including a traditional elder in Marka. The reason for the killings are not known.

ASWJ fighters attacked pro-SNG forces based at district administration office in Guri Ceel in the afternoon of 12/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire that lasted for about an hour. Six combatants were wounded during the clash. The ASWJ fighters took over control of the district administration office.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces in Ceel Garuun area near Lafoole (Afgooye District) in the night of 12/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
