Abgal/Reer Matan and Shiidle militias clashed in Xawaadley Village (27km NE of Balcad) in the evening of 12/12 following a dispute over khat. Two militiamen from Abgal/Reer Matan were reportedly killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Mayafulka (8km E of Baidoa) in the night of 12/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG/AMISOM forces in Arbacow (13km E of Afgooye) on the evening of 12/12. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a madrassa teacher in Qandho Village (45km NE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 12/12 for reportedly refusing to pay extra Zakat.

SNG forces opened fire at a civilian mini-bus passing near Dayniile Hospital (Dayniile District) in the evening of 12/12 after suspecting it as hostile. Two passengers were injured. The perpetrators escaped.
Fifteen people were killed in Dhusamareb when ASWJ attempted to seize control of nearby Guriel from SNG forces. The extent of violence in Guriel, if any at all, is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Three Puntland soldiers stationed in Golis mountains were killed and four others were wounded in a bomb blast near the village of Galgala on the afternoon of 12/12.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against SNG forces vehicle near khat market in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the evening 13/12. No casualties reported. The attackers managed to escape.

Two Rahaweyn sub-clans militias (Jilible and Luwaay) clashed following an escalated dispute over farms ownership in Manaas Village (35km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 13/12. Later, Geelidle joined and fought alongside the Jilible. Eight combatants were killed and six others injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Rage-Ceele Village (76km NE of Balcad) in the evening of 13/12. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for more than one hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Property destruction: Jilible and Geelidle burned part of Buulo Gololle Village (4km SW of Manaas) in the afternoon of 13/12. The village is mainly occupied by Luways sub-clan. No casualties were reported. The incident is related to the clash between Luways and Jilible/Geedidle in Manaas Village.
Marehan/Wagardhac gunmen shot and killed a herder from Saad/Reer Jalaf in Galinsoor Village (Galkacyo District) on 13/12. The incident is related to revenge killing between the two sub-clans.

A large number of disable people staged a demonstration at K4 Junction (Hodan District) on 13/12 in protest against the SNG for failing to assist them. The demonstrators reportedly closed the junction and disrupted traffic at the busy junction. This is the third time the disable demonstrated in the streets of Mogadishu in two weeks.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against NISA forces manning a checkpoint in the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 13/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the chairman of Dharkeynley sports committee in Suuq Yaraha neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the afternoon of 13/12. The motive is unknown. The victim was an employee of the Justice Ministry and used to visit the presidential palace frequently and maintained good relationship with some ministers. The perpetrators escaped.
Fighting between SNG forces and ASWJ reported in Dhuusamarreeb. The death of three people and injury of two others has been ascertained. The two actors clashed in the area the previous day.

A large number of people staged a demonstration in central Borama on 14/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the deployment of Somaliland army in Borama to arrest a traditional leader who reportedly mobilized a clan militia to fight Somaliland government. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrations. They also arrested 14 demonstrators. Police also arrested two councillors who were involved in the protest.

Children at Hargeisa Orphanage Centre staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against plans by the government to construct a vocational centre at a local football pitch adjacent to the orphanage centre. The children said they play soccer at the pitch during their leisure time. The demonstration follows amid reports that the Office of the President and the Ministry of Information are jointly planning to develop skills training centre at the football pitch.

Geelidle and Luwaay militias (Rahaweyn sub-clans) clashed in Manaas Village (32km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 14/12 over farm dispute. Five people, including two pastoralists hit by stray bullets, were killed in the clash. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly intervened the conflict between the two sub-clans and disarmed both groups in the afternoon of 14/12. The intervention created a calm situation in the village.
Luways militia shot and killed an al Shabaab fighter from Geelidle sub-clan in the vicinity of Manaas Village (32km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 14/12 and took his gun.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters fired mortar rounds towards the position of Puntland forces near Galgala (35km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 14/12. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers fired six projectiles at Mogadishu Airport from Adan Kukay neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the night of 14/12. The rounds landed in the AMISOM protected area of MIA. Local residents reportedly said several young men in a Toyota spotted in the area are believed to have been behind the attack. No casualties or damages were reported. The attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Biyo Degaanka (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Abdi Wayeel neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/12. The attack was simultaneous with the one in Biyo Degaanka area. Casualties could be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at an AMISOM military convoy at Bundo Bilan in Ruusiya neighbourhood of Marka in the afternoon of 15/12. Casualties could not be established. The attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG police on foot near Marka police station in the afternoon of 15/12. One policeman was killed and four civilians were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Two militias groups from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud clashed in an area 20km E of Garowe over land dispute in the afternoon of 15/12. Two combatants were injured. The fighting caused tension in the area. The two sides were reportedly regrouping for a fresh armed clash.

Two Majeerteen sub-clans militias (Ugaar Saleeban and Ali Saleeban) clashed following an escalated dispute over camels stolen in Rako Village (77 km NE of Qardho) in the afternoon of 15/12. Four militias-three Ugaar Saleeban and one Ali Saleeban-were killed and five combatants were injured in the clash. The fighting caused tension in the village.

Biyomaal and Habar Gidir clan militias clashed in Danada Village (7km N of Marka) in the morning of 15/12. The two sides reportedly clashed several times in the village and the fighting later spread to Buufow Bacaad area in the afternoon. About four combatants were reportedly killed and 10 others wounded in the clash.

Two groups of pro-SNG forces (not named or identified) clashed in Ceel Waq in the morning of 15/12. The fighting broke out after pro-SNG forces allied to a replaced deputy District Commissioner attacked those of the new deputy DC who was appointed by the local authority. Both the former and the new deputy DCs hail from Marehan/Uur-midig sub-clan. One soldier was killed and another injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Warmahan settlement (27Km SE of Wanlaweyne) in the morning of 15/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Tixsiile Village (20Km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 15/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces in Siinaay neighbourhood in Waajid in the evening of 15/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Gunmen believed to be from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan opened fire at a private vehicle in Waqderi (15km S of Laas Caanood) on 15/12, killing a man from Dhulbahante/Bahararsame and injuring four others. The attack was a revenge killing between the two Dhulbahante sub-clans. The vehicle had left Laas Caanood and was heading to Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) when the incident happened. Bahararsame gunmen went on revenge mission immediately and killed a man from Qayaad sub-clan and injured another in Geel-Booba near Kalabaydh (30km S of Laas Caanood).

Gunmen believed to be from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan opened fire at a private vehicle in Waqderi (15km S of Laas Caanood) on 15/12, killing a man from Dhulbahante/Bahararsame and injuring four others. The attack was a revenge killing between the two Dhulbahante sub-clans. The vehicle had left Laas Caanood and was heading to Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) when the incident happened. Bahararsame gunmen went on revenge mission immediately and killed a man from Qayaad sub-clan and injured another in Geel-Booba near Kalabaydh (30km S of Laas Caanood).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces based at the western part of Bulo Burte in the evening of 16/12. The two side exchanged small arms fire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties from fighting reported, however five civilians have starved to death due to an ongoing al Shabaab blockade of the town.

A RCIED targeted a SNG vehicle in Baraawe in the morning of 16/12. The vehicle was reportedly carrying a SNG military officer when the incident happened. The commander was unhurt but his two body guards were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces escorting a food convoy in Xara Lugoole (15km S of Jalalaqsi) in the night of 16/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Gelidle and Luwaays clan militias clashed in villages near Manaas Village (35km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 16/12. The two sides engaged in a sporadic gun battle. Reports indicate 5-6 pastoralists were killed after they were hit by stray bullets. Luwaays militias burned down Jameeco Furid Village belonging to Gelidle during the clashes.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM (KDF) in Tabta Village (75km SW of Afmadow) in the night of 16/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported.

Unidentified gunmen picked two men hailing from Biyomaal clan from their houses in Ceel Hindi neighbourhood of Marka in the night of 16/12. The perpetrators killed one of the abductees and dumped his body in the same neighbourhood but whereabouts of the other man is unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Dec 16. Unidentified persons attacked Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops in Marka town with a hand grenade. No reported casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Dec 16. Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops killed one civilian and wounded three others in the town of Marka after being attacked by unidentified persons with a hand grenade. In addition to this violence, AMISOM are believed to responsible for civilian deaths in Marka several days prior.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces near Robow Village (20km NE of Baraawe) on the 17/12. The attack was initiated with a detonation of a RCIED followed by direct confrontation. The convoy was escorting a food convoy heading to Baraawe. One truck was damaged. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces in an area between Goof Gaduud Shabeelow and Manaas (30km SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 17/12. The SNG forces were returning to Baidoa after deploying in Manaas to intervene between Luwaays and Gelidle who clashed in Manaas Village following a dispute over farms. The soldiers decided to return to Baidoa after finding no militias in the village. One SNG soldier was killed and five others injured. Al Shabaab reportedly seized two guns from the SNG forces.
A shootout is reported between police and unidentified gunmen at a former cement factory in Berbera. Causalities not known.

A policeman at the port of Berbera physically assaulted a local journalist at the gate of the port on 17/12. The incident happened after the journalist who wanted to interview the general manager of the port, had an argument with the policeman for refusing to allow him enter the port. The journalist was reportedly admitted to Berbera Hospital.

Al Shabaab fighters took a man from his home in Duuray Village (9km SW of Qansax Dhere) in the morning of 17/12 and later beheaded him in Shanta Mundule (7km SW of Baidoa). The motive is unclear. The victims brother is a member of SNG parliament and it remains unclear whether the incident is related to his brothers position in the government. It was later learned the victim was of Rahanweyn clan, though it is unclear whether this contributed to the motive.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a SNG police vehicle escorting the deputy divisional police commander of Lower Shabelle Region in Xawa Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye in the afternoon of 17/12. Two police officers and a by-sander (civilian) were injured by the explosion.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in the vicinity of the livestock market (Heliwa District) on the evening of 17/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
AMISOM/KDF convoy was targeted with a RCIED in Buusaar Village (37km SE of Ceel Waaq) in the morning of 18/12. One truck was slightly damaged. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A roadside bomb targeted AMISOM forces in Marka. It is still unknown how many people were killed or injured in the blast. Security forces carried out an operation and arrested several people in connection with the explosion, though the identities of the perpetrators remained unreported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack AMISOM/SNG forces in Mundul Barawe settlement (Barawe District) in the night of 19/12/2014. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire. Casualties could not be established.

Pro-SNG (not identified) forces in Waajid conducted a security operation in Eel Tuumad Village (7km NE of Waajid) in the morning of 19/12. The soldiers captured an al Shabaab fighter and later killed him outside the village before returning to Waajid.

Biyomaal militia shot and killed a man hailing from Garre clan in Shalaambood (Marka District) on 19/12 following a dispute over a piece of land. The victim had co-owned the land with Habar Gidir and the Biyomaal militias wanted the land of Habar Gidir be given to them but the victim opposed leading to the killing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Two armed groups clashed in the outskirt of E of Garowe over a land dispute in the morning of 19/12. The two sides were reported to be members of Puntland forces. No casualties were reported.

A NISA soldier opened fire at other NISA forces on security operation after suspecting them as hostile in Jiiro Maskin neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 19/12. The other soldiers returned fire and killed the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against NISA forces at Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 19/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes. One NISA soldier was killed. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against a convoy of SNG forces returning from Buq-Goosaar village (50km SW of Beled Weyne) in the night of 20/12. Three SNG soldiers were killed and seven others were injured during the ambush and subsequent armed clash. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.
Clan militias from Habar Gidir and Biyomaal clashed near Ceel Waregow Village (10km NE Marka) in the afternoon of 20/12. No casualties reported.

Group of youths armed with sticks and stones attacked a residential house in Huluul (57km W of Ceel-Afweyn) on 20/12 where Wadani (opposition) Party was holding a ceremony for the opening a new office. Police arrived and stopped the ceremony. They also arrested four youth who were part of the group that the attacked the venue.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Police open fire on a group of youths who disrupted a wedding at a IDP camp. The nature of the disruption is not clear; it is unknown if the youths were armed. Six injuries reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against the residence of Kaxda District Commissioner in Barwaqo neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 20/12. The guards at the residence exchanged gunfire with the attackers. Two guards and a woman were killed and a number of other people were injured. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 20/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two SNG policemen and injured a civilian passerby near Black Sea Junction (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 20/12. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed men this evening attacked Kaxda [Kahda] District governors residence in Mogadishu, the Somali capital. The attacked residence is located near Kaxda District headquarters. A gun battle ensued between soldiers guarding the governors home and the attackers. Two people - a soldier guarding the home and a female passerby - are known to have been killed in the exchange of gunfire. One soldier was also wounded in the attack. It was unclear if the attackers suffered any casualties.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Lafoole (Afgooye District) in the evening of 21/12. The reason behind the killing of the soldier remains unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A RCIED targeted the vehicle of Puntlands deputy governor of Mudug Region, Farhan Ali Hirsi, near Galkacyo North police station in the morning of 21/12. The governor suffered minor injuries and is being treated in Galkacyo General Hospital. Puntland security forces launched a security operation in the area after the blast. It remains unclear whether they have made any arrest.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 21/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces-NISA and the guards of Banaadir regional governor-clashed at Liido Beach (Cabducasiis District) in the evening of 21/12 after suspecting each other. One soldier from NISA was killed while three others were injured.
A pro-al Shabaab source claims several explosions occurred in Afgooye, killing at least five soldiers. The attack has not been confirmed by the military.
A hand grenade attack in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood in Jowhar in the evening of 21/12 against SNG forces. It is not know if there were any causalities resulting from the blast.
Hundreds of residents of Jowhar stage d a peaceful rally in the morning of 22/12 in support of SNG newly appointed Prime Minister Omar Abdirashid Ali Sharmarke.

Armed Militias from Biimaal and Habar-Gedir clashed in the vicinity of Ceel Wareegow village (17km SW of Marka) in the morning of 22/12. Reports indicate that the Habar-Gedir militias initiated the clash that lasted for about 30 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Lafoole settlement (7km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 22/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces on security patrol clashed with Al Shabaab fighters in Doondardiir village (25km SW of Xudur) in the afternoon of 22/12. The two sides exchanged RPGs and other small fire arms for 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. SNG forces return back to their base in Xudur. One al Shabaab fighter was killed while another one was injured.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Leego village (48km SE of Buur Hakaba) in the morning of 22/12 for unknown reason. One soldier was killed while three others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters publicly executed a civilian man in Biyo Cadde village (46 NE of Jowhar) in the evening of 22/12. Reports indicate that the victim was accused of been spy for SNG forces in the region.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Jubaland forces based in the northern part of Afmadow town in the evening of 22/12. The two sides exchange gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces in Yoontoy Village (20km E of Kismaayo) in the morning of 22/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two combatants were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces position in Sarta Qabyada neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 22/12. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Civil servants staged a peaceful demonstration in Garowe in the morning of 23/12 in protest against a new directive to test the qualification of all civil servants. Under the new directive, all civil servants will undergo an examination to test whether they qualify for the posts they are holding.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/EOD team safely disabled several IEDs in the vicinity of Mayafulka (Baidoa) in the morning of 23/12. The devices were initially collected from various Baidoa neighbourhoods. No casualties were reported during the detonation exercise.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Labada Dhagax in the vicinity Cabdow Dibile Village (8km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 23/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG/AMISOM forces position in Baraawe in the night of 23/12. Reports indicate that the clash lasted more than an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two SNG soldiers in Raas Qode village (10km E of Garbahareey) in the morning of 23/12. The beheaded soldiers were reportedly brothers who were visiting their families in the village.

Two groups of SNG forces hailing from Rahanweyn (Shanta Caleemo and Erdo sub-clans) clashed over unknown reasons in Bulo Adow Mudey village (13km SE of Wanla weyn) in the morning of 23/12. No casualties were reported.

Students from Farah Omar Secondary School staged a demonstration along the main road near Imperial Hotel on 23/12 to express their anger of lack of teachers in the school. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the students. At the time of reporting the students were reportedly regrouping to continue their protest.

Unidentified gunmen shot and seriously injured an official from Jubaland administration called Yassin Radeel (Marehan) and two of his body guards in Tawakal Hotel in Fanoole neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 23/12. The reason behind the attack is currently unknown. The same official was attacked in June 2013 where he was airlifted to Nairobi for treatment. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a businessman (Majerteen/Dishiishe) from his home in Biyo Kulule neighbourhood in Bosasso on the evening of 23/12. The motive is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that the perpetrators could be al Shabaab operatives.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED targeted a mini-bus transporting supplies to Jubaland soldiers manning a check-point in Buulo Gaduud village (32km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 23/12. The bus was slightly damaged by the blast. No casualties were reported.

A group of local residents mostly, youth and women, staged a demonstration in Caynabo on 23/12.The protestors were expressing their anger against individuals turned large pasture land in to a private use. The protestors requested the government to intervene the matter since their animals left no land to grass.

Armed men dressed in SNG military uniforms (unclear if perpetrators were legitimate soldiers) opened gunfire at a SNG forces vehicle in the vicinity of Daljirka Dahsoon Junction (Bondheere District) in the afternoon of 23/12. The reason behind the shooting is unclear. One soldier was killed in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters with two battle wagons took over control of Kaxda District Commissioners office (Dharkenley District) without any resistance from SNG forces in the night of 23/12. The al Shabaab fighters raised their flag at the office and stayed for about two hours before leaving to unknown location. This is the second time that al Shabaab fighters had made on offensive on the DC office in a week.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier near Karaan Police station (Karaan District) in the night of 23/12 and immediately escaped.

Pro-SNG forces (organization not identified) on a security operation killed an al Shabaab fighter in the outskirts of Teyeeglow in the morning of 24/12 and brought his body to the town. The operation came after a tip-off that al Shabaab fighters had been planning an attack pro-SNG forces in revenge of women related to al Shabaab fighters killed by pro-SNG forces.

Clan militias from Habar Gidir/Saad and Mareehan/Wagardhac reportedly clashed in around Saaxo village (70km SW of Galkacyo) in the morning of 24/12. The fighting broke out following a dispute over ownership of land and revenge killings between the two sub-clans. Six combatants from both sides were allegedly injured during the clash. Tensions are building up in the area while elders stepped in to prevent further clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG convoy in Buulo Xaawo village (57km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 24/12. The two sides engaged heavy fighting which lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters were overwhelmed. The SNG forces left Qansax Dheere and were heading to Bardaale when the ambush happened. Two SNG soldiers and one al Shabaab fighter were killed while another al Shabaab fighter was injured.

Al Shabaab fighters on 27/12 beheaded a former SNG soldier whom they abducted from Daqalow Village (29km SE of Beled Weyne) on 24/12. The victim quit the SNG forces and started farming in the village by the time of his abduction. Al Shabaab fighters took him to their base in Buqcagable Village (80km SE of Beled Weyne) where he was condemned to death for spying for the SNG. His body was dumped on the western side of the river in Daqalow Village. Al Shabaab reportedly told his relatives that he should not be buried as a Muslim as he was not Muslim but an apostate.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters (8-10 members) launched a well-organized attack against AMISOM base in Mogadishu known as Xalane base, which is very close to Mogadishu International Airport in the afternoon of 25/12. The attackers were reportedly wearing SNA uniforms, initiated the attack with a hand grenade attack. They managed to breach the base camp and attempted to gain access to critical infrastructure. It took AMISOM soldiers more than 18 hours to clear the compound. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack as soon as the first shots rang out and later broadcasted that they had killed 17 AMISOM soldiers, including senior AMIOSM commanders and two white mercenaries. AMISOM said that they lost five soldiers and one of their contractors in the attack. The number of al Shabaab killed in the attack were not reported upon, though it was later learned at least some were killed as AMISOM forces later publicly displayed the bodies of the enemy dead as an act of discouragement for future attacks. A press release reportedly issued by the al Shabaab, claimed the operation was in revenge for the killing of the al Shabaab leader, Ahmed Aw Godane alias Mukhtar Abu Zubeyr and other Muslims killed in Somalia.

Habar Gidir and Bimaal militias clashed near Buufow Bacaad Village (5km NW of Marka) in the evening of 25/12. The fighting was initiated by Bimaal militias. The two sides exchanged gunfire for 30 minutes after which the Bimaal militias withdrew. Three combatants were killed.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Khadijo Haji (38km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 25/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel Saliini (30km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 25/12. The fighting lasted for about two hours. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland forces convoy heading to Kismaayo along the Jilib-Kismaayo highway hit an IED in Bula Gudud Village (32km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 25/12. Two soldiers were killed and three others injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland solder manning at a security checkpoint near Golis Telecommunication Company in Galkacyo (North) shot and killed a civilian man in the evening of 26/12. The shooting was reportedly followed after the victim argued with the policeman over body searching. The perpetrator was later arrested by the police.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based at Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the evening of 26/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Juungal neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 26/12. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Arrests: Senior al Shabaab official Zakariya Ismail Ahmed Hersi surrenders to AMISOM forces in Gedo Region, location unknown. Al Shabaab later denied the arrest.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Puntland forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed in in Madashon near Galgala (58km SW of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 27/12. The fighting was initiated by Puntland forces after a tip-off that al Shabaab fighters and their commander were hiding in the area. The two sides reportedly engaged in a fierce fighting. Twelve al Shabaab fighters were killed and three others, including a senior al Shabaab operational commander, were captured. Puntland forces casualties could not be established. Unconfirmed reports indicate that US war planes took part in the offensive. Additional troops were later deployed to reinforce the unit that had clashed with al Shabaab fighters earlier in the day.

Police shot and injured an al Shabaab operative running a Madrasa in Mursal neighbourhood in Baidoa on the morning of 27/12 after he tried to escape immediately he saw police approaching his Madrasa. The operation follows a tip-off from undisclosed sources. The victim, Rahaweyn/Elay, succumbed to his injuries in Baidoa general hospital.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Siinka Dheer (Afgooye District) in the night of 27/12. Casualties could not be established.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a man in Dabagalo Village (36km SW of Xarar-dheere) on 27/12. The motive of the killing is unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

Pro-SNG forces (organization not identified) manning a checkpoint in Dina Village (18km SE of Xudur) opened fire at a mini-bus after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop. Six passengers were killed and 11 others injured. The pro-SNG forces claimed that they had suspected the mini-bus as an al Shabaab vehicle. The vehicle had left Puntland and was heading to Bay Region when the incident happened.

Al Shabaab fighters on 27/12 beheaded a former SNG soldier whom they abducted from Daqalow Village (29km SE of Beled Weyne) on 24/12. The victim quit the SNG forces and started farming in the village by the time of his abduction. Al Shabaab fighters took him to their base in Buqcagable Village (80km SE of Beled Weyne) where he was condemned to death for spying for the SNG. His body was dumped on the western side of the river in Daqalow Village. Al Shabaab reportedly told his relatives that he should not be buried as a Muslim as he was not Muslim but an apostate.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a former pro-SNG soldier from Marehan sub-clan in Ceel Cadde (52km SW of Garbarhaarey) in the night of 26/12. The victim was a running a shop in the village after he quit pro-SNG forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces in Bulla Gadud Village (32km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 27/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces vehicle in Ceelasha settlement (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 28/12. SNG soldiers in the vehicle opened fire after the blast. The soldiers were heading to Afgooye when the incident happened. No casualties reported.

Two groups of al Shabaab fighters clashed in Baardheere on 28/12 over an escalated dispute regarding the surrender of the former al Shabaab intelligence chief to SNG forces in Ceel Waaq on 26/12. A number of combatants were injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab militants fired at a public passenger truck near Xuddur, the capital of Bakool region, killing seven passengers. Xudur administrator Muhammad Maalin Ahmad told Keydmedia Online that the vehicle was travelling to Xuddur from the city of Baydhabo when al Shabaab fired at it.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters took over control of Yoontoy Village (25km E of Kismaayo) in the evening of 28/12 after Jubaland forces vacated the village. The Jubaland forces went to Bulla Gudud Village (30km NE of Kismaayo). The al Shabaab fighters also established a road-block on Bulla Gudud-Kismaayo road.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG police based at Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 28/11. The soldiers reacted by opening fire. No casualties reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a man near Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 28/11. The motive of the killing is unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA forces in Ciise Cabdi neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 28/12. The two sides exchange gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: The Pentagon says it conducted an airstrike at Saacow (Local Source Project claims the strike took place at nearby Gaduuday) in Somalia against a senior leader of al Shabaab. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the operation was targeting the head of al Shabaab Amniyat (intelligence), Talil Abdishakur or Fuad Shongole aka ""Tahlil"", a senior al Shabaab official. Four deaths reported. The primary target was later confirmed to be among the dead.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG/AMISOM (Djibouti) forces near Jimbiley Village (10km NW of Jalalaqsi) on the road between Jalalaqsi and Bulo Burte on 29/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three SNG soldiers were injured and a number of al Shabaab fighters killed. The convoy was also targeted with a RCIED but casualties could not be established; al Shabaab claimed have had killed a SNG commander. The allied forces were on an operation aimed at opening the road between the two towns following an al Shabaab economic blockade.

Berbera municipal council workers backed by police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of the town on 29/12. The affected traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council but were immediately dispersed by the police.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces on foot patrol in the outskirts of Khadija Haji Village (Beled Xawo District) in the afternoon of 29/12. Three SNG soldiers were killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established. The targeted SNG forces were recently deployed from Dollow.

Clan militias from Habar Gidir/Ayr and Habar Gidir/Salebaan clashed in Miliqo Village (40km W of Xarar-dheere) in the afternoon of 29/12. The fighting was related to previous clash on 29/11 and revenge killings between the two sub-clans. Ten combatants were reportedly killed and scores of others injured in the clash. Elders have stepped in to prevent further clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Maduulow Village (25km NE of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 29/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. At least five al Shabaab fighters including the former commander in Buulo Mareer were killed in the clash. The al Shabaab fighters launched a retaliatory attacks against SNG/AMISOM positions in Buulo Mareer later in the evening.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Maduulow Village (25km NE of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 29/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. At least five al Shabaab fighters including the former commander in Buulo Mareer were killed in the clash. The al Shabaab fighters launched a retaliatory attacks against SNG/AMISOM positions in Buulo Mareer later in the evening, causalities not known.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a woman in Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 30/12. Reports indicate that the victim (lady) was working with the Central Bank. The reason behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Aymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 29/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Unknown assailants attack and kill a woman in western Mogadishu, reasons unknown.
Al Shabaab infighting reported in Baardheere, unconfirmed causalities. The clash began after one group wanted to defect to the SNG. Al Shabaab had clashed within itself two days prior in Baardheere.
SNG forces, at the direction of the Yaaqshid District Commissioner, are alleged to have assassinated a prominent businessman and injured his wife in the area. The motive to the killing is not known.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Daynuunay Village (18kms SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 30/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SPUs static guards assigned to the UNCC on 30/12 complained and showed a kind of protest about unpaid/delayed of their stipends for two months. The SPU commander later clarified that the payment has already been processed and they will be paid on 31/12 while the situation returned to normalcy. On the same note SPUs static guards for INGOs compounds claimed that they have received their stipends on November and still waiting for December to be paid.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a mini-bus driver following an escalated dispute over extortion money demanded by the soldier in Sei-Biano neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 30/12. The soldier reportedly escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Sarta qabyada (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 30/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties.
Unidentified men armed pistols shot and killed an official of Yaaqshiid District administration in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 30/12. The perpetrators escaped.

Heavy fighting broke out between Hawadle and Dir militias in Defow Village (30 km NW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 31/12. The fighting was related to previous armed clashes between the two clans. Ten combatants were killed and more than 10 others injured. Latest reports indicate that Hawadle militias managed to take-over the village. Ten Hawadle militias were killed and 20 more were injured. Further reports suggest that Dir community have been displaced and started moving towards Ethiopia while fresh fighting resumed in the morning of 01/01

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: Puntland government confirmed the capture of senior al Shabaab officials including Mukhtar Abdinur Ahmed, alias Ahmed Gurey and Ahmed Abdi Mohamed in the military offensive against al Shabaab fighters in Galgala Mountains over the last two weeks.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two men installing solar-powered street lights along the industrial road near Miisaanka Dhuxusha (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 31/12. The motive is unclear. The victims were working for a private contractor. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified persons attacked the Radio Galkayo building with a pair of hand grenades. Two journalists reported injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab and AMISOM-Kenya clash in Yoontoy Yarey, causalities not known. The fighting started when Al-Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Kenyan troops convoy in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against AMISOM/SNG forces near Buur Weyn village (29km S of Buulo Burte) in the morning of 01/01. The ambush followed by exchange of gunfire between the two sides. The allied forces were escorting convoy of vehicles transporting food aid from Jalalaqsi to Buulo Burte when the ambush happened. One al Shabab fighter was reportedly killed.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Xudur on 10/01. The two sides briefly clash after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/Jubaland forces in Goob Weyn (13km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 01/01. Both sides briefly clashed after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab attacks a government base in Baidoa - six soldiers, one civilian dead.

Angered at the presence of SNG forces in the area, residents of Guri Ceel riot, burning tires in front of a police station. Police respond by opening fire on the rioters, killing a civilian and injuring four others. The rioters wanted the SNG forces to be replaced with the ASWJ.

A RCIED targeted a vehicle belonging to Yamayska International School in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the morning of 02/01. The device which was planted at the front gate of the school targeted Kenyan teachers in the school. One security guard was killed while four others among them two Kenyan teachers were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against KDF convoy heading to a water point near Raas Kambooni village (78kms SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 02/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three AMISOM-KDF soldiers were reportedly injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces in Goof Gaduud village (25km SW of Baidoa) in the midnight of 02/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two al Shabaab fighters were injured in the attack. No other casualties were reported.

Gunmen dressed in SNA uniforms (unknown if attackers were legitimate SNA) opened fire on a public mini-bus near Cabdow Dibile village (8km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 02/01. The driver passed a checkpoint after which the men at the checkpoint started the shooting. Two passengers were injured in the incident.

A civilian man was shot and killed by al Shabaab fighters in Dhurey (20km SE of Waajid) in the evening of 02/01. The man was killed after he was caught with 20kg of sugar in an attempt to defy the economic blockade imposed by al Shabaab.

A vehicle attached with IED exploded in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 02/01. The driver died in the explosion. The victim was a local businessman who used to sell airline tickets. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG soldiers chewing Khat in a private residence in Xoosh area (Dharkenley District) in the night of 02/01. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED explosion targeted AMISOM convoy passing Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 02/01. The explosion reportedly missed the vehicle and no casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Clan militias from Madhiban and Arab (Meheri) clans clashed in an area near Bursaalax (30km NE of Galdogob) in the afternoon of 03/01. The fighting was related to a land dispute. One combatant was reportedly killed and two others injured in the clash. Clan elders stepped in to prevent further clashes between the two sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces escorting food convoy near Yasooman village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 03/01. The convoy was heading to Maxaas from Bulo Burte. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported. Yasooman proper had been taken over by SNG forces earlier in the day.

SNG forces took over the control of Yasooman village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 03/01 without armed resistance. Al Shabaab fighters fled the town before the arrival of SNG forces. No casualties were reported.

A body of a beheaded man was brought to Beled Weyne town by villagers in the afternoon of 04/01. The victim was allegedly taken by suspected al Shabaab fighters from a lorry he was travelling with in the western outskirts of Beled Weyne in the previous night (03/01). The motive behind his killing is currently unknown but sources suggest that he used to work as a tax collector at the local livestock market.

A SNG soldier shot and injured a civilian man in Dhagahtur neighbourhood in Afgooye town in the afternoon of 03/01 following an unknown verbal dispute between soldier and the victim. No arrest was reported in connection with the incident.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier near Bakara Junction (Howl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 03/02. The perpetrators escaped.

Soldiers raid Haduuman and Buulo Sheekh killing five civilians, the raping of four women and the torture of three young men. The attack was suspected to be motivated over a ""complexity of alliances"" among al Shabaab, government forces and clan groups.

Soldiers raid Haduuman and Buulo Sheekh killing five civilians, the raping of four women and the torture of three young men. The attack was suspected to be motivated over a ""complexity of alliances"" among al Shabaab, government forces and clan groups.

Khatumo state supporters held a demonstration in Buuhoodle on 04/01 to protest against the opening of a political office in the town by Wadani political party. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and were carrying pictures of victims from previous clashes between Somaliland and Khatumo.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a house in Hawo Tako neighbourhood in the evening of 04/01. SNG forces were chewing Khat in the house and three of them were injured in the blast. No arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in the eastern part of Xudur town in the evening of 04/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported from either side.

Al Shabaab fighters planning to attack SNG forces base in Waajid town clashed with SNG forces in defence position outside the base in the early morning of 04/01. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clashes while no casualties were reported from SNG forces side.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces manning an illegal checkpoint in Cumar-Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 04/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a religious man who was a member of Tabliq sect in Luuq Jeelow (22km S of Beled Weyne) in the midnight of 04/01. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

A SVBIED rammed into a convoy of US-trained Gashaan forces (Alpha Group) in Vinta Una October in Afisiyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the afternoon of 04/01. SNG forces opened fire after the blast to disperse on-lookers. The spokesman for Somali National Security Ministry stated that the SVBIED was in fact being chased by NISA personnel when it rammed into a civilian car and detonated. Other sources indicate that the suicide vehicle was targeting a pick-up truck used by Alpha group to transport al Shabaab suspects arrested in normal security operations. At least four civilians were killed during the blast and six others, mostly Alpha soldiers were injured. It cannot be verified whether two Gashaan soldiers were killed in the blast as some sources claim. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA troops in Abdi Wayel Cinema area (Heliwa District) in the evening of 04/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Tayeeglow. SNG reports five al Shabaab dead in the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Heavy fighting has broken out between Al-Shabab forces and Puntland militias on the outskirts of the city of Boosaaso in north-eastern Somalia. The fighting started after Al-Shabaab mujahidin forces based in the Golis mountain range ambushed a convoy of Puntland and American soldiers. News sources learned that most of the fighting is taking place in an area called Karin Hagar-wade near Galgala. Injuries/causalities not known. This was an ongoing battle at the time the source provided its report.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in Gol-Weyn village (21km SW of Marka) in the evening of 05/01. The soldier reportedly received a phone call from a lady who claimed her house was attacked by a group of armed men. The soldier was killed as he arrived at the woman's house in response to the distressed call. The motive is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
One killed, fourteen injured in a Galkacyo roadside blast. Perpetrators not known. Among the injured were Kenyan teachers.

Unidentified gunmen stopped a mini-bus and picked out two unarmed SNG soldiers in Mariin-Gubaay (48km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 05/01. The gunmen killed one soldier and injured the other. The two soldiers were from Buulo Mareer and were heading to Baraawe when the incident happened. The soldiers hid their guns prior to the journey as advised by the driver in fear of al Shabaab attacks. AMISOM/SNG forces arrested the mayor of Mariin-Gubaay village in connection with the incident.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in the outskirts of Hunyaley/Lugay Weene (13km E of Xudur) in the afternoon of 05/01. Both sides engaged in a heavy fighting which lasted for about three hours after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew following reports of immediate reinforcement from AMISOM/ENDF forces based in Xudur. Reports indicate that 11 al Shabaab fighters were killed while 4 SNG forces were injured. One of the al Shabaab fighters killed in the attack - who hails from Rahanweyn/Luways sub clan - was said to be known for planning the hit and run attacks against SNG forces in the town.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base in Mariin-Gubaay (48km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 05/11. The fighting lasted for about ten minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces base in Waajid in the morning of 05/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Bulo Aw Mudey village (8km SE of Wanla Weyn) in the afternoon of 05/01 over unknown reasons. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters executed a Somali soldier in Gamboole village (40km W of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 05/01. The soldier was executed in a public firing squad.

A man hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub clan shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Jamac Siyad sub-clan in Burtinle in the morning of 06/01. The perpetrator took the victims gun and escaped before he was arrested by the police. The motive is unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Agreement: About 50 clan militias with two battle wagons hailing from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan believed to be loyal to Ahmed Abdi Haabsade arrived in Garowe on 05/01. The militiamen reportedly defected from Somaliland forces to join Puntland forces. Ahmed Abdi Haabsade has in the past defected from Somaliland administration.
A RCIED targeted SNG police vehicle passing in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 05/01. The device reportedly missed the target. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Garas Balley neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 05/01. The motive behind the killing of the man is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA base in Sarta Qabyada area (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 05/01. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew.

Unidentified armed attackers raided the residence of two Yaaqshiid District officials and killed them in Jungal neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 05/01. The motive behind the killing of the two officials is currently unknown. No arrests were made in connection with the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 06/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters managed to take over the base and remained there until the following morning. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a number of SNG forces were injured in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM convoy at Hawinaa near Tabta village (78km SW of Afmadow) in the evening of 06/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The convoy was heading to Dhobley when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against Marka Police Station in the afternoon of 06/01. The policemen at the station opened gunfire after the explosion. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and injured an elder on his way to his residence in Baled Xaawo in the evening of 06/01. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escape.

A group of armed militia hailing from Hawadle/Agoon sub-clan - who were manning an illegal checkpoint in Bacda (51km NE of Beled Weyne) - opened fire at a vehicle rented by a local NGO in the morning of 05/01. The car was carrying a team of engineers to Hees village on borehole drilling mission. One engineer was killed and two others injured. The motive is currently unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab court in Bardheere sentenced four men to death penalty in the afternoon of 06/01. The four were accused of spying for the CIA, Ethiopia and SNG intelligence and following the court they executed in public firing squad.

Al Shabaab beheaded a civilian man in Gumarayaale (30km NW of Waajid) in the afternoon of 06/01. Reports indicate that the victim was abducted by al Shabaab fighters a day earlier and later beheaded him for unknown reason. The body was dumped at the outskirts of the village.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces intensified their military offensive against al Shabaab fighters in Galgala Mountains (65 km SW of Bosasso) on 06/01. The forces reportedly killed 20 al Shabaab fighters and injured 29 others. Five Puntland soldiers were also killed and four others injured in the new military offensive.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Galgala/al Shabaab fighters in Galgala Mountains (65 km SW of Bosasso) carried out an ambush against Puntland forces in the vicinity of Dindigle on 06/01. The ambush followed by armed clash between the two sides where three Galgala/al Shabaab fighters were killed and three Puntland soldiers were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces base near Dayniile Hospital (Dayniile District) in the night of 06/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM-SNG forces attack several al Shabaab locations east of Xudur, including: Ceel Xagar, Abaq Beedeey, Laan Xabag, Kuunyaaley, and Ceel Mareer. Allied forces have declared they have taken control of the villages. Fifteen combatants dead, plus injures.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against ENDF forces escorting convoy of food aid in Luuq Jeelow village (22 km S of Beled-weyne) in the afternoon of 07/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. ENDF battle wagon was reportedly burnt down. Casualties could not be established.

Three SNG soldiers defected with a vehicle they were driving in to al Shabaab fighters in Murugeey village (8km NW of Wanla Weyn) in the afternoon of 07/01. SNG forces looking after the missing soldiers and their vehicle were ambushed by al Shabaab fighters near Murugeey village. The two sides engaged fighting for about 20 minutes after which SNG forces retreated back towards Wanla Weyn. Three SNG soldiers were killed and five others were injured in the ambush and subsequent fighting while a SNG vehicle was damaged by RPG fired by al Shabaab fighters.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Gol-Weyn (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 07/01. After a brief exchange of gunfire the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One SNG soldier was injured in the clash.

SNG forces on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Ceel Gudo (20km NW of Tayeeglow) in the afternoon of 07/01. Reports indicate that three al Shabaab fighters were killed. Stray bullets hit and killed a civilian woman and injured another one during the clash.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burned two vehicles ferrying Khat near Goof-gaduud (28km SW of Baidoa) on 07/01. The vehicles were coming from Baidoa when the incident happened. The drivers and other passengers were released unharmed.
Al Shabaab executes two civilians for allegedly spying for SNG.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters executed a Jubaland soldier in Buale in the morning of 07/01. Reports indicate that the victim was captured in Kudhaa during last years al Shabaab and Jubaland clash in the area. The al Shahaab authority displayed the victim to the public before the execution and promised that they will parade more prisoners of war in the coming weeks in other places under the control of al Shabaab without mentioning any specific places.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces they escorted logistic supplies to Bulla Gudud (30km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 07/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The Jubaland forces were heading to Kismaayo when the attack happened. Three JLF were injured while casualties from al Shabaab could not be established. Latest reports indicate that Jubaland forces conducted a security operation an hour later after the attack but made no arrest.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the vicinity of Cabdi Wayel Cinema in the night of 07/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Suspected magnetic IED targeted a vehicle detonated near Taleex junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 07/01. The device is believed to have been attached to the vehicle prior to the incident. The driver - a lecturer from SIMAD and Mogadishu universities - was confirmed to have been injured in the incident. The motive is currently unknown. No arrests were reported in connection with the explosion.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a senior military officer, six soldiers outside the town of Wanlaweyn, precise location unknown.
Al Shabaab attacks Ethiopian positions in Buur Dhuxunle on the evening of 08/01. ""Heavy [Ethiopian] causalities."" The source is pro-al Shabaab.

A RCIED detonated in the outskirts of Khadija Haji village (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 08/01. Reports indicate that the target was reportedly SNG commander who was expected to be travel using that road. The device missed the target and seriously injured five civilians.

A contingent of ENDF pulls out from Ceel Garas village (40km SE of Dhusamareeb) to Dhusamareeb in the morning of 08/01. SNG commissioner in the town stated that the forces will be replaced by new contingent. The Ethiopian forces have been in the town from January 2014 and suffered continues hit and run attack from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab fighters are expected to fill the vacuum left by ENDF.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a boat inside Indian Ocean near Marka in the night of 08/01. After a brief exchange of gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and the guards on the boat, the al Shabaab over powered the men on the boast. The boat was carrying tw

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier guarding Garowe Police Station shot and killed a civilian man in the front gate of the police station in afternoon of 08/01 following an escalated dispute between the soldier and the victim. Reports indicate that the two had exchanged gunfire before the victim was gun down. The soldier was reportedly injured in the shot out and currently under arrest in the hospital while undergoing treatment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Two Puntland soldiers who were guarding local government office in Xarfo (70km N of Galkacyo) shot and injured two local government officials (a cashier and his assistant) in the morning of 08/01. The two soldiers also escaped with unspecified amount of money that was in the office savings. The cashier later succumbed to his injuries in Galkacyo hospital.

A RCIED targeted a SNG forces vehicle in Xamar Bile neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 08/01.The device reportedly missed the target and detonated after the vehicle passed over. SNG police in the area arrive at the scene but made no arrest. Two civilian bystanders were killed and two others were injured.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab sets fire to a food aid truck on the outskirts of Goof Gaduud. The truck was travelling from Baidoa.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against ENDF convoy carrying supply in the outskirts of Buur Dhuxunle (27km N of Waajid) in the afternoon of 09/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. ENDF temporarily took-over the village while telecommunication was shut down. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted an ambush against ENDF convoy transporting supply in the outskirts of Waajid in the afternoon of 09/01. The attackers shoot gunfire from a distance against the convoy, while the convoy continues its journey. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen from Majerteen/Ali Jibrail shot and injured two men hailing from Majerteen/Ali Saleeban in the evening of 09/11. The motive is unclear but it is believed to be related to clan revenge between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators escaped.

Five people, among them three women, are injured in a mortar attack in the Warta Nabada area. A foreign ministers conference was being held in the area at the time of the explosion, though it is not known if the violence was related. Perpetrators not known.

Two opposite clan militias hailing from Habar-Gedir/Sacad clashed in Galinsor village (30km NE of Cadaado) in the afternoon of 10/01. The two sides shortly exchanged gunfire after which the situation went back to normal. Reports indicate that one group of the fighting militias was planning to re-enforce clan fighting in Saaxo while the other one was trying to stop the re-enforcement hence fighting erupted. One combatant was killed during the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 10/01. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Gol-Weyn (21km SW of Marka) in the mid-night of 10/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED targeted a Jubaland forces vehicle in Guul Wade section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 10/01.There are two conflicting reports indicating that the town was under power shortage either due to breakage of supplying generators or power supplying companies were been ordered by al Shabaab of not to provide power during the night which could facilitate their operation in the dark. Two Jubaland soldiers were killed while a civilian was injured.
A RCIED was discovered near Cagadhiig Police station (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 10/01. The SNG EOD team arrived at the scene and dismantled the device safely.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Heliwa District in the evening of 10/01. The two sides briefly clashed after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of NISA engaged an intra-clash after one group assumed the other as hostile near General Kahiye Police Academy (Xamar Jabjab District) in the morning of 10/01. The two groups exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the fighting has stopped and each group identified the other. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against Bosasso Central Police Station in the morning of 11/01. Police in the targeted police station open fire in response, cordon off the area and later conducted a security operation but made no arrest. A police man and a civilian woman selling Khat nearby were injured in the blast - It was later learned the police officer died. The perpetrators managed to escape. The attack may have had occurred on 12/01.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceel Saliini (Ceel Shiikh) Village (32km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 11/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Janaale village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 11/01. The fighting lasted for a few minutes before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two dead bodies were found in Kabora east of Wamo Section in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 11/01. The dead bodies were been discovered as two men hailing from Marehan clan and apparently they were former al Shabaab members who use to be in Kismaayo before Jubaland/AMSIOM were in control of the town. The motive and identity of the killers are unknown as well as the current occupation of the victims. The date(s) of death are not known.

Two groups from SNG clashed in the Military Hospital in (Hodan District) in the afternoon of SNAF engaged an intra-clash in the military hospital (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 11/01. Reports indicate that the clash started after one of the group attackers SNG positions around the hospital in the intention of disarming them. Four combatants were killed while five others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit- and-run attack against SNG forces position in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 11/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

A dead body was found in Daab Yanbo section east of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 12/1. The date of death not known. Reports indicate that the victim was a member of al Shabaab Amniyat unit assigned for assassination.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Well-armed al Shabaab fighters launched three consecutive attacks against AMISOM base in Baraawe in the night of 12/01. Reports indicate that the gunfire was heard up to 03:00 morning. Both sides have reportedly received casualties but exact figures are currently unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit- and-run attack against SNG forces base in Goof-Gaduud (27km SW of Baidoa) on 12/1. The two sides exchanged small arms fire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambush Puntland forces near Jingada village (100km S of Bosasso) on 12/01. No reported causalities.

Gunmen hailing from Majerteen/Usman Mohamud and Majerteen Isse Mohammud clashed in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood of Garowe in the morning of 13/01 over an escalated dispute on land ownership. One combatant was reportedly injured in the clash. Police arrested six combatants.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Siinka Dheer (Afgooye District) in the morning of 13/01. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against KDF(AMISOM)/SNG forces in Taraka (49km W of Baardheere) in the morning of 13/01. The two sides used heavy weapons during the fighting after which the allied forces retreated back to their base in Faafax Dhuun (95km SE of Ceel Waaq). The allied forces come from Faafax Dhuun when the fighting broke out. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a tax collector in Dhagahtur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 13/01. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA forces outpost in former Somali National TV centre in Towfiiq Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 13/01. Reports indicate that the two sides reportedly exchange gunfire for about 20 minutes before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Hundreds of Berbera residents staged a violent demonstration on 14/01 against the government, following after a report emerged about privatization of power company to businessmen. The protestors demanded from the government not privatize the power company. The demonstrators burnt tyres and destroyed governors vehicle and some other private cars. Police arrive at the scene and arrested unspecified number of protestors. This is second time Berbera residents are protesting against privatization of power company.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Balambale in the morning of 14/01 in protest against the planned conference on the formation of Somali central state in Cadaado. The demonstrator called for the organizers to change the venue to Dhusamareeb, where all communities in the region are present.

A group of militias hailing from Habar-Gedir/Saad sub-clan, who were manning an illegal checkpoint at the outskirt of Galkacyo (South), engaged shoot out with an armed man from the same sub-clan who also set up an illegal check-point in the area in the night of 14/01. Following a shootout between the sides the man was killed while another one from the attacking group was injured. Reports indicate that the armed group was reportedly angered by the man who erected a check-point in their area of control. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen ambushed a group of armed militia escorting Khat near Buulo Sheekh (5km SE of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 14/01. The two sides exchanged gunfire, leading to the death of one person and the injury of another. The vehicle had left Mogadishu and was heading to Qoryooley when the incident happened. Al Shabaab is adverse to the sale and consumption of khat.
Two groups of SNG soldiers clashed in Mareerey Village (about 7km W of Afgooye) in the morning of 14/01 following a dispute over money extorted from public vehicles. Casualties are unknown.

Agreement: A local al Shabaab commander (Sheikh Osman Sheikh Mohamed) defected to local authority in Luuq in the morning of 14/01. Reports indicate that the man was al Shabaab commander in Diinsoor and Baidoa area before his surrender. The local authority in Luuq welcomed the defection and urged other al Shabaab fighters who hail from Gedo region to surrender and integrate in to their communities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Puntland police forces manning at a security checkpoint in Afar-Irdood area in New Bosasso neighbourhood (Bosasso) in the night of 14/01. The attackers opened fire after the blast killing one soldier and injuring two others. The forces in the check-point open fire in response to the blast, cordon off the area, conducted a security operation and arrested unspecified number of people. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Sei Biano neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 14/01. The perpetrators escaped.

Heavy fighting reported between al Shabaab and military forces during the evening hours. Five solders, 10 al Shabaab believed dead, plus injuries. Al Shabaab reports the killings of several SNG officers.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped over 50 charcoal burners from Kidi Faani Village (31km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 15/01. In Sadaxlogood Village (40km E of Badhaadhe), 25 charcoal burners went missing and are believed to have been kidnapped by al Shabaab fighters. Five charcoal trucks and three mini-buses are also reportedly missing and believed to have taken by the al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate these villages are the main charcoal producers in the region. The charcoal is later transported to Buur Gaabo Village (43km SE of Badhadhe) along the coast of the Indian Ocean.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped over 50 charcoal burners from Kidi Faani Village (31km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 15/01.
